fields.name: DataSpaceId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the data space where an experiment's resources originate. Required.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Text description of the experiment. Optional.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: System or user-generated API name for the experiment. Required.

fields.name: LastAnalyzed
fields.description: Time and date of last analysis.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: Timestamp that indicates the last time an experiment was referenced by another resource.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: Timestamp that indicates the last time a user viewed the experiment.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Text label that identifies the experiment. Required.

fields.name: PersonalizationSchemaEnum
fields.description: Picklist value that indicates the type of personalization schema, which is related to where a personalization decision is created.

fields.name: PersonalizationSchemaId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the schema that’s related to the experiment.

fields.name: PrimaryMetricId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to engagement signal metrics, which are used to measure an experiment.

fields.name: ProfileDataGraphId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the profile data graph that’s used.

fields.name: ScheduleFrequencyInMinutes
fields.description: Number of minutes that defines when personalized content can be made available.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: Indicates where the experiment was created.

fields.name: SourceRecordId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the specific record that contains the experiment.

fields.name: StartedDate
fields.description: Timestamp that indicates when the experiment began or is scheduled to begin.

fields.name: State
fields.description: Picklist value that indicates the current state of the experiment.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Picklist value that indicates the current status of the experiment while an action is being performed.

fields.name: StoppedDate
fields.description: Timestamp that indicates when the experiment ended or is scheduled to end.

fields.name: WinnerSelectionMode
fields.description: Possible values are: Automatic Manual

fields.name: AbnExperimentId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to a related experiment.

fields.name: AllocationWeight
fields.description: Percentage of an audience to experience the selected part of the experiment.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three letter ISO currency codes for supported currencies. Optional.

fields.name: DataSpaceId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the data space where an experiment cohort's resources originate. Required.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Text description of the experiment. Optional.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: System or user-generated API name for the experiment. Required.

fields.name: IsControl
fields.description: Whether the cohort is used as the control group that performance is checked against.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Text label that identifies the experiment cohort. Required.

fields.name: PersonalizerId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the personalizer that’s related to the experiment cohort.

fields.name: EventId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the event.

fields.name: RelationId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the invitee.

fields.name: RespondedDate
fields.description: Indicates the most recent date and time when the invitee accepted an invitation to the event.

fields.name: Response
fields.description: Indicates the content of the response field. Label is Comment .

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Indicates whether the invitee is a user, lead or contact, or resource.

fields.name: AccountNumber
fields.description: Account number assigned to this account (not the unique, system-generated ID assigned during creation). Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: AccountSource
fields.description: The source of the account record. For example, Advertisement or Trade Show . The source is selected from a picklist of available values, which are set by an administrator. Each picklist value can have up to 40 characters.

fields.name: ActivityMetricId
fields.description: When Einstein Activity Capture with Activity Metrics is enabled, the ID of the related activity metric.

fields.name: ActivityMetricRollupId
fields.description: When Einstein Activity Capture with Activity Metrics is enabled, the ID of the related activity metric rollup.

fields.name: AnnualRevenue
fields.description: Estimated annual revenue of the account.

fields.name: BillingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the billing address. Read-only. For details on compound address fields, see Address Compound Fields .

fields.name: BillingCity
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this account. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: BillingCountry
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this account. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: BillingCountryCode
fields.description: The ISO country code for the account’s billing address.

fields.name: BillingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the billing address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: BillingLatitude
fields.description: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: BillingLongitude
fields.description: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: BillingPostalCode
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this account. Maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: BillingState
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this account. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: BillingStateCode
fields.description: The ISO state code for the account’s billing address.

fields.name: BillingStreet
fields.description: Street address for the billing address of this account.

fields.name: ChannelProgramLevelName
fields.description: Read only. Name of the channel program level the account has enrolled. If this account has enrolled more than one channel program level, the oldest channel program name is displayed.

fields.name: ChannelProgramName
fields.description: Read only. Name of the channel program the account has enrolled. If this account has enrolled more than one channel program, the oldest channel program name is displayed.

fields.name: CleanStatus
fields.description: Indicates the record’s clean status as compared with Data.com. .

fields.name: ConnectionReceivedId
fields.description: ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that shared this record with your organization. This field is available if you enabled Salesforce to Salesforce.

fields.name: ConnectionSentId
fields.description: ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that you shared this record with. This field is available if you enabled Salesforce to Salesforce. This field is supported using API versions earlier than 15.0. In all other API versions, this field’s value is null. You can use the new PartnerNetworkRecordConnection object to forward records to connections.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Text description of the account. Limited to 32,000 KB.

fields.name: DunsNumber
fields.description: The Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S) number is a unique, nine-digit number assigned to every business location in the Dun & Bradstreet database that has a unique, separate, and distinct operation. D-U-N-S numbers are used by industries and organizations around the world as a global standard for business identification and tracking. Maximum size is 9 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts. Note This field is only available to organizations that use Data.com Prospector or Data.com Clean.

fields.name: Fax
fields.description: Fax number for the account.

fields.name: Industry
fields.description: An industry associated with this account. For example, Biotechnology . Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: IsBuyer
fields.description: Indicates that the account is enabled as a buyer for Lightning B2B Commerce. The default value is false . This field is available in API version 48.0 and later. Note This field is only available to organizations that have the B2B Commerce license enabled.

fields.name: IsCustomerPortal
fields.description: Indicates whether the account has at least one contact enabled to use the org's Experience Cloud site or Customer Portal ( true ) or not ( false ). This field is available if Customer Portal is enabled OR digital experiences is enabled. If your org is enabled to use Content Security Policy (CSP) features, then this field is visible on the Account object even if those features are later disabled. If you change this field's value from true to false , you can disable up to 100 Experience Cloud site or Customer Portal users associated with the account and permanently delete all of the account's site roles and groups. You can't restore deleted site roles and groups. Exclude this field when merging accounts. This field can be updated in API version 16.0 and later. Tip We recommend that you update up to 50 contacts simultaneously when changing the accounts on contacts enabled for an Experience Cloud site. We also recommend that you make this update after business hours.

fields.name: IsPartner
fields.description: Indicates whether the account has at least one contact enabled to use the org's partner portal ( true ) or not ( false ). This field is available if partner relationship management (partner portal) is enabled OR digital experiences is enabled and you have partner portal licenses. If you change this field's value from true to false , you can disable up to 15 partner portal users associated with the account and permanently delete all of the account's partner portal roles and groups. You can't restore deleted partner portal roles and groups. Disabling a partner portal user in the Salesforce user interface or the API doesn’t change this field's value from true to false . Even if this field's value is false , you can enable a contact on an account as a partner portal user via the API. Exclude this field when merging accounts. This field can be updated in API version 16.0 and later. Tip We recommend that you update up to 50 contacts simultaneously when changing the accounts on contacts enabled for an Experience Cloud site. We also recommend that you make this update after business hours.

fields.name: IsPersonAccount
fields.description: Read only. Label is Is Person Account . Indicates whether this account has a record type of Person Account ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsPriorityRecord
fields.description: Shows whether the user has marked the account as important ( True ) or not ( False ). The default value is false . Available in API version 60.0 and later.

fields.name: Jigsaw
fields.description: References the ID of a company in Data.com. If an account has a value in this field, it means that the account was imported from Data.com. If the field value is null , the account was not imported from Data.com. Maximum size is 20 characters. Available in API version 22.0 and later. Label is Data.com Key . This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts. Important The Jigsaw field is exposed in the API to support troubleshooting for import errors and reimporting of corrected data. Do not modify the value in the Jigsaw field.

fields.name: JigsawCompanyId
fields.description: The ID of the company in reference to Jigsaw . Important The Jigsaw field is exposed in the API to support troubleshooting for import errors and reimporting of corrected data. Don’t modify the value in the Jigsaw field.

fields.name: LastActivityDate
fields.description: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ), but not viewed it.

fields.name: MasterRecordId
fields.description: If this object was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that was kept. If this object was deleted for any other reason, or has not been deleted, the value is null .

fields.name: NaicsCode
fields.description: The six-digit North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is the standard used by business and government to classify business establishments into industries, according to their economic activity for the purpose of collecting, analyzing, and publishing statistical data related to the U.S. business economy. Maximum size is 8 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts. Note This field is only available to organizations that use Data.com Prospector or Data.com Clean.

fields.name: NaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an org’s line of business, based on its NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts. Note This field is only available to organizations that use Data.com Prospector or Data.com Clean.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Label is Account Name . Name of the account. Maximum size is 255 characters. If the account has a record type of Person Account: This value is the concatenation of the FirstName , MiddleName , LastName , and Suffix of the associated person contact. You can't modify this value.

fields.name: NumberOfEmployees
fields.description: Label is Employees . Number of employees working at the company represented by this account. Maximum size is eight digits.

fields.name: OperatingHoursId
fields.description: The operating hours associated with the account. Available only if Field Service is enabled.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who currently owns this account. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create. If you have set up account teams in your org, updating this field has different consequences depending on your version of the API: For API version 12.0 and later, sharing records are kept, as they are for all objects. For API version before 12.0, sharing records are deleted. For API version 16.0 and later, users must have the “Transfer Record” permission in order to update (transfer) account ownership using this field.

fields.name: Ownership
fields.description: Ownership type for the account, for example Private, Public, or Subsidiary.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the parent object, if any.

fields.name: PersonActionCadenceAssigneeId
fields.description: The ID of the sales rep designated to work the lead through their assigned cadence. This field is available in API version 47.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: PersonActionCadenceId
fields.description: The ID of the lead’s assigned cadence. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: PersonActionCadenceState
fields.description: The state of the current action cadence tracker. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: PersonIndividualId
fields.description: ID of the data privacy record associated with this person’s account. This field is available if you enabled Data Protection and Privacy in Setup.

fields.name: PersonScheduledResumeDateTime
fields.description: The date and time when the action cadence tracker is going to resume after it’s paused or on a wait step. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: Phone number for this account. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: PhotoUrl
fields.description: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance (for example, https:// yourInstance .salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the account. Generated URL returns an HTTP redirect (code 302) to the social network profile image for the account. Blank if Social Accounts and Contacts isn't enabled for the org or if Social Accounts and Contacts is disabled for the requesting user.

fields.name: Rating
fields.description: The account’s prospect rating, for example Hot, Warm, or Cold.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

fields.name: Salutation
fields.description: Honorific added to the name for use in letters, etc. This field is available on person accounts.

fields.name: ShippingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the shipping address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: ShippingCity
fields.description: Details of the shipping address for this account. City maximum size is 40 characters

fields.name: ShippingCountry
fields.description: Details of the shipping address for this account. Country maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: ShippingCountryCode
fields.description: The ISO country code for the account’s shipping address.

fields.name: ShippingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the shipping address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: ShippingLatitude
fields.description: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: ShippingLongitude
fields.description: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: ShippingPostalCode
fields.description: Details of the shipping address for this account. Postal code maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: ShippingState
fields.description: Details of the shipping address for this account. State maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: ShippingStateCode
fields.description: The ISO state code for the account’s shipping address.

fields.name: ShippingStreet
fields.description: The street address of the shipping address for this account. Maximum of 255 characters.

fields.name: Sic
fields.description: Standard Industrial Classification code of the company’s main business categorization, for example, 57340 for Electronics. Maximum of 20 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.

fields.name: SicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an org’s line of business, based on its SIC code. Maximum length is 80 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.

fields.name: Site
fields.description: Name of the account’s location, for example Headquarters or London . Label is Account Site . Maximum of 80 characters.

fields.name: TickerSymbol
fields.description: The stock market symbol for this account. Maximum of 20 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts.

fields.name: Tradestyle
fields.description: A name, different from its legal name, that an org may use for conducting business. Similar to “Doing business as” or “DBA”. Maximum length is 255 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts. Note This field is only available to organizations that use Data.com Prospector or Data.com Clean.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of account, for example, Customer, Competitor, or Partner.

fields.name: Website
fields.description: The website of this account. Maximum of 255 characters.

fields.name: YearStarted
fields.description: The date when an org was legally established. Maximum length is 4 characters. This field is available on business accounts, not person accounts. Note This field is only available to organizations that use Data.com Prospector or Data.com Clean.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: ID of the Account. This number is unique within your organization.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: The street address.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The city.

fields.name: CompanyName
fields.description: The name of the company associated with the account brand.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The country where the account is physically located.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: Email address associated with the account.

fields.name: GeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Stores data for accurate geocoded location.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: Most recent date referenced.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: Most recent date viewed.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: Used along with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

fields.name: LogoId
fields.description: ID of the logo.

fields.name: LogoUrl
fields.description: URL of the logo. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later.

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Name of the account.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: Required. ID of the Owner.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: Phone number.

fields.name: PostalCode
fields.description: The postal code where the user’s IP address is physically located.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The address state.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The address street.

fields.name: Website
fields.description: Website for the Account Brand.

fields.name: AccountContactRelationshipCurrency
fields.description: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: ID of the account that is related to the contact. Field can't be modified when updating existing account-contact relationship records.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: ID of the contact that is related to the account. Field can't be modified when updating existing account-contact relationship records.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The date a relationship between a contact and account ended. Use with the Start Date to keep a history of the relationship.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether relationship is active ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsDirect
fields.description: Indicates whether the account associated with the contact is the contact's primary account ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: Roles
fields.description: The contact’s participating role in the account. Values are Business User , Decision Maker , Economic Buyer , Economic Decision Maker , Evaluator , Executive Sponsor , Influencer , Technical Buyer , and Other .

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The date a relationship between a contact and account began. Use with the End Date to keep a history of the relationship.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: The unique, system-generated ID assigned when the account record was created.

fields.name: AccountSite
fields.description: Information about the account’s location, such as single location, headquarters, or branch.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: The compound form of the address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: AnnualRevenue

fields.name: CompanyName

fields.name: CompanyStatusDataDotCom

fields.name: Country
fields.description: Details for the billing address of the account.

fields.name: DandBCompanyDunsNumber
fields.description: The D-U-N-S Number on the D&B Company record (if any) that is linked to the account.

fields.name: DataDotComId
fields.description: The ID Data.com maintains for the company.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the account.

fields.name: DunsNumber
fields.description: The Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S) number is a unique, nine-digit number assigned to every business location in the Dun & Bradstreet database that has a unique, separate, and distinct operation. D-U-N-S numbers are used by industries and organizations around the world as a global standard for business identification and tracking.

fields.name: DunsRightMatchGrade

fields.name: Fax

fields.name: Industry

fields.name: DeveloperName

In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Corresponds to Rule Name in the user interface. fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the record in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This field is automatically generated but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the account relationship share rule.

fields.name: MasterLabel
