fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: StaticFormulaCriteria
fields.description: A way to further filter what data gets shared. This must be a deterministic formula and spanning is not allowed.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Must match the type of an account relationship for data to be shared according to the AccountToCriteriaField and the StaticForumulaCriteria .

fields.name: AccountAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to the Account. The possible values are: Read Edit All (This value isn't valid for create or update calls.) This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default Account access level. In addition, either this field, the OpportunityAccessLevel field, or the CaseAccessLevel field must be set higher than the organization’s default access level.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: ID of the Account associated with this sharing entry. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: CaseAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to cases associated with the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default CaseAccessLevel . This field can't be updated via the API if the AccountAccessLevel field is set to All . You can't update this field for the associated account owner via the API. You must update the account owner’s CaseAccessLevel via the Salesforce user interface.

fields.name: ContactAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to contacts associated with the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default ContactAccessLevel . This field can't be updated via the API if the ContactAccessLevel field is set to “Controlled by Parent.” You can't update this field for the associated account owner using the API. You must update the account owner’s ContactAccessLevel via the Salesforce user interface.

fields.name: OpportunityAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to opportunities associated with the Account. The possible values are: None Read Edit This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default opportunity access level. This field can’t be updated via the API if the AccountAccessLevel field is set to All . You can't use the API to update this field for the associated Account owner. You must update the Account owner’s opportunityAccessLevel via the Salesforce user interface.

fields.name: RowCause
fields.description: Reason that this sharing entry exists. If you’re creating a sharing entry, the only permitted value is Manual . If no value is specified, the field defaults to Manual . All other RowCause values are read-only. After the sharing entry is created, this field can’t be edited.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: ID of the User or Group that has been given access to the Account. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: ItemId
fields.description: ID of the tagged item.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the tag. If this value does not already exist, a new TagDefinition is created and becomes the parent of this Tag object. Otherwise, a TagDefinition with the same name becomes the parent of this Tag object. Parent relationships are created automatically.

fields.name: TagDefinitionId
fields.description: ID of the parent TagDefinition object that owns the tag.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines the visibility of a tag.

fields.name: AccountAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User has to the Account. The possible values are: Read Edit All This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default Account access level. In addition, the users’s AccountAccessLevel , ContactAccessLevel , OpportunityAccessLevel , or CaseAccessLevel field must be set higher than the organization’s default access level.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: Required. ID of the Account to which this user is a team member. Must be a valid account ID.

fields.name: CaseAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User has to cases associated with the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default case access level. In addition, the users’s AccountAccessLevel , ContactAccessLevel , OpportunityAccessLevel , or CaseAccessLevel field must be set higher than the organization’s default access level. This field is available in API version 37.0 and later.

fields.name: ContactAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User has to contacts associated with the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit Controlled By Parent This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default contact access level. In addition, the users’s AccountAccessLevel , ContactAccessLevel , OpportunityAccessLevel , or CaseAccessLevel field must be set higher than the organization’s default access level. If the org-wide default for contacts is set to Controlled By Parent, users can’t see or edit the Contact Access field. This field is available in API version 37.0 and later.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the org.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: OpportunityAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User has to opportunities associated with the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit This field must be set to an access level that is at least equal to the organization’s default opportunity access level. In addition, the users’s AccountAccessLevel , ContactAccessLevel , OpportunityAccessLevel , or CaseAccessLevel field must be set higher than the organization’s default access level. This field is available in API version 37.0 and later.

fields.name: PhotoURL
fields.description: Read only. Retrieves the users Chatter photo URL. This field is available in API version 37.0 and later.

fields.name: TeamMemberRole
fields.description: Role associated with this team member. One of the valid team member roles defined for your organization. Label is Team Role .

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Read only. Retrieves the user’s title. This field is available in API version 37.0 and later.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: Required. ID of the User who is a member of this account team. Must be a valid User ID.

fields.name: BooleanFilter
fields.description: Advanced filter conditions that were specified for the rule in the online application. For example, “(1 AND 2) OR 3.”

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the rule is active ( true ) or inactive ( false ). Via the API, active rules run automatically when new accounts are created and existing accounts are edited. The exception is when the IsExcludedFromRealign field on an account is true , which prevents account assignment rules from evaluating that account.

fields.name: IsInherited
fields.description: Indicates whether the rule is an inherited rule ( true ) or a local rule ( false ). An inherited rule also acts upon territories below it in the territory hierarchy. A local rule is created at the immediate territory and only impacts the immediate territory.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: A name for the rule. Limit is 80 characters.

fields.name: TerritoryId
fields.description: ID of the territory where accounts that satisfy this rule are assigned.

fields.name: Field
fields.description: The standard or custom account field to use as a criteria.

fields.name: Operation
fields.description: The criteria to apply, such as “equals” or “starts with.”

fields.name: RuleID
fields.description: ID of the associated AccountTerritoryAssignmentRule.

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: The order in which this row is evaluated compared to other AccountTerritoryAssignmentRuleItem objects for the given AccountTerritoryAssignmentRule.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The field value(s) to evaluate, such as 94105 if the Field is Billing Zip/Postal Code .

fields.name: AccountAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of sharing being allowed. The possible values are: Read Edit All

fields.name: CaseAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of access granted to the target group for all child cases of the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit

fields.name: ContactAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of access granted to the target group for all related contacts on the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit Note This field is read only.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the sharing rule. Maximum size is 1000 characters. This field is available in API version 29.0 and later.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Corresponds to Rule Name in the user interface. This field is available in API version 24.0 and later. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: GroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the source group. Accounts owned by users in the source territory trigger the rule to give access.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Label of the sharing rule as it appears in the user interface. Limited to 80 characters. Corresponds to Label on the user interface.

fields.name: OpportunityAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of access granted to the target group for all opportunities associated with the account. The possible values are: None Read Edit

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the user or group being given access, or, if a territory ID, the users assigned to that territory.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: Unique identifier for the account associated with the Users in Assigned Territories related list.

fields.name: RoleInTerritory2
fields.description: The role of each user in the Users in Assigned Territories related list.

fields.name: Territory2Id
fields.description: Unique identifier for each territory in the Users in Assigned Territories related list.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: Unique identifier for each user in the Users in Assigned Territories related list.

fields.name: ActivatedDate
fields.description: The date that the user activated the action cadence. ActionCadence objects are created in a draft state and must be manually activated before they’re used.

fields.name: ActiveTargets
fields.description: The total number of active targets that are currently assigned with this cadence. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of this action cadence.

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: If there was an error when activating the action cadence, this field contains the error message.

fields.name: FolderId
fields.description: The ID of the folder that contains the action cadence. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: FolderName
fields.description: The name of the folder that contains the action cadence. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: IsWaitAllowedBeforeDaisyChain
fields.description: Whether the cadence is allowed to have a wait step before a daisy chain step ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: LastEditedDateTime
fields.description: The date and time this object was last edited.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date this object was last referenced.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date this action cadence was last viewed in the Sales Engagement app.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of this action cadence. Every action cadence in an org must have a unique name.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the action cadence (typically the user who created it). Note To change the owner of an action cadence, the new owner must have read access to action cadences enabled in their user profile.

fields.name: State
fields.description: This entity's state.

fields.name: SuccessfulCompletions
fields.description: The total number of successful dispositions this cadence has upon completion. For example, customer engaged or customer connected. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: TotalSteps
fields.description: The number of total steps associated with this cadence. This value doesn’t include special step types such as root, branch, and daisy chain. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: TotalTargets
fields.description: The total number of targets that have been assigned with this cadence. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Indicates the type of ActionCadence. Available in API version 56.0 and later.

fields.name: ActionCadenceStepId
fields.description: The ActionCadenceStep that this rule is associated with.

fields.name: ConditionLogic
fields.description: The logical operator used to evaluate the rule conditions. Possible values are: AND If this rule has several conditions, all of them must be true for this step to be true .

fields.name: GlobalEventType
fields.description: If the action cadence rule contains a global exit condition, this field contains the type of event that the rule represents. Possible values are: EmailReply EmailHardBounce EmailSoftBounce CallMeaningfulConnect CallNotInterested CallUnqualified CallLeftVoicemail CallCallBackLater This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: GraphState
fields.description: Represents the state of the ActionCadenceRule within the step graph, or sequence, of the related action cadence. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: OutcomeNextStepName
fields.description: The next step in the action cadence if this rule evaluates as true . If this rule evaluates as false , the next step is ActionCadenceStep.BranchDefaultStepName .

fields.name: ParentRuleName
fields.description: The value of the RuleName field of the previous rule in the action cadence. Must contain a valid rule name value unless this rule is the root rule. null if this rule is a root rule. This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: RuleName
fields.description: The name given to the rule. Every rule in an action cadence must have a unique name.

fields.name: RuleType
fields.description: The type of step that this rule applies to. Possible values are: BranchStep — The rule evaluates the condition of a branch step. A branch step is an ActionCadenceStep record with the field type equal to Branch . RepeatedStep — The rule evaluates the repeat steps for quick cadence. Available in API version 58.0 and later. RootStep — The rule evaluates a global exit condition. SubRootStep —Available in API version 58.0 and later. This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: ActionCadenceRuleId
fields.description: The ID of the ActionCadenceRule that this condition is associated with.

fields.name: Operator
fields.description: The conditional operator for this rule. Possible values are: Equal

fields.name: Resource
fields.description: The field to evaluate. Possible values are: CallDispositionCategory Use by branch steps. EmailEngagement Used by ListenerBranch steps.

fields.name: RuleConditionName
fields.description: The name of the rule condition. Every rule condition in a cadence must have a unique name.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The event that your cadence rule condition listens for to decide when the event is complete. Possible values for emails are: EmailOpen EmailLinkClick Possible values for calls are: CallMeaningfulConnect CallUnqualified CallLeftVoicemail CallNotInterested CallCallBackLater

fields.name: ActionCadenceId
fields.description: The ID of the ActionCadence that this step belongs to.

fields.name: AllCallsCallBackLater
fields.description: The number of calls having the call outcome Call Back Later .

fields.name: AllCallsLeftVoicemail
fields.description: The number of calls having the call outcome Left Voicemail .

fields.name: AllCallsMeaningfulConnect
fields.description: The number of calls having the call outcome Meaningful Connect .

fields.name: AllCallsNotInterested
fields.description: The number of calls having the call outcome Not Interested .

fields.name: AllCallsUncategorized
fields.description: The number of calls where the call outcome isn’t categorized.

fields.name: AllCallsUnqualified
fields.description: The number of calls having the call outcome Unqualified .

fields.name: AllEmailsBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of emails that weren’t delivered successfully.

fields.name: AllEmailsDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of emails delivered.

fields.name: AllEmailsHardBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of emails returned for a permanent reason — for example, the email address doesn’t exist. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsLinkClickedCount
fields.description: The number of links inside an email that the target clicked during this step. Multiple clicks on the same link count towards this total. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsOpenedCount
fields.description: The number of emails that the target opened while working on this step. Multiple opens of the same email count towards this total.

fields.name: AllEmailsOutOfOfficeCount
fields.description: The number of emails that were returned because the recipient set an out-of-office responder. Multiple replies count towards this total. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsRepliedCount
fields.description: The number of emails that targets replied to as part of this step. Multiple replies to the same email count towards this total, This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsSentCount
fields.description: The number of sent emails.

fields.name: AllEmailsSoftBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of emails that were returned for temporary reasons — for example, the email is too large. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsTrackedSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent by this user with engagement tracking enabled.

fields.name: AllEmailsUntrackedSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent by this user without engagement tracking.

fields.name: AllManuallyCompletedCount
fields.description: The number of steps manually completed.

fields.name: AllOnTimeCompletedCount
fields.description: The number of steps completed on time.

fields.name: AllOverdueCompletedCount
fields.description: The number of overdue steps that were completed.

fields.name: AllSkippedCount
fields.description: The number of steps skipped.

fields.name: AllTotalCallsCount
fields.description: The number of calls that the sales rep made during this step.

fields.name: BranchDefaultStepName
fields.description: The name of the default step.

fields.name: ChainedCadenceId
fields.description: The ID of the ActionCadence for the linked action cadence. Available only if the step type is DaisyChain (meaning that another action cadence is connected to this action cadence).

fields.name: GoToStepIntervalInMinutes
fields.description: Contains information about when the step should be repeated next, in minutes. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: GoToStepIterationLimit
fields.description: Contains the maximum number of repeat (goto) step iterations allowed. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: GoToStepName
fields.description: If this step’s original next step was removed during an edit after activation, this field specifies the updated next step.

fields.name: GraphState
fields.description: Represents the state of the ActionCadenceStep within the step graph, or sequence, of the action cadence.

fields.name: HasVariant
fields.description: This field is valid for email and call step types. If true , the step has email or call template variants. The template variants are defined in ActionCadenceStepVariant records. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: IsImmediateWakeUp
fields.description: Indicates whether a listener branch is immediate wake up ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsOrphan
fields.description: If true , this step isn’t executed by the action cadence and will be deleted. Steps with IsOrphan equal to true have ParentStepName equal to null . Note To retrieve the active steps in an action cadence, include IsOrphan=false in your query. The default value is false . This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: IsScheduledDueDateLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether assignees can change the due date ( true ) or not ( false ). Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: IsScreenFlowActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the flow is active and can be executed ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsStepAutomationActive
fields.description: If true, the flow referenced in the StepAutmationReference field is active. If false, the flow isn’t active. Only active flows can be executed. The default value is false . This field is available in API version 56.0 and later.

fields.name: IsThreaded
fields.description: This field is valid for email steps. Email steps have ActionCadence.StepType equal to SendAnEmail . If true , the email for this email step is sent as a reply to the email conversation from the previous email step. By sending the email as a reply to a previous email, customers see a "conversation" view of the emails. Only emails from the same action cadence are grouped as conversations. This field can’t be true for the first email step in an action cadence, because the first email from an action cadence must start a new conversation with the prospect. The default value is false . This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: ParentStepName
fields.description: The step name ( ActionCadenceStep.StepName ) of the previous step in the action cadence. Must contain a valid step name value unless this step is the root step. null if this step is a parent step.

fields.name: RootStepId
fields.description: The ID of the root step for this action cadence. Every action cadence has exactly one root step (so that the Salesforce API can find all the steps for this cadence).

fields.name: ScheduledDaysUntilDue
fields.description: The number of days after which this current step is due. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: ScheduledDaysUntilStart
fields.description: The number of days when this step starts after the previous step completes. For delays of greater than one day from ScheduledStartTimeInMinutes . Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: ScheduledStartDelayInMinutes
fields.description: Any hard waits in minutes is captured in this field. Waits greater than 1 day need to set ScheduledDaysUntilStart . Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: ScheduledStartTimeInMinutes
fields.description: The specific time of day when the step starts. The time represents minutes after 00:00. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: ScreenFlowReference
fields.description: The namespace__fullname of the screen flow. Used to describe flow objects and launch flows client side.

fields.name: StepAutomationReference
fields.description: The name of the flow that the step uses. Cadence steps can launch a cadence step flow as the step or as a cadence autolaunched flow when a rep completes the step. The format is namespace__fullName . This field is available in API version 56.0 and later.

fields.name: StepComments
fields.description: A comment that provides additional information about this step.

fields.name: StepName
fields.description: Unique identifier for this step. Generated by Salesforce.

fields.name: StepTitle
fields.description: The title given to the step when it was created.

fields.name: TemplateId
fields.description: If a template was added to this step, this field contains the template's ID. For example, if this step is a call step it can contain a template for a call script. Or, if this step is an email step, it can contain a template for an email.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of step. Possible values are: AutoSendAnEmail — Salesforce automatically sends the specified email. Branch — A branch step in the action cadence. CreateTask — Used for custom steps. DaisyChain — A daisy chain step. A daisy chain step connects this action cadence to another action cadence. It must be the last step in the path. LinkedInConnection LinkedInMail ListenerBranch — A branch step for emails. MakeACall — The sales rep must call the prospect at this step. PlatformScreenFlow Root — This step is the root step for the action cadence. SendAnEmail — The sales rep must send the prospect an email at this step. Wait — A wait step tells the sales rep not to do anything at this point in the action cadence.

fields.name: TypeDetail
fields.description: More detail about the step type. If the step is a cadence step flow, this field contains the flow name. Otherwise, this field contains the same value as the Type field. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsLinkClickedCount
fields.description: The number of links inside an email that the target clicked during this step. Multiple clicks on the same link aren’t counted. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsOpenedCount
fields.description: The number of emails that the target opened as part of this step. Multiple openings of the same email aren’t counted. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsRepliedCount
fields.description: The number of emails that targets replied to as part of this step. Multiple replies to the same email aren’t counted. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: WaitTimeInSeconds
fields.description: Required if the step type is Wait . The time in seconds for this step to wait.

fields.name: ActionCadenceId
fields.description: The ID of the ActionCadence that is related to the ActionCadenceStep.

fields.name: ActionCadenceName
fields.description: The name of the related ActionCadence object.

fields.name: ActionCadenceStepId
fields.description: ActionCadenceStepTracker is the runtime version of an ActionCadenceStep. This field contains the ID of the related ActionCadenceStep.

fields.name: ActionCadenceTrackerId
fields.description: The ID of the related ActionCadenceTracker.

fields.name: ActionTakenDateTime
fields.description: The date and time that the action described in this step was taken.

fields.name: CompletedById
fields.description: The user ID of the sales rep who completed this step. A step can be assigned to several users before it’s completed. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: CompletionDate
fields.description: The date this step completed. A step is completed either when the action is taken, or the step is skipped.

fields.name: CompletionReason
fields.description: The reason that this step completed: Possible values are: AutomaticallyCompleted — The sales rep successfully completed this step and moved to the next one. Salesforce automatically marks this step as completed. AutomaticallyExited — The step exited because a global exit condition occurred. This value is available in API version 49.0 and later. ManuallyCompleted — The sales rep manually marked this step as completed. ManuallySkipped — The sales rep skipped this step.

fields.name: DueDateTime
fields.description: Some steps have a due date to indicate when they must be completed. If this step has been assigned a due date, this field contains the date and time it is due.

fields.name: ErrorCode
fields.description: Possible values are: AUTO_EMAIL_DAILY_LIMIT_REACHED AUTO_EMAIL_ORG_SETTING_OFF AUTO_LIST_MQ_MAX_RETRIES_FAILED BCC_NOT_ALLOWED_IF_BCC_COMPLIANCE_ENABLED EAC_GLOBAL_DATA_SOURCE_ERROR —EAC data source error EMAIL_ORG_SETTING_OFF EXCHANGE_MAX_MAILBOX_SIZE —Max Exchange mailbox size reached EXCHANGE_SEND_AS_DENIED FIX_WITH_RECONNECT —Data connection failed GOOGLE_MAIL_SERVICE_NOT_ENABLED —Gmail service not enabled INVALID_DRAFT —Invalid email draft INVALID_TARGET_EMAIL INVALID_TEMPLATE_ID INVALID_USER_EMAIL MAIL_PROVIDER_RATE_LIMIT_REACHED —Email provider rate limit reached NON_EMAIL_UNKNOWN_ERROR —Unknown error NO_ATTACHMENT_ACCESS NO_CONTENT_VERSION_ACCESS NO_LIST_EMAIL_PERMISSION NO_TARGET_ACCESS ORG_WIDE_AUTO_EMAIL_LIMIT_REACHED ORG_WIDE_DAILY_EMAIL_LIMIT_REACHED OTHER_REQ_FIELD_MISSING —Other required field missing PARDOT_MERGE_FIELD_RENDERING_ERROR POST_SEND_EXCEPTION RETRIES_MAX_EXCEEDED —Maximum retries exceeded RETRY_LATER SCHEDULED_EMAIL_FAILED —Unknown error SENDER_MAILBOX_NOT_FOUND TARGET_DO_NOT_CONTACT_ON —Target has Do Not Contact on TARGET_EMAIL_BOUNCED TARGET_EMAIL_EMPTY TEMPLATE_DELETED TEMPLATE_EMPTY —Email subject or body missing TEMPLATE_HAS_INVALID_MERGE_FIELD TEMPLATE_MERGE_FIELD_RENDERING_ERROR TEMPLATE_NOT_PUBLIC —No access to template TEMPLATE_TOO_LARGE UNKNOWN —Email unknown error USER_HAS_LOST_HVS_ACCESS USER_IS_INACTIVE

fields.name: GoToStepIterationCount
fields.description: The number of times the action cadence step tracker was created for the same step in a cadence. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: IsActionTaken
fields.description: true if the sales rep completed an action during this step, such as making a phone call, otherwise false .

fields.name: ScheduledStartDateTime
fields.description: The date and time when the step starts. Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: SecondsOverdue
fields.description: If this step has a due date that has passed, this field contains the number of seconds that has elapsed since the due date. Once a sales rep takes action on the cadence step, the value of this field is the number of seconds elapsed between the due date and the time the action was taken.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The current state of this step. Possible values are:

fields.name: StepTitle
fields.description: The name of the related step.

fields.name: StepType
fields.description: The type of step to execute. Possible values are: AutoSendAnEmail Branch CreateTask DaisyChain LinkedInConnection LinkedInMail ListenerBranch MakeACall PlatformScreenFlow Root SendAnEmail SubRoot Wait

fields.name: TargetId
fields.description: The ID of the prospect that is assigned to this cadence.

fields.name: WasEverPaused
fields.description: Indicates whether the sales rep had ever paused this step ( true ), or not ( false ). This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: ActionCadenceStepId
fields.description: The ID of the related action cadence step.

fields.name: SplitPercentage
fields.description: The percentage of emails to send or calls to make using this email template or call script variant. The total for all variants must be 100%.

fields.name: TemplateId
fields.description: The ID of the associated email template or call script.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of the associated action cadence step.

fields.name: ActionCadenceId
fields.description: The ID of the related ActionCadence.

fields.name: CompletionDisposition
fields.description: The target’s disposition when it exited the action cadence. This field contains a value if the target’s State is Complete . Sales reps can set this value when removing a target from a cadence. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later. Possible values are: Bad Data — some of the target’s data is incorrect or invalid. Contact Later — the target asked to be contacted at a later date. Customer Connected — the sales rep contacted the target. Customer Engaged — the target engaged with an email. Disqualified — a sales rep determined that the target isn’t qualified. Duplicate — the target has a duplicate lead, contact, or person account record. No Response — the target didn’t reply to any outreach. Not Interested — the target stated a lack of interest. Success — the cadence outreach was successful.

fields.name: CompletionReason
fields.description: The reason that the target completed the cadence. This field contains a value if the target’s State is Complete . Possible values are: AutomaticallyExited — the target completed because a global exit condition occurred. This value is available in API version 49.0 and later. AutomaticallyExitedDeletedStep AutomaticallyExitedInvalidParentStep DaisyChained — the target completed because it’s connected to another action cadence. LeadConverted — the target completed because the lead converted. ManuallyRemoved — the target completed because the sales rep removed it from the cadence. ManuallyRemovedNoAccess — reserved for future use. NoMoreSteps — the target completed the action cadence because all the action cadence steps were completed.

fields.name: CurrentStepId
fields.description: The ID of the current ActionCadenceStepTracker.

fields.name: DaisyChainIteration
fields.description: The number of this action cadence in a sequence of linked action cadences followed by this target. This value starts at 1 with the initial action cadence. A target can follow a sequence of up to 10 linked action cadences. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: If an error occurs while this target is being completed, this field contains the error message.

fields.name: ExitGlobalRuleId
fields.description: If a global exit condition occurs, a target completes. One example of a global exit condition is an email returned because of an invalid address. If the target completed because a global exit condition occurred, this field contains the ID of the ActionCadenceRule record that evaluated as true . This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: IsTrackerActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the action cadence target is active (true) or not (false) . The default value is false . An action cadence target is active if the state is Running , Paused , Processing , or Initializing . Only active targets count against the org limit of 150,000 trackers. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: LastCompletedStepId
fields.description: The ID of the last completed ActionCadenceStepTracker.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who is assigned to complete the cadence steps for the target.

fields.name: RelatedToAttributionType
fields.description: Defines when the cadence is related to an opportunity or invoice. Available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: RelatedToId
fields.description: The ID of the related opportunity if there’s one. Available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: ScheduledResumeDateTime
fields.description: The date and time when the action cadence tracker is going to resume after it’s paused or on a wait step. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The state of the current action cadence tracker. Possible values are: Complete Error Initializing Paused Processing —Salesforce is working on changing the state of this action cadence tracker. We recommend that you filter out steps that have this state from your dashboards. Running

fields.name: TargetId
fields.description: The ID of the target that is assigned to this action cadence.

fields.name: ActionCadenceStepId
fields.description: The ID of the related action cadence step.
fields.relationshipType: This is an overview-detail relationship field, where ActionCadenceStep is the master object.

fields.name: AllCallsCallBackLater
fields.description: The number of calls in the month for this step with the call result Call Back Later.

fields.name: AllCallsLeftVoicemail
fields.description: The number of calls in the month for this step with the call result Left Voicemail.

fields.name: AllCallsMeaningfulConnect
fields.description: The number of calls in the month for this step with the call result Meaningful Connect.

fields.name: AllCallsNotInterested
fields.description: The number of calls in the month for this step with the call result Not Interested.

fields.name: AllCallsUncategorized
fields.description: The number of calls in the month for this step with no call result specified.

fields.name: AllCallsUnqualified
fields.description: The number of calls in the month for this step with the call result Unqualified.

fields.name: AllEmailsBouncedCount
fields.description: The total of hard and soft bounced emails for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of successfully delivered emails for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsHardBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of hard bounced emails for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsLinkClickedCount
fields.description: The number of emails containing a link clicked by the recipient for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsNotDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of sent emails that were bounced for all recipients on the email. Bounced emails aren’t marked as delivered. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsOpenedCount
fields.description: The number of emails opened by the recipient for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsOutOfOfficeCount
fields.description: The number of emails that triggered an out-of-office reply for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsRepliedCount
fields.description: The number of emails replied to for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsSoftBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of emails soft bounced for this step in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsTrackedSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent with engagement tracking enabled for this step in the month. Available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsUntrackedSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent without engagement tracking for this step in the month. Available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: AllTotalCallsCount
fields.description: The total number of calls with all call results for this step in the month.

fields.name: DeliveredRecipientCount
fields.description: The number of recipients that were successfully delivered an email. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: DeliveredRecipientRate
fields.description: The percentage of unique recipients that received an email you sent. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: HardBounceTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with hard bounce tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: HasTemplateAssigned
fields.description: Indicates whether this step has an associated email template or call script. Available in API version 52.0 and later.

fields.name: HrdBncTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with hard bounce tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: IsCompoundMetric
fields.description: When true, indicates that this metric represents engagement for a combination of the action cadence step and a single email template. The value is true for all action cadence steps created in Summer ’21 and later.

fields.name: LinkClickTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with link click tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: LinkClkTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with link tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: The month in which the engagement occurred.

fields.name: MonthInt
fields.description: The month in which the engagement occurred, in yyyymm format.

fields.name: OooTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with out-of-office tracking. Out-of-office tracking requires Inbox. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: OpenTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with open tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: OpenTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with open tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: OutOfOfficeTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with out-of-office tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientReplies
fields.description: The number of unique recipients who replied to an email. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientSends
fields.description: The number of unique email recipients. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientsHardBounced
fields.description: The number of recipients that hard-bounced an email. Hard bounces can mean that the recipient's email address doesn't exist or is misspelled. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientsOutOfOffice
fields.description: The number of recipients that responded with an out-of-office reply. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientsSoftBounced
fields.description: The number of recipients that soft-bounced an email. A soft bounce often indicates a temporary issue with the recipient's email server, such as a full inbox. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: ReplyTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with reply tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: ReplyTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with reply tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SftBncTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with soft bounce tracking. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: SoftBounceTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with soft bounce tracking. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SomeEmailsDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of sent emails that were successfully delivered to at least one of its recipients. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SomeEmailsDeliveredRate
fields.description: The percentage of sent and tracked emails that were successfully delivered to at least one of their recipients. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TemplateId
fields.description: The ID of the email template or call script associated with this step. Available in API version 52.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendHrdBncRt
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent to unique recipients with hard bounce tracking that hard bounced. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendOooRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with out-of-office tracking that received out-of-office replies from unique recipients. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendReplyRt
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with reply tracking that received replies from unique recipients. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendSftBncRt
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent to unique recipients with soft bounce tracking that soft-bounced. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendHardBounceRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with hard bounce tracking that hard bounced. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendLinkClickRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with link tracking that had link clicks. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendOpenRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with open tracking that were opened by the recipient. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendOutOfOfficeRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with out-of-office tracking that received out-of-office replies. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendReplyRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with reply tracking that received replies. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendSoftBounceRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with soft bounce tracking that soft bounced. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsLinkClickedCount
fields.description: The number of unique recipients who clicked a link in an email for this step in the month.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsOpenedCount
fields.description: The number of unique recipients who opened an email for this step in the month.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsRepliedCount
fields.description: The number of unique recipients who replied to an email for this step in the month.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: The location of the action link group within the feed element. Values are: Primary —The action link group is displayed in the body of the feed element. Overflow —The action link group is displayed in the overflow menu of the feed element.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The name of the action link group template to use in code.

fields.name: ExecutionsAllowed
fields.description: The number of times an action link can be executed. Values are: Once —An action link can be executed only once across all users. OncePerUser —An action link can be executed only once for each user. Unlimited —An action link can be executed an unlimited number of times by each user. If the action link’s actionType is Api or ApiAsync , you can’t use this value.

fields.name: HoursUntilExpiration
fields.description: The number of hours from when the action link group is created until it's removed from associated feed elements and can no longer be executed. The maximum value is 8,760.

fields.name: IsPublished
fields.description: If true , the action link group template is published. Action link group templates shouldn’t be published until at least one ActionLinkTemplate is associated with it. Once set to true , this can’t be set back to false .

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the MasterLabel .

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The name of the action link group template.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: ActionLinkGroupTemplateId
fields.description: ID of the ActionLinkGroupTemplate with which this action link template is associated.

fields.name: ActionUrl
fields.description: The action link URL. For example, a Ui action link URL is a Web page. A Download action link URL is a link to the file to download. Ui and Download action link URLs are provided to clients. An Api or ApiAsync action link URL is a REST resource. Api and ApiAsync action link URLs aren’t provided to clients. Links to Salesforce can be relative. All other links must be absolute and start with https:// . Links to resources hosted on Salesforce servers can be relative, starting with a / . All other links must be absolute and start with https: // . This field can contain context variables and binding variables in the form {!Bindings. key } , for example, https://www.example.com/{!Bindings.itemId} . Set the binding variable’s value when you instantiate the action link group from the template.

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: Template for the HTTP headers sent when corresponding action links are invoked. This field can be used only for Api and ApiAsync action links. This field can contain context variables and binding variables in the form {!Bindings. key } .

fields.name: IsConfirmationRequired
fields.description: If true , a confirmation dialog appears before the action is executed.

fields.name: IsGroupDefault
fields.description: If true , action links derived from this template are the default or primary action in their action groups. There can be only one default action per action group.

fields.name: Label
fields.description: A custom label to display on the action link button. If none of the LabelKey values make sense for an action link, use a custom label. Set the LabelKey field to None and enter a label name in the Label field.

fields.name: LabelKey
fields.description: Key for the set of labels to display for these action link states: new, pending, success, failed. For example, the Approve set contains these labels: Approve, Pending, Approved, Failed. For a complete list of keys and labels, see Action Link Labels in the Connect REST API Developer Guide .

fields.name: LinkType
fields.description: The type of action link. One of these values: Api —The action link calls a synchronous API at the action URL. Salesforce sets the status to SuccessfulStatus or FailedStatus based on the HTTP status code returned by your server. ApiAsync —The action link calls an asynchronous API at the action URL. The action remains in a PendingStatus state until a third party makes a request to /connect/action-links/ actionLinkId to set the status to SuccessfulStatus or FailedStatus when the asynchronous operation is complete. Download —The action link downloads a file from the action URL. Ui —The action link takes the user to a web page at the action URL.

fields.name: Method
fields.description: HTTP method for the action URL. One of these values: HttpDelete —Returns HTTP 204 on success. Response body or output class is empty. HttpGet —Returns HTTP 200 on success. HttpHead —Returns HTTP 200 on success. Response body or output class is empty. HttpPatch —Returns HTTP 200 on success or HTTP 204 if the response body or output class is empty. HttpPost —Returns HTTP 201 on success or HTTP 204 if the response body or output class is empty. Exceptions are the batch posting resources and methods, which return HTTP 200 on success. HttpPut —Return HTTP 200 on success or HTTP 204 if the response body or output class is empty. Ui and Download action links must use HttpGet .

fields.name: Position
fields.description: An integer specifying the position of the action link template relative to other action links in the group. 0 is the first position.

fields.name: RequestBody
fields.description: Template for the HTTP request body sent when corresponding action links are invoked. This field can be used only for Api and ApiAsync action links. This field can contain context variables and binding variables in the form {!Bindings. key } .

fields.name: UserAlias
fields.description: If you selected CustomUser or CustomExcludedUser for UserVisibility , this field is the alias for the custom user. Use the alias in a template binding to specify the custom user when an action link group is created using the template.

fields.name: UserVisibility
fields.description: Who can see the action link. This value is set per action link, not per action link group. One of these values: Creator —Only the creator of the action link can see the action link. Everyone —Everyone can see the action link. EveryoneButCreator —Everyone but the creator of the action link can see the action link. Manager —Only the manager of the creator of the action link can see the action link. CustomUser —Only the custom user can see the action link. CustomExcludedUser —Everyone but the custom user can see the action link.

fields.name: ActionPlanState
fields.description: The status of work being done for the action plan.

fields.name: ActionPlanTemplateVersionId
fields.description: The ID of the version of the action plan template used to create this action plan. At creation, the referenced action plan template must be in the published state.

fields.name: ActionPlanType
fields.description: The action plan’s type.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the action plan is locked or not.

fields.name: IsUsingHolidayHours
fields.description: Indicates whether task completion dates have been calculated by incrementing the task offset for each non-work day, excluding recurring holidays.

fields.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the action plan can be edited or not.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the action plan.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who owns this record.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The start date of the action plan.

fields.name: TargetId
fields.description: The ID of the parent object record that relates to this action plan. For API version 63.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, AccountPlanObjective, Applicant, ApplicationForm, ApplicationFormProduct, Asset, BusinessLicense, BusinessMilestone, Campaign, Case, ChangeRequest, Claim, Contact, Contract, FinancialGoal, Incident, InsurancePolicy, InsurancePolicyCoverage, Lead, Opportunity, PersonLifeEvent, Problem, ResidentialLoanApplication, WorkOrder, and WorkOrderLineItem. For API version 62.0 and later, supported parent objects are ApplicationFormEvaluation and VettingEvaluation. For API version 48.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, AssetsAndLiabilities, BusinessMilestone, Campaign, Card, Case, Claim, Contact, Contract, Financial Account, Financial Goal, Financial Holding, InsurancePolicy, InsurancePolicyCoverage, Lead, Opportunity, PersonLifeEvent, ResidentialLoanApplication, and Visit as well as custom objects with activities enabled. For API version 47.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, BusinessMilestone, Campaign, Case, Claim, Contact, Contract, InsurancePolicy, InsurancePolicyCoverage, Lead, Opportunity, PersonLifeEvent, and Visit as well as custom objects with activities enabled. For API version 46.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, Campaign, Case, Contact, Contract, Lead, and Opportunity as well as custom objects with activities enabled. For API version 45.0 and earlier, the only supported parent object is Account.
