fields.description: Date that profile metrics were collected.

fields.name: ProfileId
fields.description: The ID of the profile.

fields.name: UserLicenseId
fields.description: The ID of the user license.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of this scratch org.

fields.name: Edition
fields.description: The org edition of this scratch org. Possible values are Group , Developer , Enterprise , and Professional . This field is read only.

fields.name: ExpirationDate
fields.description: Date when the scratch org expires. This field is read only.

fields.name: Features
fields.description: The features enabled in this scratch org, such as MultiCurrency . See the Salesforce DX Developer Guide for the full list of valid features. This field is read only.

fields.name: HasSampleData
fields.description: Specifies whether the scratch org contains sample data. If set to true , the sample data is similar to the data in a Salesforce free trial org.

fields.name: LastLoginDate
fields.description: The date of the last user login to the scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record. This field is read only.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate isn’t null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly. This field is read only.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The auto-generated ID of this scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: Namespace
fields.description: The namespace associated with this scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: OrgName
fields.description: The name of the scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who owns this scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: ScratchOrg
fields.description: The org ID of the scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: ScratchOrgInfoId
fields.description: The id of the associated ScratchOrgInfo object. This field is read only.

fields.name: SignupEmail
fields.description: The email address of the Administration user. This field is read only.

fields.name: SignupInstance
fields.description: The Salesforce instance on which this scratch org resides. This field is read only.

fields.name: SignupTrialDays
fields.description: The number of days between the scratch org's creation and expiration. This field is read only.

fields.name: SignupUsername
fields.description: The username of the Administration user of the scratch org. This field is read only.

fields.name: Snapshot
fields.description: If this scratch org was created from a scratch org snapshot, then this field contains either the name or ID of the snapshot. Specifically, the name corresponds to the Name field of the snapshot’s record in the OrgSnapshot standard object; the ID corresponds to the record ID.

fields.name: ActivityId
fields.description: The ID of the task or event that changed.

fields.name: ChangedById
fields.description: The ID of the user who made the change.

fields.name: ChangedDate
fields.description: The date the field value changed.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: The type of the field with the changed value.

fields.name: FieldName
fields.description: The name of the field changed.

fields.name: IsDataAvailable
fields.description: Indicates whether valid data is available in the old and new value fields. This field is false if, for example, the fields are encrypted or the changed values are too large, such as for Description field types.

fields.name: NewValueDateTime
fields.description: The new value for date type fields.

fields.name: NewValueNumber
fields.description: The new value for number type fields.

fields.name: NewValueText
fields.description: The new value for all other field types that are not a date or number type.

fields.name: OldValueDateTime
fields.description: Old value for date type fields.

fields.name: OldValueNumber
fields.description: Old value for number type fields.

fields.name: OldValueText
fields.description: The old value for all other field types that are not a date or number type.

fields.name: Operation
fields.description: The operation of the field value change.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the related account, which is determined as follows: The account associated with the WhatId , if it exists; or The account associated with the WhoId , if it exists; otherwise null For information on IDs, see ID Field Type .

fields.name: ActivityDate
fields.description: Indicates one of the following: The due date of a task The due date of an event if IsAllDayEvent is set to true

fields.name: ActivityDateTime
fields.description: Contains the event’s due date if the IsAllDayEvent flag is set to false . The time portion of this field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Translate the time portion to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. Label is Due Date Time . The value for this field and StartDateTime must match, or one of them must be null .

fields.name: ActivitySubtype
fields.description: Provides standard subtypes to facilitate creating and searching for specific activity subtypes. This field isn’t updateable. Possible values are: Task Email Call Event LinkedIn —Available in API version 56.0 and later. List Email

fields.name: ActivityType
fields.description: Represents one of the following values: Call , Email , Meeting , or Other . Label is Type . These are default values, and can be changed.

fields.name: AlternateDetailId
fields.description: The ID of a record the activity is related to which contains more details about the activity. For example, an activity can be related to an EmailMessage record.

fields.name: CallDisposition
fields.description: Represents the result of a given call, for example, “we'll call back,” or “call unsuccessful.” Limit is 255 characters.

fields.name: CallDurationInSeconds
fields.description: Duration of the call in seconds.

fields.name: CallObject
fields.description: Name of a call center. Limit is 255 characters.

fields.name: CallType
fields.description: The type of call being answered: Inbound, Internal, or Outbound.

fields.name: CompletedDateTime
fields.description: The date and time the task was saved with a Closed status. For insert, if the task is saved with a Closed status the field is set. If the task is saved with an Open status the field is set to NULL. For update, if the task is saved with a new Closed status, the field is reset. If the task is saved with a new non-closed status, the field is reset to NULL. If the task is saved with the same closed status (that is, unchanged) there is no change to the field. Note The status is a dynamic enum. If the Closed mapping is changed it won’t cause an update of existing tasks. Only new insert/update operations are affected.

fields.name: ConnectionReceivedId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that shared this record with your organization. This field is available only if your organization has enabled Salesforce to Salesforce and only in API versions 28.0 and later.

fields.name: ConnectionSentId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that your organization shared this record with. This field is available only if your organization has enabled Salesforce to Salesforce, and only in API versions 28.0 and later. The value is always null . You can use the PartnerNetworkRecordConnection object to forward records to connections.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Contains a description of the event or task. Limit is 32 KB.

fields.name: Division
fields.description: A logical segment of your organization's data. For example, if your company is organized into different business units, you could create a division for each business unit, such as “North America,” “Healthcare,” or “Consulting.” Available only if the organization has the Division permission enabled.

fields.name: DurationInMinutes
fields.description: Indicates the duration of the event or task.

fields.name: EndDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the end date and time of the event or task. Available in versions 27.0 and later. This field is optional, depending on the following: If IsAllDayEvent is true, you can supply a value for either DurationInMinutes or EndDateTime . Supplying values in both fields is allowed if the values add up to the same amount of time. If both fields are null , the duration defaults to one day. If IsAllDayEvent is false, a value must be supplied for either DurationInMinutes or EndDateTime . Supplying values in both fields is allowed if the values add up to the same amount of time.

fields.name: IsAllDayEvent
fields.description: If the value of this field is set to true , then the activity is an event spanning a full day, and the ActivityDate defines the date of the event. If the value of this field is set to false , then the activity may be an event spanning less than a full day, or it may be a task. The default value of this field is false . Label is All-Day Event .

fields.name: IsClosed
fields.description: Indicates whether a task is closed ( true ) or not closed ( false ). The default value of this field is false . This field is set indirectly by setting the Status field on the task—each picklist value has a corresponding IsClosed value. Label is Closed .

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the activity has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: IsHighPriority
fields.description: Indicates a high-priority task. This field is derived from the Priority field. The default value of this field is false .

fields.name: IsOnlineMeeting
fields.description: Indicates whether the activity represents an online meeting ( true ) or not ( false ). Note This field is not available in API version 16.0 or later.

fields.name: IsReminderSet
fields.description: Indicates whether a reminder is set for an activity ( true ) or not ( false ).The default value of this field is false .

fields.name: IsTask
fields.description: If the value of this field is set to true , then the activity is a task. If the value is set to false , then the activity is an event. The default value of this field is false . Label is Task .

fields.name: IsVisibleInSelfService
fields.description: If the value of this field is set to true , then the activity can be viewed in the self-service portal. The default value of this field is false . Label is Visible in Self-Service .

fields.name: Location
fields.description: If the activity is an event, then this field contains the location of the event. If the activity is a task, then the value is null .

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the user or group who owns the activity.

fields.name: PrimaryAccountId
fields.description: Contains the AccountId value from the activity record. Available in API versions 30.0 and later to organizations that use Shared Activities.

fields.name: PrimaryWhoId
fields.description: Contains the WhoId value from the activity record. Available in API versions 30.0 and later to organizations that have enabled Shared Activities.

fields.name: Priority
fields.description: Indicates the priority of a task, such as high, normal, or low. The default value of this field is Normal .

fields.name: ReminderDateTime
fields.description: Represents the time when the reminder is scheduled to fire, if IsReminderSet is set to true . If IsReminderSet is set to false , then the user may have deselected the reminder checkbox in the Salesforce user interface, or the reminder has already fired at the time indicated by the value.

fields.name: StartDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the start date and time of the event. Available in versions 29.0 and later. If the event’s IsAllDayEvent flag is set to true (indicating an all-day event), then the time stamp in StartDateTime is always set to midnight in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Note Don’t attempt to alter the time stamp to account for any time zone differences. If the event’s IsAllDayEvent flag is set to false, then you must translate the time portion of the time stamp in StartDateTime to or from a local time zone for the user or the application, as appropriate. The translation must be in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. If this field has a value, then ActivityDate and ActivityDateTime either must be null or must match the value of this field. If the activity is a task, StartDateTime is null

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Indicates the current status of a task,. The default value of this field is Not Started . Each predefined status field sets a value for IsClosed . To obtain picklist values, query TaskStatus. Possible values are: Completed Deferred In Progress Not Started Waiting on someone else

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: Contains the subject of the task or event.

fields.name: WhatId
fields.description: The WhatId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects. WhatId s are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhatId is equivalent to the ID of a related object. The label is Related To ID .

fields.name: WhoId
fields.description: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact. WhoIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhoId is equivalent to a contact’s ID or a lead’s ID. The label is Name ID . If Shared Activities is enabled, the value of this field is the ID of the related lead or primary contact. If you add, update, or remove the WhoId field, you might encounter problems with triggers, workflows, and data validation rules that are associated with the record. The label is Name ID . If your organization uses Shared Activities, when you query activities in API version 30.0 or later, the returned value of the WhoId field matches the value in the queried object, not necessarily in the activity record itself. If Shared Activities is enabled, the value of this field is not populated and the field PrimaryWhoId should be queried instead.

fields.name: BaseId
fields.description: The ID of the record that the activities apply to.

fields.name: BaseType
fields.description: The entity that corresponds to the BaseId

fields.name: FirstCallDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the first call was made. This field is available only to Sales Engagement users. Einstein Activity Capture and Activity Metrics aren’t required.

fields.name: FirstEmailDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the first email was sent. This field is available only to Sales Engagement users. Einstein Activity Capture and Activity Metrics aren’t required.

fields.name: InactiveDays
fields.description: Indicates the number of days since the most recent activity was completed. This field is derived from the Last Activity Date field.

fields.name: LastActivityDateLastModDate
fields.description: Indicates when the LastActivityDateTime field was last modified.

fields.name: LastActivityDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the most recent activity was completed.

fields.name: LastCallDateLastModDate
fields.description: Indicates when the LastCallDateTime field was last modified.

fields.name: LastCallDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the most recent call was made through Sales Dialer or Inbox.

fields.name: LastEmailDateLastModDate
fields.description: Indicates when the LastEmailDateTime field was last modified.

fields.name: LastEmailDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the most recent email was sent or received.

fields.name: LastEmailReceivedDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the most recent email was received. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: LastEmailSentDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the most recent email was sent. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: LastEventDateLastModDate
fields.description: Indicates when the LastEventDateTime field was last modified.

fields.name: LastEventDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the most recent event was completed.

fields.name: LastTaskDateLastModDate
fields.description: Indicates when the LastTaskDateTime field was last modified.

fields.name: LastTaskDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date when the last task was completed.

fields.name: NextActivityDateLastModDate
fields.description: Indicates when the NextActivityDateTime field was last modified.

fields.name: NextActivityDateTime
fields.description: Indicates the date of the next scheduled task or event. Only open tasks in the future are included.

fields.name: ConfigurationName
fields.description: The name of the Einstein Activity Capture configuration that the user is assigned to.

fields.name: ConnectivityStatus
fields.description: The status of the user’s email connection.

fields.name: ContactsSynced
fields.description: The number of contacts synced after midnight between Salesforce and the user’s Microsoft or Google email account. This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: EmailAddress
fields.description: The email address that’s used to capture and sync data between Salesforce and the user’s Microsoft or Google account.

fields.name: EventsSynced
fields.description: The number of events synced after midnight between Salesforce and the user’s Microsoft or Google email account. This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: This field is reserved for future use.

fields.name: GlobalOauthTermsState
fields.description: Indicates the user’s terms of service status. When emails are enabled for Einstein Activity Capture, each user must accept the terms of service.

fields.name: IsTermsOfServiceAccepted
fields.description: Indicates whether the user has accepted the Einstein Activity Capture terms of service or not. When emails are enabled for Einstein Activity Capture, each user must accept the terms of service.

fields.name: RecommendedActionDescription
fields.description: Recommended action to take when the user’s ConnectivityStatus is NEEDSATTENTION . Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: RecommendedActionTitle
fields.description: Reason for the user's ConnectivityStatus when the status is NEEDSATTENTION . Available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: ID of the user.

fields.name: UserName
fields.description: The username of the Einstein Activity Capture user.

fields.name: UserOnboardingStatus
fields.description: The initial sync status when the user connects Salesforce with their external email account and syncs data for the first time. This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: CallCenterId
fields.description: System field that contains the ID of the user who created the call center associated with this additional number. If value is null, this additional number is displayed in every call center's phone directory.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the additional number, such as Conference Room B. Limit: 255 characters.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the additional number. Limit: 80 characters.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: The phone number that corresponds to this additional number.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: The full address.

fields.name: AddressType
fields.description: Picklist of address types. The values are: Mailing Shipping Billing Home

fields.name: City
fields.description: The address city.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The address country.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A brief description of the address.

fields.name: DrivingDirections
fields.description: Directions to the address.

fields.name: GeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. A geocoding service typically provides this value based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: LocationType
fields.description: Picklist of location types. The available values are: Warehouse (default) Site Van Plant

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the address.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: A lookup field to the parent location.

fields.name: PostalCode
fields.description: The address postal code.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The address state.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The address street.

fields.name: TimeZone
fields.description: Picklist of available time zones.

fields.name: AcceptDateTime
fields.description: Indicates when the work item was accepted.

fields.name: ActiveTime
fields.description: The amount of time an agent is actively working on a work item in their console. Active time is tracked only for tasks routed using the tab-based capacity model. It's tracked only when the work tab is open and in focus in the console. If the agent switches console tabs, the time spent on the other tabs isn't counted. Active time continues to count if you switch to a new browser tab or window. Active time stops when the agent closes the work item or the after conversation work time ends, whichever happens first.

fields.name: AcwExtensionCount
fields.description: The number of times that an agent extended the After Conversation Work (ACW) timer. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later.

fields.name: AcwExtensionDuration
fields.description: The length of time (in seconds) that the After Conversation Work (ACW) timer was extended each time that the agent extended the timer. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. To find the total extension duration, multiply this field by AcwExtensionCount or use AfterConversationActualTime .

fields.name: AfterConversationActualTime
fields.description: The number of seconds an agent spent on After Conversation Work (ACW) after customer contact ended. This field is available in API version 52.0 and later.

fields.name: AgentCapacityWhenDeclined
fields.description: The agent’s capacity when declining work, either explicitly or through push timeout.

fields.name: AssignedDateTime
fields.description: Indicates when the work item was assigned to an agent

fields.name: BotId
fields.description: The ID of the Enhanced Einstein Bot or AI agent that performed the work. This is a relationship field. This field is available in API version 52.0 and later.

fields.name: BotType
fields.description: Indicates the type of bot. Valid values are: Bot. Refers to an Einstein bot. ExternalCopilot. Refers to an AI agent with whom your customers can interact.

fields.name: CancelDateTime
fields.description: Indicates when the work item was canceled.

fields.name: CapacityModel
fields.description: Indicates the capacity model used to determine agent capacity. Valid values are StatusBased and TabBased . This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: CapacityPercentage
fields.description: The percentage of an agent’s capacity that’s consumed when this work item is in progress. Valid values are from 0 to 100.

fields.name: CapacityWeight
fields.description: The amount of an agent’s capacity that’s consumed when this work item is in progress.

fields.name: CloseDateTime
fields.description: Indicates when the work item was closed.

fields.name: DeclineDateTime
fields.description: Date and time when the agent declined this record.

fields.name: DeclineReason
fields.description: The provided reason for why an agent declined the work request.

fields.name: ExternalBotId
fields.description: The ID of the third-party bot that handles the work item. This is a relationship field. This field is available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: HandleTime
fields.description: The amount of time an agent had the work item open, calculated by CloseDateTime – AcceptedDateTime . Handle time stops when the agent closes the work item or the after conversation work time ends, whichever happens first.

fields.name: IsConference
fields.description: Indicates whether the agent was conferenced on the work item by another agent ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false . Available in API version 44.0 and later. This field is accessible in Reports, but not via the API.

fields.name: IsInterruptible
fields.description: Indicates whether a work item consumes interruptible or primary capacity. The default value is false. Available in API version 57.0 and later when the Interruptible Capacity feature is enabled.

fields.name: IsOwnerChangeInitiated
fields.description: Indicates whether a work item owner change triggered the direct assignment of the work item to the agent. The default value is false . Status-Based Capacity Model has to be turned on to use this field. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: IsPreferredUserRequired
fields.description: Indicates whether a work item stays with the preferred user even when the user isn’t available. The default value is false. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: IsStatusChangeInitiated
fields.description: Indicates whether a work item status change triggered the direct assignment of the work item to the agent. The default value is false. Status-Based Capacity Model has to be turned on to use this field. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: IsTransfer
fields.description: Indicates whether the agent received the work item through transfer from another agent ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false . Available in API version 38.0 and later. This field is accesible in Reports, but not via the API.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An automatically generated ID number that identifies the record.

fields.name: OriginalGroupId
fields.description: The ID of the queue that the work assignment was originally routed to. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: OriginalQueueId
fields.description: The ID of the queue that the work assignment was originally routed to. Due to API changes, OriginalQueueId is no longer recommended. Use OriginalGroupId instead.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the AgentWork. This field is a polymorphic relationship field. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: PausedCapacityPercentage
fields.description: The percentage of an agent’s capacity that’s consumed when this work item is paused. The paused capacity feature is available with status-based capacity and Enhanced Omni-Channel only. This field is available in API version 62.0 and later.

fields.name: PausedCapacityWeight
fields.description: The amount of an agent’s capacity that’s consumed when this work item is paused. The paused capacity feature is available with status-based capacity and Enhanced Omni-Channel only. This field is available in API version 62.0 and later.

fields.name: PendingServiceRoutingId
fields.description: The ID of the PendingServiceRouting from which the AgentWork was created. This field is a relationship field. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: PreferredUserId
fields.description: The ID of the preferred user to handle the work. This field is a relationship field. This field is available in API v46.0 and later.

fields.name: PushTimeout
fields.description: The time limit set for an agent to respond to an item before it’s pushed to another agent. The time limit is measured in seconds. This field is available in API version 36.0 and later.

fields.name: PushTimeoutDateTime
fields.description: The date and time (in UTC) when the push timeout event occurred. This field is available in API version 36.0 and later.

fields.name: RequestDateTime
fields.description: Indicates when the work was requested.

fields.name: RoutingModel
fields.description: Determines how incoming work items are routed to agents assigned to a service channel. Possible values are: ExternalRouting LeastActive MostAvailable

fields.name: RoutingPriority
fields.description: The order in which work items from the queue that are associated with the routing configuration are routed to agents.

fields.name: RoutingType
fields.description: The type of Omni-Channel routing. Possible values are: QueueBased SkillsBased

fields.name: SecondaryRoutingPriority
fields.description: Indicates the secondary routing priority.

fields.name: ServiceChannelId
fields.description: The ID of the service channel that’s associated with the work assignment. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: ShouldSkipCapacityCheck
fields.description: Indicates whether to skip checking an agent’s available capacity ( true ) or not ( false ) when an externally routed work item is created. This field is used when agents can simultaneously handle work from both Omni-Channel queues and queues using external routing.

fields.name: SpeedToAnswer
fields.description: The amount of time between when the work was requested and when an agent accepted it.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The working status of the work item. Valid values are: Assigned – The item is assigned to the agent but hasn’t been opened. Canceled – The item no longer needs to be routed. For example: a chat visitor cancels their Omni-Channel routed chat request before it reaches an agent. Closed – The item is closed. Declined – The item was assigned to the agent but the agent explicitly declined it. DeclinedOnPushTimeout – The item was declined because push time-out is enabled and the item request timed out with the agent. Opened – The agent opened the item. Transferred –The item was transferred from an agent to another agent, queue, or skill. Unavailable – The item was assigned to the agent but the agent became unavailable (went offline or lost connection).

fields.name: TargetAcceptDateTime
fields.description: The date and time by when a rep must accept a work item. Influences backlog ordering by prioritizing work items with earlier target acceptance deadlines. The field can be dynamically set using Flow for each work item during the routing process. This allows for flexible prioritization based on case urgency, customer tier, or other business rules. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: TransferRequesterId
fields.description: The user ID of the rep who reassigned the work using the Reassign action. This field is populated in reassigned AgentWork records only, not the original AgentWork record. This is a relationship field. This field is available in API version 63.0 and later.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: The ID of the user that the work item was assigned to. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: WorkItemId
fields.description: The ID of the object that’s routed to the agent through Omni-Channel.
refersTo: Custom objects and these standard objects: Account
and VoiceCall. WorkOrder is available in version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: AgentWorkId
fields.description: The AgentWork object associated with this skill.

fields.name: IsAdditionalSkill
fields.description: After a designated timeout period, a skill marked as additional is dropped from Omni-Channel routing. The case is then routed to the best-matched agent, even if the agent doesn’t have all the skills. The default value is false. Available in API version 48.0 and later.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An automatically generated ID number that identifies the record.

fields.name: SkillId
fields.description: The skill that is required or additional.

fields.name: SkillLevel
fields.description: The level of the required or additional skill. Skill levels can range from 1 to 10. Depending on your business needs, you might want the skill level to reflect years of experience, certification levels, or license classes.

fields.name: SkillPriority
fields.description: For additional skills, specifies the order in which skills are dropped if after the specified timeout no agent with that skill is available. Higher priority-value skills are dropped first. Lower priority-value skills, for example 0, are dropped last. Skills with the same priority value are dropped as a group. You can set skill priority using attribute setup for skills-based routing or Apex code.

fields.name: WasDropped
fields.description: For skills marked as additional, indicates if the skill was dropped from Omni-Channel routing because an agent with this skill was not available. The default value is false. Available in API version 48.0 and later.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the application. Possible values are: da —Danish de —German en_US —English es —Spanish es_MX —Spanish (Mexico) fi —Finnish fr —French it —Italian ja —Japanese ko —Korean nl_NL —Dutch no —Norwegian pt_BR —Portuguese (Brazil) ru —Russian sv —Swedish th —Thai zh_CN —Chinese (Simplified) zh_TW —Chinese (Traditional)

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Label that identifies the AI application throughout the Salesforce user interface.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: Specifies the namespace of the application if installed with a managed package.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the AI application. Possible values are: Disabled Enabled Migrated

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of application. Possible values are: PredictionBuilder

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the application. Possible values are: da —Danish de —German en_US —English es —Spanish es_MX —Spanish (Mexico) fi —Finnish fr —French it —Italian ja —Japanese ko —Korean nl_NL —Dutch no —Norwegian pt_BR —Portuguese (Brazil) ru —Russian sv —Swedish th —Thai zh_CN —Chinese (Simplified) zh_TW —Chinese (Traditional)

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Label that identifies the AI application throughout the Salesforce user interface.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: Specifies the namespace of the application config, if installed with a managed package.

fields.name: ActionItemOwnerId
fields.description: The ID associated with the owner of the AI-generated action item. The owner can be an agent or human user, and can change during the review and execution process. By default, the owner is an agent or queue.

fields.name: ActionResult
fields.description: The result generated when the agent action is executed.

fields.name: AgentType
fields.description: The specific agent that processes the AI-generated action item.

fields.name: BotDefinitionId
fields.description: The bot record with a template name that matches the value in the Sales Management agent template.

fields.name: BotVersionId
fields.description: The bot version from the bot record with an ID that matches the ID of the Sales Management agent bot record.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The explanation of why the action item has been suggested. The description provides additional context to guide human users and agents in their decision-making.

fields.name: ExpirationDate
fields.description: The date that the action item expires and is deleted. AI-generated action items are no longer visible to users after 14 days and removed from records after 30 days.

fields.name: GeneratedResponseIdRef
fields.description: The ID of generated result in the GenAIGeneration DMO. This field can be used by human users to provide feedback on the AI-generated action item.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of this object.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the AI-generated action item.

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: The subject line that displays to users indicating what the action item is.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The category that the action item falls under. This field can be used to search for specific action items, such as field updates or follow-up sales emails.

fields.name: UnmodActionItemOutput
fields.description: The unmodified output for the action item produced by AI, whether from a prompt template or other generation method.

fields.name: WhatId
fields.description: The record that the AI-generated action item is for.

fields.name: ActionId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated action, such as the ID of a Macro.

fields.name: ActionName
fields.description: The ID of the action. For example, a value of “Case.SendEmail” indicates a send email quick action on Case.

fields.name: AiRecordInsightId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated AIRecordInsight.

fields.name: Confidence
fields.description: Relative confidence strength of the generated prediction insight. Higher values (near 1.0) indicate stronger confidence.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the AIInsightAction.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of action. Possible values are: InvocableAction —Invocable Action Macro —Macro QuickAction —Quick action. StandardAction —Standard Action. An example standard action would be to update a record.

fields.name: ActualValue
fields.description: The raw feedback value. This field is null when no recommendation is selected.

fields.name: AiFeedback
fields.description: The feedback user sentiment. Possible values are: Negative —Negative feedback Neutral —Neutral feedback Positive —Positive feedback

fields.name: AiInsightFeedbackType
fields.description: The nature of the feedback. Possible values are: Explicit —Explicit feedback. For example, a user applies and saves an Einstein recommendation on a case. Implicit —Implicit feedback. For example, a user edits or updates a case field without viewing or applying field recommendations from Einstein.

fields.name: AiRecordInsightId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated AIRecordInsight.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the AIInsightFeedback.

fields.name: Rank
fields.description: The feedback score.

fields.name: ValueId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated AIInsightValue.

fields.name: AiInsightValueId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated AIInsightValue.

fields.name: Contribution
fields.description: The contribution weight for this insight reason.

fields.name: FeatureType
fields.description: The type of the feature, such as BOOL.

fields.name: FeatureValue
fields.description: The value of the feature, such as TRUE or FALSE.

fields.name: FieldName
fields.description: The name of the field the insight uses for its evaluation.

fields.name: FieldValue
fields.description: The value for the field the insight uses for its evaluation.

fields.name: Intensity
fields.description: The intensity weight for this insight reason.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the AIInsightReason.

fields.name: Operator
fields.description: The logical operator the insight uses to compare the field value with the expression value. For example, if the prediction evaluates whether the fieldValue for the field bonus__c is greater than $5,000, the logical operator is greater than .

fields.name: ReasonLabelKey (Beta)
fields.description: The key used to map an Einstein Key Accounts Identification (Beta) insight phrase or phrases to the correct messaging template.

fields.name: RelatedInsightReasonId (Beta)
fields.description: The ID used to relate multiple insights to a single model reason in the Einstein Key Accounts Identification (Beta) feature.

fields.name: SortOrder (Beta)
fields.description: A number value used to organize the phrases in the model’s insights message in the Einstein Key Accounts Identification (Beta) feature.

fields.name: Variance
fields.description: The variance weight for this insight reason.

fields.name: AiInsightActionId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated AIInsightAction.

fields.name: AiRecordInsightId
fields.description: The unique ID of the associated AIRecordInsight.

fields.name: Confidence
fields.description: Relative confidence strength of the generated prediction insight. Higher values (near 1.0) indicate stronger confidence.

fields.name: Field
fields.description: The name of the target field Einstein is making predictions for, such as “AnnualRevenue”.

fields.name: FieldValueLowerBound
fields.description: The lower bound value.

fields.name: FieldValueUpperBound
fields.description: The upper bound value.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the AIInsightValue.

fields.name: SobjectLookupValueId
fields.description: The unique ID of the value object, if this insight value references an object.

fields.name: SobjectType
fields.description: The type of the value object, such as Account or Case, if this insight value references an object.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The prediction result insight value.

fields.name: ValueType
fields.description: The data type of the prediction result insight value. Possible values are: Boolean —Boolean Currency —Currency DateTime —DateTime Enum —Enum Lookup —Lookup Number —Number String —String

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: The time when the job run ends.

fields.name: ErrorCode
fields.description: If the job run fails, this field indicates the specific error that occurred.

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: Contains a detailed, human-readable message that explains the reason for the job run failure.

fields.name: JobType
fields.description: Defines the job's logic.

fields.name: Label
fields.description: A user-defined name or label for the job run, which can be used for identification and tracking.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: A unique, system-generated identifier for the AiJobRun record.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user group that owns the AiJobRun record.

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: The time when the job run's status changes to InProgress .

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Tracks the lifecycle of the job run. Valid values are: New : The job run has been created. ReadyToStart : The job run is ready for the user to initiate processing. Queued : The job run is queued to start. InProgress : The job run is currently processing. Completed : The job run completed. Failed : The job run failed. Aborted : The job run was aborted by the user. Archived : The job run was archived by the user.

fields.name: Target
fields.description: A metadata field used to specify job-specific details, such as a PromptTemplateId , PromptTemplateName , or ModelId . This provides further context for the job execution.

fields.name: AiJobRunId
fields.description: A required reference to the parent AiJobRun record that this item belongs to.

fields.name: ErrorCode
fields.description: If processing for this item fails, this field contains a numeric code indicating the error.

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: Contains a detailed, human-readable message that explains the reason for the job run item failure.

fields.name: Input
fields.description: Contains the input data for a single item within the job run. For example, in a PromptTemplate job, this is the JSON input for the prompt template.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: A unique, system-generated identifier for the AiJobRunItem record.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user or group that owns the AiJobRunItem record.

fields.name: PreprocessedInput
fields.description: Stores an intermediate version of the input data after the preprocessing step. For example, this field could be a hydrated JSON prompt.

fields.name: Response
fields.description: Contains the generated response for the job item after processing is complete.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Tracks the status of the individual job item. Valid values are: Ready : The default value. The job run item is ready to start processing. Completed : Processing for the job run item is complete. Failed : Processing for the job run item failed.

fields.name: ApplicationType
fields.description: Type of application using the AI model.

fields.name: ExternalAiModelId
fields.description: ID of the AI model used to generate predictions.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Languages supported by this AI model.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: AI model name.

fields.name: ServingStatus
fields.description: Determines if the language is enabled or disabled for this AI model.

fields.name: TranscriptCount
fields.description: Transcript count detected for each language.

fields.name: AiApplicationId
fields.description: The unique ID of the AiApplication that generated this prediction.

fields.name: Confidence
fields.description: Relative confidence strength of the generated prediction insight, from 0.0 to 1.0. Higher values (near 1.0) indicate stronger confidence.

fields.name: MlPredictionDefinitionId
fields.description: This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: ModelId
fields.description: The ID of the model to use when generating the insight.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the AIRecordInsight.

fields.name: PredictionField
fields.description: The label of the field that Einstein is making predictions for, such as “Case.IsEscalated”.

fields.name: RunGuid
fields.description: A unique identifier for the Einstein process that made the prediction.

fields.name: RunStartTime
fields.description: The date and time the Einstein prediction process was started.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of this insight. Possible values are: Defunct —The insight has been consumed by the Einstein feature that owns the prediction. For example, Case Classification marks an insight as defunct if a predicted recommendation was presented to a user and the user either accepted or ignored the recommendation. This behavior ensures that the same recommendation isn’t presented multiple times to the user. New —The insight hasn’t been consumed by the Einstein feature.

fields.name: TargetField
fields.description: The field to which prediction results are written. Case Classification doesn’t use this field.

fields.name: TargetId
fields.description: The unique ID of the record Einstein is making predictions for.

fields.name: TargetSobjectType
fields.description: The type of the target object, such as Account or Case.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of insight. Possible values are: Action —An insight that indicates a suggested action, such as sending an email. Lookup —An insight that indicates a related value not directly related to the target object and field. MultiValue —An insight with multiple values, such as a multi-class classification. SimilarRecord —An insight that indicates similar or duplicate records. SingleValue —A single value insight, such as a regression number or a score.

fields.name: ValidUntil
fields.description: The day and time this insight is valid until. After this day and time, the insight might no longer be valid due to new prediction results from new or changed data. If this field is null , this insight never expires.

fields.name: AiGenActionItemId
fields.description: The business action suggested by generative AI.

fields.name: IsToxicityDetected
fields.description: Specifies whether the generated response contains toxic language ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: LatestErrorMessage
fields.description: The error message that displays if the result can't be generated.

fields.name: LatestGenResponseIdRef
fields.description: The ID of the most recently generated result in the GenAIGeneration object. The object is derived from the Data Cloud data model object (DMO).

fields.name: LatestGenerationDate
fields.description: The date and time that the result was most recently generated.

fields.name: LatestResult
fields.description: The AI-generated result.

fields.name: LatestSafetyScore
fields.description: Overall safety score for the generated research. A higher value means the generated response is more likely to be safe. Minimum value of 0.0. Maximum value of 1.0.

fields.name: LatestStatus
fields.description: The status of the generated result.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The owner of the generated research result.

fields.name: ReferenceRecordId
fields.description: The record ID that the research result was generated for.

fields.name: StandardPromptTemplate
fields.description: The standard prompt template used to generate the result.

fields.name: Version
fields.description: The prompt template version number.

fields.name: Domain
fields.description: An allowed email domain for users.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: The account for the alternative payment method.

fields.name: AlternativePaymentMethod​Number
fields.description: Salesforce ID number for the alternative payment method.

fields.name: AuditEmail
fields.description: The email address of the payment owner where audit information about payments is sent.

fields.name: BankAccountHolderType
fields.description: Determines if the bank account is held by a business or an individual.

fields.name: BankAccountType
fields.description: Type of bank account such as a checking or savings account.

fields.name: BillingFirstName
fields.description: The first name of the payment method owner, based on their billing address details.

fields.name: BillingLastName
fields.description: The last name of the payment method owner, based on their billing address details.

fields.name: BillingName
fields.description: The first and last name of the payment method owner, based on their billing address details.

fields.name: Comments
fields.description: Users can add comments to provide additional details about a record. Maximum of 1000 characters.

fields.name: CompanyName
fields.description: Company name for this payment method. Part of the payment method’s address.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: Email address of the payment method holder.

fields.name: ExtendedPaymentMethodType
fields.description: Other alternative payment methods used for the transaction. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: GatewayToken
fields.description: Tokenized form of the alternative payment method, returned by the gateway. Stored as encrypted text.

fields.name: GatewayTokenDetails
fields.description: A unique tokenized ID generated by the payment gateway when this payment method first interacts with the gateway. Used to identify the payment method during future transactions.

fields.name: IpAddress
fields.description: IP address for the payment method owner.

fields.name: IsAutoPayEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the payment method can be used for recurring payments (True) or not (False). The default value is False.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it's possible the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

fields.name: MacAddress
fields.description: Mac Address of the payment method holder.

fields.name: NickName
fields.description: User-defined nickname for this payment method.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user who owns the alternative payment method.

fields.name: PaymentGatewayId
fields.description: ID of the payment gateway entity used to handle transactions from this payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodAddress
fields.description: Full address associated with the alternative payment method. For more information about address fields, see Address Compound Fields .

fields.name: PaymentMethodCity
fields.description: Payment method address details.

fields.name: PaymentMethodCountry
fields.description: Payment method address details.

fields.name: PaymentMethodDetails
fields.description: Optional information about the payment method type. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: PaymentMethodGeocode​Accuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the payment method address. An accuracy level contains information about the location of a latitude and longitude. For more information about geolocation fields, see Geolocation Compound Field .

fields.name: PaymentMethodLatitude
fields.description: Latitude of the payment method address. Used with the PaymentMethodLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. For details about geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: PaymentMethodLongitude
fields.description: Longitude of the payment method address. Used with the PaymentMethodLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. For details about geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: PaymentMethodPostalCode
fields.description: Details of the address for this payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodState
fields.description: Details of the address for this payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodStreet
fields.description: Details of the address for this payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodSubType
fields.description: More information about the payment method. For example, if the PaymentMethodType is Visa, this field can be a digital wallet. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: PaymentMethodType
fields.description: Payment method used for the transaction, such as Visa, Mastercard, EPS, SepaDebit, and Klarna. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: Phone number of the payment method's owner.

fields.name: ProcessingMode
fields.description: Indicates whether the payment method was created in Salesforce or externally. Required.

fields.name: SavedPaymentMethodId
fields.description: The ID of the saved payment method record.

fields.name: StandardEntryClassCode
fields.description: A three-letter code that indicates how a customer or a business initiated and authorized an ACH payment.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The state of the payment method. Required.

fields.name: AnalyticsMode
fields.description: The location where the dashboard is displayed. In the Salesforce mobile app, embedded dashboards are logged as embedded first.

fields.name: AnalyticsSessionIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of a particular session of CRM Analytics. Use this field to determine which log lines originated from a particular session.

fields.name: AnalyticsTimestamp
fields.description: The time when this log line was generated.

fields.name: ClientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”. For example: 96.43.144.26 .

fields.name: CpuTime
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: IsMobile
fields.description: Indicates that the dashboard is displayed in mobile (true) or not (false).

fields.name: IsNew
fields.description: The field indicates that this action opens a new tab ( true ) or goes back to a previously opened tab ( false ).

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: PageContext
fields.description: The name of the component hosting the main content of the page. For example: clients:cardsContainer.

fields.name: PageIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the CRM Analytics dashboard page.

fields.name: RecordIdentifier
fields.description: The Salesforce ID of the CRM Analytics object.

fields.name: ReopenCount
fields.description: If IsNew is false , the number of times that an existing page opens.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier. For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The amount of time that the request took in milliseconds.

fields.name: SavedViewIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the CRM Analytics dashboard saved view.

fields.name: SessionKey
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started. For example: d7DEq/ANa7nNZZVD .

fields.name: TabIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the particular Analytics tab in the user interface.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of Apex callout. For example: REST or AJAX.

fields.name: Uri
fields.description: The URI of the page that’s receiving the request. For example: /home/home.jsp .

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character Identifier of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: ViewMode
fields.description: The view mode for the CRM Analytics asset. Possible values include view edit present JSON print

fields.name: AnalyticsWorkspaceId
fields.description: The ID of the Tableau Next workspace the dashboard is associated with.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of the dashboard.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The API name of the dashboard.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The supported languages for the visualization. There are over 50+ supported language and dialect values.

fields.name: LastDraftModifiedDate
fields.description: The last modified date for the dashboard in draft mode.

fields.name: LastPublishedDate
fields.description: The last published date for the dashboard.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The label for the dashboard.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix for the dashboard.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user ID of the user who created the dashboard.

fields.name: Style
fields.description: The widget style for the dashboard, represented as a JSON string. For example, {"widgetStyle":{"backgroundColor":"#ffffff","borderEdges":[],"borderColor":"#cccccc","borderWidth":1,"borderRadius":0}}

fields.name: TemplateAssetSourceName
fields.description: If the dashboard was created from a template, this is name of the asset source.

fields.name: TemplateSource
fields.description: If the dashboard was created from a template, this is name of the template.

fields.name: Version
fields.description: The API version for the dashboard.
