fields.description: The percentage of Apex SOAP calls that were made against the organization’s limit.

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: MethodName
fields.description: The name of the calling Apex method.

fields.name: QueryString
fields.description: The SOQL query, if one was performed.

fields.name: RateLimitUsage
fields.description: The percent of the current usage of your rate limit.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier . For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV .

fields.name: RequestStatus
fields.description: The status of the request for a page view or user interface action.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The amount of time that the request took in milliseconds. Requests with a value over five seconds are considered long-running requests for the purposes of the Concurrent Long-Running Apex Limit. HTTP callout processing time isn't included when calculating the 5-second limit. We pause the timer for the callout and resume it when the callout completes.

fields.name: SessionKey
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started. For example: d7DEq/ANa7nNZZVD .

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: Uri
fields.description: The URI of the page that’s receiving the request. For example: /home/home.jsp .

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: UserType
fields.description: The category of user license.

fields.name: ApexClassId
fields.description: The Apex class whose tests are to be executed.

fields.name: ExtendedStatus
fields.description: The pass rate of the test run. For example: “(4/6)”. This means that four out of a total of six tests passed. If the class fails to execute, this field contains the cause of the failure.

fields.name: ParentJobId
fields.description: Points to the AsyncApexJob that represents the entire test run. If you insert multiple Apex test queue items in a single bulk operation, the queue items share the same parent job. This means that a test run can consist of the execution of the tests of several classes if all the test queue items are inserted in the same bulk operation.

fields.name: ShouldSkipCodeCoverage
fields.description: Indicates whether to opt out of collecting code coverage information during Apex test runs. Available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the job. Valid values are: Holding 1 Queued Preparing Processing Aborted Completed Failed 1 This status applies to batch jobs in the Apex flex queue.

fields.name: TestRunResultId
fields.description: The ID of the associated ApexTestRunResult object.

fields.name: ApexClassId
fields.description: The Apex class whose test methods were executed.

fields.name: ApexLogId
fields.description: Points to the ApexLog for this test method execution if debug logging is enabled; otherwise, null .

fields.name: ApexTestRunResultId
fields.description: The ID of the ApexTestRunResult that represents the entire test run.

fields.name: AsyncApexJobId
fields.description: Points to the AsyncApexJob that represents the entire test run. This field points to the same object as ApexTestQueueItem.ParentJobId .

fields.name: IsTestSetup
fields.description: Indicates if the results are for a test setup method. The default is false.

fields.name: Message
fields.description: The exception error message if a test failure occurs; otherwise, null .

fields.name: MethodName
fields.description: The test method name.

fields.name: Outcome
fields.description: The result of the test method execution. Can be one of these values: Pass Fail CompileFail Skip

fields.name: QueueItemId
fields.description: Points to the ApexTestQueueItem which is the class that this test method is part of.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The time it took the test method to run, in milliseconds.

fields.name: StackTrace
fields.description: The Apex stack trace if the test failed; otherwise, null .

fields.name: TestTimestamp
fields.description: The start time of the test method.

fields.name: ApexTestResultId
fields.description: The ID of the associated ApexTestResult object.

fields.name: AsyncCalls
fields.description: The number of asynchronous calls made during the test run.

fields.name: Callouts
fields.description: The number of callouts made during the test run.

fields.name: Cpu
fields.description: The amount of CPU used during the test run, in milliseconds.

fields.name: Dml
fields.description: The number of DML statements made during the test run.

fields.name: DmlRows
fields.description: The number of rows accessed by DML statements during the test run.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: The number of email invocations made during the test run.

fields.name: LimitContext
fields.description: Indicates whether the test run was synchronous or asynchronous.

fields.name: LimitExceptions
fields.description: Indicates whether your org has any limits that differ from the default limits.

fields.name: MobilePush
fields.description: The number of mobile push calls made during the test run.

fields.name: QueryRows
fields.description: The number of rows queried during the test run.

fields.name: Soql
fields.description: The number of SOQL queries made during the test run.

fields.name: Sosl
fields.description: The number of SOSL queries made during the test run.

fields.name: AsyncApexJobId
fields.description: The parent Apex job ID for the result.

fields.name: ClassesCompleted
fields.description: The total number of classes executed during the test run.

fields.name: ClassesEnqueued
fields.description: The total number of classes enqueued during the test run.

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: The time at which the test run ended.

fields.name: IsAllTests
fields.description: Indicates whether all Apex test classes were run.

fields.name: JobName
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: MethodsCompleted
fields.description: The total number of methods completed during the test run. This value is updated after each class is run.

fields.name: MethodsEnqueued
fields.description: The total number of methods enqueued for the test run. This value is initialized before the test runs.

fields.name: MethodsFailed
fields.description: The total number of methods that failed during this test run. This value is updated after each class is run.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: The source of the test run, such as the Developer Console.

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: The time at which the test run started.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the test run. Values include: Queued Preparing Processing Aborted Completed Failed

fields.name: TestSetupTime
fields.description: The time it took the setup methods to run, in milliseconds.

fields.name: TestTime
fields.description: The time it took the test to run, in milliseconds.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: The user who ran the test run.

fields.name: TestSuiteName
fields.description: The name of the Apex test suite. This label appears in the user interface. This value is case-sensitive and must be unique.

fields.name: ApiVersion
fields.description: The API version for this trigger. Every trigger has an API version specified at creation.

fields.name: Body
fields.description: The Apex trigger definition. Limit: 1 million characters.

fields.name: BodyCrc
fields.description: The CRC (cyclic redundancy check) of the class or trigger file.

fields.name: IsValid
fields.description: Indicates whether any dependent metadata has changed since the trigger was last compiled ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: LengthWithoutComments
fields.description: Length of the trigger without comments

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the trigger. Limit: 255 characters

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The current status of the Apex trigger. The following string values are valid: Active —The trigger is active. Inactive —The trigger is inactive, but not deleted. Deleted —The trigger is marked for deletion. This is useful for managed packages, because it allows a class to be deleted when a managed package is updated. Note Inactive is not valid for ApexClass. For more information, see the Metadata API Developer Guide .

fields.name: TableEnumOrId
fields.description: Specifies the object associated with the trigger, such as Account or Contact.

fields.name: UsageAfterDelete
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is an after delete trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageAfterInsert
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is an after insert trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageAfterUndelete
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is an after undelete trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageAfterUpdate
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is an after update trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageBeforeDelete
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is a before delete trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageBeforeInsert
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is a before insert trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageBeforeUpdate
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is a before update trigger ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: UsageIsBulk
fields.description: Specifies whether the trigger is defined as a bulk trigger ( true ) or not ( false ). Note This field is not used for Apex triggers saved using Salesforce API version 10.0 or higher: all triggers starting with that version are automatically considered bulk, and this field will always return true .

fields.name: BotIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the bot.

fields.name: BotSessionIdentifier
fields.description: The bot session ID.

fields.name: ClientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the client that is using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”. For example: 96.43.144.26 .

fields.name: CpuTime
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: DatabaseTotalTime
fields.description: Time (in milliseconds) spent waiting for database processing in aggregate for all operations in the request. Compare this field to CpuTime to determine whether performance issues are occurring in the database layer or in your own code.

fields.name: ExecutionTime
fields.description: The end-to-end Apex execution time (in milliseconds).

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: ObjectName
fields.description: The name of the object affected by the trigger.

fields.name: PlannerIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the agent planner.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: RequestStatus
fields.description: The status of the request for a page view or user interface action.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The amount of time that the request took in milliseconds. Requests with a value over five seconds are considered long-running requests for the purposes of the Concurrent Long-Running Apex Limit. HTTP callout processing time isn't included when calculating the 5-second limit. We pause the timer for the callout and resume it when the callout completes.

fields.name: SessionKey
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started. For example: d7DEq/ANa7nNZZVD .

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: TriggerIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the trigger that was fired.

fields.name: TriggerName
fields.description: For triggers coming from managed packages, TriggerName includes a namespace prefix separated with a . character. If no namespace prefix is present, the trigger is from an unmanaged trigger. For example: examplePackage.managedExampleTrigger —Managed trigger from the examplePackage namespace unmanagedExampleTrigger —Unmanaged trigger

fields.name: TriggerType
fields.description: The type of this trigger.

fields.name: Uri
fields.description: The URI of the page that’s receiving the request. For example: /home/home.jsp .

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who is using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: UserType
fields.description: The category of user license.

fields.name: ApexClassId
fields.description: The foreign key to the outer class that contains the Apex class implementing the interface.

fields.name: ClassName
fields.description: Apex class name that implements the interface. For an inner class that implements the interface, the outer class and inner name separated by a period.

fields.name: ClassNamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix of the class that implements the interface.

fields.name: DurableId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the interface and implementor.

fields.name: InterfaceApexClassId
fields.description: The foreign key to the outer class that contains the Apex class defining the interface. Null for built-in system interfaces, such as System.Batchable .

fields.name: InterfaceName
fields.description: The interface name for which Apex class implementation is retrieved. For an inner interface, the outer Apex class name and the inner interface name separated by a period.

fields.name: InterfaceNamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix of the class that defines the interface.

fields.name: IsConcrete
fields.description: Indicates whether the implementing class is abstract ( false ) or not ( true ).

fields.name: ExceptionCategory
fields.description: The category of the unexpected Apex exception. For example, the LimitException exception type is split into subcategories that indicate if you exceeded a limit, such as the total heap size or CPU time. Possible values: Subcategories of LimitException that indicate the Apex limit you’ve exceeded. Examples: LimitException: CpuTime: Maximum CPU time on the Salesforce servers. LimitException: HeapSize: Total heap size LimitException: Queries: Total number of SOQL queries issued. LimitException: QueryRows: Total number of records retrieved by SOQL queries. LimitException: DmlStatements: Total number of DML statements issued. LimitException: Callouts: Total number of callouts (HTTP requests or web services calls) in a transaction.

fields.name: ExceptionMessage
fields.description: The exception message for a SOAP API request. An exception message gives details about errors in handling an API request, such as why an API request failed. For example: common.exception.ApiException: startDate cannot be more than 30 days ago.

fields.name: ExceptionType
fields.description: The class type of the unexpected exception. For example: System.MathException

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier. For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV.

fields.name: StackTrace
fields.description: The stack trace for the exception. For example: Class.OpportunityUtility.insert: line 22, column 1 AnonymousBlock: line 1, column 1

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: ApiFamily
fields.description: The API family. For example, REST, SOAP, or Bulk.

fields.name: ApiResource
fields.description: The API method or resource. For example, describeSObjects for SOAP.

fields.name: BotIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the bot.

fields.name: BotSessionIdentifier
fields.description: The bot session ID.

fields.name: ClientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP, such as a login from AppExchange, is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”. For example: 96.43.144.26.

fields.name: ClientName
fields.description: The name of the client making the API request.

fields.name: ConnectedAppIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the connected app making the API request.

fields.name: HttpMethod
fields.description: The HTTP method. For example, GET .

fields.name: IsApiLimitCounted
fields.description: Whether the request counted against the API limit ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: ObjectName
fields.description: The name of the object accessed by the API request.

fields.name: PlannerIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the agent planner.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier. For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV.

fields.name: StatusCode
fields.description: The HTTP response status code for the request.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: AvailableSince
fields.description: An optional value used to limit the requested results file to data newly arrived in the data lake after the specified date and time. This field is always transferred in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone. Use the AvailableSince field as part of your catch-up query strategy. AvailableSince must be later than StartTime and EndTime , if specified. AvailableSince must be earlier than now. A query must include StartTime , AvailableSince , or both. For example, to schedule a catch-up query on 2021-04-03T18:00:00Z for this date range: StartTime=2021-03-29T00:00:00Z EndTime=2021-03-30T00:00:00Z Valid AvailableSince values range from 2021-03-30T00:00:00Z to 2021-04-03T18:00:00Z . For more information on AvailableSince and catch-up queries, read AppExchange App Analytics Best Practices .

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: The type of usage data being requested. Valid values include: PackageUsageLog PackageUsageSummary SubscriberSnapshot Note In Summer ’20, we changed the enum names from CustomObjectUsageSummary and CustomObjectUsageLog to PackageUsageSummary and PackageUsageLog . If you wrote integrations using CustomObjectUsageSummary or CustomObjectUsageLog , they continue to work only with v47 and earlier. After you upgrade to v48, you must update the DataType to PackageUsageSummary and PackageUsageLog .

fields.name: DownloadExpirationTime
fields.description: The time when the download URL is no longer valid. The expiration time is 60 minutes after the query is completed.

fields.name: DownloadSize
fields.description: The size of the AppExchange App Analytics results file available for download, in bytes.

fields.name: DownloadUrl
fields.description: URL that the user can download data from. Populated after the request is completed. This URL expires and is removed after the expiration time is reached.

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: Enter end time in format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Example: 2019-04-15T12:00:00 For Package Usage Summaries, we recommend that StartTime corresponds to midnight UTC at beginning of the desired month and EndTime corresponds to midnight UTC at the beginning of the following month. For example, to retrieve the Package Usage Summary for December 2024 specify: StartTime=2024-12-01T00:00:00Z EndTime=2025-01-01T00:00:00Z

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: Stores error message text that results from this query.

fields.name: FileCompression
fields.description: The file compression format of your requested results file. FileCompression and FileType must align. If FileType is csv , FileCompression defaults to none and can be none or gzip . If FileType is parquet , FileCompression is snappy by default and can be snappy , gzip , or none . Valid values include: gzip snappy none

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: The data format of your requested results file. The default is csv . FileCompression and FileType must align. If FileType is csv , FileCompression defaults to none and can be none or gzip . If FileType is parquet , FileCompression is snappy by default and can be snappy , gzip , or none . Valid values include: csv parquet

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The auto-generated name of the App Analytics query request.

fields.name: OrganizationIds
fields.description: Optional. Enter up to 16 comma-separated org IDs without spaces between IDs. Or enter up to 15 comma-separated org IDs with spaces between the IDs. To request data for all the orgs the package is installed in, leave the field blank.

fields.name: PackageIds
fields.description: Optional. Enter up to 16 comma-separated package IDs without spaces between IDs. Or enter up to 15 comma-separated package IDs with spaces between the IDs. Use the subscriber package ID that begins with 033 . To retrieve a list of your second-generation managed package IDs, run sf package list --verbose in Salesforce CLI. To request data on all packages registered to this License Management App, leave the field blank.

fields.name: QuerySubmittedTime
fields.description: The date and time that the App Analytics query request was received for processing, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). QuerySubmittedTime is read only.

fields.name: RequestState
fields.description: Status of the query request. Valid values are: New Pending Complete Expired Failed NoData

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: Enter start time in format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. All App Analytics query requests must include StartTime or AvailableSince or both. Example: 2019-04-14T12:00:00 For Package Usage Summaries, we recommend that StartTime corresponds to midnight UTC at beginning of the desired month and EndTime corresponds to midnight UTC at the beginning of the following month. For example, to retrieve the Package Usage Summary for December 2024 specify: StartTime=2024-12-01T00:00:00Z EndTime=2025-01-01T00:00:00Z

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The optional description of the application.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The developer name of the application.

fields.name: DurableId
fields.description: A unique virtual Salesforce ID for the application.

fields.name: HeaderColor
fields.description: The header color in the application. Specify the color with a hexadecimal code, such as #0000FF for blue.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: A default Salesforce ID.

fields.name: IsLargeFormFactorSupported
fields.description: Indicates whether the Large form factor is set in the CustomApplication metadata.

fields.name: IsMediumFormFactorSupported
fields.description: Indicates whether the Medium form factor is set in the CustomApplication metadata.

fields.name: IsNavAutoTempTabsDisabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the navigation automatically creates temporary tabs settings.

fields.name: IsNavPersonalizationDisabled
fields.description: Indicates whether navigation personalization is disabled.

fields.name: IsNavTabPersistenceDisabled
fields.description: Indicates whether workspace tabs are cleared for each new console session.

fields.name: IsOmniPinnedViewEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the Omni-Channel component is enabled in sidebar view. The default is false.

fields.name: IsOverrideOrgTheme
fields.description: Indicates whether to override the global theme for the org. When true, the color scheme and logo that the user has set are used. When false, the global theme for the org is used, even if the user has set a color scheme and logo.

fields.name: IsSmallFormFactorSupported
fields.description: Indicates whether the Small form factor is set in the CustomApplication metadata.

fields.name: Label
fields.description: The localized label value corresponding to the MasterLabel field.

fields.name: LogoUrl
fields.description: The logo URL of the application as selected by the admin.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The non-translated label entered when the application was created.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace of the application.

fields.name: NavType
fields.description: The type of navigation for the application. The value Standard is for Lightning Experience. The value Console is for Salesforce console. A null value is for Salesforce Classic.

fields.name: UiType
fields.description: Indicates the type of custom application. The value Aloha is for Salesforce Classic, and Lightning is for Lightning Experience.

fields.name: UtilityBar
fields.description: The ID of the utility bar associated with this application.

fields.name: AppExtensionLabel
fields.description: The label in the UI for the app extension.

fields.name: AppExtensionName
fields.description: The API name of the app extension.

fields.name: FieldServiceMobileSettingsId
fields.description: The ID of a set of field service mobile settings.

fields.name: InstallationUrl
fields.description: The URL that takes the user to the app install location, such as the App Store or Google Play.

fields.name: LaunchValue
fields.description: A value directing the Field Service app to the appropriate app extension. The Launch Value can be a static URL or a dynamic value that you can represent with certain tokens. These tokens pass field information from the record that the user is currently viewing. The basic format for these tokens is based on the field names; for example: {!$Name} .

fields.name: ScopedToObjectTypes
fields.description: Indicates the types of records from which the app extension can be activated. Scoping an app extension to an object lets users activate the app extension from records of the specified type. For example, to scope to both work orders and service appointments you would use the value WorkOrder,ServiceAppointment .

fields.name: Type
fields.description: A picklist of types of app extensions: iOS, Android, Flow, and Lightning Apps

fields.name: ApprovalFlowName
fields.description: The name of the flow that must be launched to approve the applications associated with the application form template.

fields.name: ApplicationType
fields.description: Specifies the type of application or template.

fields.name: ApprovalLimitAmount
fields.description: Amount up to which the approver has the authority to approve applications.

fields.name: ApprovalFlowName
fields.description: The name of the flow that must be launched to approve the applications associated with the application form template.

fields.name: ApproverId
fields.description: The user who must approve the application payout.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of the application form template.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the application form template.

fields.name: ApplicationId
fields.description: The 15-character ID for the menu item.

fields.name: CanvasAccessMethod
fields.description: The access method for the canvas app. Values can be: Get —OAuth Webflow Post —Signed Request

fields.name: CanvasEnabled
fields.description: Indicates if the app menu item is a canvas app ( true ) or not ( false ). The default setting is false .

fields.name: CanvasOptions
fields.description: Represents the options enabled for a canvas connected app. The options are: PersonalEnabled —The app is enabled as a canvas personal app. HideHeader —The publisher header, which contains the “What are you working on?” text, is hidden. HideShare —The publisher Share button is hidden. This field is available in API version 34.0 and later.

fields.name: CanvasReferenceId
fields.description: The canvas app unique identifier.

fields.name: CanvasSelectedLocations
fields.description: The selected locations for the canvas app which define where the canvas app can appear in the user interface. For example: Chatter,ChatterFeed,Publisher,ServiceDesk

fields.name: CanvasUrl
fields.description: The URL of the canvas app.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of this menu item.

fields.name: IconUrl
fields.description: The icon for the menu item’s application.

fields.name: InfoUrl
fields.description: The URL for more information about the application.

fields.name: IsAccessible
fields.description: If true , the current user is authorized to use the app. The default setting is false .

fields.name: IsRegisteredDeviceOnly
fields.description: If true , indicates that the app is available to registered devices only. The default setting is false . Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: IsUsingAdminAuthorization
fields.description: If true , the app is pre-authorized for certain users by the administrator. The default setting is false .

fields.name: IsVisible
fields.description: If true , the app is visible to users of the organization. The default setting is false .

fields.name: Label
fields.description: The app’s name.

fields.name: LogoUrl
fields.description: The logo for the menu item’s application. The default is the initials of the Label value.

fields.name: MobileAppBinaryId
fields.description: The URL for the Mobile App Binary file.

fields.name: MobileAppInstallUrl
fields.description: The location mobile users are directed to install the app. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobileAppInstalledDate
fields.description: The date and time that a user installed a mobile app. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobileAppInstalledVersion
fields.description: The version of the user’s installed mobile app. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobileAppVer
fields.description: The version number of the mobile app. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobileDeviceType
fields.description: The supported device form factors for the mobile app. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobileMinOsVer
fields.description: The minimum version required for the app. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobilePlatform
fields.description: The mobile platform for the app. Possible values include: android – Android ios – iOS Available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: MobileStartUrl
fields.description: The location mobile users are directed to after they’ve authenticated. This field is used with connected apps and Experience Builder sites. For sites only, this location is a fully qualified domain name. For other apps, it’s a relative URL.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The API name of the item.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values: In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: The index value that controls where this item appears in the menu. For example, a menu item with a sort order of 5 appears between items with sort order values of 3 and 9.

fields.name: StartUrl
fields.description: For a connected app, the location users are directed to after they’ve authenticated. Otherwise, the application’s default start page.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of application represented by this item. The types are: ConnectedApplication Network ServiceProvider TabSet

fields.name: UserSortOrder
fields.description: The index value that represents where the user set this item in the menu (or App Launcher). For example, an item with a sort order value of 5 appears between items with sort order values of 3 and 9. This value is separate from SortOrder so you can create logic incorporating both values. For example, if you want the user-sorted items to appear first, followed by the organization order for the rest, use: SELECT ApplicationId,SortOrder,UserSortOrder FROM AppMenuItem order by userSortOrder NULLS LAST, sortOrder NULLS LAST

Appointments can then begin at the top of the hour and at 15-minute intervals thereafter (10:00 AM, 10:15 AM, 10:30 AM, and so on). Possible values are: 5 10 15 20 30 45 60 90 120 150 180 240 300 360 420 480

fields.name: IsSvcTerrOpHoursWithShiftsUsed

fields.name: IsSvcTerritoryMemberShiftUsed
fields.description: Indicates whether this scheduling policy considers shifts of service territory members when determining the availability of service resources for appointments (true). The default value is false. Available in API version 56.0 and later.

fields.name: ShouldEnforceRequiredResource

fields.name: ShouldMatchSkill

fields.name: ShouldMatchSkillLevel

fields.name: ShouldRespectVisitingHours

fields.name: ShouldUsePrimaryMembers

fields.name: ShouldUseSecondaryMembers

One of the following picklist values: Pending —Specified only when the Approval request is created ( create() call) Approved —Specified only when the Approval request is approved ( update() call) Rejected —Specified when the Approval request is rejected ( update() call) or when it is created ( create() call) and immediately rejected for archival/historical purposes.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Specifies the type of archive process to be executed. This static enum categorizes the purpose or mode of the run. Valid values are: Analyzer Archive Archive-fail-to-delete Estimate Export Export-and-download Export-to-external-bucket Import-data-archive Import-data-load Index-request None Purge Purge-by-retention Purge-estimation RTBF-SDK Unarchive Unarchive-retry Unarchive-sdk

fields.name: DataProtectionThreshold
fields.description: Specifies a retention buffer, in days, during which recently updated or sensitive records must not be archived or deleted. Enforces data protection compliance.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The purpose or scope of the policy.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the policy is active and eligible for execution. Only active policies can be executed by scheduled or manual processes.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The unique name assigned to the policy.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Process type that the policy executes. Valid values are: Archive Import Purge

fields.name: Query
fields.description: A complete SOQL or custom query defining the set of records to archive or purge, based on policy rules. Determines which records are eligible for processing.

fields.name: QueryLimit
fields.description: The maximum number of root records this policy can process in a single run. Used to throttle execution for scalability and control.

fields.name: RootEntityName
fields.description: The API name of the Salesforce object targeted by the policy. Determines which object’s records are queried and processed.

fields.name: RunFrequency
fields.description: Specifies how often the policy is executed—manually or on a regular interval. Enables automation for recurring data lifecycle operations. Valid values are: None This option is specifically for manual policy runs. Daily Weekly Monthly

fields.name: DataCategoryGroupName
fields.description: Unique name of the data category group which has categories associated with the article.

fields.name: DataCategoryName
fields.description: Unique name of the data category associated with the article.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the article associated with the data category selection.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: (Required) ID of the Account associated with this asset. Must be a valid account ID. Required if ContactId isn’t specified.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: Represents the physical address or geolocation of the asset.

fields.name: AssetLevel
fields.description: The asset’s position in an asset hierarchy. If the asset has no parent or child assets, its level is 1. Assets that belong to a hierarchy have a level of 1 for the root asset, 2 for the child assets of the root asset, 3 for their children, and so forth. On assets created before the introduction of this field, the asset level defaults to –1. After the asset record is updated, the asset level is calculated and automatically updated.

fields.name: AssetProvidedById
fields.description: The account that provided the asset, typically a manufacturer.

fields.name: AssetServicedById
fields.description: The account in charge of servicing the asset.

fields.name: AssetTypeId
fields.description: The asset type associated with the asset.

fields.name: Availability
fields.description: The percentage of expected uptime where the asset was available for use.

fields.name: AveragetimetoRepair
fields.description: Represents the number of hours it typically takes to repair an asset after a failure.

fields.name: AveragetimeBetweenFailure
fields.description: Represents the number of hours that typically elapses before the asset is likely to fail again.

fields.name: AverageUptimePerDay
fields.description: The average number of hours per day the asset is expected to be available for use.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The city detail for the address.

fields.name: ConsequenceOfFailure
fields.description: The business impact associated with the asset’s failure. Using this field, you can address the asset’s health and take action using Flows . To enable this field, use Object Manager to update the field availability. Make sure that the field is visible for field-level security and for page layout. To learn more, see What Determines Field Access . The picklist values aren’t predefined in orgs created before Winter ’22 that aren’t Field Service enabled. This field is available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: Required if AccountId isn’t specified. ID of the Contact associated with this asset. Must be a valid contact ID that has an account parent (but doesn’t need to match the asset’s AccountId ).

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The country detail for the address.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the invoice. The default value is USD.

fields.name: CurrentAmount
fields.description: Reserved for future use. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: CurrentLifecycleEndDate
fields.description: Represents the end of the period shown as current. System-populated field inherited from the end date of the current asset state period. If that field is empty, as with an evergreen subscription, the Current Lifecycle End Date field is also empty. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: CurrentMrr
fields.description: The asset’s monthly recurring revenue during the current asset state period. System-populated field inherited from the monthly recurring revenue on the current asset state period. If no asset state period is current, the value is 0 . Label is Current Monthly Recurring Revenue. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: CurrentQuantity
fields.description: The asset’s quantity during the current asset state period. System-populated field inherited from the quantity on the current asset state period. If no asset state period is current, the value is 0 . This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the asset.

fields.name: DigitalAssetStatus
fields.description: Status of digital tracking of the asset. The default picklist includes the following values: On Off Warning Error

fields.name: ExternalIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the matching record in an external system. This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: GeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address.

fields.name: HasLifecycleManagement
fields.description: True if this asset is a lifecycle-managed asset, otherwise false. You can’t switch an asset to a lifecycle-managed asset or the reverse. This field is system populated.

fields.name: InstallDate
fields.description: Date when the asset was installed.

fields.name: IsCompetitorProduct
fields.description: Indicates whether this Asset represents a product sold by a competitor ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false . Its UI label is Competitor Asset.

fields.name: IsInternal
fields.description: Indicates that the asset is produced or used internally ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false . Its UI label is Internal Asset.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date and time that the asset was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date and time that the asset was last viewed.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address.

fields.name: LifecycleEndDate
fields.description: Represents the end of the asset’s lifecycle. System-populated field inherited from the end date of the final asset state period. If that field is empty, as with an evergreen subscription, the lifecycle has no end date. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: LifecycleStartDate
fields.description: Represents the beginning of the asset’s lifecycle. System-populated field inherited from the start date of the earliest asset state period. This field can’t be edited. When a new asset action affects the start date of an asset state period, the period is deleted and a new one is generated. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: LocationId
fields.description: The asset’s location. Typically, this location is the place where the asset is stored, such as a warehouse or van.

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address.

fields.name: ManufactureDate
fields.description: The date when the asset was manufactured. This field is available from API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: (Required) Name of the asset. Label is Asset Name.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The asset’s owner. By default, the asset owner is the user who created the asset record. Its UI label is Asset Owner.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The asset’s parent asset. Its UI label is Parent Asset.

fields.name: PostalCode
fields.description: The postal code for the address.

fields.name: Price
fields.description: Price paid for this asset.

fields.name: PricingSource
fields.description: Pricing source to use when amending or renewing an asset.

fields.name: Product2Id
fields.description: (Optional) ID of the Product2 associated with this asset. Must be a valid Product2 ID. Its UI label is Product.

fields.name: ProductCode
fields.description: The product code of the related product.

fields.name: ProductDescription
fields.description: The product description of the related product.

fields.name: ProductFamily
fields.description: The product family of the related product.

fields.name: PurchaseDate
fields.description: Date on which this asset was purchased.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: Quantity purchased or installed. The Quantity field value isn’t set by Customer Asset Lifecycle Management. Instead, you can populate the field as you need.

fields.name: QuantityIncreasePricingType
fields.description: Specify which pricing type to use when the quantity of this asset is increased. Its UI label is Pricing Type for Quantity Increase. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later. This field is available when Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: The unique identifier for the asset.

fields.name: Reliability
fields.description: The percentage of expected uptime where the asset wasn’t subject to unplanned downtime.

fields.name: RenewalPricingType
fields.description: The price used when renewing a subscription. Its UI label is Pricing Type for Renewal. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: RenewalTerm
fields.description: With Renewal Term Unit, defines the default subscription term for renewal quotes. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: RenewalTermUnit
fields.description: The unit of time for a subscription term. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: RootAssetId
fields.description: (Read only) The top-level asset in an asset hierarchy. Depending on where an asset lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent. Its UI label is Root Asset.

fields.name: SalesStoreId
fields.description: ID of the RetailStore or WebStore associated with this Asset.

fields.name: SerialNumber
fields.description: Serial number for this asset.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The state detail for the address.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Customizable picklist of values. The default picklist includes the following values: Purchased Shipped Installed Registered Obsolete

fields.name: StatusReason
fields.description: The explanation of the device status. This field is available from API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: StockKeepingUnit
fields.description: The SKU assigned to the related product.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The street detail for the address.

fields.name: SumDowntime
fields.description: Accumulated downtime (planned and unplanned), determined as follows: When only UptimeRecordStart is set, the sum of all downtime from UptimeRecordStart When UptimeRecordStart and UptimeRecordEnd are set, the sum of all downtime from UptimeRecordStart to UptimeRecordEnd Otherwise, downtime isn’t accumulated.

fields.name: SumUnplannedDowntime
fields.description: Accumulated unplanned downtime, determined as follows: When only UptimeRecordStart is set, the sum of all unplanned downtime from UptimeRecordStart When UptimeRecordStart and UptimeRecordEnd are set, the sum of all unplanned downtime from UptimeRecordStart to UptimeRecordEnd Otherwise, unplanned downtime isn’t accumulated.

fields.name: TotalLifecycleAmount
fields.description: The total amount of revenue for the asset, including revenue from each stage in the asset lifecycle. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Revenue Cloud is enabled.

fields.name: UptimeRecordEnd
fields.description: The date until which SumDowntime and SumUnplannedDowntime are accumulated.

fields.name: UptimeRecordStart
fields.description: The date from which SumDowntime and SumUnplannedDowntime are accumulated.

fields.name: UsageEndDate
fields.description: Date when usage for this asset ends or expires.

fields.name: Uuid
fields.description: The unique ID for the asset. This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: ActionDate
fields.description: The date when an asset action change is recorded. This date can differ from the start date of the related asset state period. For example, suppose that a customer cancels a subscription in June, and the subscription expires in October. The date the customer cancels the subscription (June) is the action date of the asset action. The cancellation's effective date (October) is the start date of the asset state period.

fields.name: ActualTaxChange
fields.description: The rollup of actual tax from all asset action sources. This field is populated by the system. Label is Change in Actual Tax .

fields.name: AdjustmentAmountChange
fields.description: The rollup of adjustment amount from all asset action sources. This field is populated by the system. Label is Change in Adjustment Amount .

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: The delta in the total asset amount resulting from an asset action.

fields.name: AssetActionNumber
fields.description: The ID of the asset action. Label is Name .

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The ID of the related lifecycle-managed asset. Label is Asset .

fields.name: CanRollBack
fields.description: Indicates whether the last asset action can be rolled back ( true ). If this property is set to false , the asset and the last asset action can’t be rolled back.

fields.name: CategoryEnum
fields.description: The business category of the asset action, for use in reporting. Asset action totals are broken out by the picklist values on this required field, and those totals are in turn reflected on assets. The following categories are available. They aren’t customizable. Label is Business Category .

fields.name: EstimatedTaxChange
fields.description: The rollup of estimated tax from all asset action sources. This field is populated by the system. Label is Change in Estimated Tax .

fields.name: MrrChange
fields.description: The delta in the asset’s monthly recurring revenue resulting from an asset action. For example, suppose that the MRR during an asset state period is $200 and the next asset action adds $100. Then this field’s value is $100. Label is Change in Monthly Recurring Revenue .

fields.name: ProductAmountChange
fields.description: The rollup of product amount from all asset action sources. This field is populated by the system. Label is Change in Product Amount .

fields.name: QuantityChange
fields.description: The delta in the asset quantity resulting from an asset action. For example, suppose that the asset quantity during an asset state period is 20 and the next asset action adds 10. Then this field’s value is 10. Label is Change in Quantity .

fields.name: RolledbackAssetAction
fields.description: The last asset action that was rolled back in the current rollback transaction. This field is available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: SubtotalChange
fields.description: The rollup of subtotal from all asset action sources. This field is populated by the system. Label is Change in Subtotal .

fields.name: Subtype
fields.description: The subtype of the action on the asset.

fields.name: TotalAmount
fields.description: The sum of the current and previous asset action amount. This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalCancellationsAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Cancellations . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalCrossSellsAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Cross-Sells . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalDownsellsAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Downsells . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalInitialSaleAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Initial Sale . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalMrr
fields.description: The sum of the monthly recurring revenue for the current and previous asset action. This field is populated by the system. Label is Total Monthly Recurring Revenue .

fields.name: TotalOtherAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Other . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the changes in quantity for the current and previous asset action. This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalRenewalsAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Renewals . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalTermsAndConditionsAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Terms and Conditions Changes . This field is populated by the system. Label is Total Terms and Conditions Changes Amount .

fields.name: TotalTransfersAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Transfers . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: TotalUpsellsAmount
fields.description: The sum of current and previous asset action amounts categorized as Upsells . This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The REST API used to generate the asset action. This field is populated by the system.

fields.name: ActualTax
fields.description: The region-specific tax amount determined at time of the order.

fields.name: AdjustmentAmount
fields.description: An adjustment to the product amount, such as a discount.

fields.name: AssetActionId
fields.description: The related asset action, that is, the change caused by an asset action source transaction.

fields.name: AssetActionSourceNumber
fields.description: The ID of the asset action source. Label is Name .

fields.name: BillingReference
fields.description: The ID of the OrderItem or OrderItemDetail record that this AssetActionSource record is created for.

fields.name: Discount
fields.description: The discount, expressed as a percentage, that's applied to the asset.

fields.name: DiscountAmount
fields.description: The discount, expressed as currency, that's applied to the asset.

fields.name: EffectiveGrantDate
fields.description: The date when the resources associated with the asset were granted.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The end date of the service or change.

fields.name: EstimatedTax
fields.description: The estimate of the region-specific tax amount made at time of the transaction.

fields.name: ExternalReference
fields.description: The ID of an asset action source transaction originating in a system outside of Salesforce.

fields.name: ExternalReferenceDataSource
fields.description: A system outside of Salesforce that contains asset action source transactions.

fields.name: LegalEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the legal entity record associated with the asset action source transaction.

fields.name: ListPrice
fields.description: List price for the order product. Value is inherited from the associated PriceBookEntry upon order product creation.

fields.name: NetUnitPrice
fields.description: The final adjusted unit price, inclusive of all adjustments, but exclusive of tax. The unit price after all price adjustments are applied.

fields.name: ObligatedAmount
fields.description: When a line amount is prorated, this amount shows the service amount that’s been consumed.

fields.name: OriginalLineNumber
fields.description: The number of the original order item detail line. Salesforce uses this information to create a record to amend, renew, or cancel an order. This field is available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: PeriodBoundary
fields.description: Boundary delimiters for periods. It determines when a period starts and/or ends.

fields.name: PeriodBoundaryDay
fields.description: The number specifying the day number when Period Boundary is a specific day in a week/month/year. It only applies when PeriodBoundary is set to "day of period.”

fields.name: PeriodBoundaryStartMonth
fields.description: Field is populated based on input in the StartDate, PeriodBoundary, and PeriodBoundaryDay when BillingFrequency2 is Annual or by manual user entry. Possible values are: 1-January 2-February 3-March 4-April 5-May 6-June 7-July 8-August 9-September 10-October 11-November 12-December

fields.name: PricebookEntryId
fields.description: PricebookEntry is used as a lookup for price information in order to pre-populate OrderItem's ListPrice and UnitPrice.

fields.name: PricingTermCount
fields.description: Number of pricing terms is this subscription product.

fields.name: ProductAmount
fields.description: The product amount after the asset action source transaction.

fields.name: ProductSellingModelId
fields.description: Specifies the product selling model type. Foreignkey to ProductSellingModel entity.

fields.name: ProrationPolicyId
fields.description: The ID of the ProrationPolicy used for pricing.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The product quantity or the change in product quantity after the asset action source transaction.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityItemId
fields.description: The ID of an asset action source transaction originating in Salesforce. The transaction can be an order product or a work order line item.

fields.name: SegmentIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the ramp segment associated with the asset action source transaction.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The start date of the service or change.

fields.name: Subtotal
fields.description: The sum of the product amount and the adjustment amount.

fields.name: TaxTreatmentId
fields.description: Lookup to Tax Treatment entity. It's used to calculate tax.

fields.name: TotalLineAmount
fields.description: The price of the line before any price adjustments were applied. SalesTransactionItem: ProratedStartingTotal / StartingPriceTotal. Note: TotalPrice is computed using the UnitPrice, which includes discounts (price adjustments), while TotalLineAmount doesn’t include price adjustments.

fields.name: TotalPrice
fields.description: Calculated by the pricing engine for ARC. Summation of TotalAdjustmentAmount plus TotalLineAmount for this item.

fields.name: TransactionDate
fields.description: The date of a source transaction, such as an order date.

fields.name: UnitPrice
fields.description: The unit price of the item before any discounts or tax calculation.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The ID of the asset.

fields.name: AttributeDefinitionId
fields.description: The ID of the attribute definition for this asset attribute.

fields.name: AttributeName
fields.description: The name given to the asset attribute in the UI by the user.

fields.name: AttributePicklistValueId
fields.description: The ID of the attribute picklist value if the attribute is a picklist type.

fields.name: AttributeValue
fields.description: Stores the value of an asset attribute, for example 5-TB storage .

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: An auto-generated ID of the attribute record saved in an external system (for example an HBase database). This field is reserved and used for internal purpose.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The ID of the asset related to the contract.

fields.name: ContractId
fields.description: The ID of the contract related to the asset.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The end date and time of the relationship between contract and asset.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view. The associated UI label is Last Modified Date .

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but didn’t view it.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The auto-generated number assigned to AssetContractRelationship. (Read Only)

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The start date and time of the relationship between contract and asset.

fields.name: AssetDowntimePeriodNumber
fields.description: The unique number of this asset downtime period record.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The ID of the asset this asset downtime period record is for.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of this asset downtime period.

fields.name: DowntimeType
fields.description: The type of this asset downtime period. Possible values are: Planned Unplanned

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: The time this asset downtime period ended.

fields.name: IsExcluded
fields.description: Whether this asset downtime period is excluded from the calculation of accumulated downtime and accumulated unplanned downtime, and therefore not included in availability and reliability calculations.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: The time this asset downtime period started.

fields.name: AssetAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of sharing being allowed. The possible values are: Read Edit

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the sharing rule. Maximum size is 1000 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Corresponds to Rule Name in the user interface. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: GroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the source group. Cases owned by users in the source group trigger the rule to give access.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Label of the sharing rule as it appears in the user interface. Limited to 80 characters. Corresponds to Label on the user interface.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the target user or group. Target users or groups are given access.

fields.name: AdjustmentType
fields.description: The type of rate adjustment.

fields.name: AdjustmentValue
fields.description: The value of the adjustment.

fields.name: AssetRateCardEntryId
fields.description: The ID of the parent asset rate card entry record associated with the asset rate adjustment.

fields.name: LowerBound
fields.description: The minimum quantity for the adjustment to be applicable.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the asset rate adjustment.

fields.name: UpperBound
fields.description: The maximum quantity for the adjustment to be applicable.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The ID of the asset rate card entry record.

fields.name: BindingObjectFormula
fields.description: The formula that returns the ID of the associated binding object, if specified. If binding object isn't added, the formula returns the asset ID of the asset related to this asset rate card entry. This field is read-only. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: BindingObjectId
fields.description: The ID of the binding object associated with the asset rate card entry. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: BindingObjectRateOrder
fields.description: The order that determines the applicable binding object rate when multiple rates are defined for an Anchor binding object within a effective period. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: The ID of the binding object associated with the asset rate card entry.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The date when the rate card's time period becomes inactive. The rate card becomes inactive at 11:59:00 PM on the end date.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An auto-generated number assigned to the asset rate card entry. Read-only.

fields.name: NegotiatedRate
fields.description: The base negotiated rate used to charge overage consumption.

fields.name: RateCardEntryId
fields.description: The ID of the rate card entry record containing the catalog rates that's associated with the asset rate card entry.

fields.name: RateCardId
fields.description: The ID of the rate card record that's associated with the asset rate card entry.

fields.name: RateUnitOfMeasureId
fields.description: The ID of the unit of measure record that's associated with the asset rate card entry.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The date when the rate card's time period becomes active. The rate card becomes active at 12:00:00 AM on the start date.

fields.name: UsageResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the usage resource record that's associated with the asset rate card entry.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The unique identifier of the new asset, which is the asset that is taking the place of the existing asset.

fields.name: AssetRelationshipNumber
fields.description: An auto-generated number identifying the asset relationship.

fields.name: AssetRole
fields.description: Describes the position of the main asset relative to the other assets in the relationship.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the asset. The default value is USD.

fields.name: FromDate
fields.description: The date when the new asset was installed.

fields.name: GroupingKey
fields.description: Read-only field used to indicate the bundle that an asset belongs to. For example, if two assets have the same GroupingKey value, then it means that the assets are bundled together.

fields.name: ProductRelationshipTypeId
fields.description: The unique identifier of the record that describes the relationship between the main and associated assets.

fields.name: ProductRelatedComponent
fields.description: The product related component that’s associated with the asset relationship.

fields.name: RelatedAssetId
fields.description: The existing asset that is being modified.

fields.name: RelatedAssetPricing
fields.description: Specifies whether the price of the related asset is included in the bundle price. Valid values are: IncludedInBundlePrice NotIncludedInBundlePrice

fields.name: RelatedAssetQtyScaleMethod
fields.description: Specifies how the quantity of the related asset changes relative to the quantity of the parent asset. Valid values are: Constant Proportional

fields.name: RelatedAssetRole
fields.description: Describes the position of the associated asset relative to other assets in the relationship.

fields.name: RelationshipType
fields.description: The type of relationship between the existing asset and the new asset. This field comes with three values—Replacement, Upgrade, and Crossgrade—, but you can create more values in Setup.

fields.name: ToDate
fields.description: The date when the modified asset is uninstalled.

fields.name: AssetAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to the Asset. The possible values are: Read Edit All This value is not valid for creating or deleting records. This field must be set to an access level that is higher than the organization’s default access level for cases.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: ID of the Asset associated with this sharing entry. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: RowCause
fields.description: Reason that this sharing entry exists. If you’re creating a sharing entry, the only permitted value is Manual . If no value is specified, the field defaults to Manual . All other RowCause values are read-only. After the sharing entry is created, this field can’t be edited.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: ID of the User or Group that has been given access to the Asset. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: An asset’s total amount during an asset state period. Revenue Cloud doesn't set or use this field's value currently.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The asset related to an asset state period. Label is Asset .

fields.name: AssetStatePeriodNumber
fields.description: The ID of the asset state period. Label is Name .

fields.name: BillingFrequency
fields.description: The time period that indicates how often the line item is billed.

fields.name: BindingInstanceTargetId
fields.description: The ID of a custom product target for a usage-based quote line item, order Item, or asset allocation.

fields.name: Discount
fields.description: Editable number from 0 to 100. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: DiscountAmount
fields.description: The fixed amount discount to apply to the line item. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The end date and time of an asset state period. On an asset that is an evergreen subscription, the last asset state period has no end date.

fields.name: LegalEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the related legal entity.

fields.name: Mrr
fields.description: An asset’s monthly recurring revenue during an asset state period.

fields.name: PriceRevisionPolicy
fields.description: Specifies the price uplift policy associated with this asset state period.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The total quantity of an asset during an asset state period.

fields.name: RampIdentifier
fields.description: The ramp record used to group order item segments for this asset state period.

fields.name: SegmentIdentifier
fields.description: The order item segment for this asset state period.

fields.name: SegmentName
fields.description: The name of the order item segment for this asset state period.

fields.name: SegmentType
fields.description: The period for the order item segment for this asset state period. Valid values are: Custom Free Trial Yearly

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The start date and time of an asset state period.

fields.name: UnitPrice
fields.description: The price per unit for the line item. Available in API version 65.0 and later. Revenue Cloud won't populate this field in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: UnitPriceUplift
fields.description: Indicates the percentage increase of a line item's unit price. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: AssetStatePeriodId
fields.description: The asset state period that's associated with the asset attribute.

fields.name: AttributeDefinitionId
fields.description: The attribute definition that's associated with the asset state period attribute.

fields.name: AttributeName
fields.description: The name of the asset attribute.

fields.name: AttributePicklistValueId
fields.description: The value specified in the picklist type field that corresponds to the attribute in the AttributePicklistValue object.

fields.name: AttributeValue
fields.description: The value of the asset state period attribute. For example, a shirt can have the value of blue , which indicates the shirt's color, or it can have the value of small , which indicates the shirt's size.

fields.name: ItemId
fields.description: ID of the tagged item.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the tag. If this value does not already exist, a new TagDefinition is created and becomes the parent of this Tag object. Otherwise, a TagDefinition with the same name becomes the parent of this Tag object. Parent relationships are created automatically.

fields.name: TagDefinitionId
fields.description: ID of the parent TagDefinition object that owns the tag.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines the visibility of a tag.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: The ID of the asset this warranty term applies to.

fields.name: AssetWarrantyNumber
fields.description: The identifier of the asset warranty record.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The date on which this warranty term expires.

fields.name: ExchangeType
fields.description: The type of exchange offered by this warranty term.

fields.name: Exclusions
fields.description: Description of any exclusions.

fields.name: ExpensesCovered
fields.description: The percentage of expenses covered.

fields.name: ExpensesCoveredEndDate
fields.description: The date on which cover for expenses ends.

fields.name: IsTransferable
fields.description: Defines whether the warranty term can be transferred to a new owner.

fields.name: LaborCovered
fields.description: The percentage of labor covered.

fields.name: LaborCoveredEndDate
fields.description: The date on which cover for labor ends.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date when the asset warranty term was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date .

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date when the asset warranty term was last viewed.

fields.name: PartsCovered
fields.description: The percentage of parts covered.

fields.name: PartsCoveredEndDate
fields.description: The date on which cover for parts ends.

fields.name: Pricebook2Id
fields.description: The ID of the price book item associated with this asset warranty term.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The date on which cover under this warranty term starts.

fields.name: WarrantyTermId
fields.description: The ID of the warranty term this asset warranty term extends.

fields.name: WarrantyType
fields.description: The type of the warranty.

fields.name: ActualTravelTime
fields.description: The number of minutes that the service resource needs to travel to the assigned service appointment. You can enter a value with up to two decimal places.

fields.name: ApptAssistantInfoUrl
fields.description: The URL that contains the status of the mobile worker approaching the service appointment, the Community URL, and the expiry of the URL. Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: AssignedResourceNumber
fields.description: An auto-generated number identifying the resource assignment.

fields.name: EstimatedTravelTime
fields.description: The estimated number of minutes needed for the service resource to travel to the service appointment they’re assigned to. You can enter a value with up to two decimal places.

fields.name: LocationStatus
fields.description: The status of the mobile worker approaching the service appointment. When the location status changes to one of these values, a status update containing ApptAssistantInfoUrl is sent to the customer. Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: IsPrimaryResource
fields.description: Indicates whether the service resource is a primary resource or not. The default value is false. Available in API version 47.0 and later.

fields.name: ServiceAppointmentId
fields.description: The service appointment that the resource is assigned to.

fields.name: ServiceCrewId
fields.description: The service crew that the resource is assigned to. Note Since service resources can represent crews or individuals, appointments are typically assigned to crews in the following way: Create a service resource of the Crew type that represent the crew. Create an assigned resource on the service appointment and select the crew resource in the ServiceResourceId field. As an alternative, you can assign appointments to crew members separately. This lets you track each member’s travel time and see a list of the crew members in the Assigned Resources related list. To take this approach, create an assigned resource for each crew member. List the crew member in the ServiceResourceId field and the crew they belong to in the ServiceCrewId field.

fields.name: ServiceResourceId
fields.description: The resource who is assigned to the service appointment.

fields.name: Transaction
fields.description: The last transaction ID of the scheduling and optimization request that updated this object. The transaction ID is automatically generated and populated by the Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization engine. Available in API version 63.0 and later.

fields.name: Active
fields.description: Indicates whether this assignment rule is active ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: Name
