fields.description: Name of this assignment rule.

fields.name: SobjectType
fields.description: Type of assignment rule—Case or Lead.

fields.name: ActiveFrom
fields.description: Date and time the associated location is active.

fields.name: ActiveTo
fields.description: Date and time the associated location stops being active.

fields.name: AssociatedLocationNumber
fields.description: Auto-generated number identifying the associated location.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date the associated location was last modified.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date the associated location was last viewed.

fields.name: LocationId
fields.description: The location associated with the address.

fields.name: ParentRecordId
fields.description: The account associated with the location.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Picklist of address types. The values are: Bill To Ship To

fields.name: ApexClassId
fields.description: The ID of the Apex class executing the job. Label is Class ID .

fields.name: CompletedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the job was completed.

fields.name: CronTriggerId
fields.description: The ID of the CronTrigger for the AsyncApexJob. This field only applies to ScheduledApex job type. This field is available in API version 53.0 and later. For scheduled jobs created before version 53.0, this field is populated on subsequent execution.

fields.name: ExtendedStatus
fields.description: If one or more errors occurred during the batch processing, this field contains a short description of the first error. A more detailed description of that error, along with any subsequent errors, is emailed to the last user who modified the batch class. This field is available in API version 19.0 and later.

fields.name: JobItemsProcessed
fields.description: Number of job items processed. Label is Batches Processed .

fields.name: JobType
fields.description: The type of job being processed. Valid values are: ApexToken BatchApex BatchApexWorker Future Queueable ScheduledApex SharingRecalculation TestRequest TestWorker

fields.name: LastProcessed
fields.description: Last ID that was processed and committed.

fields.name: LastProcessedOffset
fields.description: Offset of the last ID that was processed and committed.

fields.name: MethodName
fields.description: The name of the Apex method being executed. Label is Apex Method .

fields.name: NumberOfErrors
fields.description: Total number of batches with a failure. A batch is considered transactional, so any unhandled exceptions constitute an entire failure of the batch. Label is Failures .

fields.name: ParentJobId
fields.description: For batch Apex jobs that run using chunking implementation, multiple child jobs of type BatchApexWorker are created. Each of these child job records contains the job Id of the parent Apex job that started their execution. For batch Apex jobs that run using a non-chunking implementation, child jobs aren’t created.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the job. Valid values are: Aborted Completed Failed Holding 1 Preparing Processing Queued 1 This status applies to batch jobs in the Apex flex queue.

fields.name: TotalJobItems
fields.description: Total number of batches processed. Each batch contains a set of records. Label is Total Batches .

fields.name: AsyncOperationNumber
fields.description: The auto-generated number assigned to the operation.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the operation.

fields.name: Error
fields.description: The error message for the operation. Applies only if the operation has an error.

fields.name: ExternalReference
fields.description: The unique external reference ID per type.

fields.name: FinishedAt
fields.description: The date and time the operation finished.

fields.name: LastStatusUpdateAt
fields.description: The date and time the status of the operation was last updated.

fields.name: RelatedRecordId
fields.description: The related record ID for the async request. This field is available in API version 60.0 and later.

fields.name: Request
fields.description: The request sent to the external service.

fields.name: Response
fields.description: The full response from the external service.

fields.name: StartedAt
fields.description: The date and time the operation started.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the operation.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of operation that is being tracked.

fields.name: AsyncOperationNumber
fields.description: A string that identifies the operation being tracked in AsyncOperationTracker.

fields.name: CorrelationIdentifier
fields.description: A string that identifies an operation across services.

fields.name: ExpiresAt
fields.description: The timestamp indicating when this record will be deleted.

fields.name: FailedJobItems
fields.description: The number of items within the job that have failed.

fields.name: FinishedAt
fields.description: The timestamp indicating when the asynchronous process completed.

fields.name: JobType
fields.description: The type of job.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user or group that owns the job.,

fields.name: ParentOperationId
fields.description: This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityId
fields.description: Contains the ID of a record associated with the asynchronous request. For example, if the asynchronous request is associated with a credit memo, this field contains the ID of the credit memo.

fields.name: StartedAt
fields.description: The timestamp indicating when Salesforce started the asynchronous process.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the asynchronous request.

fields.name: StepName
fields.description: Possible values are: AssetizationAsyncJob AutomatedNegativeInvoiceLineConversion —Automated Negative Invoice Line Conversion AutomaticRefunds —Automatic Refunds CommerceVariationsUpsert ContextPersistence CreateCPQContractsJob DeltaCatalogSyndicationAsyncJob FullCatalogSyndicationAsyncJob InvoiceDocgenJob InvoiceDocgenPostProcessJob InvoiceDocgenRetryJob InvoiceDraftToPosted PSTCommonSyncStep PSTConfigAndPersist PSTOrderTaxAsync PSTPriceAndPersist PSTQuoteTaxAsync PearAmendQtyAssets —Initiate Amend Quantity PearCancelAssets —Initiate Cancellation PearRenewAssets —Initiate Renewal PlaceOrder PlaceOrderPersistSync PlaceOrderPriceAsync PlaceOrderTaxAsync PlaceQuote —Place Quote PlaceQuotePersistAndPriceSync PlaceQuotePersistSync PlaceQuotePriceAsync PlaceQuoteTaxAsync PriceRuleDeployment —Price Rule Deployment PriceSheetDeployJob QuoteToOrderJob RuleLibraryDeployment TransactionLineBom —Create Material Lines

fields.name: SubmittedAt
fields.description: The timestamp indicating when the asynchronous process was submitted by the REST request.

fields.name: SuccessfulJobItems
fields.description: The number of successful items in this job.

fields.name: TotalJobItems
fields.description: Total number of items in this job.

fields.name: AsyncOpSyndicationFeedFileNumber
fields.description: ID assigned to each syndication feed file record, and used for tracking and reference purposes.

fields.name: AsyncOperationTrackerId
fields.description: ID assigned to the Async Operation Tracker record, which monitors and manages the lifecycle of the syndication process.

fields.name: FeedContentBody
fields.description: The content of the feed file that is syndicated to the external platform.

fields.name: FeedContentContentType
fields.description: Specifies the format of the feed file to ensure proper processing. For example, CSV, JSON, or XML files.

fields.name: FeedContentLength
fields.description: The size of the feed file in bytes, which is used for validation and processing requirements.

fields.name: FeedContentName
fields.description: The name of the feed file, which includes identifiers like timestamp or sequence number.

fields.name: FeedScope
fields.description: Defines the scope or category of the feed. For example, if the feed applies to main, country-specific, or language-specific catalog segments.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: PlatformConnections
fields.description: The external channel or destination for syndication.

fields.name: SyncMode
fields.description: Specifies the type of sync being performed.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the attached ContentDocument .

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: The size of the document in bytes for notes smaller than 2 GB. In API version 66.0 and later, we recommend that you use the ContentSizeLong field even for notes smaller than 2 GB.

fields.name: ContentSizeLong
fields.description: The size of the note in bytes up to 10 GB. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentUrl
fields.description: URL for links and Google Docs. This field is set only for links and Google Docs, and is one of the fields that determine the FileType . This field is available in API version 31.0 and later.

fields.name: ExternalDataSourceName
fields.description: Name of the external data source in which the document is stored. This field is set only for external documents that are connected to Salesforce. This field is available in API version 32.0 and later.

fields.name: ExternalDataSourceType
fields.description: Type of external data source in which the document is stored. This field is set only for external documents that are connected to Salesforce. This field is available in APIAPI version 35.0 and later.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: File extension of the attached ContentDocument . This field is available in API version 31.0 and later.

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Type of document, determined by the file extension.

fields.name: LinkedEntityId
fields.description: ID of the record the ContentDocument is attached to.

fields.name: SharingOption
fields.description: Controls whether or not sharing is frozen for a file. Only administrators and file owners with Collaborator access to the file can modify this field. Default is Allowed , which means that new shares are allowed. When set to Restricted , new shares are prevented without affecting existing shares. This field is available in API versions 35.0 and later.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title of the attached ContentDocument .

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the attached ContentNote

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: Size of the note in bytes for notes smaller than 2 GB. In API version 66.0 and later, we recommend that you use the ContentSizeLong field even for notes smaller than 2 GB.

fields.name: ContentSizeLong
fields.description: The size of the note in bytes up to 10 GB. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: File extension of the attached ContentNote .

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Type of file for the note. All notes have a file type of SNOTE .

fields.name: LinkedEntityId
fields.description: ID of the record the ContentNote is attached to.

fields.name: TextPreview
fields.description: A preview of the note, up to 255 characters.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title of the note.

fields.name: Body
fields.description: Required. Encoded file data.

fields.name: BodyLength
fields.description: Size of the file (in bytes).

fields.name: ConnectionReceivedId
fields.description: ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that shared this record with your organization. This field is available if you enabled Salesforce to Salesforce.

fields.name: ConnectionSentId
fields.description: ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that you shared this record with. This field is available if you enabled Salesforce to Salesforce. This field is supported using API versions earlier than 15.0. In all other API versions, this field’s value is null. You can use the new PartnerNetworkRecordConnection object to forward records to connections.

fields.name: ContentType
fields.description: The content type of the attachment. If the Don't allow HTML uploads as attachments or document records security setting is enabled for your organization, you cannot upload files with the following file extensions: .htm , .html , .htt , .htx , .mhtm , .mhtml , .shtm , .shtml , .acgi , .svg . When you insert a document or attachment through the API, make sure that this field is set to the appropriate MIME type.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the attachment. Maximum size is 500 characters. This field is available in API version 18.0 and later.

fields.name: IsEncrypted
fields.description: Indicates whether the attachment is encrypted using Shield Platform Encryption ( true ) or not ( false ). This field is available in API version 34.0 and later.

fields.name: IsPartnerShared
fields.description: Indicates whether this record is shared with a connection using Salesforce to Salesforce. Label is Is Shared With Partner .

fields.name: IsPrivate
fields.description: Indicates whether this record is viewable only by the owner and administrators ( true ) or viewable by all otherwise-allowed users ( false ). During a create or update call, it is possible to mark an Attachment record as private even if you are not the owner. This can result in a situation in which you can no longer access the record that you just inserted or updated. Label is Private . Attachments on tasks or events can't be marked private.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Name of the attached file. Maximum size is 255 characters. Label is File Name .

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the User who owns the attachment. This field isn’t required for API version 9.0 or later. The owner of an attachment on a task or event must be the same as the owner of the task or event.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: Required. ID of the parent object of the attachment. The following objects are supported as parents of attachments: Account Asset Campaign Case Contact Contract Custom objects EmailMessage EmailTemplate Event Lead Opportunity Product2 Solution Task

fields.name: AttachmentIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the attachment.

fields.name: ContentType
fields.description: The content type of the attachment.

fields.name: IsPrivateOn
fields.description: Whether the attachment is flagged as private or not.

fields.name: OperationType
fields.description: The operation type of the attachment.

fields.name: ParentIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the parent object of the attachment. For example, a07EE00001LgsUH

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: AttribModelStatus
fields.description: Indicates a model’s current status. The default value is Draft , and accepted values are Active Draft Inactive

fields.name: AttributionModelType
fields.description: Indicates the type of attribution model, which determines which touchpoints to evaluate. The default value is LastTouch , and accepted values are

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three letter ISO currency codes for supported currencies. The default value is USD . This is an optional field.

fields.name: DataSpaceId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the data space where a model's resources originate. This is a required field.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Text description of the attribution model. Optional.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: Auto-generated or user-generated API name for the attribution model. This is a required field.

fields.name: Error Code
fields.description: Indicates the issue that’s causing an error. The default value is None , and accepted values are ConfigurationMissingError indicates that a required configuration setting is missing. DpcJobError indicates a problem during processing. InternalError indicates an internal error during processing. ModelValidationError indicates that the model is invalid. None

fields.name: GlobalAttributionWindowDays
fields.description: Defines a timeframe for tracking attribution-related engagement. This is a required field.

fields.name: IdentityResolutionMode
fields.description: Defines which identity resolution method to use when tracking engagement activities. Default value is Individual , and acceptable values are Individual Unified

fields.name: IsZeroDayLoadRequired
fields.description: Defines whether to sync data before the attribution window begins. The default value is false .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: Timestamp that indicates the last time the model was referenced by another resource.

fields.name: LastRefresh
fields.description: The timestamp that indicates the last time engagement data was refreshed and evaluated by the model.

fields.name: LastSuccessfulRefresh
fields.description: The timestamp that indicates the last time the model was successfully refreshed.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: Timestamp that indicates the last time a user viewed the model.

fields.name: LatestRefreshedStatus
fields.description: Picklist value that indicates the status of last refresh process. The default value is None , and accepted values are Canceled Complete Failure None Processing

fields.name: ModelContext
fields.description: Indicates the app or feature in which the attribution model is used. The default value is Personalization , and accepted values are Attribution : indicates the use with Attribution in Salesforce Personalization. CampaignInfluence : indicates the use with Campaign Influence in Unified Marketing Analytics. Personalization : indicates the use with Personalization in Salesforce Personalization.

fields.name: ModelRevision
fields.description: A version number that indicates the latest save of the model.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Text label that identifies the attribution model. This is a required field.

fields.name: Partner
fields.description: Indicates who's using the model. This field is required if the value of ModelContext is Attribution .

fields.name: ProfileDataGraphId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the profile data graph that’s used with the model.

fields.name: ScheduledFrequencyMins
fields.description: The scheduled frequency (in minutes) at which the attribution model is processed.

fields.name: SyncStatus
fields.description: Indicates the current status of the attribution model while an action is being performed. The default value is Processing , and acceptable values are: Active CreateError DeleteError Deleting EditError Processing

fields.name: Tags
fields.description: User-generated strings that can be used to organize attribution models.

fields.name: AttribModelId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the attribution configuration that uses this stage. This is a required field.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three letter ISO currency codes for supported currencies. The default value is USD . This is an optional field.

fields.name: EngagementSignalEnum
fields.description: Picklist value that indicates the engagement signal that’s selected for an attribution stage. This value represents a step in a customer journey. The accepted values are the engagement signals that are configured in the selected data space.

fields.name: IsContentMatchRequired
fields.description: Indicates whether to link item attribution from one funnel stage to the next. The default value is false , meaning not required. If you set this value to true , only engagement with the same item from the previous stage is linkable.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Text label that identifies the attribution model stage. This is a required field.

fields.name: Sequence
fields.description: Indicates the position of a stage in its journey sequence, reflecting funnel engagement from start to finish. The funnel requires a minimum of two stages, with a maximum of four stages. Accepted values are 1 , 2 , 3 , or 4 .

fields.name: StageUnionGroupName
fields.description: Name of a certain group of stages. It can be used to reference individual, consecutive stages as a combined group with a common name.

fields.name: Alias
fields.description: Indicates the name of the output data metric. This name appears as the column name for the metric on the attribution output table.

fields.name: AttribModelStageId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the attribution configuration stage that uses this metric.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three letter ISO currency codes for supported currencies. The default value is USD . This is an optional field.

fields.name: EngagementSignalMetricId
fields.description: Unique identifier that refers to the engagement signal that defines this stage.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The text label that identifies the attribution model stage metric.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: The data type of the attribute definition.

fields.name: DefaultValue
fields.description: The default value for this attribute.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of this attribute.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the attribute definition record.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates that the attribute definition is active. Active attributes definitions can be selected for assets.

fields.name: IsRequired
fields.description: Indicates whether the attribute definition is required for an asset.

fields.name: Label
fields.description: The label for the attribute. Displays a friendly name for the attribute, for example, threshold monitor lightning component and recordset filter criteria rule .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date the attribute definition was last referenced.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date the attribute definition was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the attribute.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The owner of the attribute definition.

fields.name: PicklistId
fields.description: The ID of the attribute picklist with the valid values for this attribute.

fields.name: SourceSystemIdentifier
fields.description: The identifier of the attribute definition in an external system.

fields.name: UnitOfMeasureId
fields.description: The ID of the measurement unit for this attribute.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: The data type of this picklist.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the picklist. Maximum size is 32000 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date the attribute picklist was last referenced.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date the attribute picklist was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the picklist. Names must be unique.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the attribute picklist record.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the attribute picklist.

fields.name: UnitOfMeasureId
fields.description: The ID of the unit of measure associated with the product.

fields.name: Abbreviation
fields.description: A short name of the picklist value that's displayed at run time. Use up to 255 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @ ! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

fields.name: Code
fields.description: A picklist value code unique to the picklist. Maximum size is 80 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @ ! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

fields.name: DisplayValue
fields.description: The displayed picklist value if it’s different from the Name field. For example, the Name ‘5’ could have a DisplayValue ‘Five’.

fields.name: IsDefault
fields.description: Indicates whether the picklist value is the default for the associated picklist. Only one value can be the default for a picklist.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date the attribute picklist value was last referenced.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date the attribute picklist value was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the attribute picklist value.

fields.name: PicklistId
fields.description: The ID of the picklist that the value is associated with.

fields.name: Sequence
fields.description: The order in which the picklist value appears in the picklist.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the attribute picklist value.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The text value for a picklist item if the picklist data type is text. This value must be unique within a picklist. Maximum size is 255 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @ ! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

fields.name: AverageRowSize
fields.description: The average row size (in bytes) of all rows in the Asynchronous Report Run event.

fields.name: BucketCount
fields.description: The number of buckets used in the report.

fields.name: ClientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”. For example: 96.43.144.26 .

fields.name: ColumnCount
fields.description: The number of columns in the report.

fields.name: CpuTime
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: DashboardIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the dashboard that was run.

fields.name: DatabaseBlocks
fields.description: How much activity is occurring in the database.

fields.name: DatabaseCpuTime
fields.description: The CPU time (in milliseconds) to complete the request.

fields.name: DatabaseTotalTime
fields.description: Total time spent in OracleJdbc calls, counting the Jdbc driver, Network, and Oracle time for execs, fetches, and get-connection.

fields.name: DisplayType
fields.description: Possible values are: D—Dashboard S—Show Details H—Hide Details

fields.name: ExceptionFilterCount
fields.description: The number of exception filters used in the report.

fields.name: IsPreview
fields.description: This field is reserved for future use.

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: ObjectName
fields.description: The name of the object affected by the trigger.

fields.name: Origin
fields.description: Where the report is being executed, such as from a UI (Classic, Lightning, Mobile), through an API (synchronous, asynchronous, Apex), or through a dashboard.

fields.name: RenderingType
fields.description: Describes the format of the report output in Salesforce Classic. If the report was exported in Lightning Experience, this field is blank.

fields.name: ReportIdentifier
fields.description: The report’s ID.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier. For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV.

fields.name: RequestStatus
fields.description: The status of the request for a page view or user interface action.

fields.name: RowCount
fields.description: The number of rows that were processed in the Asynchronous Report Run event.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The amount of time that the request took in milliseconds.

fields.name: SessionKey
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started. For example: d7DEq/ANa7nNZZVD .

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: The sort column and order that was used in the report.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: Uri
fields.description: The URI of the page that’s receiving the request. For example: /home/home.jsp .

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: UserType
fields.description: The category of user license. Possible values are: CsnOnly—Users whose access to the application is limited to Chatter. This user type includes Chatter Free and Chatter moderator users. CspLitePortal—CSP Lite Portal license. Users whose access is limited because they’re organization customers and access the application through a customer portal or an Experience Cloud site. CustomerSuccess—Customer Success license. Users whose access is limited because they’re organization customers and access the application through a customer portal Guest—Users whose access is limited so that your customers can view and interact with your site without logging in. PowerCustomerSuccess—Power Customer Success license. Users whose access is limited because they’re organization customers and access the application through a customer portal. Users with this license type can view and edit data they directly own or data owned by or shared with users below them in the customer portal role hierarchy. PowerPartner—Power Partner license. Users whose access is limited because they’re partners and typically access the application through a partner portal or site. SelfService—Users whose access is limited because they’re organization customers and access the application through a self-service portal. Standard—Standard user license. This user type also includes Salesforce Platform and Salesforce Platform One user licenses, and admins for this org.

fields.name: AudienceName
fields.description: Name of the audience.

fields.name: ContainerId
fields.description: ID of the site or org that contains the audience. ContainerId is nillable in API versions 47.0 and earlier.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the audience.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the audience in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This field is automatically generated, but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: FormulaFilterType
fields.description: Formula filter for the criteria used to define the audience. Valid values are: AllCriteriaMatch —Matching all the conditions (AND). AnyCriterionMatches —Matching at least one condition (OR). CustomLogicMatches —Matching condition logic (AND and OR) and numbered criteria groups. This value is available in API version 45.0 and later.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Language of the audience. Valid values are: Chinese (Simplified): zh_CN Chinese (Traditional): zh_TW Danish: da Dutch: nl_NL English: en_US Finnish: fi French: fr German: de Italian: it Japanese: ja Korean: ko Norwegian: no Portuguese (Brazil): pt_BR Russian: ru Spanish: es Spanish (Mexico): es_MX Spanish (Mexico) defaults to Spanish for customer-defined translations. Swedish: sv Thai: th The Salesforce user interface is fully translated to Thai, but Help is in English.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Master label for the audience. This internal name doesn’t get translated.

fields.name: AuraDefinitionBundleId
fields.description: The ID of the bundle containing the definition. A bundle contains a Lightning definition and all its related resources.

fields.name: DefType
fields.description: The definition type. Valid values are: APPLICATION — Lightning Aura Components app CONTROLLER — client-side controller COMPONENT — component markup EVENT — event definition HELPER — client-side helper INTERFACE — interface definition RENDERER — client-side renderer STYLE — style (CSS) resource PROVIDER — reserved for future use MODEL — deprecated, do not use TESTSUITE — reserved for future use DOCUMENTATION — documentation markup TOKENS — tokens collection DESIGN — design definition SVG — SVG graphic resource MODULE — reserved for future use

fields.name: Format
fields.description: The format of the definition. Valid values are: XML for component markup JS for JavaScript code CSS for styles TEMPLATE_CSS reserved for future use SVG for an SVG graphic

fields.name: Source
fields.description: The contents of the definition. This is all the markup or code for the definition.

fields.name: ApiVersion
fields.description: The API version for this bundle. Every bundle has an API version specified at creation.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The text description of the bundle. Maximum size of 255 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the record in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This field is automatically generated but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the MasterLabel .

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Master label for the Lightning bundle. This internal label doesn’t get translated.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: ActionMessage
fields.description: The action (Apex method) names and times for all the actions in the request in the format. For example: action1Name=action1Time;action2Name=action2Time...

fields.name: ClientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”. For example: 96.43.144.26 .

fields.name: CpuTime
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: DatabaseTotalTime
fields.description: The time in nanoseconds for a database round trip. Includes time spent in the JDBC driver, network to the database, and DatabaseCpuTime . Compare this field to CpuTime to determine whether performance issues are occurring in the database layer or in your own code.

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier. For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV.

fields.name: RequestMethod
fields.description: The HTTP method of the request, such as GET or POST .

fields.name: RequestStatus
fields.description: The status of the request for a page view or user interface action.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The amount of time that the request took in milliseconds.

fields.name: SessionKey
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started. For example: d7DEq/ANa7nNZZVD .

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: Uri
fields.description: The URI of the page that’s receiving the request. For example: /home/home.jsp .

fields.name: UserAgent
fields.description: The numeric code for the type of client used to make the request (for example, the browser, application, or API) as a string.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: UserType
fields.description: The category of user license.

fields.name: AuthOptionsAuthProvider
fields.description: If true , at least one Auth. Provider is selected to show up on the login page, and this object has child AuthConfigProvider objects for each provider.

fields.name: AuthOptionsCertificate
fields.description: If true , certificate-based login displays on the My Domain login page.

fields.name: AuthOptionsSaml
fields.description: If true , at least one SAML configuration is selected to show up on the login page. If the organization has only one SAML configuration, this value indicates whether that configuration is selected to show up on the login page. If the organization has multiple SAML configurations, see the child AuthConfigProvider objects for each configuration.

fields.name: AuthOptionsUsernamePassword
fields.description: If true , the login option for a username and password appears on the login page.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The name of the domain created using My Domain or, for an Experience Cloud site, a concatenated string of site name _ site prefix . Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Whether this configuration is in use.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language for the organization.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The text that’s used to identify the Visualforce page in Setup.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The organization type for this object. Org (includes custom domains) Community Site Portal

fields.name: Url
fields.description: The login URL of the organization for this AuthConfig object. Each URL has only one associated AuthConfig object.

fields.name: AuthConfigId
fields.description: The ID for this configuration.

fields.name: AuthProviderId
fields.description: The ID of the Auth. Provider or SAML configuration.

fields.name: DefaultAuthFormTextId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the default authorization form text to use if text isn’t available for a specific language.

fields.name: EffectiveFromDate
fields.description: The date when the authorization form takes effect.

fields.name: EffectiveToDate
fields.description: The date when the authorization form is no longer in effect.

fields.name: IsSignatureRequired
fields.description: Indicates whether the authorization form requires a signature.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. The name of the authorization form.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the account associated with this customer.

fields.name: RevisionNumber
fields.description: The revision number of the authorization form. For example, "rev1.21."

fields.name: AuthorizationFormTextId
fields.description: Required. The authorization form text that the Individual consented to.

fields.name: ConsentCapturedDateTime
fields.description: Required. The date and time that consent was given.

fields.name: ConsentCapturedSource
fields.description: Required. The source through which consent was captured. For example, user@example.com, www.example.com.

fields.name: ConsentCapturedSourceType
fields.description: Required. The source type through which consent was captured. For example, phone, email, or website.

fields.name: ConsentGiverId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the person consenting to the authorization form.

fields.name: DocumentVersionId
fields.description: The ID of the document version for which consent is given.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. The name of the authorization form consent.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the owner of the account associated with this customer.

fields.name: RelatedRecordId
fields.description: The ID of a record showing consent of an authorization form.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the authorization form.

fields.name: PartyId
fields.description: This field was removed in API version 47.0. Use ConsentGiverId instead.

fields.name: AuthorizationFormId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the associated authorization form record.

fields.name: DataUsePurposeId
fields.description: Required. Identifies the data use purpose record associated with the authorization form.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. The name of the authorization form data use.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the account associated with this customer.

fields.name: AuthorizationFormId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the associated authorization form record.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: The ID of the ContentDocument that provides the authorization form’s text.

fields.name: DetailAuthorizationFormText
fields.description: A detailed version of the authorization form.

fields.name: FullAuthorizationFormUrl
fields.description: The URL where the full text of the authorization form is located.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: Locale
fields.description: The combined language and locale ISO code that control the language of the authorization form text. Locale and LocaleSelection have the same function. Note Locale can contain custom values not included in the picklist if added before version 47.0.

fields.name: LocaleSelection
fields.description: The combined language and locale ISO code that control the language of the authorization form text. Locale and LocaleSelection have the same function.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. The name of the authorization form text.

fields.name: SummaryAuthFormText
fields.description: A shortened version of the authorization form that is displayed to the user.

fields.name: AppleTeam
fields.description: Required when using Apple as a third-party authentication provider. A 10-character team ID, obtained from an Apple developer account. Available in API version 48.0 and later.

fields.name: AuthorizeUrl
fields.description: Required when creating an OpenID Connect authentication provider. The OAuth authorization endpoint URL. Available in API version 29.0 and later. In API version 33.0 and later, for Salesforce-managed auth providers, leave the field blank to let Salesforce supply and manage the value.

fields.name: ConsumerKey
fields.description: The app’s key that is registered at the third-party (external) authentication provider. In API version 33.0 and later, for Salesforce-managed auth providers, leave the field blank to let Salesforce supply and manage the value.

fields.name: ConsumerSecret
fields.description: The consumer secret of the authentication provider that is registered at the third-party SSO provider. It’s used by the consumer for identification to Salesforce. In API version 33.0 and later, for Salesforce-managed auth providers, leave the field blank to let Salesforce supply and manage the value. You can create your own consumer secret on create() . However, after you set it, you can’t change the value.

fields.name: CustomMetadataTypeRecord
fields.description: Required when creating a custom authentication provider plug-in. The API name of the custom authentication provider. Available in API version 36.0 and later.

fields.name: DefaultScopes
fields.description: For OpenID Connect authentication providers, the scopes to send with the authorization request, if not specified when a flow starts. Available in API version 29.0 and later. In API version 33.0 and later, for Salesforce-managed auth providers, leave the field blank to let Salesforce supply and manage the value.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: Required. Used when referring to the authentication provider from a program.

fields.name: EcKey
fields.description: Required when using Apple as a third-party authentication provider. Available in API version 48.0 and later.

fields.name: ErrorUrl
fields.description: A custom error URL for the authentication provider to use to report errors.

fields.name: ExecutionUserId
fields.description: Required to specify a registration handler. The username of the Salesforce admin or system user who runs the Apex handler or flow. The execution user provides the context in which the registration handler runs. For example, if the handler creates a contact, the creation can be easily traced back to the registration process. In production, use a system user. The user must have the Manage Users permission. Available in API version 27.0 and later.

fields.name: FlowDefaultAccountId
fields.description: For authentication providers that use a flow registration handler, the default account that new external users are assigned to. If you include this field, Salesforce automatically uses it for the defaultAccountId variable in the Authentication Provider User Registration standard flow. A default account is required to use a flow registration handler for external users. You can specify a default account here or in the flow itself. If you use both, the default account that's configured in the flow takes precedent. Available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: FlowDefaultProfileId
fields.description: For authentication providers that use a flow registration handler, the default profile that new users are assigned to. If you include this field, Salesforce automatically uses it for the defaultProfileId variable in the Authentication Provider User Registration standard flow. A default profile is required to use a flow registration handler. You can specify a default profile here or in the flow itself. If you use both, the default profile that's configured in the flow takes precedent. Available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: FriendlyName
fields.description: Required. A user-friendly name for the authentication provider.

fields.name: IconUrl
fields.description: The path to an icon to use as a button on the login page. Users click the button to log in with the associated authentication provider, such as Twitter or Facebook. Available in API version 32.0 and later.

fields.name: IdTokenIssuer
fields.description: The source of the authentication token in https: URI format. This field is available when configuring an OpenID Connect or Microsoft authentication provider. If provided, Salesforce validates the returned id_token value. OpenID Connect requires returning an id_token value with the access_token value. Available in API version 30.0 and later.

fields.name: LinkKickoffUrl
fields.description: The URL for linking existing Salesforce users to a third-party account. This field is read-only. Available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: LogoutUrl
fields.description: The destination for users after they log out if they authenticated using single sign-on. The URL must be fully qualified with an http or https prefix, such as https://acme.my.salesforce.com . Available in API version 33.0 and later.

fields.name: OauthKickoffUrl
fields.description: The URL for obtaining OAuth access tokens for a third party. This field is read-only. Available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: OptionsIncludeOrgIdInId
fields.description: Used to differentiate between users with the same user ID from two sources (such as two sandboxes). If enabled ( true ), Salesforce stores the org ID of the third-party identity in addition to the user ID. After you enable this setting, you can’t disable it. Applies only to a Salesforce-managed auth provider. Available in API version 32.0 and later.

fields.name: OptionsIsPkceEnabled
fields.description: If set to true , the authentication provider uses the OAuth 2.0 Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) extension, which improves the security of the provider’s authorization flow. This field applies only to these providerType values: Custom Facebook Google Microsoft OpenIdConnect Salesforce . This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: OptionsRequireMfa
fields.description: Requires multi-factor authentication (MFA) for single sign-on with this auth provider based on the MFA status of each user. For this setting to trigger MFA, you must apply MFA directly to users via one of two methods. 1) Assign the user permission Multi-Factor Authentication for User Interface Logins. 2) Enable the org setting Require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all direct UI logins to your Salesforce org.

fields.name: OptionsSendAccessTokenInHeader
fields.description: If enabled ( true ), the access token is sent to the UserInfoUrl in a header instead of a query string. Available in API version 30.0 and later.

fields.name: OptionsSendClientCredentialsInHeader
fields.description: Required when creating an OpenID Connect authentication provider. If enabled ( true ), the client credentials are sent in a header to the tokenUrl instead of a query string. The credentials are in the standard OpenID Connect Basic Credentials header format, which is Basic <token> , where <token> is the base64-encoded string "clientkey:clientsecret" . Available in API version 30.0 and later.

fields.name: OptionsSendSecretInApis
fields.description: Determines whether the encrypted consumer secret appears in API responses. If enabled (default), the secret appears in the response. If disabled ( false ), responses don’t include the consumer secret. For security, you can disable the setting. However, keep in mind that: By disabling this setting, the consumer secret is excluded from API responses in all API versions. Change sets and other metadata deployments break because both the consumer key and secret are expected. To fix this problem, insert the consumer key manually during deployment. Available in API version 47.0 and later.

fields.name: PluginId
fields.description: An existing Apex class that extends the Auth.AuthProviderPluginClass abstract class. Available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: ProviderType
fields.description: Required. The third-party authentication provider to use. Valid values include: Apple . Available in API version 48.0 and later. Bitbucket —Provides authentication for a Bitbucket provider. Enables you to connect to Bitbucket from a Lightning Platform application. When logged in to Bitbucket, the app can makes calls to Bitbucket APIs. The Bitbucket provider isn’t available as an SSO provider, so users can’t log in to a Salesforce org using their Bitbucket login credentials. Available in API version 61.0 and higher. Custom —A provider configured with a custom authentication provider plug-in. Available in API version 36.0 and later. Facebook . GitHub — Provides authentication for a GitHub provider. Used to log in users of your Lightning Platform app to GitHub using OAuth. When logged in to GitHub, your app can make calls to GitHub APIs. The GitHub provider isn’t available as an SSO provider, so users can’t log in to your Salesforce org using their GitHub login credentials. Available in API version 35.0 and later. Google . Janrain . LinkedIn . Available in API version 32.0 and later. Microsoft . Provides authentication for all services that can be accessed via Microsoft Azure Active Directory. Available in API version 55.0 and later. MicrosoftACS —Microsoft Access Control Service provides authentication for a Microsoft Office 365 service, like SharePoint Online. The MicrosoftACS provider doesn't support SSO. Available in API version 31.0 and later. OpenIdConnect . Available in API version 29.0 and later. Salesforce . Slack . Available in API version 54.0 and later. Twitter . Available in API version 32.0 and later.

fields.name: RegistrationHandlerId
fields.description: An existing Apex class that implements the Auth.RegistrationHandler interface.

fields.name: SsoKickoffUrl
fields.description: The URL for performing SSO into Salesforce from a third party by using its third-party credentials. This field is read-only. Available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: TokenUrl
fields.description: The OAuth token endpoint URL of an OpenID Connect authentication provider. Available in API version 29.0 and later. In API version 33.0 and later, for Salesforce-managed auth providers for sandbox use cases only, leave the field blank to let Salesforce supply and manage the value.

fields.name: UserInfoUrl
fields.description: The OpenID Connect endpoint URL of the OpenID Connect authentication provider. Available in API version 29.0 and later. In API version 33.0 and later, for Salesforce-managed auth providers, leave the field blank to let Salesforce supply and manage the value.

fields.name: AuthProviderId
fields.description: The ID of the authentication provider associated with the allowlist.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description for the allowlisted URL parameter.

fields.name: Param
fields.description: The name of the parameter, such as ui_locales or login_hint .

fields.name: CreatedDate
fields.description: The date and time this session was created. This field is a standard system field.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: The current session’s ID.

fields.name: IsAssociatedWithJwtAccessToken
fields.description: If true , the session is associated with a JSON Web Token (JWT)-based access token. This field is available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: IsCurrent
fields.description: If true , the session is a member of the user’s current session family. This field is available in API version 37.0 and later.

fields.name: LastModifiedDate
fields.description: The date and time this session was last updated. A session expires when the current date and time equals LastModifiedDate + NumSecondsValid . This field is a standard system field.

fields.name: LoginGeoId
fields.description: The 18-character ID for the record of the geographic location of the user for a login event. Due to the nature of geolocation technology, the accuracy of geolocation fields (for example, country, city, postal code) can vary. This field is available in API version 34.0 and later.

fields.name: LoginHistoryId
fields.description: The 18-character ID for a successful login event. When a session is reused, Salesforce updates the LoginHistoryId with the value from the most recent login. This field is available in API version 33.0 and later.

fields.name: LoginType
fields.description: The type of login used to access the session. Possible values are: AJAX Toolkit Apex Office Toolkit AppExchange Application AppStore Certificate-based login Chatter Communities External User Chatter Communities External User Third Party SSO Community Customer Service Portal Third-Party SSO Customer Service Portal DataJunction DB Replication Employee Login to Community Excel Integration Help and Training HOTP YubiKey Lightning Login Networks Portal API Only Offline Client Order Center Other Apex API Outlook Integration Partner Portal Third-Party SSO Partner Portal Partner Product Passwordless Login Remote Access 2.0 Remote Access Client Sales Anywhere Salesforce Outlook Integration Salesforce.com Website SAML Chatter Communities External User SSO SAML Customer Service Portal SSO SAML Idp Initiated SSO SAML Partner Portal SSO SAML Sfdc Initiated SSO SAML Site SSO Self-Service Signup Sync SysAdmin Switch Third Party SSO Unknown Validate

fields.name: LogoutUrl
fields.description: The page or view to display after users log out of an Experience Cloud site, or an org if they authenticated using SAML. This field is available in API version 32.0 and later.

fields.name: NumSecondsValid
fields.description: The number of seconds before the session expires, starting from the last update time.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The 18-character ID for the parent session, if one exists (for example, if the current session is for a canvas app). If the current session doesn’t have a parent, this value is the current session’s own ID.

fields.name: SessionSecurityLevel
fields.description: Standard or High, depending upon the authentication method used.

fields.name: SessionType
fields.description: The type of session. Common ones are UI, Content, API, and Visualforce.

fields.name: SourceIp
fields.description: IP address of the end user’s device from which the session started. This address can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

fields.name: UserType
fields.description: The kind of user for this session. Types include Standard, Partner, Customer Portal Manager, High Volume Portal, and CSN Only.

fields.name: UsersId
fields.description: The user’s Salesforce user ID.

fields.name: ApiVersion
fields.description: Required. API version to use for executing the automated action.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the automated action.

fields.name: ErrorDetail
fields.description: The source of the error encountered when executing the automated action.

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: A description of the error encountered when executing the automated action.

fields.name: EvalType
fields.description: When the automated action runs.

fields.name: ExecutionType
fields.description: Whether the action runs automatically or generates a reminder.

fields.name: ExtraFilterExpression
fields.description: Additional condition logic for cross-object filters.

fields.name: ExtraFilterType
fields.description: Additional criteria for cross-object filters.

fields.name: FilterExpression
fields.description: If FilterType is Advanced , this field contains the condition logic.

fields.name: FilterType
fields.description: Criteria for filters.

fields.name: InvocationName
fields.description: Invocable action to execute.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action record is locked or not.

fields.name: LastEditedDateTime
fields.description: The timestamp when the automated action had a change that impacted rule evaluation.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record was likely referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action record can be edited or not.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the automated action.

fields.name: ReferenceEntity
fields.description: Entity on which the automated action operates.

fields.name: RuleType
fields.description: The type of workflow rule.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The status of the alert.

fields.name: SubscriptionState
fields.description: For users who don’t have an override, the default value of the subscription.

fields.name: Summary
fields.description: A human-readable explanation of the automated action, its conditions, and its parameters.

fields.name: AutomatedActionId
fields.description: ID of the automated action.

fields.name: ConditionNumber
fields.description: Reference number of the condition containing advanced filter logic.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action condition record is locked or not.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action condition record can be edited or not.

fields.name: Operator
fields.description: The logical operator for this condition.

fields.name: ReferenceField
fields.description: The field to use for this condition.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of condition.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The value to compare to the ReferenceField .

fields.name: FieldName
fields.description: The name of the field to override.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action override record is locked or not.

fields.name: IsRelatedRecordOverridable
fields.description: Indicates whether the parent automated action record can be overridden.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action override record can be edited or not.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the automated action.

fields.name: RelatedRecordApiName
fields.description: The object name of the RelatedRecordId .

fields.name: RelatedRecordId
fields.description: ID of the automated action.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The overridden value used for FieldName .

fields.name: AutomatedActionId
fields.description: ID of the automated action.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: The data type of the value or field reference value.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action parameter record is locked or not.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action parameter record can be edited or not.

fields.name: ParameterName
fields.description: The name of the invocable action parameter the value maps to.

fields.name: ReferenceField
fields.description: The reference to the field that’s resolved at runtime. For example, LeadID. If Value has a value, this field is null.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The value to be passed to the invocable action parameter at runtime. If ReferenceField has a value, this field is null.

fields.name: ActionTakenDateTime
fields.description: Timestamp of when the user took the action suggested by the reminder.

fields.name: AutomatedActionId
fields.description: ID of the automated action.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action reminder record is locked or not.

fields.name: IsValidForUser
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action is active and accessible to the user who owns the record ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action reminder record can be edited or not.

fields.name: ReferenceRecordId
fields.description: The record that triggered the reminder. For example, when a rule is set to Case, the value of this field is CaseId .

fields.name: StartDateTime
fields.description: The date and time this reminder is scheduled to be displayed to the user.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The status of the reminder.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of automated action reminder.

fields.name: Error
fields.description: The error message for the operation. Applies only if the operation has an error status.

fields.name: ExecutionGroup
fields.description: Applies only if the operation is merged with other operations into an execution group to be processed in bulk. Identifies the execution group.

fields.name: ExpiresAt
fields.description: After this time, the operation is removed from the asynchronous job queue. Applies only if the operation has a status of complete, canceled, error, or merged.

fields.name: FinishedAt
fields.description: When the operation reached the status of completed or error.

fields.name: GroupLeaderId
fields.description: Applies only if the operation is merged with other operations into an execution group to be processed in bulk. Identifies the operation that’s selected as the leader of the execution group.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Identifies the background operation.

fields.name: NumFollowers
fields.description: Applies only if the operation is merged with other operations into an execution group to be processed in bulk. Number of other operations that are in the execution group.

fields.name: ParentKey
fields.description: Tag that identifies related sets of operations, if any.

fields.name: ProcessAfter
fields.description: The operation is scheduled to be processed after this time.

fields.name: RetryBackoff
fields.description: Applies only if the operation has an error status. The first retry is attempted immediately. Each subsequent retry is increasingly delayed according to an exponential expression that’s multiplied by the RetryBackoff , in milliseconds. Specifically, the delay time is (2 n -1)×R , where n is the RetryCount , and R is the RetryBackoff . The default value for RetryBackoff depends on the type of operation. For example, the RetryBackoff default for write operations on external objects is 1,000 milliseconds. For write operations, retries are attempted immediately, after 3 seconds, after 7 seconds, after 15 seconds, and so on.

fields.name: RetryCount
fields.description: Number of attempted retries. Applies only if the operation has an error status.

fields.name: RetryLimit
fields.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt. Applies only if the operation has an error status.

fields.name: SequenceGroup
fields.description: Identifies the sequence group. Applies only if the operation is merged with other operations into an execution group to be processed in bulk. Within an execution group, operations can be placed into a sequence group to be executed in a specific order.

fields.name: SequenceNumber
fields.description: Order position within the sequence group. Applies only if the operation is merged with other operations into an execution group to be processed in bulk. Within an execution group, operations can be placed into a sequence group to be run in a specific order.

fields.name: StartedAt
fields.description: When the operation started running.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the background operation. The options are: New Scheduled Canceled Merged Waiting Running Error Complete

fields.name: SubmittedAt
fields.description: When the operation was added to the job queue.

fields.name: Timeout
fields.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for results after the operation started running.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of the background operation. The options are: ApiCatalogPoller BlockchainEventPoller CdpMetadataDeploy ExternalChangeDataCapture ExternalConnectivityPoller ExternalObject ExternalObjectSync ExternalServiceCallback MetadataChangesetOperation MfgBulkUpdate PrivateConnectMigration SingularityAutoSync SingularityMDSSync SingularitySchemaEvolutionTrigger SiteTaskCreate SiteTaskPublish Sweeper WebCart XClean

fields.name: WorkerUri
fields.description: URI of the worker that performed the operation. Example for a Salesforce Connect OData operation: services/data/v35.0/xds/upsert

fields.name: CreatedById
fields.description: The user ID of the user initiating the Bulk API request.

fields.name: CreatedDate
fields.description: The date and time at which the Bulk API request was made.

fields.name: Data
fields.description: The data that generated the error message. The total length is limited to 2,000 characters, and each column can occupy a maximum of 50 characters. Any data exceeding those limits is truncated.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: The ID of the error message.

fields.name: Message
fields.description: The text of the error message.

fields.name: MessageType
fields.description: The type of error message. The possible values are: ERROR, WARNING, or INFO.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The batch ID in Bulk API.

fields.name: BillingSchedulerName
fields.description: Name of the scheduler.

fields.name: Comments
fields.description: Optional field for comments about the scheduler.

fields.name: CronExpression
fields.description: Determines how often the scheduler recurs.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The date when the scheduler stops triggering batch processing jobs.

fields.name: FrequencyCadence
fields.description: Indicates how often the scheduler triggers the invoice batch run or the payment batch run.

fields.name: FrequencyOptions
fields.description: Derived field that stores the scheduler configuration.

fields.name: JobType
fields.description: Indicates the type of batch processing job that the scheduler triggers.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: NextRunTime
fields.description: The date and timestamp of the next scheduled batch invoice run or batch payment run are shown in the user's time zone.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who created the scheduler.

fields.name: RecurringSubType
fields.description: Specifies the frequency at which the batch processing job recurs when the FrequencyCadence is set to Monthly .

fields.name: RecurringType
fields.description: Specifies the frequency at which the batch processing job is repeated when the FrequencyCadence is set to Weekly .

fields.name: RecursOn
fields.description: Specifies the interval at which the scheduler triggers a batch processing job.

fields.name: RecursOnDate
fields.description: Specifies the date on which the scheduler triggers a batch processing job.

fields.name: RecursOnDay
fields.description: Specifies the day on which the scheduler triggers a batch processing job.

fields.name: RunCriteriaId
fields.description: The ID of the filter criteria that’s defined for the invoice batch run or the payment batch run.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The date when the scheduler triggers its first batch processing job.

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: The time when the scheduler triggers the batch processing job.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the scheduler. Only Active schedulers can trigger batch processing jobs.

fields.name: TimeZone
fields.description: The time zone is either the value selected when the run was configured, or it's the user's time zone. The time zone is shown in Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: Price for the billing period item. Used to calculate the invoice line's Amount field.

fields.name: BillingPeriodEndDate
fields.description: Used to calculate the invoice line's end date.

fields.name: BillingPeriodItemNumber
fields.description: System-defined number that refers to the billing period item.

fields.name: BillingPeriodStartDate
fields.description: Used to calculate the invoice line's start date.

fields.name: BillingScheduleId
fields.description: Parent billing schedule of the billing period item.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the org. Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled.

fields.name: InvoiceBatchRunId
fields.description: Parent invoice batch run of the billing period item.

fields.name: InvoiceLineId
fields.description: This field looks up to the invoice line that's generated from the billing period item. This field is populated only when a billing period item is generated via an invoice batch run. Otherwise, this field is empty.

fields.name: InvoiceStatus
fields.description: Status of the invoice that contains the invoice line created from the billing period item.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the billing period item. Draft billing period items aren't evaluated for invoice line creation.

fields.name: BillingTreatmentSelection
fields.description: Defines how Subscription Management assigns billing treatments to order items and to assets related to the billing policy.

fields.name: DefaultBillingTreatmentId
fields.description: When BillingTreatmentSelection has a value of Default , Subscription Management uses the selected billing treatment for all order items and assets related to the billing policy.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Optional user-defined description that describes the billing policy.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Optional user-defined name for the billing policy.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The billing policy's status.

fields.name: BillDayOfMonth
fields.description: An integer from 1 to 31 that indicates the day of the month.

fields.name: BilledAmount
fields.description: The total amount (excluding tax) that has been invoiced from the billing schedule.

fields.name: BillingAccountId
fields.description: This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: BillingPeriodAmount
fields.description: The amount to be invoiced each billing period.

fields.name: BillingScheduleEndDate
fields.description: The last date that the billing schedule is available for invoicing. Inherited from the EndDate field on the order item.

fields.name: BillingScheduleGroupId
fields.description: ID of the billing schedule group that contains the billing schedule. Billing schedules are grouped when they have the same source order item. The source order item is the original order item that a customer bought. Afterwards, if the customer amends, cancels, or renews the order item, a new billing schedule is created with the BillingScheduleGroupId for the original order item.

fields.name: BillingScheduleNumber
fields.description: Autogenerated reference number for the billing schedule.

fields.name: BillingScheduleStartDate
fields.description: The date that the billing schedule is available for invoicing. Inherited from the ServiceDate on the order item.

fields.name: BilledThroughPeriod
fields.description: The last billing period that includes this date.

fields.name: BillingTreatmentItemId
fields.description: The billing treatment item used to configure invoiceable amounts on the billing schedule.

fields.name: CancellationDate
fields.description: The date on which the subscriber can no longer access the service. For example, if a service ends on August 31, then the cancellation date is September 1, because that’s the date when the subscriber can no longer use the service.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: The business action represented by the billing schedule.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the invoice.

fields.name: InvoiceBatchRunId
fields.description: The invoice batch run that evaluated this billing schedule and its billing period items to produce an invoice.

fields.name: InvoiceRunBatch
