fields.description: The batch value used by the invoice run that evaluated this billing schedule. During an invoice run, billing schedules with the same batch value (including null) are grouped to the same invoice run.

fields.name: NextBillingDate
fields.description: The date that the next billing period starts for the invoice. Used to calculate which invoice lines are included on an invoice. When an invoice scheduler or API evaluates an order for invoicing, billing schedules with a next billing date on or before the invoice's target date are included on the invoice.

fields.name: NextChargeFromDate
fields.description: The date that the billing schedule is invoiced in the upcoming billing period. For example, if you invoiced a customer for a billing period of 01/01/22 through 01/31/22, the billing schedule's NextChargeFromDate is 02/01/22.

fields.name: OriginalBillingScheduleId
fields.description: If this billing schedule is an amended or canceled billing schedule, then this field shows the original billing schedule. Otherwise, this field is null.

fields.name: PendingAmount
fields.description: The amount from the current billing term that hasn't been billed yet. For example, the unbilled amount for a month, quarter, or year, depending on this billing schedule's billing term.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The quantity of the order item that created the billing schedule.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityId
fields.description: The parent order of the order item that created the billing schedule.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityItemId
fields.description: The order item or asset that created the billing schedule.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The state of the order item that the billing schedule represents.

fields.name: TaxTreatmentId
fields.description: Shows the treatment used to calculate tax for the billing schedule. Defined based on the order item's tax policy.

fields.name: TotalAmount
fields.description: The total amount of the order item represented by the billing schedule.

fields.name: UnitPrice
fields.description: The price for an individual unit of the billing schedule's parent order item, including charges, adjustments, and discounts. Inherited from the order item's UnitPrice field.

fields.name: BillDayOfMonth
fields.description: The Billing Day of Month for the billing schedules that comprise the billing schedule group.

fields.name: BillToContactId
fields.description: The contact related to the billing schedule group.

fields.name: BillingAccountId
fields.description: The Salesforce account for the billing schedule group.

fields.name: BillingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the billing address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: BillingCity
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this billing schedule group. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: BillingCountry
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this billing schedule group. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: BillingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the billing address. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: BillingLatitude
fields.description: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: BillingLongitude
fields.description: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: BillingMethod
fields.description: Shows the type of billing used for the source item.

fields.name: BillingPostalCode
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this billing schedule group. Maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: BillingScheduleGroupNumber
fields.description: System-generated reference number for the billing schedule group.

fields.name: BillingStartMonth
fields.description: Read-only field used with annual billing. The field shows the numbers from 1 to 12, which indicate the month when billing begins for an annual subscription. For example, if billing starts in January, the value is 1; if billing starts in June, the value is 6. This field is available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: BillingState
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this billing schedule group. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: BillingStreet
fields.description: Street address for the billing address of this billing schedule group.

fields.name: BillingTerm
fields.description: Used with BillingTermUnit to define a billing cycle. For example, bill every 20 days or every two months. In this example, the BillingTerm is 20 and the BillingTermUnit is days

fields.name: BillingTermUnit
fields.description: The frequency with which the billing schedule is invoiced.

fields.name: BillingType
fields.description: Inherited from the shared value of each billing schedule in the billing schedule group. Defines when Subscription Management bills a product or service relative to when it’s provided to the customer. Advance billing invoices a product or service before you provide it, while arrears billing invoices a product or service after you provide it. Subscription Management evaluates the billing type when it calculates an order's next billing date.

fields.name: CancellationDate
fields.description: The date that a cancellation was made against the billing schedule. Subscription Management doesn't invoice billing schedules past their cancellation date.

fields.name: Controller
fields.description: During the invoicing process, this field determines which date is used when the billing schedule group and billing schedule have a related field with conflicting values.

fields.name: CurrentBillingPeriodAmount
fields.description: This field was removed in Subscription Management API version 55.0.

fields.name: CurrentQuantity
fields.description: This field was removed in Subscription Management API version 55.0.

fields.name: EffectiveNextBillingDate
fields.description: The earliest NextBillingDate from all billing schedules in the billing schedule group. This field is a reference field that isn't used for any features or calculations.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The latest end date from all billing schedules in the billing schedule group.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The Salesforce user who owns the billing schedule group.

fields.name: PaymentTermId
fields.description: The ID of the payment term used in this billing schedule group.

fields.name: PeriodBoundary
fields.description: Inherited from the order item's parent quote line item or sales transaction item. The period boundary helps determine the start and end date of the billing periods.

fields.name: Product2Id
fields.description: The ID of the product for the order item represented by each billing schedule in the billing schedule group.

fields.name: ProductName
fields.description: The name of the product for the order item represented by each billing schedule in the billing schedule group.

fields.name: ProrationPolicyId
fields.description: Refers to the proration policy that applies to this billing schedule group. The proration policy defines how time periods are calculated for subscription orders. For example, whether partial periods are allowed.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityId
fields.description: The asset used to create the billing schedules in the billing schedule group.

fields.name: ShippingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the shipping address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: ShippingCity
fields.description: Details for the shipping address for this billing schedule group. City maximum size is 40 characters

fields.name: ShippingCountry
fields.description: Details for the shipping address for this billing schedule group. Country maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: ShippingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the shipping address. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: ShippingLatitude
fields.description: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: ShippingLongitude
fields.description: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields.

fields.name: ShippingPostalCode
fields.description: Details for the shipping address for this billing schedule group. Postal code maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: ShippingState
fields.description: Details for the shipping address for this billing schedule group. State maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: ShippingStreet
fields.description: The street address of the shipping address for this billing schedule group. Maximum of 255 characters.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The earliest start date from all billing schedules in the billing schedule group.

fields.name: TotalBilledAmount
fields.description: The amount that has been invoiced for all billing schedules within the billing schedule group.

fields.name: TotalPendingAmount
fields.description: The amount that hasn't yet been invoiced for all billing schedules within the billing schedule group.

fields.name: BillingPolicyId
fields.description: The ID of the billing policy for the billing treatment.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Optional user-defined description of the billing treatment.

fields.name: ExcludeFromBilling
fields.description: Excludes any order items assigned to the treatment from creating billing schedules.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

fields.name: LegalEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the legal entity used to assign the treatment to order items when the parent billing policy's BillingTreatmentSelection is LegalEntity .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Optional user-defined name for the billing treatment.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Draft or inactive billing treatments can't be assigned to order items.

fields.name: BillingTreatmentId
fields.description: The parent billing treatment for the billing treatment item.

fields.name: BillingType
fields.description: Defines when Subscription Management invoices a product or service relative to when it’s provided to the customer. Advance billing invoices a product or service before it's provided, while arrears billing invoices a product or service after it has provided Subscription Management evaluates billing type when calculating an order product’s next billing date.

fields.name: Controller
fields.description: During the invoicing process, this field determines which value Subscription Management uses when the billing schedule group and billing schedule have a shared field with different values. For example, when Controller has a value of BillingScheduleGroup , if the billing schedule's billing day of month is 5 while the billing schedule group's billing day of month is 10, Subscription Management uses the value of 10.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the billing treatment item.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Optional user-defined description for the billing treatment item.

fields.name: FlatAmount
fields.description: The amount in terms of units of currency (such as $10 or $21.52) to invoice from the order item. Used only when Type has a value of FlatAmount .

fields.name: Handling0Amount
fields.description: Shows how Subscription Management invoices billing period items that have an amount of $0.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Default name of this record.

fields.name: Percentage
fields.description: The percentage (such as 10% or 12.5%) to invoice from the order item. Used only when Type has a value of Percentage .

fields.name: ProcessingOrder
fields.description: Defines the order in which Subscription Management creates billing schedules based on each billing treatment item. Lower numbers are evaluated first. For example, if your billing treatment has a billing treatment item that invoices at 25 Percentage and a ProcessingOrder of 1, and another item that invoices at 75 Percentage and a ProcessingOrder of 2, your first billing schedule will be for 25 percent of the order item's total amount, and your second billing schedule will be for 75% of the order item's total amount.

fields.name: Sequencing
fields.description: Allows users to define the number used to start invoice numbers on invoices generated from this billing treatment item.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Draft billing treatment items aren't evaluated for creating billing schedules.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines whether billing schedules created from this billing treatment item are based on a flat amount or a percentage of the order item's total amount.

fields.name: BlockedUri
fields.description: The full string of the target for the redirection.

fields.name: BlockedUriDomain
fields.description: If BLOCKED_URI is a URL, the domain for that URL. To allow future redirections to the BLOCKED_URI, BLOCKED_URI_DOMAIN is the value to add to RedirectWhitelistUrl .

fields.name: IsMalformedUrl
fields.description: Indicates whether this redirection was blocked because the target URL failed a syntax check or not.

fields.name: Origin
fields.description: The origin that caused the request to the BLOCKED_URI. For example, if a form on an Experience Cloud Visualforce site page redirects a user to an untrusted URL via the saveURL parameter, ORIGIN contains the base URL of that site.

fields.name: Referrer
fields.description: The absolute or partial address from which the request to the BLOCKED_URI came. The Referrer-Policy HTTP Header of the request determines how much of the URL is shared.

fields.name: RemoteAddress
fields.description: Remote IP address of the client making the request.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: ID
fields.description: ID of the bookmark. Label is Bookmark ID .

fields.name: FromId
fields.description: The originating opportunity. Label is Bookmarked From ID

fields.name: ToId
fields.description: The opportunity to which the originating opportunity is linked. Label is Bookmarked To ID .

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: AgentTemplate
fields.description: If this BotDefinition represents an agent, this field represents the name of the agent template used to create it.

fields.name: AgentType
fields.description: The agent type. For example, Agentforce Service Agent (ASA) or Agentforce Employee Agent (AEA).

fields.name: BotUserId
fields.description: The user ID associated with the bot definition.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description for the bot or agent.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name for this object.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The master label of the bot.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: This field represents the configuration type of the bot. The default value is Bot .

fields.name: BotDefinitionId
fields.description: Required. This field relates a bot version to its parent BotDefinition record.

fields.name: CopilotPrimaryLanguage
fields.description: The primary language that the bot or agent communicates in.

fields.name: CopilotSecondaryLanguages
fields.description: A comma-separated list of additional languages that the bot or agent supports.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name for this object.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Required. Indicates whether the bot version is active or inactive. Only one version for a related BotDefinition can be active at once.

fields.name: ToneType
fields.description: Defines the tone of the bot.

fields.name: VersionNumber
fields.description: The number for this version of the bot or agent.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the set of branding properties.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: Required. API name of the BrandingSet object.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language used in the branding set.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Required. The user-facing label of the set of branding properties.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix with a 15 character limit. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that aren’t Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix. NamespacePrefix is null if the publisher is Salesforce.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the letterhead. Limited to 1000 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Letterhead Unique Name . Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the letterhead is available for use ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Active .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Label of the template as it appears in the user interface. Limited to 255 characters. Label is Brand Template Name .

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The contents of the letterhead, in HTML, including any logos.

fields.name: AdditionalNotes
fields.description: Context related to the campaign that isn’t represented in the other fields.

fields.name: AgentGuardrails
fields.description: Guardrails that the agent must follow when creating a campaign. Use these guardrails to prevent damage to your brand and to ensure safety and compliance.

fields.name: BrandId
fields.description: The unique ID of your brand.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the brief.

fields.name: IsConversational
fields.description: Indicates whether the campaign contains conversational elements.

fields.name: KeyMessage
fields.description: The main theme or message that you want to deliver to your customers through the campaign that’s associated with the brief.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the brief was last referenced by a campaign.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the brief was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the brief.

fields.name: PlanName
fields.description: An agent-generated name for the campaign. When you save a campaign preview, the resulting campaign has this name.

fields.name: PrimaryCtas
fields.description: The main calls-to-action (CTAs) for the brief. The agent uses this information to understand the actions that it can use to meet the goals of the campaign.

fields.name: PrimaryGoal
fields.description: The goal of the campaign that’s associated with the brief. The agent uses this field to understand the main objective of the campaign.

fields.name: PrimaryKpi
fields.description: The main key performance indicator (KPI) for measuring progress toward the goal. The agent uses this field to prioritize actions that contribute to the goal of the campaign.

fields.name: Priority
fields.description: The priority of the brief. The agent uses this field to prioritize actions that contribute to the goal of the campaign.

fields.name: TargetAudience
fields.description: A description of the characteristics of the audience that you want to reach through the campaign that’s associated with this brief.

fields.name: BriefcaseId
fields.description: Required. ID of the briefcase definition. Label is Briefcase Definition ID .

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: Required. ID of the user or group requiring access to the briefcase. Label is User or Group ID .

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the briefcase definition. Limited to 1024 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Limited to 80 characters. Label is Name .

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the briefcase is available for use ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Active .

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language for the briefcase. This field defaults to the user's language unless the org is multi-language enabled. Specifies the language of the labels returned.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The master label for the briefcase. This internal label doesn’t get translated. Limited to 80 characters.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: BriefcaseId
fields.description: Required. ID of the briefcase definition. Label is Briefcase Definition ID .

fields.name: FilterLogic
fields.description: The filter logic for record selection, for example, 1 AND 2 where 1 and 2 correspond to filter 1 and filter 2. Filter logic operators include AND and OR . Limited to 255 characters. Label is Filter Logic .

fields.name: IsAscendingOrder
fields.description: Required. Indicates whether the records should be sorted in ascending order. Label is Ascending .

fields.name: OptionsIsRelatedFilesRule
fields.description: Indicates whether the briefcase rule is part of a hierarchical set of rules that configure the offline priming of file attachments. Available only for the Offline App (Salesforce Mobile App Plus).

fields.name: OrderBy
fields.description: The field to order the records by, which determines how the records can be sorted. For example, AccountName or CreatedBy . Label is Order By .

fields.name: ParentRuleId
fields.description: The ID of the parent rule of this briefcase rule. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: QueryScope
fields.description: Required. A group of records to restrict the scope of this rule.

fields.name: RecordLimit
fields.description: The record limit for the object. The recommended number for record limit is up to 500 records per object for optimal performance. The maximum number is 2000. Label is Limit .

fields.name: RelationshipField
fields.description: The Salesforce object field that relates the briefcase rule to another briefcase rule. For example, an Account rule can be related to a Contact rule using the Account ID object field. In this example, the value for the briefcase rule's RelationshipField is AccountID .

fields.name: RelationshipType
fields.description: The relationship of the briefcase rule to another briefcase rule. Possible values are:

fields.name: TargetEntity
fields.description: The standard object, custom object, or custom metadata type that the briefcase rule selects records from. The UI label is Target Object .

fields.name: BriefcaseRuleId
fields.description: Required. ID of the briefcase rule.

fields.name: FilterOperator
fields.description: Required. The comparison operator for this rule filter.

fields.name: FilterSeqNumber
fields.description: Required. The filter number. When you apply multiple filters, the filters are numbered sequentially, 1, 2, 3, and so on.

fields.name: FilterValue
fields.description: The value for the field and criteria. For example, true or false for a boolean field whose criteria or filter operator is Equals. Capitalization matters with date filter operators. Be sure to specify date literals in uppercase. Some valid date literals include TODAY, YESTERDAY and TOMORROW.

fields.name: TargetEntityField
fields.description: Required. The field to filter by. Compound fields and encrypted fields aren’t supported. Label is Field .

fields.name: AudienceId

fields.description: The reason the broadcast communication failed to send.

fields.name: LastViewedDate

fields.description: If BroacastType is Slack , this value is the timestamp when the broadcast Slack message was sent.

fields.description: If BroadcastType is ExperienceSiteBanner , this field contains the banner text displayed on the associated site.

fields.description: If BroadcastType is ExperienceSiteBanner , this field contains information about who can view the banner.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the broadcast communication.

fields.name: Body
fields.description: If BroadcastType is Alert , this field contains the alert message. If BroadcastType is Email , this field contains the email body text. If BroadcastType is ExperienceSiteBanner , this field is empty. If BroadcastType is Slack , this field contains the Slack message.

fields.name: BroadcastCommunicationNumber
fields.description: Auto-generated number for every BroadcastCommunication record.

fields.name: BroadcastType
fields.description: Medium used to distribute the message.

fields.name: CustomNotificationTypeId
fields.description: ID of the custom notification template used to frame the Slack message. Only applies if BroadcastType is Slack .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate is not null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the owner of this object.

fields.name: RelatedRecordId
fields.description: ID of the incident associated with the broadcast communication.

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: If BroadcastType is Alert , this field is the alert message in the format “Incident Alert | <Incident subject> | <Incident Number>.” If BroadcastType is Email , this field is the subject of the email sent. If BroadcastType is ExperienceSiteBanner , this field is empty. If BroadcastType is Slack , this field is in the format “Incident Alert | <Incident Subject>."

fields.name: BroadcastReason
fields.description: Reason for the broadcast topic. This field differentiates between Service Cloud and Sales Cloud use cases.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the broadcast topic.

fields.name: IsFeatured
fields.description: Indicates whether the broadcast topic is featured ( true ) or not ( false ). This field is applicable only when BroadcastReason is FeedChannels. A featured topic displays the associated collaboration rooms to new users.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: Timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The developer name of the violation.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language for the blocked request.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Master label for this violation.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: Namespace prefix for this violation.

fields.name: UntrustedUrl
fields.description: The URL associated with the blocked request, without the path. For example, if a blocked requested resource is an image with the URL https://www.example.com/images/image1.png , the UntrustedUrl is https://www.example.com .

fields.name: ViolationContext
fields.description: If the ViolationType is img-src (image) , font-src (fonts) , or frame-src (iframe content) , the content security policy (CSP) context for the request. The CSP context controls which pages can load content from a CspTrustedSite.

fields.name: ViolationImpact
fields.description: The impact of this violation. Possible values are: Blocked –The policy was enforced and prevented the resource from loading. The impact of blocked redirections and malformed URLs is always Blocked . Reported –This violation is blocked only after stricter CSP settings are configured. For example, some resource requests associated with the frame-src , font-src , and img-src ViolationType are blocked only when the Adopt updated CSP directives setting is enabled in Session Settings.

fields.name: ViolationType
fields.description: The violation type. Possible values are: img-src –At least one request to load an image file from the URL was blocked because the UntrustedUrl isn’t a CspTrustedSite object with this CSP directive. font-src –At least one request to load a font from the URL was blocked because the UntrustedUrl isn’t a CspTrustedSite object with this CSP directive. frame-src –At least one request to load content in an iframe that originated from the URL was blocked because the UntrustedUrl isn’t a CspTrustedSite object with this CSP directive. MalformedUrl –At least one redirection to this URL failed because the UntrustedUrl is malformed. Redirect –At least one redirection to this URL was blocked because the UntrustedUrl isn’t a RedirectWhitelistUrl object.

fields.name: ClientIp
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”. For example: 96.43.144.26 .

fields.name: CpuTime
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: FailedRecordCount
fields.description: The total number of records that failed. For example: 150 .

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: The error message returned on failure.

fields.name: JobIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the Bulk API 2.0 job.

fields.name: JobStatus
fields.description: The job’s current status.

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example: GeJCsym5eyvtEK2I .

fields.name: ObjectType
fields.description: The type of event. The value is always BulkApi2 .

fields.name: OperationType
fields.description: The type of Bulk API 2.0 operation that was performed.

fields.name: ProcessedRecordCount
fields.description: Number of records processed for this event. For example: 980 .The number of records processed is reported differently for ingest and query jobs. For ingest jobs: Events with a status of InProgress report (if applicable) the number of records processed. For query jobs: Events with a status of JobComplete or InProgress report (if applicable) the number of records processed.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier

fields.description: Number of megabytes returned in query. Empty for ingest jobs. For example: 670 . ResultSizeMb currently does not emit events, but is shown here as a placeholder for future enhancement.

fields.name: RunTime
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestId . For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV .

fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started. For example: d7DEq/ANa7nNZZVD .

fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: DisplayField

When false , records are hidden from the user’s calendar view. The default is true . IsDisplayed can be true for up to 50 calendars.

fields.description: The name of the call script.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who owns the call script.

fields.name: TemplateType
fields.description: The type of call template.

fields.name: TotalCalls
fields.description: The total number of calls that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: TotalCallsCallBackLater
fields.description: The total Call Back Later call results that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: TotalCallsLeftVoicemail
fields.description: The total Left Voicemail call results that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: TotalCallsMeaningfulConnect
fields.description: The total Meaningful Connect call results that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: TotalCallsNotInterested
fields.description: The total Not Interested call results that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: TotalCallsUncategorized
fields.description: The total uncategorized call results that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: TotalCallsUnqualified
fields.description: The total Unqualified call results that use the CallTemplate.

fields.name: ActualCost
fields.description: The amount of money spent to run the campaign. Label is Actual Cost in Campaign.

fields.name: AmountAllOpportunities
fields.description: Amount of money in all opportunities associated with the campaign, including closed/won opportunities. Label is Value Opportunities in Campaign.

fields.name: AmountWonOpportunities
fields.description: Amount of money in closed or won opportunities associated with the campaign. Label is Value Won Opportunities in Campaign.

fields.name: BriefId
fields.description: The ID of the brief that's associated with the campaign. A brief contains additional context about the goals and audience for the campaign. The label is Brief.

fields.name: BudgetedCost
fields.description: Amount of money budgeted for the campaign. Label is Budgeted Cost in Campaign.

fields.name: CampaignImageId
fields.description: ID of the campaign image. Available in API version 42.0 and later. Only available to orgs with Partner Community licenses and Digital Experience enabled or orgs that have installed the Direct Marketing Managed package.

fields.name: CampaignMemberRecordTypeId
fields.description: The record type ID for CampaignMember records associated with the campaign.

fields.name: CampaignStage
fields.description: This field is available with Marketing Cloud Growth and Advanced editions. The lifecycle stage of the campaign based on the status of all of its related flows. Possible values are:

fields.name: CreatedByID
fields.description: ID of the user who created the campaign.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the campaign. Limit: 32 KB. Only the first 255 characters display in reports.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: Ending date for the campaign. Responses received after this date are still counted.

fields.name: ExpectedResponse
fields.description: Percentage of responses you expect to receive for the campaign.

fields.name: ExpectedRevenue
fields.description: Amount of money you expect to generate from the campaign.

fields.name: HierarchyActualCost
fields.description: Calculated field for the total amount of money spent to run the campaigns in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Actual Cost in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyAmountAllOpportunities
fields.description: Amount of money in all opportunities associated with the campaign in a campaign hierarchy, including closed/won opportunities. Label is Value Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyAmountWonOpportunities
fields.description: The amount of money in closed or won opportunities associated with the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Value Won Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyBudgetedCost
fields.description: Calculated field for the total amount of money budgeted for the campaigns in a campaign hierarchy. Label isTotal Budgeted Cost in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyExpectedRevenue
fields.description: Calculated field for the total amount of money you expect to generate from the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Expected Revenue in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyNumberOfContacts
fields.description: Calculated field for the number of contacts associated with the campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Contacts in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyNumberOfConvertedLeads
fields.description: Calculated field for the number of converted leads from the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Converted Leads in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyNumberOfLeads
fields.description: Calculated field for the number of leads from the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Leads in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyNumberOfOpportunities
fields.description: Calculated field for the number of opportunities related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyNumberOfResponses
fields.description: Number of contacts and unconverted leads with a Member Status equivalent to “Responded” for the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Responses in Hierarchy .

fields.name: HierarchyNumberOfWonOpportunities
fields.description: The number of closed or won opportunities associated with the campaign. Label is Won Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyNumberSent
fields.description: Calculated field for the total number of individuals targeted by the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. For example, the number of email messages sent. The label is Num Sent in Hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyTotalEmailsDelivered
fields.description: Calculated field for emails delivered related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Emails Delivered in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyTotalFormSubmissions
fields.description: Calculated field for form submissions related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Form Submissions in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyTotalFormViews
fields.description: Calculated field for form views related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Form Views in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyTotalLandingPageFormSubmissions
fields.description: Calculated field for form submissions from a landing page related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Landing Page Form Submissions in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyTotalLandingPageViews
fields.description: Calculated field for landing page views related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Landing Page Views in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyUniqueEmailOpens
fields.description: Calculated field for email opens related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Excludes repeat opens. Label is Unique Email Opens in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyUniqueEmailTrackedLinkClicks
fields.description: Calculated field for unique email link clicks related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Excludes repeat clicks. Label is Unique Email Clicks in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: HierarchyUniqueMarketingLinkClicks
fields.description: Calculated field for unique marketing link clicks related to the campaign in a campaign hierarchy. Excludes repeat clicks. Label is Unique Marketing Link Clicks in Hierarchy. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this campaign is active ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false . The label is Active .

fields.name: LastActivityDate
fields.description: Value is one of the following, whichever is the most recent: The due date of the most recent event logged against the record. The due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

fields.name: LastModifiedById
fields.description: ID of the user who last updated the campaign.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Name of the campaign. Limit: is 80 characters.

fields.name: NumberOfContacts
fields.description: Number of contacts associated with the campaign. Label is Total Contacts.

fields.name: NumberOfConvertedLeads
fields.description: Number of leads that were converted to an account and contact due to the marketing efforts in the campaign. Label is Converted Leads.

fields.name: NumberOfLeads
fields.description: The number of leads associated with the campaign. Label is Leads in Campaign.

fields.name: NumberOfOpportunities
fields.description: The number of opportunities associated with the campaign. Label is Opportunities in Campaign.

fields.name: NumberOfResponses
fields.description: The number of contacts and unconverted leads with a Member Status equivalent to “Responded” for the campaign. Label is Responses in Campaign.

fields.name: NumberOfWonOpportunities
fields.description: The number of closed or won opportunities associated with the campaign. Label is Won Opportunities in Campaign.

fields.name: NumberSent
fields.description: The number of individuals targeted by the campaign. For example, the number of emails sent. Label is Num Sent.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the user who owns this campaign. Default value is the user logging in to the API to perform the create.

fields.name: ParentCampaign
fields.description: The campaign above the selected campaign in the campaign hierarchy.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the parent Campaign record, if any.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: Starting date for the campaign.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the campaign, for example, Planned, In Progress. Limit: 40 characters.

fields.name: TenantId
fields.description: ID of the associated Marketing Cloud Account Engagement business unit. Read-only. Available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: TotalAmountAllOpportunities
fields.description: Calculated field for total amount of all opportunities associated with the campaign hierarchy, including closed/won opportunities. Label is Total Value Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: TotalAmountAllWonOpportunities
fields.description: Calculated field for amount of all closed/won opportunities associated with the campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Value Won Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: TotalEmailsDelivered
fields.description: Calculated field for emails delivered related to the campaign. Label is Total Emails Delivered in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: TotalFormSubmissions
fields.description: Calculated field for form submissions related to the campaign. Label is Total Form Submissions in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: TotalFormViews
fields.description: Calculated field for form views related to the campaign. Label is Total Form Views in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: TotalLandingPageFormSubmissions
fields.description: Calculated field for form submissions from a landing page related to the campaign. Label is Total Landing Page Form Submissions in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: TotalLandingPageViews
fields.description: Calculated field for landing page views related to the campaign. Label is Total Landing Page Views in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: TotalNumberofLeads
fields.description: Calculated field for total number of leads associated with the campaign hierarchy. This number also includes converted leads. Label is Total Leads in Hierarchy.

fields.name: TotalNumberofOpportunities
fields.description: Calculated field for the total number of opportunities associated with the campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: TotalNumberofResponses
fields.description: Calculated field for number of contacts and unconverted leads that have a Member Status equivalent to “Responded” for the campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Responses in Hierarchy.

fields.name: TotalNumberofWonOpportunities
fields.description: Calculated field for the total number of won opportunities associated with the campaign hierarchy. Label is Total Won Opportunities in Hierarchy.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of campaign, for example, Direct Mail or Referral Program. Limit: 40 characters.

fields.name: UniqueEmailOpens
fields.description: Calculated field for email opens related to the campaign. Excludes repeat opens. Label is Unique Email Opens in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: UniqueEmailTrackedLinkClicks
fields.description: Calculated field for unique email link clicks related to the campaign. Excludes repeat clicks. Label is Unique Email Clicks in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: UniqueMarketingLinkClicks
fields.description: Calculated field for unique marketing link clicks related to the campaign. Excludes repeat clicks. Label is Unique Marketing Link Clicks in Campaign. This field is available with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement.

fields.name: CampaignId
fields.description: The ID of the campaign that’s related to the opportunity.

fields.name: CampaignMemberId
fields.description: The ID of the campaign member related to the opportunity. Not available in the UI.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: The ID of the contact on the associated opportunity.

fields.name: Influence
fields.description: The percentage of the Amount field for the related opportunity that’s attributed to the campaign.

fields.name: ModelId
fields.description: The ID of the campaign influence model that’s related to the record.

fields.name: OpportunityContactRoleId
fields.description: The opportunity contact role ID of the related opportunity. Not available in the UI.

fields.name: OpportunityId
fields.description: The ID of the related opportunity.

fields.name: RevenueShare
fields.description: The amount of revenue from the related opportunity attributed to the campaign.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The API name of the influence model. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the model is active. Active models can generate campaign influence records. Deactivating a model deletes its campaign influence records. Custom models are always active and this field is ignored.

fields.name: IsDefaultModel
fields.description: Indicates whether the model is the default model ( true ) or not ( false ). CampaignInfluence records associated with the default model appear in 3 locations. The Campaign Influence related list on opportunities The Influenced Opportunities related list on campaigns The Campaign Statistics section on campaigns The value of IsDefaultModel can only be true for 1 model at a time.

fields.name: IsModelLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the model is locked ( true ) or not ( false ). Records for locked models can only be added, updated, or deleted via the API.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the influence model.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The label for the influence model.

fields.name: ModelDescription
fields.description: The description of the influence model.

fields.name: ModelType
fields.description: Indicates whether the model is the Primary Campaign Source influence model, or a custom model. These values are the allowed. 1: Primary Campaign Source Model 2: Custom Model 3: First Touch Model 4: Last Touch Model 5: Even Distribution Model 6: Data-Driven Model

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: RecordPreference
fields.description: The value of this field determines when to create campaign influence records. AllRecords: Creates records regardless of the revenue attribution percentage. RecordsWithAttribution: Creates records only when the revenue attribution is greater than 0%.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: ID of the account related to the campaign. This field is available only if the Accounts as Campaign Members setting is enabled in the org.

fields.name: CampaignId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the campaign related to the lead or contact.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The city for the address of the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the city for the account.

fields.name: CompanyOrAccount
fields.description: The company or account of the lead or contact.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: Required. The ID of a contact that's related to the campaign.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only for organizations with the multicurrency feature enabled. This field contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The country for the address of the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the country for the account.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of the associated lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the description of the account.

fields.name: DoNotCall
fields.description: Indicates that the lead or contact doesn’t want to be called. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can indicate the account doesn’t want to be called.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: Email address for the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the email address for the account.

fields.name: Fax
fields.description: Fax number for the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the fax number for the account.

fields.name: FirstName
fields.description: The first name of the lead or contact.

fields.name: FirstRespondedDate
fields.description: This field indicates the date that the campaign member received a status of Responded.

fields.name: HasOptedOutOfEmail
fields.description: This field indicates the email opt-out preference for the lead or contact. A value of false indicates that the lead or contact is opted in to emails. A value of true indicates that they’re opted out. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the opt-out preference for the account email address.

fields.name: HasOptedOutOfFax
fields.description: This field indicates the fax opt-out preferences for the lead or contact. A value of false indicates that the lead or contact is opted in to receiving faxes. A value of true indicates that they’re opted out. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can indicate the account has opted out of faxes.

fields.name: HasResponded
fields.description: This field indicates whether the campaign member has responded to the campaign ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Responded .

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: The last name of the lead or contact. The limit is 80 characters.

fields.name: LeadId
fields.description: Required. The ID of a lead that's related to the campaign.

fields.name: LeadOrContactId
fields.description: The ID of a lead or contact that's related to the campaign. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field also accepts an account ID.

fields.name: LeadOrContactOwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the associated lead or contact owner. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the owner of the account.

fields.name: LeadSource
fields.description: The source where the lead was obtained.

fields.name: MobilePhone
fields.description: The mobile phone number of the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the mobile phone number for the account.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The first and last name of the lead or contact that's related to the campaign member.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: The phone number of the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the phone number for the account.

fields.name: PostalCode
fields.description: The postal code for the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the postal code for the account.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the record type assigned to this object. To change the record type, modify the CampaignMemberRecordTypeId field on the associated Campaign.

fields.name: Salutation
fields.description: Salutation for the lead or contact.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The state for the address of the lead or contact. The limit is 80 characters. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the state of the account address.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Controls the HasResponded flag on this object. You can't directly set the HasResponded flag, as it’s read-only. You can set it indirectly by setting this field in a create or update call. Each predefined value implies a HasResponded flag value. Each time you update this field, you implicitly update the HasResponded flag. In the Salesforce user interface, Marketing users can define valid status values for the Status picklist. They can choose one status as the default status. For each Status field value, they can also select which values to count as “Responded,” meaning that the HasResponded flag is set to true for those values. The limit is 40 characters. When you create or update campaign members, use the text value for Status instead of the ID from the CampaignMemberStatus object.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The street for the address of the lead or contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can be the street of the account address.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title for the lead or contact.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Indicates if the campaign member is a lead or a contact. In orgs with the Accounts as Campaign Members setting enabled, this field can indicate an account.

fields.name: CampaignId
fields.description: ID of the campaign associated with this member status.

fields.name: HasResponded
fields.description: Indicates whether this status is equivalent to “Responded” ( true ) or not ( false ). Beginning with API version 39.0, at least one CampaignMemberStatus on each campaign must have a hasResponded value of true .

fields.name: IsDefault
fields.description: Indicates whether this status is the default status ( true ) or not ( false ). Beginning with API version 39.0, there must be a default CampaignMemberStatus defined for every campaign.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: Label
fields.description: Label for the status in the picklist. Limited to 765 characters.

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: Unique number order where this campaign member status appears in the picklist.

fields.name: CampaignAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of access granted to the target Group, or UserRole. The possible values are: Read Edit All

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the sharing rule. Maximum size is 1000 characters. This field is available in API version 29.0 and later.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Corresponds to Rule Name in the user interface. This field is available in API version 24.0 and later. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: GroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the source group. A Campaign owned by a User in the source Group triggers the rule to give access.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Label of the sharing rule as it appears in the user interface. Limited to 80 characters. Corresponds to Label on the user interface.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the User or Group being granted access.

fields.name: CampaignId
fields.description: ID of the Campaign associated with this sharing entry. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: CampaignAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to the Campaign. The possible values are: Read Edit All (This value is not valid for creating or updating records.) This field must be set to an access level that is higher than the organization’s default access level for Campaign.

fields.name: RowCause
fields.description: Reason that this sharing entry exists. If you’re creating a sharing entry, the only permitted value is Manual . If no value is specified, the field defaults to Manual . All other RowCause values are read-only. After the sharing entry is created, this field can’t be edited.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: ID of the User or Group that has been given access to the Campaign. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: ItemId
fields.description: ID of the tagged item.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the tag. If this value does not already exist, a new TagDefinition is created and becomes the parent of this Tag object. Otherwise, a TagDefinition with the same name becomes the parent of this Tag object. Parent relationships are created automatically.

fields.name: TagDefinitionId
fields.description: ID of the parent TagDefinition object that owns the tag.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines the visibility of a tag.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: Customer account for the payment method.

fields.name: AuditEmail
fields.description: Email address of the card owner where audit information about payments gets sent.

fields.name: AutoCardType
fields.description: Card network type, derived from the card number.

fields.name: CardBin
fields.description: First six digits of the card number.

fields.name: CardCategory
fields.description: Defines whether the card is a credit card or debit card.

fields.name: CardHolderFirstName
fields.description: First name of the cardholder.

fields.name: CardHolderLastName
fields.description: Last name of the cardholder.

fields.name: CardHolderName
fields.description: Full name of the cardholder.

fields.name: CardLastFour
fields.description: Last four digits of the credit card or debit card.

fields.name: CardPaymentMethodNumber
fields.description: System-defined unique ID for the card payment method.

fields.name: CardType
fields.description: Identifies the credit card type.

fields.name: CardTypeCategory
fields.description: Further identifies the credit card. Used for internal reference.

fields.name: Comments
fields.description: Payment admin can add comments to provide additional details about a record. Maximum of 1000 characters.

fields.name: CompanyName
fields.description: Company of the cardholder.

fields.name: DisplayCardNumber
fields.description: Masked digits for the full credit card number except the last four digits.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: Email address of the payer.

fields.name: ExpiryMonth
fields.description: The card’s expiration month.

fields.name: ExpiryYear
fields.description: The card’s expiration year.

fields.name: GatewayDate
fields.description: The date that the payment gateway logs a card activity.

fields.name: GatewayResultCode
fields.description: The result of the card payment method’s interaction with the payment gateway during a transaction request.

fields.name: GatewayResultCodeDescription
fields.description: Additional information about the gateway result code. Descriptions vary between payment gateway providers.

fields.name: GatewayToken
fields.description: Unencrypted unique token ID generated by the payment gateway to represent the card payment method during transactions. GatewayToken is for use with APIs earlier than version 52.0. For version 53.0 and latter, use the GatewayTokenEncrypted field. To secure the token, use the GatewayTokenEncrypted field.

fields.name: GatewayTokenDetails
fields.description: Additional information about the gateway token.

fields.name: GatewayTokenEncrypted
fields.description: Encrypted unique token ID generated by the payment gateway to represent the card payment method during transactions. Encrypted using Salesforce Classic Encryption.

fields.name: InputCardNumber
fields.description: Used by a payer to enter a credit card number when storing an external-type card payment method. After entry, the credit card number isn’t saved, so the InputCardNumber value always appears blank. The credit card number appears as a masked value in DisplayCardNumber , which shows only the last four digits.

fields.name: IpAddress
fields.description: IP address of the card payment method holder.

fields.name: IsAutoPayEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the payment method can be used for recurring payments ( True ) or not ( False ). The default value is False .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record or list view related to this record, but didn’t access it directly.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it's possible the user referenced this record but didn’t view it directly.

fields.name: MacAddress
fields.description: MAC address of the card payment method holder.

fields.name: NickName
fields.description: Payer-defined nickname for the card payment method.

fields.name: PaymentGatewayId
fields.description: The payment gateway used to create a gateway token. For transactions with a saved payment method in Salesforce, this field stores the payment gateway ID used in the transaction.

fields.name: PaymentMethodAddress
fields.description: Full address associated with the card payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodCity
fields.description: City of the address for the payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodCountry
fields.description: Country of the address for the payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodDetails
fields.description: Optional information about the payment method type. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: PaymentMethodGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the payment method address. An accuracy level contains information about the location of a latitude and longitude. For more information about geolocation fields, see Geolocation Compound Field .

fields.name: PaymentMethodLatitude
fields.description: Latitude of the payment method address. Used with the PaymentMethodLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: PaymentMethodLongitude
fields.description: Latitude of the payment method address. Used with the PaymentMethodLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: PaymentMethodPostalCode
fields.description: Postal Code of the address for the payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodState
fields.description: State of the address for the payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodStreet
fields.description: Street of the address for the payment method.

fields.name: PaymentMethodSubType
fields.description: A payment method that exists as a subtype of a payment method type. For example, Visa, Mastercard, and American Express exist as subtypes of payment method types such as Apple Pay and Google Pay. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: PaymentMethodType
fields.description: Payment method used for the transaction. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: Phone number of the payer.

fields.name: ProcessingMode
fields.description: Defines whether the card payment method is used for transactions made by Salesforce Payments or by an external third-party payment provider.

fields.name: SavedPaymentMethodId
fields.description: The ID of the saved payment method record. This field is available in API version 60.0 and later.

fields.name: SfResultCode
fields.description: The results of the card payment method’s interaction with the payment gateway.

fields.name: StartMonth
fields.description: The month is activated.

fields.name: StartYear
fields.description: The year the card is activated.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the payment method.

fields.name: BackgroundOperationId
fields.description: The ID of the in progress background operation.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: The currency used for the checkout session. Default value is USD .

fields.name: IsArchived
fields.description: Indicates whether checkout processing is archived ( true ) or not ( false ). After a session is archived, it can’t be unarchived. Default value is false .

fields.name: IsError
fields.description: Indicates whether the session is in error state ( true ) or not ( false ). Default value is false .

fields.name: IsProcessing
fields.description: Determines whether checkout processing is in progress ( true ) or not ( false ). Default value is false .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the checkout session.

fields.name: NextState
fields.description: The next state of the checkout session.

fields.name: OrderId
fields.description: The ID of a created order after the checkout session has gone from cart to order.

fields.name: OrderReferenceNumber
fields.description: Unique reference number the shopper can use to refer to the order. In API version 63.0 and later, LWR stores don't populate this field upon checkout. Instead, the InitialOrderReferenceNumber field on the WebCart object is populated.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The current state of the checkout session.

fields.name: WebCartId
fields.description: The ID of the cart that is used to create the checkout session.

fields.name: CartId
fields.description: The ID the WebCart that’s associated with this delivery group.

fields.name: CompanyName
fields.description: Company name associated with a delivery. This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: The ISO code for the currency that’s specified on the buyer’s account. Default value is USD . Possible values are:

fields.name: DeliverToAddress
fields.description: The address to which a buyer order is delivered.

fields.name: DeliverToCity
fields.description: The city to which a buyer order is delivered.

fields.name: DeliverToCountry
fields.description: The country to which a buyer order is delivered.

fields.name: DeliverToFirstName
fields.description: The first name of the person set to receive an order. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: DeliverToGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: The geocode location to which a buyer order is delivered. Possible values are: Address Block City County ExtendedZip NearAddress Neighborhood State Street Unknown Zip

fields.name: DeliverToLastName
fields.description: The last name of the person to whom a buyer order is delivered. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

fields.name: DeliverToLatitude
fields.description: The latitude of a buyer delivery location.

fields.name: DeliverToLongitude
fields.description: The longitude of a buyer delivery location.

fields.name: DeliverToName
fields.description: The name of the person to deliver a buyer order to. This field is set based on the Name field of the ContactPointAddress associated with this delivery group. ContactPointAddress.Name is generated by the system using the first and last names entered by a buyer during checkout.

fields.name: DeliverToPostalCode
fields.description: The postal code to which to deliver a buyer order.

fields.name: DeliverToState
fields.description: The state to which to deliver a buyer order.

fields.name: DeliverToStreet
fields.description: The street to which to deliver a buyer order.

fields.name: DeliveryMethodId
fields.description: The ID for the delivery method to use to deliver a buyer order. Populated if the selected CartDeliveryGroupMethod only has the ShippingFee populated, but it has reference to an existing DeliveryMethodId which contains the fields Carrier , ClassOfService , and ReferenceNumber . If not, the SelectedDeliveryMethod field is used.

fields.name: DesiredDeliveryDate
fields.description: The date that a buyer requests to have an order delivered.

fields.name: GiftMessage
fields.description: Personalized gift message for the order. This field is available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: GiftToName
fields.description: The name of the recipient for a gift order. This field is available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: GrandTotalAmount
fields.description: Sum of all cart items’ TotalAmount , or CartDeliveryGroup TotalAmount plus CartDeliveryGroup TotalTaxAmount .

fields.name: IsDefault
fields.description: Indicates if the delivery group is the default. This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: IsGift
fields.description: Indicates if the delivery group is a gift. This field is available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of this CartDeliveryGroup record. Name can be up to 255 characters. In API version 62.0 and later, if IsDefault is true , the Name is Shipment1 , a localized string. In prior API versions, the Name for a default delivery group was Cart Delivery Group . Due to this change, any queries intended to identify default delivery groups should use the IsDefault rather than Name field.

fields.name: SelectedDeliveryMethodId
fields.description: ID of the selected cart delivery group method. Populated if the selected CartDeliveryGroupMethod has the fields Carrier , ClassOfService , ReferenceNumber , and ShippingFee , but the DeliveryMethodId is null. If not, the DeliveryMethodId field is used. This field is available in API version 59.0 or later.

fields.name: ShipToPhoneNumber
fields.description: Phone number associated with a delivery. This field is available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: ShippingInstructions
