fields.name: EffectiveStartDate
fields.description: The effective start date of the Commission Schedule.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the Commission Schedule is active.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the Commission Schedule.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the record owner.

fields.name: TierDefinition
fields.description: Internal-only. Applies when the CalculationType is CalculationMatrix.

fields.name: CommissionableEventType
fields.description: The event that results in the commission calculation.

fields.name: CommissionScheduleId
fields.description: The ID of the associated Commission Schedule, which is the commission calculation tied to the product or producer.

fields.name: EffectiveEndDate
fields.description: The last date when the Commission Schedule is in effect for the product or producer.

fields.name: EffectiveStartDate
fields.description: The first date when the Commission Schedule is in effect for the product or producer.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: MaxCommissionAmount
fields.description: The maximum commission calculated for the product or producer for a commissionable event. Constrains the output from the Commission Schedule.

fields.name: MaxCommissionRate

fields.name: MinCommissionAmount
fields.description: The minimum commission calculated for the product or producer for a commissionable event. Constrains the output from the Commission Schedule.

fields.name: MinCommissionRate

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the Commission Schedule Assignment.

fields.name: ProducerId

fields.name: Product2Id

fields.name: LastViewedDate

fields.name: LastReferencedDate

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: EffectiveToDate

fields.name: EngagementChannelTypeId

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: OwnerId

fields.name: PartyId

fields.name: PrivacyConsentStatus

fields.name: CommSubscriptionConsentId

fields.name: LastViewedDate

fields.name: Offset
fields.description: The amount of time before or after an event or the specific day of the week to communicate with the contact point. Set the unit of time in the Unit field.

fields.name: PreferredTimeEnd

fields.name: PreferredTimeStart
fields.description: Start of the preferred time span in which to reach the customer.

fields.name: PreferredTimeZone

fields.name: CanCreateCase

fields.name: DataCategoryName
fields.description: The data category associated with the zone.

fields.name: Description

fields.name: HasChatterService
fields.description: Indicates whether Chatter Answers is available in the zone.

fields.description: Indicates whether the zone is active or inactive. An idea or question can only be posted to an active zone.

fields.name: IsPublished
fields.description: Indicates whether the zone is available in portals.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the zone.

fields.name: NetworkId
fields.description: ID of the Experience Cloud site that this zone is associated with. This field is available only if digital experiences is enabled in your org. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: RequestCount
fields.description: Count of requests with an established Apex context executing for longer than 5 seconds in your org.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier . For example: 3nWgxWbDKWWDIk0FKfF5DV .

fields.name: RequestLimit
fields.description: Maximum count of requests with an established Apex context that can execute for longer than 5 seconds. When RequestCount reaches this limit, then additional long-running Apex requests are terminated. (Asynchronous requests don’t count towards the limit.) See Apex Developer Guide : Lightning Platform Apex Limits . For example: 10 .

fields.name: RequestUri
fields.description: The URI of the long-running Apex request that Salesforce terminated. For example: /apex/ApexClassName .

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z . Milliseconds are the most granular setting.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: MobileSessionTimeout
fields.description: Length of time after which the system logs out inactive mobile users.

fields.name: MobileStartUrl
fields.description: Users are directed to this URL after they’ve authenticated when the app is accessed from a mobile device.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The unique name for this object.

fields.name: NamedUserUvidTimeout
fields.description: The timeout value for a JSON Web Token (JWT)-based access token that's issued to a named user. This field defines the timeout only if the app is configured to have an app-specific timeout. If the app uses the user's session timeout, the timeout value is defined based on the user's profile or the org session settings. For more information about defining JWT-based access token timeout, see Configure a Connected App to Issue JWT-Based Access Tokens .

fields.name: OptionsAllowAdminApprovedUsersOnly
fields.description: Indicates whether access is limited to users granted approval to use the connected app by an administrator. Manage profiles for the app by editing each profile’s Access list.

fields.name: OptionsHasSessionLevelPolicy
fields.description: Specifies whether the connected app requires a High Assurance level session.

fields.name: OptionsRefreshTokenValidityMetric
fields.description: Specifies whether the refresh token validity is based on duration or inactivity. If true , the token validity is measured based on the last use of the token; otherwise, it’s based on the token duration.

fields.name: OptionsTokenExchangeManageBitEnabled
fields.description: If true , the OAuth 2.0 token exchange flow is enabled.

fields.name: PinLength
fields.description: For mobile apps, this field is the PIN length requirement for users of the connected app. Valid values are 4 , 5 , 6 , 7 , or 8 .

fields.name: RefreshTokenValidityPeriod
fields.description: The duration of an authorization token until it expires in hours, months, or days as set in the connected app management page.

fields.name: StartUrl
fields.description: If the app isn’t accessed from a mobile device, users are directed to this URL after they’ve authenticated.

fields.name: UvidTimeout
fields.description: The timeout value for a JWT-based access token that's issued to an unknown user as a result of the guest user variation of the Authorization Code and Credentials Flow. JWT-based access tokens issued during this flow variation always contain a UVID. This field defines the timeout only if the app is configured to have an app-specific timeout. If the app uses the user's session timeout, the timeout value is defined based on the user's profile or the org session settings. For more information about defining JWT-based access token timeout, see Configure a Connected App to Issue JWT-Based Access Tokens .

fields.name: AccessCode
fields.description: Specifies the access code to enter in order to validate identity and join the call.

fields.name: ExternalEventId

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Returns true if the conference number is locked, or false if it’s not.

fields.name: Label
fields.description: The description of the conference number.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the conference call’s organizer.

fields.name: Number
fields.description: The phone number used to connect to the conference call.

fields.name: Vendor
fields.description: The vendor or company associated with the conference number.

fields.name: ConsumptionScheduleId

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the consumption rate.

fields.description: The lowest quantity of usage for the consumption rate.

fields.name: Price
fields.description: The price for usage that falls within the consumption rate’s bounds.

fields.name: PricingMethod
fields.description: How Salesforce applies the consumption rate’s price to the total quantity of usage within a usage summary.

fields.name: ProcessingOrder
fields.description: The order for processing the usage rate across multiple rates. Consumption rates are evaluated beginning with the lowest processing order.

fields.name: UpperBound
fields.description: The highest quantity of usage for the consumption rate.

fields.name: BillingTerm
fields.description: The number used with the billing term unit to determine billing frequency.

fields.name: BillingTermUnit
fields.description: The unit used with the billing term to determine billing frequency

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the consumption schedule.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this record is active ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Active .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: MatchingAttribute
fields.description: Salesforce Billing matches usage with a consumption schedule if the records share Matching Attribute value.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Default name of this record. Label is Product Name .

fields.name: NumberOfRates
fields.description: The number of consumption rates in this consumption schedule.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user who owns a consumption schedule record.

fields.name: RatingMethod
fields.description: A specific use case to rate usage against the schedule. This field is the controlling picklist for the Type field.

fields.name: SBQQ__Category__c
fields.description: This field is available only with Salesforce CPQ.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines how rate tiers are calculated.

fields.name: UnitOfMeasure
fields.description: A unit of measure defines how you quantify instances of usage for your usage products. For example, if your usage product is a cloud storage subscription, you could provide a value of GB for your unit of measure.

fields.name: blng__BillingRule__c
fields.description: This field is available only with Salesforce Billing.

fields.name: blng__RevenueRecognitionRule__c
fields.description: This field is available only with Salesforce Billing.

fields.name: blng__TaxRule__c
fields.description: This field is available only with Salesforce Billing.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: ID of the account that’s the parent of this contact. We recommend that you update up to 50 contacts simultaneously when changing the accounts on contacts enabled for a Customer Portal or partner portal. We also recommend that you make this update after business hours.

fields.name: ActionCadenceAssigneeId
fields.description: The ID of the sales rep designated to work the lead through their assigned cadence. This field is available in API version 48.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: ActionCadenceId
fields.description: The ID of the lead’s assigned cadence. This field is available in API version 48.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: ActionCadenceState
fields.description: The state of the current action cadence tracker. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: ActiveTrackerCount
fields.description: The number of cadences that are actively running on this contact. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: ActivityMetricId
fields.description: When Einstein Activity Capture with Activity Metrics is enabled, the ID of the related activity metric.

fields.name: ActivityMetricRollupId
fields.description: When Einstein Activity Capture with Activity Metrics is enabled, the ID of the related activity metric rollup.

fields.name: AssistantName
fields.description: The assistant’s name.

fields.name: AssistantPhone
fields.description: The assistant’s phone number. Label is Asst. Phone .

fields.name: Birthdate
fields.description: The contact’s birthdate. Filter criteria for report filters, list view filters, and SOQL queries ignore the year portion of the Birthdate field. For example, this SOQL query returns contacts with birthdays later in the year than today: SELECT Name, Birthdate FROM Contact WHERE Birthdate > TODAY

fields.name: BuyerAttributes
fields.description: If Automatic Contact Enhancements or Buyer Relationship Map is enabled, this field contains the role of the contact in the opportunity or account. Possible values are: BusinessUser —For example, an end user. Key value. Buyer —Key value Champion —Key value DecisionMaker —Shown in green on a contact in the buyer relationship map UI. Key value. Detractor —Shown in red on a contact in the buyer relationship map UI. Key value. Evaluator ExecutiveSponsor —Key value TechnicalExpert Key values represent key contacts on an opportunity or account. If a buyer relationship map doesn’t have contacts with key values, then Salesforce prompts you to add them. Having all key values represented on the map provides a full view of the deal or account, increasing sales success. Warning To ensure that the buyer relationship map feature works as expected, don't modify field values. For example, if you change Detractor to Detract , the value isn’t shown in red in a buyer relationship map. This field is available with all profiles except custom and minimum-access. To provide access, use field-level security in Object Manager.

fields.name: CanAllowPortalSelfReg
fields.description: Indicates whether this contact can self-register for your Customer Portal ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: CleanStatus
fields.description: Indicates the record’s clean status as compared with Data.com. Values include: Matched , Different , Acknowledged , NotFound , Inactive , Pending , SelectMatch , or Skipped . Several values for CleanStatus appear with different labels on the contact record. Matched appears as In Sync Acknowledged appears as Reviewed Pending appears as Not Compared

fields.name: ConnectionReceivedId
fields.description: ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that shared this record with your organization. This field is available if you enabled Salesforce to Salesforce.

fields.name: ConnectionSentId
fields.description: ID of the PartnerNetworkConnection that you shared this record with. This field is available if you enabled Salesforce to Salesforce. This field is supported using API versions earlier than 15.0. In all other API versions, this field’s value is null. You can use the new PartnerNetworkRecordConnection object to forward records to connections.

fields.name: ContactSource
fields.description: If Automatic Contact Creation is enabled, this field indicates whether the contact was created automatically. A possible value is: Auto Create

fields.name: Department
fields.description: The contact’s department.

fields.name: DepartmentGroup
fields.description: If Automatic Contact Enhancements or Buyer Relationship Map is enabled, this field contains the business unit, function, or department that the contact belongs to in the organization. Possible values are: chiefExecutive —Key value customerSuccess —For example, wealth management, consumer banking, subject matter experts, or healthcare research experts. finance —Includes pricing and procurement. Key value. humanResources legal —Key value marketing other sales support —For example, tech support or customer support. tech —For example, IT or engineering. Key value. Key values represent key contacts on an opportunity or account. If a buyer relationship map doesn’t have contacts with key values, then Salesforce prompts you to add them. Having all key values represented on the map provides a full view of the deal or account, increasing sales success. This field is available with all profiles except custom and minimum-access. To provide access, use field-level security in Object Manager.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the contact. Label is Contact Description up to 32 KB.

fields.name: DoNotCall
fields.description: Indicates that the contact doesn’t want to receive calls.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: The contact’s email address.

fields.name: EmailBouncedDate
fields.description: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the contact results in a hard bounce, the date and time of the bounce.

fields.name: EmailBouncedReason
fields.description: If bounce management is activated and an email sent to the contact results in a hard bounce, the reason for the bounce.

fields.name: Fax
fields.description: The contact’s fax number. Label is Business Fax .

fields.name: FirstCallDateTime
fields.description: The date and time of the first call placed to the contact. This field is available in API version 48.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: FirstEmailDateTime
fields.description: The date and time of the first email sent to the contact. This field is available in API version 48.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: FirstName
fields.description: The contact’s first name up to 40 characters.

fields.name: GenderIdentity
fields.description: The contact’s internal experience of their gender, which may or may not correspond to their designated sex at birth.

fields.name: HasOptedOutOfEmail
fields.description: Indicates whether the contact doesn’t want to receive email from Salesforce ( true ) or does ( false ). Label is Email Opt Out .

fields.name: HasOptedOutOfFax
fields.description: Indicates whether the contact prohibits receiving faxes.

fields.name: HomePhone
fields.description: The contact’s home phone number. Label is Home Phone .

fields.name: IndividualId
fields.description: ID of the data privacy record associated with this contact. This field is available if Data Protection and Privacy is enabled.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: IsEmailBounced
fields.description: If bounce management is activated and an email is sent to a contact, indicates whether the email results in a soft or hard bounce ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsPersonAccount
fields.description: Read only. Indicates whether this account has a record type of Person Account ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Is Person Account .

fields.name: IsPriorityRecord
fields.description: Shows whether the user has marked the contact as important ( True ) or not ( False ). The default value is false . Available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: Jigsaw
fields.description: References the company’s ID in Data.com. If an account has a value in this field, it means that the account was imported from Data.com. If the field value is null , the account wasn’t imported from Data.com. Maximum size is 20 characters. Available in API version 22.0 and later. Label is Data.com Key . Important The Jigsaw field is exposed in the API to support troubleshooting for import errors and reimporting of corrected data. Do not modify this value.

fields.name: JigsawContactId
fields.description: The ID of the contact in reference to Jigsaw . Important The Jigsaw field is exposed in the API to support troubleshooting for import errors and reimporting of corrected data. Don’t modify the value in the Jigsaw field.

fields.name: LastActivityDate
fields.description: Value is the most recent of either: Due date of the most recent event logged against the record. Due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: Required. Last name of the contact up to 80 characters.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: LeadSource
fields.description: The source of the lead that was converted to this contact.

fields.name: MailingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the mailing address. Read-only. For details on compound address fields, see Address Compound Fields .

fields.name: MailingCity
fields.description: Mailing address details.

fields.name: MailingCountry
fields.description: Mailing address details.

fields.name: MailingCountryCode
fields.description: The ISO codes for the mailing address’s state and country.

fields.name: MailingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the mailing address. For details on geolocation compound field, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: MailingLatitude
fields.description: Used with MailingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a mailing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: MailingLongitude
fields.description: Used with MailingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a mailing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: MailingPostalCode
fields.description: Mailing address details.

fields.name: MailingState
fields.description: Mailing address details.

fields.name: MailingStateCode
fields.description: The ISO codes for the mailing address’s state and country.

fields.name: MailingStreet
fields.description: Street address for mailing address.

fields.name: MasterRecordId
fields.description: If this record was deleted as the result of a merge, this field contains the ID of the record that remains. If this record was deleted for any other reason, or hasn’t been deleted, the value is null .

fields.name: MiddleName
fields.description: The contact’s middle name. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: MobilePhone
fields.description: Contact’s mobile phone number. Label is Mobile Phone .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Concatenation of FirstName , MiddleName , LastName , and Suffix up to 203 characters, including whitespaces.

fields.name: OtherAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the other address. Read-only. For details on compound address fields, see Address Compound Fields .

fields.name: OtherCity
fields.description: Alternate address details.

fields.name: OtherCountry
fields.description: Alternate address details.

fields.name: OtherCountryCode
fields.description: The ISO codes for the alternate address’s state and country.

fields.name: OtherGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the other address. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: OtherLatitude
fields.description: Used with OtherLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of an alternate address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: OtherLongitude
fields.description: Used with OtherLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an alternate address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 up to 15 decimal places. For details on geolocation compound fields, see Compound Field Considerations and Limitations .

fields.name: OtherPhone
fields.description: Phone for alternate address.

fields.name: OtherPostalCode
fields.description: Alternate address details.

fields.name: OtherState
fields.description: Alternate address details.

fields.name: OtherStateCode
fields.description: The ISO codes for the alternate address’s state and country.

fields.name: OtherStreet
fields.description: Street for alternate address.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of the account associated with this contact.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: Phone number for the contact. Label is Business Phone .

fields.name: PhotoUrl
fields.description: Path to be combined with the URL of a Salesforce instance ( Example: https:// yourInstance .salesforce.com/) to generate a URL to request the social network profile image associated with the contact. Generated URL returns an HTTP redirect (code 302) to the social network profile image for the contact. Empty if Social Accounts and Contacts isn't enabled or if Social Accounts and Contacts is disabled for the requesting user.

fields.name: Pronouns
fields.description: The contact’s personal pronouns, reflecting their gender identity. Others can use these pronouns to refer to the contact in the third person. The entry is selected from a picklist of available values, which the administrator sets. Maximum 40 characters.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

fields.name: ReportsToId
fields.description: ID of the contact that this contact reports to.

fields.name: Salutation
fields.description: Honorific abbreviation, word, or phrase to be used in front of name in greetings, such as Dr. or Mrs.

fields.name: ScheduledResumeDateTime
fields.description: The date and time when the action cadence tracker is going to resume after it’s paused or on a wait step. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later when the Sales Engagement license is enabled. To see this field, the user also needs the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Quick Cadence Creator user permission set.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description: Name suffix of the contact. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title of the contact, such as CEO or Vice President.

fields.name: TitleType
fields.description: If Automatic Contact Enhancements or Buyer Relationship Map is enabled, this field contains the hierarchical position that the contact holds in the organization. In the UI, this field is shown as Seniority Level. Possible values are: ceo —Key value directorOrManager —Key value executive —Key value individualContributor vp —VP or Head of Department. Key value. Key values represent key contacts on an opportunity or account. If a buyer relationship map doesn’t show contacts with key values, then Salesforce prompts you to add them. Having all key values represented on the map provides a complete picture of the deal or account, increasing sales success. This field is available with all profiles except custom and minimum-access. To provide access, use field-level security in Object Manager.

fields.name: ChannelId
fields.description: For Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS, this field represents the unique ID of the Bring Your Own Channel messaging channel (MessagingChannel) that’s associated with the contact center (CallCenterId). Available in API version 60.0 and later.

fields.name: ContactCenterId
fields.description: This field is a relationship field. For Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS, this field represents the unique ID of the contact center (CallCenterId) that’s associated with the Bring Your Own Channel messaging channel (MessagingChannel). Available in API version 60.0 and later.

fields.name: OmniCallbackFallbackQueueId
fields.description: If callbacks are configured for the contact center and the contact center uses Omni-Channel Unified Routing, this field represents the unique ID of the fallback queue to use if contact request routing through an Omni-Channel flow fails. Don't change the value in this field. Instead, configure contact request routing in Lightning Experience.

fields.name: OmniCallbackHandler
fields.description: If callbacks are configured for the contact center and the contact center uses Omni-Channel Unified Routing, this field represents the unique ID of the flow or queue used to route contact requests. Don't change the value in this field. Instead, configure contact request routing in Lightning Experience.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: Available in API version 63.0 only. For internal use.

fields.name: VoicemailFallbackQueueId
fields.description: If voicemail routing is configured for the contact center, this field represents the unique ID of the fallback queue to use if voicemail routing fails. Don't change the value in this field. Instead, configure voicemail routing in Lightning Experience.

fields.name: VoicemailHandler
fields.description: If voicemail routing is configured for the contact center, this field represents the unique ID of the flow used to route voicemails. Don't change the value in this field. Instead, configure voicemail routing in Lightning Experience.

fields.name: ContactAccessLevel
fields.description: A value that represents the type of access granted to the target Group, UserRole, or User for Contacts. The possible values are: Read Edit

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the sharing rule. Maximum size is 1000 characters. This field is available in API version 29.0 and later.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Corresponds to Rule Name in the user interface. This field is available in API version 24.0 and later. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: GroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the source group. A Contact owned by a User in the source Group triggers the rule to give access.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Label of the sharing rule as it appears in the user interface. Limited to 80 characters. Corresponds to Label on the user interface.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: The ID representing the User or Group being granted access.

fields.name: AvailableCallbackAttempts
fields.description: Specifies the number of retries that are possible for a voice callback. Applies to calls routed through Omni-Channel Unified Routing. Valid values are 0 through 5 . The default is 0 .

fields.name: DelayBetweenCallbackAttempts
fields.description: Specifies the delay between voice callback attempts in minutes. Applies to calls routed through Omni-Channel Unified Routing. Valid values are 0 through 10,080 , and the default is 0 .

fields.name: IsCallback
fields.description: Determines how a voice call callback is handled after an agent accepts the callback work item.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The contact request number.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the Salesforce record that owns the request.

fields.name: PreferredChannel

fields.name: PreferredPhone
fields.description: The phone number the customer provided when requesting help in the contact request flow.

fields.name: RequestDescription
fields.description: The description of the customer’s issue that they provided when requesting help in the contact request flow.

fields.name: RequestReason
fields.description: The reason the customer provided when requesting help in the contact request flow. These values are customizable in Object Manager. The default values are: Account Billing Case General Order Other Product

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the contact request. For example: Abandoned Attempted Contacted New

fields.name: WhatId

fields.name: WhoId
fields.description: ID of the Salesforce contact record the contact request is related to, such as a contact, lead, or user.

fields.name: AccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to contact requests. The possible values are: Read Edit All (This value is not valid for create() or update() calls.) This value must be set to an access level that is higher than the organization’s default access level for contact requests.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the parent object, if any.

fields.name: RowCause
fields.description: Reason that this sharing entry exists. If you’re creating a sharing entry, the only permitted value is Manual . If no value is specified, the field defaults to Manual . All other RowCause values are read-only. After the sharing entry is created, this field can’t be edited.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: ID of the User or Group that has been given access to the ContactRequest.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: ID of the Contact associated with this sharing entry. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: ContactAccessLevel
fields.description: Level of access that the User or Group has to cases associated with the account Contact. The possible values are: Read Edit All This value is not valid for create or update. This field must be set to an access level that is higher than the organization’s default access level for contacts.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: RowCause
fields.description: Reason that this sharing entry exists. If you’re creating a sharing entry, the only permitted value is Manual . If no value is specified, the field defaults to Manual . All other RowCause values are read-only. After the sharing entry is created, this field can’t be edited. Valid values include: Rule —The User or Group has access via a Contact sharing rule. GuestRule —The User or Group has access via a Contact guest user sharing rule. ImplicitChild —The User or Group has access to the Contact via sharing access on the associated Account. After faster account sharing recalculation is enabled for your org, sharing entries with this value aren’t returned in queries. Instead of storing implicit child shares, record access is determined dynamically. ImplicitPerson —The User or Group has access to the business contact of a person account via access to the person account itself. GuestPersonImplicit —The guest user has access to the business contact of a person account via a Contact sharing rule. PortalImplicit —The Contact is associated with the portal user. LpuImplicit —The User has access to records owned by high-volume Experience Cloud site users via a share group. ARImplicit —The User, who belongs to a partner or customer account, has access to the Contact via an account relationship data sharing rule. Manual —The User or Group has access because a User with “All” access manually shared the Contact with them. Owner —The User is the owner of the Contact.

fields.name: UserOrGroupId
fields.description: ID of the User or Group that has been given access to the Contact. This field can't be updated.

fields.name: AccountId

ContentAsset.DeveloperName: must be 40 characters or fewer must begin with a letter can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters can’t include spaces can’t end with an underscore can’t contain 2 consecutive underscores In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization.

fields.description: Indicates whether unauthenticated users can see the asset file.

The value must be a valid user locale (language and country), such as de_DE or en_GB . For more information on locales, see the Language field on the CategoryNodeLocalization object.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The label for the asset file. This internal label doesn’t get translated.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix associated with this object. Each Developer Edition organization that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: ID of the file body.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId

fields.name: ContentDownloadUrl
fields.description: The link for downloading the file. This field is available in API version 40.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentVersionId
fields.description: ID of the shared document version.

fields.name: DistributionPublicUrl
fields.description: URL of the link to the shared document.

fields.name: ExpiryDate
fields.description: Date when the shared document becomes inaccessible.

fields.name: FirstViewDate
fields.description: Date when the shared document is first viewed.

fields.name: LastViewDate
fields.description: Date when the shared document was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the content delivery.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the user who owns the shared document.

fields.name: PdfDownloadUrl
fields.description: The link for downloading the file as a PDF. This field is available in API version 40.0 and later.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: A password that allows access to a shared document.

fields.name: PreferencesAllowOriginalDownload
fields.description: When true , the shared document can be downloaded as the file type that it was uploaded as. When false , download availability depends on whether a preview of the file exists. If a preview exists, the file can’t be downloaded. If a preview doesn’t exist, the file can still be downloaded. If the shared document is a link, it can’t be downloaded.

fields.name: PreferencesAllowPDFDownload
fields.description: When true , the shared document can be downloaded as a PDF if the original file type is PDF or if a PDF preview has been generated.

fields.name: PreferencesAllowViewInBrowser
fields.description: When true , a preview of the shared document can be viewed in a Web browser.

fields.name: PreferencesExpires
fields.description: When true , access to the shared document expires on the date that’s specified by ExpiryDate .

fields.name: PreferencesLinkLatestVersion
fields.description: When true , users see the most recent version of a shared document. When false , users see the version of the document that’s shared, even if it isn’t the most recent version.

fields.name: PreferencesNotifyOnVisit
fields.description: When true , the owner of the shared document is emailed the first time that someone views or downloads the shared document.

fields.name: PreferencesNotifyRndtnComplete
fields.description: When true , the owner of the shared document is emailed when renditions of the shared document that can be previewed in a Web browser are generated.

fields.name: PreferencesPasswordRequired
fields.description: When true , a password, specified by Password , is required to access the shared document.

fields.name: RelatedRecordId
fields.description: ID of the record, such as an Account, Campaign, or Case, that the shared document is related to.

fields.name: ViewCount
fields.description: The number of times that the shared document has been viewed.

fields.name: Action
fields.description: The action that’s used when a delivery is viewed.

fields.name: DeliveryIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the content delivery.

fields.name: DeliveryLocation
fields.description: The location of the delivery.

fields.name: RelatedObjectIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the record that’s associated with the delivery distribution.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 20130715233322.670 .

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API. For example: 00530000009M943 .

fields.name: VersionIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the content version.

fields.name: DistributionId
fields.description: ID of the content delivery that the document is part of.

fields.name: IsDownload
fields.description: true if the shared document is downloaded; false if the shared document is viewed.

fields.name: IsInternal
fields.description: true if the shared document is viewed by a user in the same organization; false if viewed by an external user.

fields.name: ParentViewId
fields.description: ID of this instance of accessing the shared document.

fields.name: ArchivedById
fields.description: The ID of the user who archived the document. This field is available in API version 24.0 and later.

fields.name: ArchivedDate
fields.description: The date when the document was archived. This field is available in API version 24.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentAssetId
fields.description: If the ContentDocument is an asset file, this field points to the asset. For most entities, the value of this field is null . This field is available in API version 38.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentModifiedDate
fields.description: The date the document was modified. ContentModifiedDate updates when, for example, the document is renamed or a new document version is uploaded. When you’re uploading the first version of a document, ContentModifiedDate can be set to the current time or anytime in the past. This field is available in API version 32.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: The size of the document in bytes for documents smaller than 2 GB. This field is available in API version 31.0 and later. In API version 65.0 and later, we recommend that you use the ContentSizeLong field even for files smaller than 2 GB.

fields.name: ContentSizeLong
fields.description: The size of the document in bytes up to 10 GB. This field is available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the document. This field is available in API version 31.0 and later.

fields.name: Division
fields.description: A logical segment of your organization's data. For example, if your company is organized into different business units, you could create a division for each business unit, such as “North America,” “Healthcare,” or “Consulting.” Available only if the organization has the Division permission enabled.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: File extension of the document. This field is available in API version 31.0 and later.

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Type of document, determined by the file extension. This field is available in API version 31.0 and later.

fields.name: IsArchived
fields.description: Indicates whether the document was archived ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsInternalOnly
fields.description: Indicates that a file is for internal use only. When true , prevents users with the Query Non Vetoed Files permission from viewing and performing SOQL query on public and non vetoed files in a Data Cloud org. Default value is false .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: LatestPublishedVersionId
fields.description: ID of the latest document version (ContentVersion).

fields.name: MalwareScanDate (Beta)
fields.description: The date the document was scanned for malware. This field is available as a beta feature in API version 66.0 and later. Note The MalwareScanDate field is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory . Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

fields.name: MalwareScanStatus (Beta)
fields.description: Indicates whether the document was scanned for malware and whether it’s safe or malicious. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the owner of this document.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the library that owns the document. Created automatically when inserting a ContentVersion via the API for the first time. This field is available in API version 24.0 and later when Salesforce CRM content is enabled.

fields.name: PublishStatus
fields.description: Indicates if and how the document is published. Valid values are: P —The document is published to a public library and is visible to other users. Label is Public . R —The document is published to a personal library and is not visible to other users. Label is Personal Library . U —The document is not published because publishing was interrupted. Label is Upload Interrupted .

fields.name: SharingOption
fields.description: Controls whether sharing is frozen for a file. Only administrators and file owners with Collaborator access to the file can modify this field. Default is Allowed , which means that new shares are allowed. When set to Restricted , new shares are prevented without affecting existing shares. This field is available in API versions 35.0 and later.

fields.name: SharingPrivacy
fields.description: Controls sharing privacy for a file. Only administrators and file owners with Collaborator access to the file can modify this field.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: The title of a document.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the document.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: Data type of the field that was changed.

fields.name: Division
fields.description: A logical segment of your organization's data. For example, if your company is organized into different business units, you could create a division for each business unit, such as “North America,” “Healthcare,” or “Consulting.” Available only if the organization has the Division permission enabled.

fields.name: Field
fields.description: The name of the field that was changed. Possible values include: contentDocPublished —The document is published into a library. contentDocUnpublished —The document is archived or removed from a library, either directly or when the owning library is changed. contentDocRepublished —The document is removed from the archive. contentDocFeatured —The document is featured. contentDocSubscribed —The document is subscribed to. contentDocUnsubscribed —The document is no longer subscribed to.

fields.name: NewValue
fields.description: The new value of the field that was changed.

fields.name: OldValue
fields.description: The latest value of the field before it was changed.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the document.

fields.name: LinkedEntityId
fields.description: ID of the linked object. Can include Chatter users, groups, records (any that support Chatter feed tracking including custom objects), and Salesforce CRM Content libraries.

fields.name: ShareType
fields.description: Required. The permission granted to the user of the shared file in a library. This is determined by the permission the user already has in the library. This field is available in API version 25.0 and later. V Viewer permission. The user can explicitly view but not edit the shared file.

fields.name: Visibility
fields.description: Specifies whether this file is available to all users, internal users, or shared users. This field is available in API version 26.0 and later. Visibility can have the following values. AllUsers —The file is available to all users who have permission to see the file. InternalUsers —The file is available only to internal users who have permission to see the file. SharedUsers —The file is available to all users who can see the feed to which the file is posted. SharedUsers is used only for files shared with users, and is available only when an org has private org-wide sharing on by default. The SharedUsers value is available in API version 32.0 and later. Note the following exceptions for Visibility . AllUsers & InternalUsers values apply to files posted on standard and custom object records, but not to users, groups, or content libraries. For posts to a record feed, Visibility is set to InternalUsers for all internal users by default. External users can set Visibility only to AllUsers . On user and group posts, only internal users can set Visibility to InternalUsers . For posts to a user feed, if the organization-wide default for user sharing is set to private, Visibility is set to SharedUsers . Only internal users can update Visibility. Visibility can be updated on links to files posted on standard and custom object records, but not to users, groups, or content libraries. Visibility is updatable in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the document.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this document.

fields.description: ID of the list view associated with the document.

fields.description: Name of the document.

fields.name: IsDocumentSub

fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID.

fields.name: SharedWithObjectIdentifier
fields.description: Who the document was shared with.

fields.name: SharingOperation
fields.description: The type of sharing operation on the document.

fields.name: SharingPermission
fields.description: What permissions the document was shared with.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the folder.

fields.name: ParentContentFolderId
fields.description: ID of the ParentFolder.

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: The size of the file or folder in bytes, when the size is smaller than 2 GB. In API version 66.0 and later, we recommend that you use the ContentSizeLong field even for files smaller than 2 GB.

fields.name: ContentSizeLong
fields.description: The size of the file or folder in bytes up to 10 GB. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: Specifies the file extension if the ContentFolderItem is a file.

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Specifies the type of file if the ContentFolderItem is a file.

fields.name: IsFolder
fields.description: Indicates that the ContentFolderItem is a folder, and not a file.

fields.name: ParentContentFolderId
fields.description: The ID of the ContentFolder that the ContentFolderItem resides in.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: The name of the file or folder.

fields.name: ContentFolderId
fields.description: ID of the folder.

fields.name: EnableFolderStatus
fields.description: Indicates the status of enabling folders for the library. Valid values are: C — Completed folder enablement S — Started folder enablement F — Failed folder enablement This field is available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: ParentEntityId
fields.description: Name of the entity the folder hierarchy is linked to.

fields.name: ChildRecordId
fields.description: ID of the file.

fields.name: ParentContentFolderId
fields.description: ID of the folder the file is in.

fields.name: ContentHubRepositoryId
fields.description: The ID for the related external data source described by the ContentHubRepository object.

fields.name: ContentItemSize
fields.description: The size of the file or folder. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentModifiedDate
fields.description: Date the file or folder content last changed.

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: The size of the file or folder that's less than 2 GB.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Explanation of item in external data source.

fields.name: ExternalContentUrl
fields.description: The URL of the document content in the external data source.

fields.name: ExternalDocumentUrl
fields.description: The URL of the detail page in the external data source.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: ID for the file or folder in the external data source.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: File format extension, such as .doc or .pdf

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Complete file type, such as “Microsoft Word Document.”

fields.name: IsFolder
fields.description: Indicates whether item is a folder or file.

fields.name: MimeType
fields.description: MIME type of the content.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the file or folder in the external data source.

fields.name: Owner
fields.description: Username of the content owner in the external data source.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The ID of the parent folder for the record. This field isn’t returned in queries or searches of the ContentHubItem object. It supports only WHERE clauses, such as the following: WHERE ContentHubRepositoryId = <ID of external source> and ParentId = <ID of parent folder or record> . Or specify WHERE ParentId = <name of root folder> to return the children of the root folder. Tip The ParentId field supports both Salesforce IDs (in the format “0CHxxx”) and external IDs.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: The title that appears in the content, which often differs from the Name of the containing file or folder.

fields.name: UpdatedBy
fields.description: Username for the person who last updated the file.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the record in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This field is automatically generated but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Master label for the external data source. This display value is the internal label and does not get translated.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The data source type. Possible values are: contenthubGoogleDrive contenthubOffice365 contenthubOneDrive contenthubSharepoint contenthubBox contenthubQuip

fields.name: Content
fields.description: The content or body of the note, which can include properly formatted HTML or plain text. When a document is uploaded or downloaded via the API, it must be base64 encoded (for upload) or decoded (for download). Any special characters within plain text in the Content field must be escaped. You can escape special characters by calling content.escapeHtml4() . If the input contains unsafe HTML characters or new lines, we automatically strip them out before saving the content.

fields.name: ContentModifiedDate
fields.description: The date the document was modified. ContentModifiedDate updates when, for example, the document is renamed or a new document version is uploaded. This field is available in API version 48.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: The size of the note in bytes for notes smaller than 2 GB. In API version 66.0 and later, use the ContentSizeLong field.

fields.name: ContentSizeLong
fields.description: The size of the note in bytes, up to 10 GB. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: File extension of the note.

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Type of file for the note. All notes have a file type of SNOTE .

fields.name: IsReadOnly
fields.description: Indicates whether the note is read only.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date the note was last viewed. This field is available in API version 35.0 and later.

fields.name: LatestContentId
fields.description: Lookup to the note's ContentBody. This field is available in API version 52.0 and later.

fields.name: LatestPublishedVersionId
fields.description: ID of the ContentVersion for the latest published version of the note.

fields.name: OwnerId
properties: Create (for users assigned the Set Audit Fields Upon Creation permission)
Update (for users assigned the Set Audit Fields Upon Creation permission)
fields.description: ID of the owner of the note.

fields.name: SharingPrivacy
fields.description: Controls sharing privacy for a file. Only Salesforce admins and file owners with Collaborator access to the file can modify this field. Default is Visible to Anyone With Record Access . When set to Private on Records , the file is private on records but can be shared selectively with others. This field is available in API versions 41.0 and later.

fields.name: TextPreview
fields.description: A preview of the note’s content. This field is available in API version 35.0 and later.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title of the note.

fields.name: EntityIdentifierId
fields.description: ID of the object with the notification.

fields.name: EntityType
fields.description: Type of object with the notification. One of the following. ContentDocument ContentTagName ContentVersion ContentWorkspace ContentWorkspacePermission User

fields.name: Nature
fields.description: Type of notification.

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: Subject of the notification.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Text of the notification.

fields.name: UsersId
fields.description: ID of the user who received the notification.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: ID of the user following the tag on the file.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the content taxonomy. This description appears in the API and in the Content Taxonomy tab in the Digital Experiences App. The maximum length is 255 characters.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The combined language and locale ISO code.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the content taxonomy.

fields.name: ContentTaxonomyId
fields.description: The ID of the content taxonomy to which the term belongs.

fields.name: ContentTaxonomyTermId
fields.description: The ID of the term that belongs to the content taxonomy.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the content taxonomy term. This description appears in the API and in the Content Taxonomy tab in the Digital Experiences App. The maximum length is 255 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the content taxonomy term in the API. This field is unique within your organization. The name: must be 80 characters or fewer must begin with a letter can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters can't include spaces can't end with an underscore can't contain 2 consecutive underscores

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: The external ID of the content taxonomy term.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the content taxonomy term. The name must be between 2 and 255 characters long.

fields.name: ContentTaxonomyId
fields.description: The ID of the content taxonomy to which the term belongs.

fields.name: ContentTaxonomyTermId
fields.description: The ID of the primary term that has a relationship with another term.

fields.name: ContentTaxonomyTrmRelaTypeId
fields.description: The ID of the type of relationship between the two taxonomy terms.

fields.name: RelatedContentTaxonomyTermId
fields.description: The ID of the term that is related to the primary term.

fields.name: ContentTaxonomyTrmRelaCatg
fields.description: Category of the relationship type.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the relationship type.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the relationship type.

fields.name: DocumentIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the document that’s being shared.

fields.name: FilePreviewType
fields.description: The content type of the file preview.

fields.name: FileSize
fields.description: The size of rendition being added (bytes).

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: The content type of the file version.

fields.name: OperationType
fields.description: The operation that’s being performed.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID .

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 18-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: VersionIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the content version.

fields.name: SubscribedToUserId
fields.description: ID of the user who is followed by another user.

fields.name: SubscriberUserId
fields.description: ID of the user who follows another user.

fields.name: Checksum
fields.description: MD5 checksum for the file.

fields.name: ContentBodyId
fields.description: Allows inserting a file version independently of the file blob being uploaded. This field is available for query and insert only. It can only point to a ContentBody record. This field is available in API version 40.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the document.

fields.name: ContentLocation
fields.description: Origin of the document. Valid values are: S —Document is located within Salesforce. Label is Salesforce . E —Document is located outside of Salesforce. Label is External . L —Document is located on a social network and accessed via Social Customer Service. Label is Social Customer Service .

fields.name: ContentModifiedById
fields.description: ID of the user who modified the document.

fields.name: ContentModifiedDate
fields.description: Date the document was modified. ContentModifiedDate updates when, for example, the document is renamed or a new document version is uploaded. When uploading the first version of a document, ContentModifiedDate can be set to the current time or any time in the past.

fields.name: ContentSize
fields.description: The size of the document in bytes for documents smaller than 2 GB. The value is zero for links. In API version 66.0 and later, we recommend that you use the ContentSizeLong field even for documents smaller than 2 GB.

fields.name: ContentSizeLong
fields.description: The size of the document in bytes up to 10 GB. The value is zero for links. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentUrl
fields.description: URL for links. This is only set for links. One of the fields that determines the FileType . The character limit in API versions 33.0 and later is 1,300. The character limit in API versions 32.0 and earlier was 255.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the content version.

fields.name: Division
fields.description: A logical segment of your organization's data. For example, if your company is organized into different business units, you could create a division for each business unit, such as “North America,” “Healthcare,” or “Consulting.” Available only if the org has the Division permission enabled.

fields.name: ExternalDataSourceId
fields.description: ID of the external document referenced in the ExternalDataSource object.

fields.name: ExternalDocumentInfo1
fields.description: Stores the URL of the file in the external content repository. The integration from the external source determines the content for this string. After the reference or copy is created, the URL of the external file is updated when you: Republish a file reference in Lightning Experience Open the document Create a file reference in the Connect REST API with reuseReference set to true. When the file is updated, the shared link is updated to the most current version.

fields.name: ExternalDocumentInfo2
fields.description: Contains the external file ID. Salesforce determines the content for this string, which is private. The content can change without notice, depending on the external system. After the file reference is created, this field isn’t updated, even if the file path changes.

fields.name: FeaturedContentBoost
fields.description: Read only. Designates a document as featured.

fields.name: FeaturedContentDate
fields.description: Date the document was featured.

fields.name: FileExtension
fields.description: File extension of the document. This field is available in API version 31.0 and later.

fields.name: FileType
fields.description: Type of content determined by ContentUrl for links or PathOnClient for documents.

fields.name: FirstPublishLocationId
fields.description: ID of the location where the version was first published. If the version is first published into a user's personal library or My Files, the field will contain the ID of the user who owns the personal library or My Files. In Lightning Experience, if the first version is published into a public library, the field will contain the ID of that library. Accepts all record IDs supported by ContentDocumentLink (anything a file can be attached to, like records and groups). Setting FirstPublishLocationId allows you to create a file and share it with an initial record/group in a single transaction, and have the option to create more links to share the file with other records or groups later. When a file is created, it’s automatically linked to the record, and PublishStatus will change to Public from Pending/Personal. This field is only set the first time a version is published via the API. FirstPublishLocationId can’t be set to another ID when a new content version is inserted. Note Salesforce updates the FirstPublishLocationId updates automatically when a new OwnerId is added to the ContentVersion . For example, when you publish a new version with a different OwnerId than the current OwnerId , the FirstPublishLocationId of all previous versions updates to the previous OwnerId . The new published version sets the FirstPublishLocationId to the new OwnerId .

fields.name: IsAssetEnabled
fields.description: Can be specified on insert of ContentVersion to automatically convert a ContentDocument file into a ContentAsset. This field can be SOQL queried, but it can’t be edited. This field is available in API version 38.0 and later.

fields.name: IsLatest
fields.description: Indicates whether this is the latest version of the document ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsMajorVersion
fields.description: true if the document is a major version; false if the document is a minor version. Major versions can’t be replaced.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language for this document. This field defaults to the org’s default language unless the multi language setting is enabled. Specifies the language of the labels returned. The value must be a valid user locale (language and country), such as de_DE or en_GB . For more information on locales, see the Language field on the CategoryNodeLocalization object.

fields.name: MalwareScanDate (Beta)
fields.description: The date the document was scanned for malware. This field is available as a beta feature in API version 66.0 and later. Note The MalwareScanDate field is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory . Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

fields.name: MalwareScanStatus (Beta)
fields.description: Indicates whether the document was scanned for malware and whether it’s safe or malicious. This field is available in API version 66.0 and later. Valid values are: NotScanned —The file hasn’t yet been scanned for malware. This is the default value. Scheduled —The file scan is in progress. Clean —The file was scanned and doesn’t contain malware. Malicious —The file was scanned and it contains malware. Skipped —The file can’t be scanned because it’s either larger than 100 MB or it’s a Salesforce-generated file, such as a Content Note. Failed —The file wasn’t scanned because of an error.

fields.name: NegativeRatingCount
fields.description: Read only. The number of times different users have given the document a thumbs down. Rating counts for the latest version are not version-specific. If Version 1 receives 10 thumbs-down votes, and Version 2 receives 2 thumbs-down votes, the NegativeRatingCount on Version 2 is 12. However, rating counts are not retroactive for prior versions. The NegativeRatingCount on Version 1 is 10.

fields.name: NetworkId
fields.description: ID of the Experience Cloud site that this file originated from. This field is available in API version 26.0 and later, if digital experiences is enabled for your org. You can add a NetworkId only when creating a file. You can’t change or add a NetworkId for an existing file.

fields.name: Origin
fields.description: The source of the content version. Valid values are: C —Content document from the user's personal library. Label is Content . The FirstPublishLocationId must be the user's ID. If FirstPublishLocationId is left blank, it defaults to the user's ID . H —Salesforce file from the user's My Files. Label is Chatter . The FirstPublishLocationId must be the user's ID. If FirstPublishLocationId is left blank, it defaults to the user's ID. Origin can only be set to H if Chatter is enabled for your organization. This field defaults to C. Label is Content Origin .

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the owner of this document.

fields.name: PathOnClient
fields.description: The complete path of the document. One of the fields that determines the FileType . Note Specify a complete path including the file extension in order for the document to be visible in the Preview tab.

fields.name: PositiveRatingCount
fields.description: Read only. The number of times different users have given the document a thumbs up. Rating counts for the latest version are not version-specific. If Version 1 receives 10 thumbs-up votes, and Version 2 receives 2 thumbs-up votes, the PositiveRatingCount on Version 2 is 12. However, rating counts are not retroactive for prior versions. The PositiveRatingCount on Version 1 is 10.

fields.name: PublishStatus
fields.description: Indicates if and how the document is published. Valid values are: P —The document is published to a public library and is visible to other users. Label is Public . R —The document is published to a personal library and is not visible to other users. Label is Personal Library . U —The document is not published because publishing was interrupted. Label is Upload Interrupted .

fields.name: RatingCount
fields.description: Read only. Total number of positive and negative ratings.

fields.name: ReasonForChange
fields.description: The reason why the document was changed. This field can only be set when inserting a new version (revising) a document.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the record type of the version. Custom fields are restricted in RecordTypeId . When an administrator creates a custom field via the API it must be added to at least one page layout: If the custom field is added to the page layout associated with the General record type, the RecordTypeId that corresponds to that record type does not have to be set on the version record. If the custom field is added to the page layout associated with a custom record type, the RecordTypeId that corresponds to that record type must be set on the version record.

fields.name: SharingOption
fields.description: Controls whether sharing is frozen for a file. Only administrators and file owners with Collaborator access to the file can modify this field. Default is Allowed , which means that new shares are allowed. When set to Restricted , new shares are prevented without affecting existing shares. This field is available in API versions 35.0 and later.

fields.name: SharingPrivacy
fields.description: Controls sharing privacy for a file. Only administrators and file owners with Collaborator access to the file can modify this field. Default is Visible to Anyone With Record Access . When set to Private on Records , the file is private on records but can be shared selectively with others. This field is available in API versions 41.0 and later.

fields.name: TagCsv
fields.description: Text used to apply tags to a content version via the API.

fields.name: TextPreview
fields.description: A preview of a document. Available in API version 35.0 and later.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: The title of a document.

fields.name: VersionData
fields.description: The content or body of the note, which can include properly formatted HTML or plain text. When a document is uploaded or downloaded via the API, it should be base64 encoded (for upload) or decoded (for download). Any special characters within plain text in the Content field must be escaped. You can escape special characters by calling content.escapeHtml4() .

fields.name: VersionDataURL
fields.description: The URL used to fetch a file from the binary data endpoint. This field is only populated on direct queries to ContentVersion, and not when queried through a related entity’s foreign key to ContentVersion.

fields.name: VersionNumber
fields.description: The version number. The number increments with each version of the document, for example, 1, 2, 3.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: ID of the file.

fields.name: ContentVersionId
fields.description: ID of the version of the file.

fields.name: UserComment
fields.description: ID of the user who commented on the file.

fields.name: ContentVersionId
fields.description: ID of the version.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: Data type of the field that was changed.

fields.name: Division
fields.description: A logical segment of your organization's data. For example, if your company is organized into different business units, you could create a division for each business unit, such as “North America,” “Healthcare,” or “Consulting.” Available only if the organization has the Division permission enabled.

fields.name: Field
fields.description: The name of the field that was changed. Possible values include: contentVersionCreated —A new version is created. contentVersionUpdated —The title, description, or any custom field on the version is changed. contentVersionDownloaded —A version is downloaded. contentVersionViewed —The version details are viewed. contentVersionRated —The version is rated. contentVersionCommented —The version receives a comment. contentVersionDataReplaced —The new version replaces the previous version, which can happen only when the new version is uploaded immediately after the previous version.

fields.name: NewValue
fields.description: The new value of the field that was changed.

fields.name: OldValue
fields.description: The latest value of the field before it was changed.

fields.name: ContentVersionId
fields.description: ID of the version of the file.

fields.name: Rating
fields.description: Rating of the file.

fields.name: UserComment
fields.description: Comment made by the user who rated the file.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: ID of the user who rated the file.

fields.name: DefaultRecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the default content type for the library. Content types are the containers for custom fields in Salesforce CRM Content.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Text description of the content library.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the library in the API. Allows a link to the library to be packaged when an asset file is added to a package. Although libraries aren’t a packageable entity, references to libraries with a developer name will be included in the package when asset files are packaged. These links can then be restored in the target org.

fields.name: IsRestrictContentTypes
fields.description: Read only. Indicates whether content types have been restricted ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsRestrictLinkedContentTypes
