fields.description: Read only. Indicates whether linked content types have been restricted ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the library.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The unique name of the library in the API. Allows a link to the library to be packaged when an asset file is added to a package. Limit: 15 characters. This field is available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: RootContentFolderId
fields.description: ID of root folder of the library. This field is available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: ShouldAddCreatorMembership
fields.description: Automatically create a library membership for the user creating the library. Note this field isn’t meant for query and always returns false in query. This field is available in API version 40.0 and later.

fields.name: TagModel
fields.description: The type of tagging assigned to a library. Valid values are: U — Unrestricted. No restrictions on tagging. Users can enter any tag when publishing or editing content. G — Guided. Users can enter any tag when publishing or editing content, but they’re also offered a list of suggested tags. R — Restricted. Users must choose from a list of suggested tags.

fields.name: WorkspaceImageId
fields.description: ID of a library image. Image files can be assigned to libraries for branding and easy identification. Library image is visible to all users, even if they are not library members. This field is available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: WorkspaceType
fields.description: Differentiates between different types of libraries. Valid values are: R — Regular library B — Org asset library This field is available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentDocumentId
fields.description: Read only. ID of the library document.

fields.name: ContentWorkspaceId
fields.description: Read only. ID of the library.

fields.name: IsOwner
fields.description: Read only. Indicates whether the library owns the document and determines permissions for that document ( true ) or not ( false ). Documents can belong to more than one library, but only one library owns the document and determines its permissions.

fields.name: ContentWorkspaceId
fields.description: ID of the library.

fields.name: ContentWorkspacePermissionId
fields.description: The id of the library permission or role.

fields.name: MemberId
fields.description: ID of the library member (the member is either a user or a group).

fields.name: MemberType
fields.description: The type of library member. Valid values are: G - Group U - User

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the library.

fields.name: PermissionsAddComment
fields.description: Permission for user to post comments to any content in the library and view all comments in the library. Users can edit or delete their own comments.

fields.name: PermissionsAddContent
fields.description: Permission for user to publish new content to the library, upload new content versions, or restore archived (deleted) content. Content authors can also change any tags associated with their content and archive or delete their own content.

fields.name: PermissionsAddContentOBO
fields.description: Permission for user to choose an author when publishing content in the library.

fields.name: PermissionsArchiveContent
fields.description: Permission for user to archive and restore any content in the library.

fields.name: PermissionsChatterSharing
fields.description: Permission for user to make content from this library accessible outside of the library, sharing with a record or in Chatter. From a record or from Chatter, select a file from the library and attach it to a record or a post.

fields.name: PermissionsDeleteContent
fields.description: Permission for user to delete any content in the library. Authors can undelete their own content from the Recycle Bin.

fields.name: PermissionsDeliverContent
fields.description: Permission for user to share content outside the org via a content delivery or public link.

fields.name: PermissionsFeatureContent
fields.description: Permission for user to identify any content in the library as “featured.”

fields.name: PermissionsManageWorkspace
fields.description: Permission for user to perform any action in the library. This privilege is required to edit a library’s name and description, add or remove library members, or delete a library. Manage Library is a super permission which provides all other permission options listed except Deliver Content. Creating a library requires the Manage Salesforce CRM Content app permission or Create Libraries system permission.

fields.name: PermissionsModifyComments
fields.description: Permission for user to edit or delete comments made to any content in the library.

fields.name: PermissionsOrganizeFileAndFolder
fields.description: Permission for user to create, rename, and delete folders in libraries.

fields.name: PermissionsTagContent
fields.description: Permission for user to add tags when publishing content or editing content details in the library.

fields.name: PermissionsViewComments
fields.description: Permission for user to view comments.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Provides the type of access a user has to a library. Valid values are: Library Administrator Author Viewer Custom

fields.name: ContentWorkspaceId
fields.description: ID of the library.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: ID of the user following the library.

fields.name: ContextEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the Conversation or ConversationParticipant record.

fields.name: MapKey
fields.description: The key for the context data.

fields.name: MapValue
fields.description: The value for the context data.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: Required. ID of the Account associated with this contract.

fields.name: ActivatedById
fields.description: ID of the User who activated this contract.

fields.name: ActivatedDate
fields.description: Date and time when this contract was activated.

fields.name: ActivityMetricId
fields.description: When Einstein Activity Capture with Activity Metrics is enabled, the ID of the related activity metric.

fields.name: ActivityMetricRollupId
fields.description: When Einstein Activity Capture with Activity Metrics is enabled, the ID of the related activity metric rollup.

fields.name: AggregationStrategy
fields.description: The aggregation strategy when creating a pricing contract.

fields.name: BillingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the billing address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: BillingCity
fields.description: Details for the billing address. The maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: BillingCountry
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this account. The maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: BillingCountryCode
fields.description: The ISO country code for the contract's billing address.

fields.name: BillingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the geocode for the billing address.

fields.name: BillingLatitude
fields.description: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: BillingLongitude
fields.description: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: BillingPostalCode
fields.description: Details for the billing address of this account. The maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: BillingState
fields.description: Details for the billing address. The maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: BillingStateCode
fields.description: The ISO state code for the contract's billing address.

fields.name: BillingStreet
fields.description: Street address for the billing address.

fields.name: CompanySignedDate
fields.description: The date your organization signed the contract.

fields.name: CompanySignedId
fields.description: ID of the user who signed the contract.

fields.name: ContractNumber
fields.description: Number of the contract.

fields.name: ContractTerm
fields.description: Number of months that the contract is valid.

fields.name: CustomerSignedDate
fields.description: The date when the customer signed the contract.

fields.name: CustomerSignedId
fields.description: ID of the Contact who signed this contract.

fields.name: CustomerSignedTitle
fields.description: Title of the customer who signed the contract.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the contract.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: Read-only. Calculated end date of the contract. This value is calculated by adding the ContractTerm to the StartDate . If the Auto-calculate Contract End Date setting is disabled, the contract end date is editable.

fields.name: HasContractCotermination
fields.description: Indicates whether the contract can be coterminated ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsPricingContract
fields.description: Indicates whether the contract has related contract item prices ( true ) or if there are no contract item prices for the contract ( false ). This field is available with Revenue Cloud in API version 63.0 and later.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). The label is Deleted .

fields.name: LastActivityDate
fields.description: Value is the most recent: The due date of the most recent event is logged against the record. The due date of the most recently closed task associated with the record.

fields.name: LastApprovedDate
fields.description: Last date the contract was approved.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but didn’t view it.

fields.name: OwnerExpirationNotice
fields.description: Number of days ahead of the contract end date (15, 30, 45, 60, 90, and 120). Used to notify the owner in advance that the contract is ending.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the user who owns the contract.

fields.name: Pricebook2Id
fields.description: ID of the pricebook, if any, associated with this contract.

fields.name: PricingSource
fields.description: Source of the pricing for the contract.

fields.name: RecordTypeId
fields.description: ID of the record type assigned to this object.

fields.name: RenewalTerm2
fields.description: The default subscription term for renewals. For example, if the Renewal Term Unit is months and you want a 6-month term, set the Renewal Term to 6. Available in API version 60.0 and later.

fields.name: RenewalTermUnit
fields.description: The unit of time for a subscription term.

fields.name: ShippingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the shipping address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: ShippingCity
fields.description: Details of the shipping address. City maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: ShippingCountry
fields.description: Details of the shipping address. Country maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: ShippingCountryCode
fields.description: The ISO country code for the contract's shipping address.

fields.name: ShippingGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: The accuracy of the geocode for the shipping address.

fields.name: ShippingLatitude
fields.description: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: ShippingLongitude
fields.description: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: ShippingPostalCode
fields.description: Details of the shipping address. The postal code maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: ShippingState
fields.description: Details of the shipping address. The maximum size for the state is 80 characters.

fields.name: ShippingStateCode
fields.description: The ISO state code for the contract's shipping address.

fields.name: ShippingStreet
fields.description: The street address of the shipping address. The maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: SourceQuoteId
fields.description: ID of the source quote associated with this contract. This field is available with Revenue Cloud in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: SpecialTerms
fields.description: Special terms that apply to the contract.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: Start date for this contract. The label is Contract Start Date .

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The picklist of values that indicate order status. Each value is within one of two status categories defined in StatusCode . For example, the status picklist may contain: Ready to Ship, Shipped, Received as values within the Activated StatusCode .

fields.name: StatusCode
fields.description: The status category for the contract. A contract can be Draft, InApproval, or Activated. Label is Status Category .

fields.name: UnitPriceUplift
fields.description: Indicates the percentage increase of a line item’s unit price. This field is available with Revenue Cloud in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: ID of the Contact associated with this Contract.

fields.name: ContractId
fields.description: Required. ID of the Contract.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: IsPrimary
fields.description: Specifies whether this Contact plays the primary role on this Contract ( true ) or not ( false ). Each contract has one primary contact role. Default is false . Labels is Primary .

fields.name: Role
fields.description: Name of the role played by the Contact on this Contract, such as Decision Maker, Approver, Buyer, and so on. Must be unique—there can't be multiple records in which the ContractId , ContactId , and Role values are identical. Different contacts can play the same role on the same contract. A contact can play different roles on the same contract.

fields.name: AssetId
fields.description: Required. ID of the Asset associated with the contract line item. Must be a valid asset ID.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the contract line item.

fields.name: Discount
fields.description: The discount for the product as a percentage.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The last day the contract line item is in effect.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: LineItemNumber
fields.description: Automatically-generated number that identifies the contract line item.

fields.name: ListPrice
fields.description: Corresponds to the UnitPrice on the PricebookEntry that is associated with this line item, which can be in the standard pricebook or a custom pricebook. A client application can use this information to show whether the unit price (or sales price) of the line item differs from the pricebook entry list price.

fields.name: LocationId
fields.description: The location associated with the contract line item.

fields.name: ParentContractLineItemId
fields.description: The line item’s parent line item, if it has one.

fields.name: PricebookEntryId
fields.description: Required. ID of the associated PricebookEntry.

fields.name: Product2Id
fields.description: The product related to the contract line item.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: Number of units of the contract line item (product) included in the associated service contract.

fields.name: RootContractLineItemId
fields.description: (Read only) The top-level line item in a contract line item hierarchy. Depending on where a line item lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.

fields.name: ServiceContractId
fields.description: Required. ID of the ServiceContract associated with the contract line item. Must be a valid service contract ID.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The first day the contract line item is in effect.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the contract line item.

fields.name: Subtotal
fields.description: Contract line item's sales price multiplied by the Quantity .

fields.name: TotalPrice
fields.description: This field is available only for backward compatibility. It represents the total price of the ContractLineItem

fields.name: UnitPrice
fields.description: The unit price for the contract line item. In the user interface, this field’s value is calculated by dividing the total price of the contract line item by the quantity listed for that line item. Label is Sales Price .

fields.name: CalculationMethod
fields.description: The method used for calculating the contract line outcome’s captured data to determine the outcome value. Select Average or As Captured to calculate the contract line outcome. Average calculates the outcome value based on the average of all data captured to date. As Captured calculates the outcome value based on the asset’s current data at the time of the compliance check.

fields.name: CaptureFrequency
fields.description: The frequency at which data capturing and contract compliance check for the contract line outcome occurs.

fields.name: ComplianceStatus
fields.description: Indicates if the criteria were met. Compliant–The outcome is compliant with the contract. Not Compliant–The outcome isn’t compliant with the contract. Not Available–The outcome’s compliance information isn’t available yet. Invalid–The outcome isn’t valid because the option selected for the Criteria Field of the recordset filter criteria was deleted. To restart the calculation, create a new contract line outcome.

fields.name: ContractLineItemId
fields.description: The contract line item associated with the contract line outcome.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the contract line outcome.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The contract line outcome's data capture end date.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the contract line outcome.

fields.name: NextDataCaptureDate
fields.description: The date of the next data capture and compliance check based on the capture frequency. The date is auto-populated and updated after each capture

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The contract line outcome’s owner. By default, the owner is the user who created the contract line outcome record. Its UI label is Contract Line Outcome Owner.

fields.name: RecordsetFilterCriteriaId
fields.description: The ID of the recordset filter criteria in which the contract line outcome’s conditions are defined.

fields.name: ServiceContractId
fields.description: The service contract associated with the contract line item and the contract line outcome.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The contract line outcome's data capture start date.

fields.name: CalculatedValue
fields.description: The value calculated based on the contract line outcome’s calculation method and the captured data.

fields.name: CaptureDate
fields.description: The date and time when the data was captured.

fields.name: ContractLineOutcomeId
fields.description: The contract line outcome associated with the contract line outcome data record.

fields.name: KeyPerformanceIndicator
fields.description: The key performance indicators (fields or asset attributes) that define the contract line outcome’s compliance status.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome data record was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome data record was last viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the contract line outcome data record.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The actual value of the key performance indicator.

fields.name: ApiName
fields.description: Uniquely identifies a picklist value so it can be retrieved without using an id or primary label.

fields.name: IsDefault
fields.description: Indicates whether this is the default contract status value ( true ) or not ( false ) in the picklist.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Label for this contract status value. This display value is the internal label that does not get translated.

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: Number used to sort this value in the contract status picklist. These numbers are not guaranteed to be sequential, as some previous contract status values might have been deleted.

fields.name: StatusCode
fields.description: Code indicating the status of a contract. One of the following values: Draft InApproval Activated Two other values ( Terminated and Expired ) are defined but are not available for use via the API.

fields.name: ItemId
fields.description: ID of the tagged item.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the tag. If this value does not already exist, a new TagDefinition is created and becomes the parent of this Tag object. Otherwise, a TagDefinition with the same name becomes the parent of this Tag object. Parent relationships are created automatically.

fields.name: TagDefinitionId
fields.description: ID of the parent TagDefinition object that owns the tag.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines the visibility of a tag.

fields.name: AnalysisDate
fields.description: The date when the actual data analysis was done, accounting for the delay between the refresh start time and the data analysis.

fields.name: DataModelVersion
fields.description: The data model version generated by Hawking.

fields.name: Error
fields.description: The error message sent by Hawking when a refresh fails.

fields.name: FlowIdentifier
fields.description: Required. The UUID used to track the Hawking flow ID.

fields.name: RefreshDate
fields.description: Required. The date when the admin started the refresh of their ECI data for processing.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Required. The status of the refresh or run.

fields.name: TotalCalls
fields.description: The total number of calls that were analyzed for Sales Signals.

fields.name: TotalMentions
fields.description: The total number of mentions or keywords that were analyzed.

fields.name: CallPercentage
fields.description: Required. The percentage of calls that apply to a topic, out of the total number of calls that were analyzed.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: Required. A classification or grouping used to filter topics. This field is used in conjunction with Keyword .

fields.name: ConvAnalysisSummaryId
fields.description: Required. The conversation analysis summary associated with the topic.

fields.name: GenerationsIdentifier
fields.description: Required. The ID used to track the LLM-generated response for feedback purposes.

fields.name: Keyword
fields.description: Required. A specific word used in conjunction with Category to filter topics. For example, Product:Salesforce , where the keyword is Salesforce.

fields.name: MentionCount
fields.description: Required. The number of call insights associated with the topic.

fields.name: Order
fields.description: Required. A numerical value used to sort topics in a sequence.

fields.name: Summary
fields.description: Required. A detailed explanation of the topic.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Required. The title of the topic that describes it.

fields.name: TopicSentiment
fields.description: The sentiment of the topic, whether it’s negative, neutral, or positive.

fields.name: TotalCalls
fields.description: The total number of calls analyzed for the topic.

fields.name: TotalCallsForCategoryKeyword
fields.description: The total number of calls analyzed for category:keyword . Multiple topics can be under a single category:keyword .

fields.name: TotalMentionsForCategoryKeyword
fields.description: The total number of mentions analyzed for category:keyword .

fields.name: TurnIdentifier
fields.description: UUID that is generated and used to track a group of LLM-generated content.

fields.name: BulletGenerationsIdentifier
fields.description: The generation ID used to track the LLM-generated response for feedback purposes.

fields.name: CallId
fields.description: The unique identifier of the voice or video call that corresponds to the entry.

fields.name: ConvAnalysisTopicId
fields.description: Required. The conversation analysis topic associated with the entry.

fields.name: SnippetStartTime
fields.description: The timestamp when the call is associated with the current topic entry.

fields.name: Summary
fields.description: The LLM-generated call summary that corresponds to the parent topic.

fields.name: ConversationChannelId
fields.description: The record ID of the channel used to initialize the conversation. This can either be a messaging channel for the Messaging product or a call center for the Service Cloud Voice product. Available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: ConversationIdentifier
fields.description: A unique identifier generated for the conversation.

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: The date and time that a conversation ends.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The autogenerated name of the conversation.

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: The date and time that a conversation starts.

fields.name: Action
fields.description: The specific action performed using the Conversation Service API.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Autogenerated name of the logs.

fields.name: Operation
fields.description: Name of the operation that triggered the Conversation Srevice API log.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: Owner ID that triggered the Conversation API log.

fields.name: RequestedById
fields.description: The User ID that triggered the Conversation API log.

fields.name: RequestedDate
fields.description: The date of the operation that triggered the Conversation API log.

fields.name: RequestedEntityIdentifier
fields.description: The entity ID being created, updated, or deleted.

fields.name: RequestedEntityType
fields.description: The type of entity being created, updated, or deleted.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the Conversation API operation.

fields.name: ConversationContextEntryName
fields.description: The autogenerated number of the entry.

fields.name: CustomDetailContextKey
fields.description: The key or name of the pre-chat field specified by the admin in the pre-chat implementation, for example, customer_email .

fields.name: CustomDetailContextValue
fields.description: The value entered in the pre-chat field by a user before starting the chat.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The Conversation ID this entry is associated with.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsCustomChannelParameters
fields.description: Indicates whether admins can configure custom parameters and parameter mappings for messaging channels. Custom parameters and parameter mappings are used to pass additional information at runtime to Omni-Channel flows. The default value is false . Available in API version 61.0.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsDoubleOptInConsent
fields.description: Indicates whether the channel supports ( true ) the Double Opt-In consent level. The default value is false . If set to true, then capabilitiesSupportsExplicitConsent must also be set to true. This field is optional and isn’t supported for Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging. It's only supported for Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsExplicitConsent
fields.description: Indicates whether the channel supports ( true ) the Explicit Opt-In consent level. This field is optional.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsImplicitConsent
fields.description: Indicates whether the channel supports ( true ) the Implicit Opt-In consent level. This value is required and must always be set to true. The default value is false.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsIsoCountryCode
fields.description: Indicates whether the channel supports ( true ) ISO country codes. The default value is false.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsKeywords
fields.description: Indicates whether the channel supports ( true ) keywords. The default value is false.

fields.name: ConnectedAppOauthLink
fields.description: DO NOT SET OR CHANGE THIS VALUE. This value is automatically generated. This field represents the OAuth link for the external client app (ECA) or connected app if the ConnectedAppType is Partner . This is a string identifier to the ECA or connected app containing the partner Org ID and the consumer ID minus the key prefixes.

fields.name: ConnectedAppType
fields.description: The owner of the external client app (ECA) or connected app used to manage authentication between Salesforce Interaction Service and the Messaging or CCaaS partner’s system.

fields.name: ConsentOwner
fields.description: The system the customer uses to manage consent levels.

fields.name: ConversationVendorInfoId
fields.description: The ConversationChannelDefinition.ConversationVendorInfoId value used to link this record to the ConversationVendorInfo record. For example, 0m8000000000000123.

fields.name: customEventChnlAddrIdField
fields.description: The mapping field that points to the custom field used to point to the ChannelAddressIdentifier field.

fields.name: CustomEventPayloadField
fields.description: The mapping field that points to the custom field used to point to the Payload field in the format <orgNamespace> __ <CustomFieldName> __c. This is the API name of the custom Payload field in the custom platform event. For example, devorg__Payload__c.

fields.name: customEventRecipientField
fields.description: The mapping field that points to the custom field used to point to the Recipient field.

fields.name: CustomEventTypeField
fields.description: The mapping field that points to the custom field used to point to the Platform event type (EventType) field, in the format <orgNamespace> __ <CustomFieldName> __c. This is the API name of the custom EventType field in the custom platform event. For example, devorg__EventType__c.

fields.name: CustomIconId
fields.description: For Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging and Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS, this field represents the name of the status resource image used to identify the channel integration, such as a channel logo. For the best results, set the image size to 50px x 50px and save the image in SVG file format. This field is optional. Available in API version 61.0 and later.

fields.name: CustomPlatformEvent
fields.description: The API name of the custom platform event created for the Interaction Service API in the format <orgNamespace> __ <CustomPlatformEventName> __e. For example, devorg__TestEvent__e.

fields.name: CustomerConnectedAppOauthLink
fields.description: DO NOT SET OR CHANGE THIS VALUE. This value is automatically generated. This field represents the OAuth link for the external client app or connected app created by an admin if the ConnectedAppType is Customer . Available in API version 62.0.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the custom metadata type object in the API in the format <Prefix> _ <ConversationChannelDefinition> , where Prefix matches the prefix you gave to the name of the Interaction Service external client app or connected app. For example, Partner1_ChannelDefinition1, where Partner1 is the prefix and ChannelDefinition1 is the given name.

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknwOptionExposed
fields.description: Indicates whether the partner supports read receipts and delivery receipts for inbound messages ( true ) or whether the partner doesn’t support these inbound acknowledgments and the functionality is hidden from the Salesforce admin in the Messaging settings ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsProgressIndicatorOptExposed
fields.description: Indicates whether the partner supports progress indicators for AI agents ( true ) or whether the partner doesn’t support them and the functionality is hidden from the Salesforce admin in the Messaging settings ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsRoutingWorkResultSupported
fields.description: Indicates whether the Routing Work Result event is sent as a Custom Platform event ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorOptionHidden
fields.description: Indicates whether the partner doesn’t support typing indicators for outbound messages and the functionality is hidden from the Salesforce admin in the Messaging settings ( true ) or whether outbound typing indicators are supported by the partner ( false ). The default value is false , meaning the outbound typing indicator feature is supported by default. To disable the outbound typing indicator feature, set this value to true .

fields.name: IsConferenceSupported
fields.description: Indicates whether the partner supports conferencing for Bring Your Own Channel ( true ), or not ( false ). With conferencing, more than two participants are allowed in a Messaging session. The default is false .

fields.name: IsInboundReceiptsEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the partner supports read receipts and delivery receipts for inbound messages ( true ) or whether the partner doesn’t support these inbound acknowledgements and the functionality is hidden from the Salesforce admin in the Messaging settings ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the Routing Work Result event is sent as a Custom Platform event or not.

fields.name: IsTypingIndicatorDisabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the partner doesn’t support typing indicators for outbound messages and the functionality is hidden from the Salesforce admin in the Messaging settings ( true ) or whether outbound typing indicators are supported by the partner ( false ). The default value is false , meaning the outbound typing indicator feature is supported by default. To disable the outbound typing indicator feature, set this value to true .

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The UI label name for the custom metadata type object in the API. This name appears in several places in the UI, so include the partner channel name for easy identification. For example, Channel Definition 1.

fields.name: MaxParticipantsForCnfrOverride
fields.description: Specifies the limit for how many participants can be in a messaging conference. If set, this field overrides the platform limit for the number of participants in a conference. If not set or if set to a value higher than the messaging platform limit, the limit defaults to the messaging platform limit of how many participants can be in a messaging conference at one time.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix. NamespacePrefix is null if the publisher is Salesforce.

fields.name: RoutingOwner
fields.description: The system the customer uses to manage routing for Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging or Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS.

fields.name: ActorId
fields.description: The ID of the author. The possible values can be null or any ID in the following domain set: BotDefinition LiveChatVisitor MessagingEndUser User

fields.name: ActorName
fields.description: The name of the author sending the message or event.

fields.name: ActorType
fields.description: The author of this entry in the chat history. The valid values include: Agent Bot EndUser Supervisor System

fields.name: ClientDuration
fields.description: The length in milliseconds for the entry. This field is used with voice messages and other applicable use cases. This value may be 0 if not set by the client. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: ClientTimestamp
fields.description: The timestamp sent by the client when it generated the entry. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: ConversationId
fields.description: The MessagingSession ID this entry belongs to.

fields.name: EntryEndTime
fields.description: The timestamp that this entry ended in the chat history. This field is available in API version 48.0 and later.

fields.name: EntryTime
fields.description: The timestamp of this entry in the chat history.

fields.name: EntryTimeMilliSecs
fields.description: The milliseconds value for the time when an entry was received by the server. Note that the related EntryTime field does not provide millisecond accuracy. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: EntryType
fields.description: The type of entry in the chat history. Can be a message ( text ) or an event. The possible values include: Text AdminOptedIn AdminOptedOut BotEscalated ChatbotClosedIdleSession ChatbotEndedChatByAction —Conversation ended by automated action ChatbotEndedTransferNotConfigured —Conversation ended because transfer fail is not configured ChatbotEstablished ChatbotNotEstablished EndUserOptedIn EndUserOptedOut

fields.name: HasAttachments
fields.description: Indicates whether a message has attachments associated with it ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: Message
fields.description: The message or event sent by the author. In ConversationEntry records for enhanced Messaging channels or Messaging for In-App and Web, the Message field is blank due to data storage differences from standard channels.

fields.name: MessageDeliverTime
fields.description: Unused field reserved for future use.

fields.name: MessageIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID for the message. Maximum size is 36 characters.

fields.name: MessageReadTime
fields.description: Unused field reserved for future use.

fields.name: MessageSendTime
fields.description: Unused field reserved for future use.

fields.name: MessageStatus
fields.description: The status of the message sent by the author. The valid values include: Delivered Error Pending Read Sent

fields.name: MessageStatusCode
fields.description: The code associated with a message status. MessageStatusCode is only populated when a message is undeliverable

fields.name: Seq
fields.description: The sequence position of this entry in the chat history.

fields.name: ServerReceivedTimestamp
fields.description: The timestamp recorded when the server received the entry. This is a unique value and is used for ordering. This value can also be referred to as the “transcripted timestamp.” This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: AppType
fields.description: The type of app used by the participant, such as messaging, chatbot, live_message, agent. The nillable property is available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: ConversationId
fields.description: The record ID of the conversation that this participant is part of.

fields.name: JoinedTime
fields.description: The date and time that a participant joined a conversation.

fields.name: LastActiveTime
fields.description: The date and time that a participant was last active during a conversation.

fields.name: LeftTime
fields.description: The date and time that a participant left a conversation.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The autogenerated name of the conversation participants.

fields.name: ParticipantContext
fields.description: An identifier, such as a Facebook page, to add context about this participant.

fields.name: ParticipantEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the record connected to this participant record, such as a Contact, Messaging End User, or User record.

fields.name: ParticipantKey
fields.description: A value that uniquely identifies this participant.

fields.name: ParticipantRole
fields.description: The role of this participant in the conversation, such as Agent, End User, or Supervisor.

fields.name: ActionType
fields.description: Required. Action to take based on the conversation intelligence signal detected during a conversation. Possible values are:

fields.name: ActionValue
fields.description: Action to perform based on the ActionType specified. If ActionType is set to LaunchFlow , this value is the DeveloperName of the flow to be launched. For example, EmailAlert. For all other ActionType values, don’t set this parameter.

fields.name: ConversationChannelId
fields.description: Required. ID ( ChannelAddressIdentifier ) of the Messaging channel or name ( InternalName ) of the Voice channel.

fields.name: Criteria
fields.description: Required. Filter logic applied to the rule conditions (subrules). For example, ((1 AND 2) OR 3). The numbers in the formula are derived from the ConvIntelligenceSignalSubrule.Order value plus 1. For example, filter logic (1 AND 2) is calculated by adding the first condition ( Order =0) with the second condition ( Order =1).

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: API name of the conversation intelligence signal rule.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Required. Indicates whether the conversation intelligence signal rule is active ( true ) or inactive ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: Label
fields.description: Name of the conversation intelligence signal rule.

fields.name: ParticipantRole
fields.description: If Service is set to KeywordMatch, this value determines whether the rule applies to utterances made by reps, customers, or both roles. Possible values are:

fields.name: Service
fields.description: Required. Salesforce- or partner-provided intelligence source. For Salesforce-provided intelligence sources, set this parameter to KeywordMatch . For partner-provided intelligence sources, possible values are: AmazonConnectContactLens

fields.name: ConvIntelligenceSignalRuleId
fields.description: Unique ID of the conversation intelligence signal rule. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: OperandValue
fields.description: Value of the signal type used to determine if the rule condition is met. For example, escalate_level_1.

fields.name: Operator
fields.description: Filter logic operator used to determine if the rule condition is met. Possible values are: Equals GreaterThan LessThan NotEquals

fields.name: Order
fields.description: Order the condition appears in relation to the other conditions in the list, with zero (0) being the first condition listed. If Type is set to Keyword, the maximum value is 24. For all other Type values, the maximum value is 4. This value is used when applying filter logic to the rule.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Type of conversation intelligence signal used by the rule to determine whether to trigger an action. This value depends on the ConvIntelligenceSignalRule.ConversationChannelId and ConvIntelligenceSignalRule.Service values.

fields.name: AllowExistingSessionStatus
fields.description: Indicates whether the message can be sent only at certain times.

fields.name: CommSubscriptionId
fields.description: The ID of the related communication subscription, if applicable. This field is a relationship field that refers to CommSubscription.

fields.name: CompletedDate
fields.description: Date and time when the request completes and all messages associated with the request are sent or failed to be sent.

fields.name: FailedMessageCount
fields.description: The number of messages that failed to be delivered to a messaging user. For example, if a flow sends the message to 50 messaging users and 4 don’t receive the message, this value is 4.

fields.name: FailedMessageErrorReasons
fields.description: The error reason for each of the failed messages. For example, if 4 messages fail to send, this field shows the error reason for each failed message.

fields.name: FailedMessageIdentifiers
fields.description: The IDs of the messages that failed to send. For example, if 4 messages fail to send, this field shows 4 message IDs.

fields.name: FailedMeuPlatformKeys
fields.description: A list of platform keys for messaging end users with messages that failed to send. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: InProgressMessageCount
fields.description: The number of messages in the process of being sent.

fields.name: InProgressMessageIdentifiers
fields.description: A list of IDs of the messages being sent.

fields.name: InProgressMessagingEndUserIds
fields.description: A list of IDs of messaging end users with messages that are being sent. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: InProgressMessagingSessionIds
fields.description: A list of IDs of messaging sessions with messages that are being sent. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: InProgressMeuPlatformKeys
fields.description: A list of platform keys for messaging end users with messages that are being sent. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: MessageDefinition
fields.description: The name of the messaging component being sent. Only active messaging components can be sent.

fields.name: MessageDefinitionParameters
fields.description: A list of parameters used to dynamically construct the message that is being sent. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An auto-generated ID for the request that uses the format MSJ-{00000000}.

fields.name: PendingMessageCount
fields.description: The number of messages that haven’t yet been sent.

fields.name: PendingMessageEndUserIds
fields.description: A list of IDs of the messaging end users with pending messages. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: PendingMeuPlatformKeys
fields.description: A list of platform keys of the messaging end users with pending messages. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: PendingMessageIdentifiers
fields.description: A list of IDs of the pending messages.

fields.name: RequestConsentType
fields.description: Indicates whether the flow applies the consent settings of the messaging end user or the communication subscription.

fields.name: RequestStatus
fields.description: The status of the request.

fields.name: RequestType
fields.description: The type of request.

fields.name: SessionLongevityPreference
fields.description: Indicates whether to end the session after the message is sent.

fields.name: ShouldEnforceChannelConsent
fields.description: Indicates whether the existing Messaging channel consent preferences are applied when determining who receives the message. Setting this value to true is the most common approach. The default value, false , allows you to add custom consent logic—for example, to customize a flow to send the message to both implicitly opted-in users and explicitly opted-in users.

fields.name: SuccessMessageCount
fields.description: The number of messages that were successfully sent to messaging users. Delivery can occur much later than sending, depending on factors such as the connectivity status of the recipient. Delivery is reflected in the messaging session transcript.

fields.name: SuccessMessageIdentifiers
fields.description: A list of IDs of the messages that were sent.

fields.name: SuccessMeuPlatformKeys
fields.description: A list of platform keys for messaging end users with messages that were sent. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

fields.name: TotalMessageCount
fields.description: The number of messages that the related flow attempted to send.

fields.name: AwsAccountKey
fields.description: The 12-digit AWS subaccount ID that’s automatically provisioned for you when Service Cloud Voice was turned on. Available in API version 55.0 and later.

fields.name: AwsRootEmail
fields.description: The email address used by Salesforce to create the root user for the provisioned AWS subaccount when Service Cloud Voice was turned on. Available in API version 55.0 and later.

fields.name: AwsTenantVersion
fields.description: The version number of the SVCTenantStack AWS CloudFormation stack that’s deployed. The stack is deployed in AWS region "us-east-1". Available in API version 55.0 and later.

fields.name: agentSSOSupported
fields.description: If set to true , agents can single sign-on (SSO) into their contact center using Salesforce as the identity provider (IdP). Behind the scenes, Salesforce is used as the SAML IdP in the Single Sign-On connected app for the contact center. If set to false , an IdP other than Salesforce is used or an IdP isn’t used at all. The default value is false .

fields.name: BridgeComponent
fields.description: The Lightning component used to communicate between the telephony or messaging system and other Lightning components.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsIntelligence
fields.description: If set to true , Salesforce ingests real-time signals sent from a partner telephony system. If set to false , Salesforce doesn't ingest real-time intelligence signals from a partner telephony system. The default value is false . Available in API version 59.0 and later.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsKeyProvisioning
fields.description: If set to true , Salesforce has permission to automatically provision public keys to contact centers. The default value is false .

fields.name: CapabiltiesSupportsMultiVendorConfig
fields.description: Indicates whether multiple Connector URLs are supported ( true ) or not supported ( false ) for contact centers. The default value is false .

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsPartnerPhoneNumbers
fields.description: If set to true , Salesforce has permission to access relevant agents’ phone numbers while configuring contact center channels. The default value is false .

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsQueueManagement
fields.description: If set to true , support queue management. The default value is false . Available in API version 56.0 and later.

fields.name: CapabilitiesSupportsUnifiedRouting (Beta)
fields.description: Indicates whether unified routing is supported ( true ) or not supported ( false ) for inbound voice calls in voice channels. The default value is false . Once this value is set to true , it can’t be changed to false .

fields.name: ClientAuthMode
fields.description: The client authentication mode.

fields.name: ConnectorUrl
fields.description: The URL that hosts your Service Cloud Voice or Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS connector. This value could be a Visualforce page or a public URL.

fields.name: customConfig
fields.description: The foreign key to the CustomEntityDefinition, which contains partner-specific custom settings. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: CustomIconId
fields.description: ID of the static resource used to identify the contact center integration, such as a Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS) provider logo. The static resource must be in SVG format. This field is optional. Available in API version 62.0 and later.

fields.name: CustomLoginUrl
fields.description: The URL that hosts your telephony system or CCaaS system login page.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API.

fields.name: IsTaxCompliant
fields.description: Indicates whether the Amazon tax settings for the AWS subaccount provisioned for Service Cloud Voice have been confirmed ( true ). The default value is false . Available in API version 55.0 and later. Applies to the following implementation: Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect

fields.name: einsteinConversationInsights Supported
fields.description: If set to true , Einstein Conversation Insights is turned on. The default value is false . Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: integrationClass
fields.description: The foreign key to the partner Apex class implementing supported interfaces. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: IntegrationClassName
fields.description: Deprecated in API version 53.0. Don't set this field. Instead, use integrationClass .

fields.name: keyProvisioningSupported
fields.description: If set to true , key provisioning and renewal are automated. The default value is false . Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the master label ( MasterLabel ) in the user interface.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The partner vendor's display name as it appears in the UI. This name appears in several places in the UI, so include the partner vendor name for easy identification. For Service Cloud Voice, this label also represents the telephony provider name in the contact center record.

fields.name: namedCredential
fields.description: A sample-named credential that can be used for Apex callouts to the partner system. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: namedCredentialSupported
fields.description: If set to true and if supported by the partner telephony, then prescriptive setup through a named credential is enabled allowing server-to-server communication with a named credential. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that’s associated with this object.

fields.name: partnerContactCenterList Supported
fields.description: If set to true , enables the customer to select one contact center from a list of multiple contact centers to connect with Salesforce. The default value is false . Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: partnerPhoneNumbersSupported
fields.description: If set to true , displays a list of phone numbers used to create contact center channels. The default value is false . Available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: partnerTransfer DestinationsSupported
fields.description: If set to true , allows Salesforce to fetch contact center queues so that Salesforce and contact center queues can be mapped. The default value is false . Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: ServerAuthMode
fields.description: Deprecated in API 53.0. Server authentication mode. Set this value to None .

fields.name: TelephonySettingsComponent
fields.description: The name of the Lightning Web Component (LWC) that is used to display additional agent settings in the Omni-Channel widget. This value is in the format mynamespace:componentName , where mynamespace is the namespace associated with the Service Cloud Voice package that was created, and componentName is the FQDN of the Lightning component.

fields.name: ​​universalCallRecording AccessSupported​​​​​​​ ​
fields.description: If set to true , Universal Call Recording Access is turned on. The default value is false .

fields.name: userSyncingSupported
fields.description: If set to true , supports automated user syncing whenever a user is added to or removed from a contact center. The default value is false . Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: vendorType
fields.description: The Service Cloud feature the partner vendor supports. Possible values are: Amazon_Connect — For Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect. BringYourOwnChannelPartner — For Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging. Available in API version 60.0 and later. BringYourOwnContactCenter — For Bring Your Own Channel for Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS). Available in API version 60.0 and later. ServiceCloudVoicePartner — For Service Cloud Voice with Partner Telephony or Service Cloud Voice with Partner Telephony from Amazon Connect. If you're inserting or updating the record, this field must be set. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the record in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This field is automatically generated but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: This picklist contains the following fully-supported languages: Chinese (Simplified): zh_CN Chinese (Traditional): zh_TW Danish: da Dutch: nl_NL English: en_US Finnish: fi French: fr German: de Italian: it Japanese: ja Korean: ko Norwegian: no Portuguese (Brazil): pt_BR Russian: ru Spanish: es Spanish (Mexico): es_MX Spanish (Mexico) defaults to Spanish for customer-defined translations. Swedish: sv Thai: th The Salesforce user interface is fully translated to Thai, but Help is in English.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Primary label for the CORS allowlist entry.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: For managed packages, this field is the namespace prefix assigned to the package. For unmanaged packages, this field is blank.

fields.name: UrlPattern
fields.description: The origin URL pattern must include the HTTPS protocol (unless you’re using your localhost) and a domain name, and can include a port. The wildcard character (*) is supported and must be in front of a second-level domain name. For example, https://*.example.com adds all subdomains of example.com to the allowlist.

fields.name: CouponCode
fields.description: Coupon code for the coupon. A buyer can use the coupon code to qualify for a promotion.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the coupon.

fields.name: EndDateTime
fields.description: The end date and time when the coupon is no longer active.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the coupon.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the owner of this coupon.

fields.name: PromotionId
fields.description: ID of the promotion associated with the coupon.

fields.name: RedemptionLimitAllBuyers
fields.description: Number of times this coupon can be used in total. This field is available in API version 61.0 and later.

fields.name: RedemptionLimitPerBuyer
fields.description: Number of times this coupon can be used per customer. This field is available in API version 61.0 and later.

fields.name: StartDateTime
fields.description: The start date and time when the coupon is active.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the coupon.

fields.name: Buyer
fields.description: Information about the buyer. Can be any buyer-specific information.

fields.name: CouponId
fields.description: ID of the redeemed coupon.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Salesforce generated coupon code, such as CCR-000000002. Can’t be edited.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who created the coupon code redemption.

fields.name: Transaction
fields.description: ID of the transaction where the coupon code was redeemed. Must be a valid cart ID.

fields.name: AppType
fields.description: Read-only field that indicates which Salesforce application generated the credit memo.

fields.name: Balance
fields.description: Amount of the credit memo that's available for allocation.

fields.name: BillToContactId
fields.description: Inherited from the account’s Bill to Account field.

fields.name: BillingAccountId
fields.description: The customer account associated with this credit memo.

fields.name: CreationMode
fields.description: Indicates whether the credit memo originated in Salesforce or an external system.

fields.name: CreditDate
fields.description: The date when the credit memo was posted.

fields.name: CreditMemoNumber
fields.description: A credit memo numbering alternative to DocumentNumber, containing a number in a format of your choice. Credit memo numbering is optional.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the credit memo.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the credit memo.

fields.name: DocumentNumber
fields.description: System-generated number for organizing financial documents, for example DOC-0000123.

fields.name: EffectiveDate
fields.description: Represents the effective date of the credit memo. If this field is empty, the credit date is used. For reporting purposes only; this field drives no other logic.

fields.name: ExternalReference
fields.description: Contains an external system’s ID for the credit memo.

fields.name: ExternalReferenceDataSource
fields.description: Contains the name of the external system that also contains the credit memo.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it's possible that this record was only referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: NetCreditsApplied
fields.description: Represents the total difference between the credit applied to and credit unapplied from the invoice.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user who owns a credit memo record.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the record that this credit memo was generated from. For example, the order, order summary, or invoice.

fields.name: SourceAction
fields.description: Indicates which Salesforce API created the credit memo.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Status of the credit memo.

fields.name: TotalAdjustmentAmount
fields.description: Sum of TotalAmount values for the credit memo’s adjustment lines.

fields.name: TotalAdjustmentAmountWithTax
fields.description: The sum of the credit memo’s adjustment line amounts, including tax.

fields.name: TotalAdjustmentTaxAmount
fields.description: The sum of the credit memo’s adjustment line tax. Adjustment line balances are excluded.

fields.name: TotalAmount
fields.description: Sum of the credit memo’s TotalLineAmount and TotalAdjustmentAmount .

fields.name: TotalAmountWithTax
fields.description: Total credit memo amount, with tax included.

fields.name: TotalChargeAmount
fields.description: Sum of TotalAmount values for the credit memo’s charge lines.

fields.name: TotalChargeAmountWithTax
fields.description: The sum of the credit memo’s charge line amounts, including tax.

fields.name: TotalChargeTaxAmount
fields.description: This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

fields.name: TotalCreditAmountApplied
fields.description: Credit memo amount that's been applied to invoices.

fields.name: TotalCreditAmountUnapplied
fields.description: Credit memo amount that's been unapplied from invoices.

fields.name: TotalTaxAmount
fields.description: Sum of TotalAmount values for the credit memo’s tax lines.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: Buyer’s address.

fields.name: City
fields.description: Buyer's city.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: Buyer's country.

fields.name: CreditMemoAddressGroupNumber
fields.description: An auto-generated number, such as 0000123, that represents the address group.

fields.name: CreditMemoId
fields.description: ID of the credit memo associated with the address group.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the credit memo.

fields.name: GeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: The accuracy rating for the geocode of the address group. An accuracy rating contains information about the location of a latitude and longitude.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this address group.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this address group.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the buyer’s address.

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: Longitude of the buyer’s address.

fields.name: PostalCode
fields.description: The buyer’s postal code or ZIP code.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The buyer’s state.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The buyer’s street number and name.

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: The amount of the credit memo that was applied to or unapplied from the invoice.

fields.name: AppliedDate
fields.description: The date when the credit memo was applied. If the credit memo invoice application's type is Unapplied , this value is inherited from the Applied date of the credit memo referenced in the AssociatedLineId.

fields.name: AssociatedLineId
fields.description: For a credit memo invoice application that represents an unapplied credit memo, this field shows the original credit memo invoice application.

fields.name: CreditMemoBalance
fields.description: The balance of a credit memo after a credit memo is applied or unapplied. This field is a snapshot of the credit memo's balance after the action. It isn't updated after further changes to the credit memo balance.

fields.name: CreditMemoId
fields.description: The credit memo that was applied or unapplied.

fields.name: CreditMemoInvoiceNumber
fields.description: Number of the invoice to which a credit memo is applied.

fields.name: Date
fields.description: Date when the credit memo amount was applied to the invoice.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the credit applied to an invoice.

fields.name: EffectiveDate
fields.description: The effective date of the application or unapplication of credit. Users can provide this value when applying or unapplying the credit memo. This field is optional and provided only for reporting purposes. It doesn't affect the credit memo invoice application's other fields.

fields.name: HasBeenUnapplied
fields.description: Shows whether this credit memo application has been unapplied from the target invoice.

fields.name: ImpactAmount
fields.description: The net adjustment to the invoice's balance after a credit memo is applied or unapplied. If a credit memo was applied, this value is the negative version of the credit memo invoice application's Amount . If a credit memo was unapplied, this value is the positive version of the credit memo invoice application's Amount .

fields.name: InvoiceBalance
fields.description: The balance of the credit memo after a credit memo is applied or unapplied. This field is a snapshot of the credit memo's balance after the action. It isn't updated after further changes to the credit memo balance.

fields.name: InvoiceId
fields.description: ID of the invoice to which credit is applied.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Indicates whether the credit memo line application was generated because of an apply action (application) or an unapply action (unapplication).

fields.name: UnappliedDate
fields.description: The date when this application was unapplied from the target invoice.

fields.name: AdjustmentAmount
fields.description: Amount of this credit memo line item if its type is Adjustment.

fields.name: AdjustmentAmountWithTax
fields.description: Sum of the adjustment amount and the adjustment tax amount.

fields.name: AdjustmentTaxAmount
fields.description: Amount of the tax related to the adjustment amount.

fields.name: BillingAddressId
fields.description: ID of the billing address related to this credit memo line.

fields.name: ChargeAmount
fields.description: Amount of this credit memo line item if its type is Charge.

fields.name: ChargeAmountWithTax
fields.description: Sum of the adjustment amount and the adjustment tax amount.

fields.name: ChargeTaxAmount
fields.description: Amount of the tax related to the charge amount.

fields.name: CreditMemoId
fields.description: ID of the parent credit memo.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the credit memo line.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the credit memo line.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: For credit memos made from a time-based service, the end date of the line item being credited.

fields.name: LineAmount
fields.description: Amount of the credit memo line.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the credit memo line.

fields.name: Product2Id
fields.description: The product or service being credited in the credit memo line.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityItemId
fields.description: The order product or invoice line corresponding to this credit memo line.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityItemType
fields.description: The type of transaction that generated the credit memo line.

fields.name: ReferenceEntityItemTypeCode
fields.description: The type of object that generated the credit memo line.

fields.name: RelatedLineId
fields.description: The credit memo line related to this line item.

fields.name: ShippingAddressId
fields.description: The ID of the shipping address.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: For credit memo lines generated from a time-based service, the first date of the billing for the service.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: State of the credit memo line. Inherited from the credit memo.

fields.name: TaxAmount
fields.description: Total tax for the credit memo.

fields.name: TaxCode
fields.description: The code used to calculate the tax rate for the invoice line.

fields.name: TaxDocumentNumber
fields.description: The document number that tracks taxes calculated for this credit memo line.

fields.name: TaxEffectiveDate
fields.description: The date used to calculate the credit memo line’s TaxAmount .

fields.name: TaxName
fields.description: User-defined name for applied tax.

fields.name: TaxRate
fields.description: Percentage value used for calculating tax.

fields.name: TotalAmount
fields.description: The total amount of the credit memo line before any applicable tax.

fields.name: TotalAmountWithTax
fields.description: Total amount of tax for this credit memo line, with tax included. Sum of TotalAmount and TaxAmount.

fields.name: TaxStatus
fields.description: Tracks whether the taxes were calculated for this credit memo line.

fields.name: TaxTransactionNumber
fields.description: Tracks the transaction number of the tax calculated for this credit memo line. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Subscription Management is enabled.

fields.name: TaxTreatmentId
fields.description: The ID of the tax treatment for the credit memo line.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of transaction for the invoice line.

fields.name: CrisisType
fields.description: Required. The type or category of crisis.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The crisis description.

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The date the crisis ended.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. The crisis record name.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who currently owns this record. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create operation.

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: Required. The date the crisis started.

fields.name: JobType
fields.description: The type of the associated scheduled job. The following are the available job types. Use the job type value when querying for a specific job type. 1 —Data Export 3 —Dashboard Refresh 4 —Reporting Snapshot 6 —Scheduled Flow 7 —Scheduled Apex 8 —Report Run 9 —Batch Job A —Reporting Notification

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the associated scheduled job.

fields.name: CronExpression
fields.description: The cron expression used to initiate the schedule.

fields.name: CronJobDetailId
fields.description: The ID of the CronJobDetail record containing more details about this scheduled job.

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: The date and time when the job either finished or will finish.

fields.name: NextFireTime
fields.description: The next date and time the job is scheduled to run. null if the job is not scheduled to run again.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: Owner of the job.

fields.name: PreviousFireTime
fields.description: The most recent date and time the job ran. null if the job has not run before current local time.

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: The date and time when the most recent iteration of the scheduled job started.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The current state of the job. The job state is managed by the system. Possible values are: WAITING —The job is waiting for execution. ACQUIRED —The job has been picked up by the system and is about to execute. EXECUTING —The job is executing. COMPLETE —The trigger has fired and is not scheduled to fire again. ERROR —The trigger definition has an error. DELETED —The job has been deleted. PAUSED —A job can have this state during patch and major releases. After the release has finished, the job state is automatically set to WAITING or another state. BLOCKED —Execution of a second instance of the job is attempted while one instance is running. This state lasts until the first job instance is completed. PAUSED_BLOCKED —A job has this state due to a release occurring. When the release has finished and no other instance of the job is running, the job’s status is set to another state.

fields.name: TimesTriggered
fields.description: The number of times this job has been triggered.

fields.name: TimeZoneSidKey
fields.description: Returns the timezone ID. For example, America/Los_Angeles .

fields.name: CryptoWalletGroupId
fields.description: The CryptoWalletGroup ID.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate is not null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the record.

fields.name: ProductCategoryId
fields.description: The ID of the category.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Specifies if CryptoProdCatgWalletGroup is active and functional, or inactive and disabled.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Determines whether the list of wallets is for minting allowlist or for executing an airdrop.

fields.name: CanAccessCamera
fields.description: Indicates whether this CspTrustedSite can access the user’s camera. The default value is false .

fields.name: CanAccessMicrophone
fields.description: Indicates whether this CspTrustedSite can access the user’s microphone. The default value is false .

fields.name: Context
fields.description: Declares the scope of the CSP directives for this trusted URL.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of the trusted URL. Limit: 255 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The developer name of the trusted URL.

fields.name: EndpointUrl
fields.description: The URL for this CspTrustedSite.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this CspTrustedSite is active.

fields.name: IsApplicableToConnectSrc
fields.description: Indicates whether Lightning components, third-party APIs, and WebSocket connections can load URLs using script interfaces from this trusted URL.

fields.name: IsApplicableToFontSrc
fields.description: Indicates whether Lightning components, third-party APIs, and WebSocket connections can load fonts from this trusted URL.

fields.name: IsApplicableToFrameSrc
fields.description: Indicates whether Lightning components, third-party APIs, and WebSocket connections can load resources contained in <iframe> elements from this trusted URL.

fields.name: IsApplicableToImgSrc
fields.description: Indicates whether Lightning components, third-party APIs, and WebSocket connections can load images from this trusted URL.

fields.name: IsApplicableToMediaSrc
fields.description: Indicates whether Lightning components, third-party APIs, and WebSocket connections can load audio and video from this trusted URL.

fields.name: IsApplicableToStyleSrc
fields.description: Indicates whether Lightning components can load style sheets from this trusted URL.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language for the trusted URL.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Master label for this trusted URL.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: Namespace prefix for this trusted URL.

fields.name: BlockedUri
fields.description: The full string of the blocked resource. If the call to the blocked resource used a URL, BLOCKED_URI is the full URL. Or,for violations with a DIRECTIVE of script-src directives, inline or eval .

fields.name: BlockedUriDomain
fields.description: If BLOCKED_URI is a URL, the domain for that URL. To allow resources to be loaded from the BLOCKED_URI , BLOCKED_URI_DOMAIN is the endpointUrl value to add or update in the CspTrustedSite Metadata API.

fields.name: ColumnNumber
