fields.description: The column number in the document or worker script at which the violation occurred. This value is relevant only when DIRECTIVE is script-src .

fields.name: Context
fields.description: The content security policy (CSP) context for the request. The CSP context controls which pages can load content from a CspTrustedSite .

fields.name: Directive
fields.description: The CSP directive that blocked the resource request.

fields.name: Disposition
fields.description: The CSP violation handling instruction for the user agent at the time of the violation.

fields.name: LineNumber
fields.description: The line number in the document or worker script at which the violation occurred. This value is relevant only when DIRECTIVE is script-src . For those violations, use this value with COLUMN_NUMBER to identify the location of the violation.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID.

fields.name: ResourceSample
fields.description: A sample of the resource that caused the violation, usually the first 40 characters, or the empty string.

fields.name: Source
fields.description: The page where this CSP violation originated. For example, if your CSP policy prevented an image from loading on a Visualforce page, SOURCE contains the URL of that page.

fields.name: SourceFile
fields.description: The URL of the script in which the violation occurred. If the violation didn’t occur in a script, SOURCE_FILE is null.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT.

fields.name: UniqueIdentifier
fields.description: A string identifier for the CSP violation.

fields.name: ConversionRate
fields.description: Required. Conversion rate of this currency type against the corporate currency.

fields.name: DecimalPlaces
fields.description: Required. For this currency, specifies the number of digits to the right of the decimal point, such as zero ( 0 ) for JPY or 2 for USD.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this currency type is active ( true ) or not ( false ). Inactive currency types do not appear in picklists in the user interface. Label is Active . This field defaults to false if no value is provided when updating or inserting a record.

fields.name: IsCorporate
fields.description: Indicates whether this currency type is the corporate currency ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Corporate Currency . All other currency conversion rates are applied against this corporate currency. If a currency is already defined as the corporate currency in the user interface, it can't be unset. When a non-corporate currency is set to a corporate currency, the system reconfigures all conversion rates based on the new corporate currency.

fields.name: IsoCode
fields.description: Required. ISO code of the currency. Must be one of the valid alphabetic, three-letter currency ISO codes defined by the ISO 4217 standard, such as USD , GBP , or JPY . Must be unique within your organization. Label is Currency ISO Code .

fields.name: DataSourceChannelName
fields.description: The name of the associated communication channel, such as Web, Email, Chat, or Voice.

fields.name: DataSourceChannelType
fields.description: Specifies the channel type as standard or custom.

fields.name: IsDataProcessingPaused
fields.description: Indicates whether data processing for the channel is temporarily paused ( true ). Use this field to control channel operations without deactivating the channel.

fields.name: IsEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the channel is active for processing data ( true ).

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: Date and time when the current user last viewed or modified this record, a record related to this record, or a list view. If this value is null, the current user has never viewed or modified a record related to this object.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: Date and time when the current user last viewed or modified this record. If this value is null, the current user has never viewed or modified this record.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the Customer Experience Intelligence Transformer Setup record.

fields.name: ProcessingStartDate
fields.description: The date to start processing data in the specified communication channel.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The ID of the parent entity that this branding applies to. The parent entity can be an Experience Cloud site, organization, topic, or reputation level. The branding applies to the entity that the ParentId references. For example, if the ParentId references a network ID, the branding applies to that Experience Cloud site only, and if the ParentId references an organization ID, the branding applies to the organization that it is accessed through, and so on. Label is Branded Entity ID .

fields.name: AssetCategory
fields.description: Values include: MotifZeronaryColor —The background color for the header. Label is Zeronary motif color . If this CustomBrandAsset is for a network, this is the header color for the network. If it is for an org, this is the header color when users access the Salesforce mobile app. MotifPrimaryColor —The color used for the active tab. Label is Primary motif color . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. MotifSecondaryColor —The color used for the top borders of lists and tables. Label is Secondary motif color . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. MotifTertiaryColor —The background color for section headers on edit and detail pages. Label is Tertiary motif color . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. MotifQuaternaryColor —If this CustomBrandAsset is for a network, this is the background color for network pages. If it is for an org, this is the background color on a splash page. Label is Quaternary motif color . MotifZeronaryComplementColor —Font color used with zeronaryColor . Label is Zeronary motif colors complement color . MotifPrimaryComplementColor —Font color used with primaryColor . Label is Primary motif colors complement color . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. MotifTertiaryComplementColor —Font color used with tertiaryColor . Label is Tertiary motif colors complement color . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. MotifQuaternaryComplementColor —Font color used with quaternaryColor . Label is Quaternary motif colors complement color . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. PageHeader —An image that appears on the header of the pages. Can be an .html, .gif, .jpg, or .png file. Label is Page Header . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. PageFooter —An image that appears on the footer of the pages. Must be an .html file. Label is Page Footer . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. LoginFooterText —The text that appears in the footer of the login page. Label is Footer text displayed on the login page . Not used for the Salesforce mobile app branding. LoginLogoImageId —The logo that appears on the login page for external users. In the Salesforce mobile app, this logo also appears on the Experience Cloud site splash page. Label is Logo image displayed on the login page . LargeLogoImageId —Only used for the Salesforce mobile app. The logo that appears on the splash page when you start the Salesforce mobile app. Label is Large logo image . SmallLogoImageId —Only used for the Salesforce mobile app. The logo that appears on the publisher in the Salesforce mobile app. Label is Small logo image . StaticLogoImageURL —The logo that appears on the login page for external users. Label is Static logo image url . LoginQuaternaryColor —The background color that appears on the Experience Cloud site login page for external users. Label is Login background color . LoginRightFrameUrl —The URL to the contents that appears on right side of the Experience Cloud site login page for external users. Label is Login right frame url . LogoAssetId —Navigation tile menu item images. Label is Logo asset image . LoginPrimaryColor —The background color of the login button. Label is Login primary color . LoginBackgroundImageUrl —The path to the image URL that appears as the background on the Experience Cloud site’s login page. Label is Background image url . LargeLogoAssetId —Navigational topic images. Label is Large logo asset image . MediumLogoAssetId —Featured topic images. Label is Medium logo asset image .

fields.name: AssetSourceId
fields.description: ID of the document uploaded to the Documents folder if the value of AssetCategory is: PageHeader PageFooter LoginLogoImageId LargeLogoImageId SmallLogoImageId ID of the content asset if the value of the AssetCategory is: LogoAssetId LargeLogoAssetId MediumLogoAssetId

fields.name: CustomBrandId
fields.description: ID of the associated CustomBrand .

fields.name: ForeignKeyAssetId
fields.description: This field was removed in API version 41.0, and is available in earlier versions for backward compatibility only. Use AssetSourceId instead. ID of the document used if the value of AssetCategory is PageHeader , PageFooter , or LoginLogoImageId .

fields.name: TextAsset
fields.description: Text used if the AssetCategory is LoginFooterText .

fields.name: Color
fields.description: The color variation in hexadecimal value format, for example #FF0000 .

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: The currency ISO code allowed by the organization. Possible value is: USD —U.S. Dollar

fields.name: CustomFieldDisplayId
fields.description: The ID of the custom field display that this variation is associated with.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the custom field display value.

fields.name: PickListApiValue
fields.description: The API name of the color variation picklist value, for example, red_c .

fields.name: LinkUrl
fields.description: Required. The URL for the resource. Specify up to 1,000 characters.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Required. The name of the resource. Specify up to 100 characters.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The ID of the custom help section the item belongs to.

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: Required. The order of the item within the custom section. Valid values are 1 through 15.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the custom help section in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters and must be unique in your organization. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. The label corresponds to section title in the user interface. Limit: 80 characters. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance slows down while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Required. Language of the label. Possible values are: da (Danish) de (German) en_US (English) es (Spanish) es_MX (Spanish (Mexico)) fi (Finnish) fr (French) it (Italian) ja (Japanese) ko (Korean) nl_NL (Dutch) no (Norwegian) pt_BR (Portuguese (Brazil)) ru (Russian) sv (Swedish) th (Thai) zh_CN (Chinese (Simplified)) zh_TW (Chinese (Traditional))

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Required. The name of the resource. Specify up to 100 characters.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A text description of the header field’s purpose.

fields.name: HeaderFieldName
fields.description: Name of the header field. The name must contain at least one alphanumeric character or underscore. It can also include: ! # $ % & ' * + - . ^ _ ` | ~

fields.name: HeaderFieldValue
fields.description: A formula that resolves to the value for the header. The values in the formula must evaluate to a string. If the formula resolves to null and an empty string, the header isn’t sent.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the custom HTTP header is available to use.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the entity that the custom HTTP header is related to.

fields.name: ChannelDefinitionId
fields.description: Specifies the ConversationChannelDefinition for the custom channel.

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknowledgementEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the Salesforce admin has enabled read receipts and delivery receipts for inbound messages in the Messaging settings ( true ) or whether the admin hasn’t enabled these inbound acknowledgments ( false ). The default value is false , meaning inbound acknowledgments are disabled by default even if supported by the partner.

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsProgressIndicatorEnabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the Salesforce admin has enabled AI agent progress indicators in the Messaging settings ( true ) or whether the admin hasn’t enabled progress indicators ( false ). The default value is false , meaning progress indicators for AI agents are disabled by default even if supported by the partner.

fields.name: EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorDisabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the Salesforce admin has enabled typing indicators for outbound messages in the Messaging settings ( false ) or whether the admin hasn’t enabled outbound typing indicators ( true ). The default value is false , meaning the outbound typing indicators are enabled by default.

fields.name: HasInboundReceipts
fields.description: Indicates whether the Salesforce admin has enabled read receipts and delivery receipts for inbound messages in the Messaging settings ( true ) or whether the admin hasn’t enabled these inbound acknowledgments ( false ). The default value is false , meaning inbound acknowledgments are disabled by default even if supported by the partner.

fields.name: HasTypingIndicator
fields.description: Indicates whether the Salesforce admin has enabled typing indicators for outbound messages in the Messaging settings ( true ) or whether the admin hasn’t enabled outbound typing indicators ( false ). The default value is true , meaning the outbound typing indicator feature is enabled by default if supported by the partner. To disable the outbound typing indicator feature, set this value to false .

fields.name: MessagingChannelId
fields.description: Specifies the Messaging Channel ID for the custom channel. This field is unique within your organization.

fields.name: CustomNotifTypeName
fields.description: Specifies a notification type name. The notification type name is unique within your organization. The notification type name isn’t namespaced, so it can’t be duplicated across installed packages. Maximum number of characters: 80.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Specifies a general description of the notification type, which is displayed with the notification type name. Maximum number of characters: 255.

fields.name: Desktop
fields.description: Indicates whether the desktop delivery channel is enabled ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: Specifies the API name of the notification type.

fields.name: IsSlack
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Specifies the language of the custom notification type. The value for this field is the language value of the org.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Specifies the notification type label.

fields.name: Mobile
fields.description: Indicates whether the mobile delivery channel is enabled ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false .

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: Specifies the namespace of the notification type, if installed with a managed package.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description of the custom permission. Limit: 255 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the custom permission in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters and must be unique in your organization. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. The label corresponds to Name in the user interface. Limit: 80 characters. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: IsLicensed
fields.description: When enabled (true) indicates that the appropriate Salesforce license is required before accessing the permission. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: IsProtected
fields.description: Indicates whether the custom permission is protected ( true ) or not ( false ). Protected components that have been installed in other organizations can’t be linked to or referenced by components created in the subscriber organization. A developer can delete a protected component contained in a managed package in a future release of the package without worrying about failing installations. However, after a component is marked as unprotected and is released globally, the developer can’t delete it. The default value is false . This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the custom permission. Valid values are: Chinese (Simplified): zh_CN Chinese (Traditional): zh_TW Danish: da Dutch: nl_NL English: en_US Finnish: fi French: fr German: de Italian: it Japanese: ja Korean: ko Norwegian: no Portuguese (Brazil): pt_BR Russian: ru Spanish: es Spanish (Mexico): es_MX Spanish (Mexico) defaults to Spanish for customer-defined translations. Swedish: sv Thai: th The Salesforce user interface is fully translated to Thai, but Help is in English.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: The custom permission label, which corresponds to Label in the user interface. Limit: 80 characters.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: CustomPermissionId
fields.description: The ID of the custom permission that requires the permission that’s specified in RequiredCustomPermissionId .

fields.name: RequiredCustomPermissionId
fields.description: The ID of the custom permission that must be enabled when CustomPermissionId is enabled.

fields.name: CustomerStatusType
fields.description: The status of the customer account.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Required. Name of this customer.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who owns the record.

fields.name: PartyId
fields.description: Required. Represents the individual object related to this customer record.

fields.name: TotalLifeTimeValue
fields.description: The total revenue amount gained from this customer.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: The compound form of the address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The city where a company is physically located. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: CompanyCurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: The code used to represent a company’s local currency. This data is provided by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and is based on their three-letter currency codes. For example, USD is the ISO code for United States Dollar. Maximum size is 3 characters.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The country where a company is physically located. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: CountryAccessCode
fields.description: The required code for international calls. Maximum size is 4 characters.

fields.name: CurrencyCode
fields.description: The currency in which the company’s sales volume is expressed. The full list of values can be found at the Optimizer Resources page maintained by Dun & Bradstreet. Maximum size is 4 characters.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A brief description of the company, which may include information about its history, its products and services, and its influence on a particular industry. Maximum size is 32000 characters.

fields.name: DomesticUltimateBusinessName
fields.description: The primary name of the Domestic Ultimate, which is the highest ranking subsidiary, specified by country, within an organization’s corporate structure. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: DomesticUltimateDunsNumber
fields.description: The D-U-N-S Number for the Domestic Ultimate, which is the highest ranking subsidiary, specified by country, within an organization’s corporate structure. Maximum size is 9 characters.

fields.name: DunsNumber
fields.description: The Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S) number is a unique, nine-digit number assigned to every business location in the Dun & Bradstreet database that has a unique, separate, and distinct operation. D-U-N-S numbers are used by industries and organizations around the world as a global standard for business identification and tracking. Maximum size is 9 characters.

fields.name: EmployeeQuantityGrowthRate
fields.description: The yearly growth rate of the number of employees in a company expressed as a decimal percentage. The data includes the total employee growth rate for the past two years.

fields.name: EmployeesHere
fields.description: The number of employees at a specified location, such as a branch location. Maximum size is 15 characters.

fields.name: EmployeesHereReliability
fields.description: The reliability of the EmployeesHere figure. Available values include: 0—Actual number 1—Low 2—Estimated (for all records) 3—Modeled (for non-US records)

fields.name: EmployeesTotal
fields.description: The total number of employees in the company, including all subsidiary and branch locations. This data is only available on records that have a value of Headquarters/Parent in the LocationStatus field. Maximum size is 15 characters.

fields.name: EmployeesTotalReliability
fields.description: The reliability of the EmployeesTotal figure. Available values include: 0—Actual number 1—Low 2—Estimated (for all records) 3—Modeled (for non-US records) A blank value indicates this data is unavailable.

fields.name: FamilyMembers
fields.description: The total number of family members, worldwide, within an organization, including the Global Ultimate, its subsidiaries (if any), and its branches (if any). Maximum size is 5 characters.

fields.name: Fax
fields.description: The company’s facsimile number.

fields.name: FifthNaics
fields.description: An additional NAICS code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: FifthNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters.

fields.name: FifthSic
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: FifthSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: FifthSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: FifthSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: FipsMsaCode
fields.description: The Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) and the Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) codes identify the organization’s location. The MSA codes are defined by the US Office of Management and Budget. Maximum size is 5 characters.

fields.name: FipsMsaDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s FIPS MSA code. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: FortuneRank
fields.description: The numeric value of the company’s Fortune 1000 ranking. A null or blank value means that the company isn’t ranked as a Fortune 1000 company.

fields.name: FourthNaics
fields.description: An additional NAICS code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: FourthNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters.

fields.name: FourthSic
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: FourthSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: FourthSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: FourthSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: GeoCodeAccuracy
fields.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. Available values include: A – Non-US rooftop accuracy B – Block level C – Places the address in the correct city D – Rooftop level I – Street intersection M – Mailing address level N – Not matched P – PO BOX location S – Street level T – Census tract level Z – ZIP code level 0 (zero)– Geocode could not be assigned

fields.name: GlobalUltimateBusinessName
fields.description: The primary name of the Global Ultimate, which is the highest entity within an organization’s corporate structure and may oversee branches and subsidiaries. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: GlobalUltimateDunsNumber
fields.description: The D-U-N-S Number of the Global Ultimate, which is the highest entity within an organization’s corporate structure and may oversee branches and subsidiaries. Maximum size is 9 characters.

fields.name: GlobalUltimateTotalEmployees
fields.description: The total number of employees at the Global Ultimate, which is the highest entity within an organization’s corporate structure and may oversee branches and subsidiaries. Maximum size is 15 characters.

fields.name: ImportExportAgent
fields.description: Identifies whether a business imports goods or services, exports goods or services, and/or is an agent for goods. Available values include: A—Importer/exporter/agent B—Importer/exporter C—Importer D—Importer/agent E—Exporter/agent F—Agent (keeps no inventory and does not take title goods) G—None or data not available H—Exporter

fields.name: IncludedInSnP500
fields.description: A true or false value. If true , the company is listed in the S&P 500 Index. If false , the company isn’t listed in the S&P 500 Index.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: Used with longitude to specify a precise location, which is then used to assess the Geocode Accuracy. Maximum size is 11 characters.

fields.name: LegalStatus
fields.description: Identifies the legal structure of an organization.

fields.name: LocationStatus
fields.description: Identifies the organizational status of a company. Available values are Single location , Headquarters/Parent , and Branch . Available values include: 0—Single location (no other entities report to the business) 1—Headquarters/parent (branches and/or subsidiaries report to the business) 2—Branch (secondary location to a headquarters location)

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: Used with latitude to specify a precise location, which is then used to assess the Geocode Accuracy. Maximum size is 11 characters.

fields.name: MailingAddress
fields.description: The compound form of the mailing address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

fields.name: MailingCity
fields.description: The city where a company has its mail delivered. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: MailingCountry
fields.description: The country where a company has its mail delivered. Maximum size is 40 characters.

fields.name: MailingPostalCode
fields.description: The postal code that a company uses on its mailing address. Maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: MailingState
fields.description: The state where a company has its mail delivered. Maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: MailingStreet
fields.description: The street address where a company has its mail delivered. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: MarketingPreScreen
fields.description: The probability that a company will pay with a significant delay compared to the agreed terms. The risk level is based on the standard Commercial Credit Score, and ranges from low risk to high risk. Available values include: L— Low risk of delinquency M— Moderate risk of delinquency H— High risk of delinquency Important Use this information for marketing pre-screening purposes only.

fields.name: MarketingSegmentationCluster
fields.description: Twenty-two distinct, mutually exclusive profiles, created as a result of cluster analysis of Dun & Bradstreet data for US organizations.

fields.name: MinorityOwned
fields.description: Indicates whether an organization is owned or controlled by a member of a minority group. Available values include: Y—Minority owned N—Not minority owned

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The primary or registered name of a company. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: NationalId
fields.description: The identification number used in some countries for business registration and tax collection. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: NationalIdType
fields.description: A code value that identifies the type of national identification number used. The full list of resources can be found at the Optimizer Resources page maintained by Dun & Bradstreet. Maximum size is 5 characters.

fields.name: OutOfBusiness
fields.description: Indicates whether the company at the specified address has discontinued operations. Available values include: Y—Out of business N—Not out of business

fields.name: OwnOrRent
fields.description: Indicates whether a company owns or rents the building it occupies. Available values include: 0—Unknown or not applicable 1—Owns 2—Rents

fields.name: ParentOrHqBusinessName
fields.description: The primary name of the parent or headquarters company. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: ParentOrHqDunsNumber
fields.description: The D-U-N-S Number for the parent or headquarters. Maximum size is 9 characters.

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: A company’s primary telephone number.

fields.name: PostalCode
fields.description: The postal code that corresponds to a company’s physical location. Maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: PremisesMeasure
fields.description: A numeric value for the measurement of the premises.

fields.name: PremisesMeasureReliability
fields.description: A descriptive accuracy of the measurement such as actual, estimated, or modeled.

fields.name: PremisesMeasureUnit
fields.description: A descriptive measurement unit such as acres, square meters, or square feet.

fields.name: PrimaryNaics
fields.description: The six-digit North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is the standard used by business and government to classify business establishments according to their economic activity for the purpose of collecting, analyzing, and publishing statistical data related to the US business economy. The full list of values can be found at the Optimizer Resources page maintained by Dun & Bradstreet. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: PrimaryNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on its NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters.

fields.name: PrimarySic
fields.description: The four-digit Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code is used to categorize business establishments by industry. The full list of values can be found at the Optimizer Resources page maintained by Dun & Bradstreet. Maximum size is 4 characters.

fields.name: PrimarySic8
fields.description: The eight-digit Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code is used to categorize business establishments by industry. The full list of values can be found at the Optimizer Resources page maintained by Dun & Bradstreet. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: PrimarySic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on its SIC code. The full list of values can be found at the Optimizer Resources page maintained by Dun & Bradstreet. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: PrimarySicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on its SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: PriorYearEmployees
fields.description: The total number of employees for the prior year.

fields.name: PriorYearRevenue
fields.description: The annual revenue for the prior year.

fields.name: PublicIndicator
fields.description: Indicates whether ownership of the company is public or private. Available values include: Y—Public N—Private

fields.name: SalesTurnoverGrowthRate
fields.description: The increase in annual revenue from the previous value for an equivalent period expressed as a decimal percentage.

fields.name: SalesVolume
fields.description: The total annual sales revenue in the headquarters’ local currency. Dun & Bradstreet tracks revenue data for publicly traded companies, Global Ultimates, Domestic Ultimates, and some headquarters.

fields.name: SalesVolumeReliability
fields.description: The reliability of the SalesVolume figure. Available values include: 0—Actual number 1—Low 2—Estimated (for all records) 3—Modeled (for non-US records)

fields.name: SecondNaics
fields.description: An additional NAICS code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: SecondNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters.

fields.name: SecondSic
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: SecondSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: SecondSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: SecondSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: SixthNaics
fields.description: An additional NAICS code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: SixthNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters.

fields.name: SixthSic
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: SixthSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: SixthSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: SixthSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: SmallBusiness
fields.description: Indicates whether the company is designated a small business as defined by the Small Business Administration of the US government. Available values include: Y—Small business site N—Not small business site

fields.name: State
fields.description: The state where a company is physically located. Maximum size is 20 characters.

fields.name: StockExchange
fields.description: The corresponding exchange for a company’s stock symbol. For example: NASDAQ or NYSE. Maximum size is 16 characters.

fields.name: StockSymbol
fields.description: The abbreviation used to identify publicly traded shares of a particular stock. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The street address where a company is physically located. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: Subsidiary
fields.description: Indicates whether a company is more than 50 percent owned by another organization. Available values include: 0—Not subsidiary of another organization 3—Subsidiary of another organization

fields.name: ThirdNaics
fields.description: An additional NAICS code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 6 characters.

fields.name: ThirdNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code. Maximum size is 120 characters.

fields.name: ThirdSic
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: ThirdSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: ThirdSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: ThirdSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: TradeStyle1
fields.description: A name, different from its legal name, that an organization may use for conducting business. Similar to “Doing business as” or “DBA”. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: TradeStyle2
fields.description: An additional tradestyle used by the organization. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: TradeStyle3
fields.description: An additional tradestyle used by the organization. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: TradeStyle4
fields.description: An additional tradestyle used by the organization. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: TradeStyle5
fields.description: An additional tradestyle used by the organization. Maximum size is 255 characters.

fields.name: URL
fields.description: An organization’s primary website address. Maximum size is 104 characters.

fields.name: UsTaxId
fields.description: The identification number for the company used by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) in the administration of tax laws. Also referred to as Federal Taxpayer Identification Number. Maximum size is 9 characters.

fields.name: WomenOwned
fields.description: Indicates whether a company is more than 50 percent owned or controlled by a woman. Available values include: Y—Owned by a woman N—Not owned by a woman, or unknown

fields.name: YearStarted
fields.description: The year the company was established or the year when current ownership or management assumed control of the company. Maximum size is 4 characters.

fields.name: BackgroundDirection
fields.description: Returns the direction of the background fade. Available values are: Top to Bottom Left to Right Diagonal (default value)

fields.name: BackgroundEnd
fields.description: Returns the ending fade color in hexadecimal. Label is Ending Color .

fields.name: BackgroundStart
fields.description: Returns the starting fade color in hexadecimal. Label is Starting Color .

fields.name: ChartTheme
fields.description: Returns the background theme used for charts.

fields.name: ColorPalette
fields.description: Returns the color palette used for the dashboard.

fields.name: DashboardResultRefreshedDate
fields.description: Returns the date on which the dashboard results were last refreshed.

fields.name: DashboardResultRunningUser
fields.description: The user whose security settings were used to generate the dashboard results.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Returns the description of the dashboard. Limit: 255 characters.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: Required. The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Dashboard Unique Name . Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: FolderId
fields.description: Required. Returns the ID of the Folder that contains the dashboard. See Folder.

fields.name: FolderName
fields.description: Name of the folder that contains the dashboard. Available in API version 35.0 and later.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view ( LastReferencedDate ) but not viewed it.

fields.name: LeftSize
fields.description: Returns the size of the left column of the dashboard. Available values are: Narrow Medium Wide

fields.name: MiddleSize
fields.description: Returns the size of the middle column of the dashboard. Available values are: Narrow Medium Wide

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: RightSize
fields.description: Returns the size of the right column in the dashboard. Available values are: Narrow Medium Wide

fields.name: RunningUserId
fields.description: Returns the ID of the running user specified for the dashboard. If the dashboard was created in Lightning Experience and is configured to run as the viewing user, it returns the user ID of the dashboard creator. If the dashboard was created in Salesforce Classic and is configured to run as the logged-in user, returns the user ID of the last specified running user.

fields.name: TextColor
fields.description: Returns the body text color in hexadecimal. Label is Text Color .

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Returns the title of the dashboard. Limit: 80 characters.

fields.name: TitleColor
fields.description: Returns the title text color in hexadecimal. Label is Title Color .

fields.name: TitleSize
fields.description: Returns the title font size in points. Label is Title Size .

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Returns the dashboard type. Available values are: SpecifiedUser —The dashboard displays data according to the access level of one specific running user. LoggedInUser —The dashboard displays data according to the access level of the logged-in user. MyTeamUser —The dashboard displays data according to the access level of the logged-in user, and managers can view dashboards from the point of view of users beneath them in the role hierarchy.

fields.name: CustomReportId
fields.description: Requires the user permission "Manage All Private Reports and Dashboards." The ID of the report that provides data for the dashboard component. See Report .

fields.name: DashboardId
fields.description: The ID of the dashboard that contains the dashboard component. See Dashboard .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the dashboard component.

fields.name: ItemId
fields.description: ID of the tagged item.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the tag. If this value does not already exist, a new TagDefinition is created and becomes the parent of this Tag object. Otherwise, a TagDefinition with the same name becomes the parent of this Tag object. Parent relationships are created automatically.

fields.name: TagDefinitionId
fields.description: ID of the parent TagDefinition object that owns the tag.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines the visibility of a tag.

fields.name: DataAssessmentMetricId
fields.description: A unique number that identifies the parent DataAssessmentMetric record.

fields.name: FieldName
fields.description: The name of the assessed field.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An optional field used to name your record.

fields.name: NumMatchedBlanks
fields.description: The number of matched records that contain blank fields.

fields.name: NumMatchedDifferent
fields.description: The number of matched records that have a different value for this field.

fields.name: NumMatchedInSync
fields.description: The number of matched records that have the same value for this field.

fields.name: NumUnmatchedBlanks
fields.description: The number of unmatched records that contain blank fields.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An optional field used to name your record.

fields.name: NumDuplicates
fields.description: The number of duplicate records.

fields.name: NumMatched
fields.description: The number of matched records.

fields.name: NumMatchedDifferent
fields.description: The number of records in your org matched with a Data.com record that have different fields.

fields.name: NumProcessed
fields.description: The number of records processed in the data assessment.

fields.name: NumTotal
fields.description: The number of records available for data assessment processing.

fields.name: NumUnmatched
fields.description: The number of records not matched.

fields.name: DataAssessmentFieldMetricId
fields.description: A unique number that identifies the parent DataAssessementFieldMetric record.

fields.name: FieldValue
fields.description: The value in the matched field.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An optional field used to name your record.

fields.name: ValueCount
fields.description: The number of times this value appears in this field.

fields.name: BotIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the bot.

fields.name: BotSessionIdentifier
fields.description: The bot session ID.

fields.name: DmlType
fields.description: The type of DML operation.

fields.name: FirstObjectIdentifier
fields.description: Only the first object ID is logged upon an update. During record updates, the ID of that specific row is logged. When multiple rows are updated, only a single ID is logged.

fields.name: KeyPrefix
fields.description: The key prefix of the entity type that was saved

fields.name: LoginKey
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. The session starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring. For example, lUqjLPQTWRdvRG4 .

fields.name: PlannerIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the agent planner.

fields.name: RequestIdentifier
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same RequestIdentifier.

fields.name: RowCount
fields.description: Total number of records in the result set.

fields.name: SampleFactor
fields.description: Rate at which entities are logged. If the sample factor is 1 that means every entity saved was logged. If it is 100 that means that 1/100 logs.

fields.name: SessionKey
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all user events within a session. When a user logs out and logs in again, a new session is started.

fields.name: Timestamp
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT. For example, 2020-01-20T19:12:26.965Z.

fields.name: UserIdentifier
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: ActiveContacts
fields.description: The number of active contacts that are associated with a company.

fields.name: AnnualRevenue
fields.description: The amount of money that the company makes in 1 year. Annual revenue is measured in US dollars.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The name of the city where the company is located.

fields.name: CompanyId
fields.description: A unique numerical identifier for the company and theData.com identifier for a company.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: A string that represents the standard abbreviation for the country where the company is located.

fields.name: CountryCode
fields.description: A standardized name for countries of the world.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A brief synopsis of the company that provides a general overview of the company and what it does.

fields.name: DunsNumber
fields.description: A randomly generated nine-digit number that’s assigned by Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) to identify unique business establishments.

fields.name: EmployeeQuantityGrowthRate
fields.description: The yearly growth rate of the number of employees in a company expressed as a decimal percentage. The data includes the total employee growth rate for the past two years.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: A unique numerical identifier for the company. The ExternalId is a system-generated number.

fields.name: Fax
fields.description: The telephone number that’s used to send and receive faxes.

fields.name: FortuneRank
fields.description: The numeric value of the company’s Fortune 1000 ranking. A null or blank value means that the company isn’t ranked as a Fortune 1000 company.

fields.name: FullAddress
fields.description: The complete address of a company, including Street , City , State , and Zip .

fields.name: IncludedInSnP500
fields.description: A true or false value. If true , the company is listed in the S&P 500 Index. If false , the company isn’t listed in the S&P 500 Index.

fields.name: Industry
fields.description: A description of the type of industry such as Telecommunications, Agriculture, or Electronics.

fields.name: IsInCrm
fields.description: Whether the record is in Salesforce (true) or not (false).

fields.name: IsInactive
fields.description: A true or false response. True, the company record is not active. False, the company record is active.

fields.name: IsOwned
fields.description: A true or false value. True, your organization owns the record. False, your organization doesn’t own the record.

fields.name: NaicsCode
fields.description: A value that represents the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code. NAICS was created to provide details about a business’s service orientation. The code descriptions are focused on what a business does.

fields.name: NaicsDesc
fields.description: A description of the NAICS classification.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The company’s name.

fields.name: NumberOfEmployees
fields.description: The number of employees working for the company.

fields.name: Ownership
fields.description: The type of ownership of the company: Public Private Government Other

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: A numeric string containing the primary telephone number for the company.

fields.name: PremisesMeasure
fields.description: A numeric value for the measurement of the premises.

fields.name: PremisesMeasureReliability
fields.description: A descriptive accuracy of the measurement such as actual, estimated, or modeled.

fields.name: PremisesMeasureUnit
fields.description: A descriptive measurement unit such as acres, square meters, or square feet.

fields.name: PriorYearEmployees
fields.description: The total number of employees for the prior year.

fields.name: PriorYearRevenue
fields.description: The annual revenue for the prior year.

fields.name: SalesTurnoverGrowthRate
fields.description: The increase in annual revenue from the previous value for an equivalent period expressed as a decimal percentage.

fields.name: Sic
fields.description: A numeric value that represents the Standard Industrial Codes (SIC). SIC is a numbering convention that indicates what type of service a business provides. It is a four-digit value.

fields.name: SicCodeDesc
fields.description: The SIC numeric code and descsciption for a company.

fields.name: SicDesc
fields.description: A description of the SIC classification.

fields.name: Site
fields.description: An organizational status of the company. Branch: a secondary location to a headquarter location Headquarter: a parent company with branches or subsidiaries Single Location: a single business with no subsidiaries or branches

fields.name: State
fields.description: The two-letter standard abbreviation for a state.

fields.name: StateCode
fields.description: A standard two-letter abbreviation for states and territories of the United States. The state where the company is located. The abbreviation can also be a province or other equivalent to a state, depending on the country where the company is located.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: A postal address for the company.

fields.name: TickerSymbol
fields.description: The symbol that uniquely identifies companies that are traded on public stock exchanges.

fields.name: TradeStyle
fields.description: A legal name under which a company conducts business.

fields.name: UpdatedDate
fields.description: The last date and time when the information for this company was updated.

fields.name: Website
fields.description: The standard URL for the company’s home page.

fields.name: YearStarted
fields.description: The year when the company was founded.

fields.name: Zip
fields.description: A numeric postal code that’s designated for the address.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The city where the company is located.

fields.name: CompanyId
fields.description: The unique numerical identifier for the company and the Data.com company identification number or Data.com Key.

fields.name: CompanyName
fields.description: The name of the company.

fields.name: ContactId
fields.description: The unique numeric identifier for this contact.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The standard abbreviation or name for the country where the company is located. Note You can enter a comma-separated list of countries; however, for a country that uses a comma in its name, leave out the comma. For example, enter “Taiwan, ROC” as Taiwan ROC .

fields.name: Department
fields.description: The department in the company that the contact is affiliated with. The values of this field are fixed enumerated values. Engineering Finance Human Resources IT Marketing Operations Other Sales Support

fields.name: Email
fields.description: A business email address for the contact.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: A unique system-generated numerical identifier for the contact.

fields.name: FirstName
fields.description: The first name of the contact.

fields.name: IsInCrm
fields.description: Whether the record is in Salesforce (true) or not (false).

fields.name: IsInactive
fields.description: Whether the record is active (false) or not (true).

fields.name: IsOwned
fields.description: True : You own this record. False : You do not own this record.

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: The last name of the contact.

fields.name: Level
fields.description: A human resource label that designates a person’s level in the company. The values of this field are fixed enumerated values. C-Level VP Director Manager Staff Other

fields.name: Phone
fields.description: The direct-dial telephone number for the contact.

fields.name: SocialHandles
fields.description: The social handles for this contact. Social handles are a normalized URL and user name for social media accounts such as, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter. This field is response-only.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The state where the company is located, which can also be a province or other equivalent to a state, depending on the country where the company is located.

fields.name: Street
fields.description: The street address for the company where the contact works.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: Title of the contact such as CEO or Vice President.

fields.name: UpdatedDate
fields.description: The last date and time when the information for a contact was updated.

fields.name: Zip
fields.description: The postal or zip code for the address.

fields.name: City
fields.description: The name of the city where the company is physically located.

fields.name: CompanyCurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: The code used to represent a company’s local currency. This data is provided by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and is based on their three-letter currency codes. For example, USD is the ISO code for United States Dollar.

fields.name: CompanyId
fields.description: A unique numeric identifier for a company.

fields.name: Country
fields.description: The country where a company is physically located.

fields.name: CountryAccessCode
fields.description: The required code for international calls.

fields.name: CurrencyCode
fields.description: The currency in which the company’s sales volume is expressed.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A brief description of the company, which may include information about its history, its products and services, and its influence on a particular industry.

fields.name: DomesticUltimateBusinessName
fields.description: The primary name of the Domestic Ultimate, which is the highest ranking subsidiary, specified by country, within an organization’s corporate structure.

fields.name: DomesticUltimateDunsNumber
fields.description: The D-U-N-S number for the Domestic Ultimate, which is the highest-ranking subsidiary, specified by country, within an organization’s corporate structure.

fields.name: DunsNumber
fields.description: The Data Universal Numbering System (D-U-N-S) number is a unique, nine-digit number assigned to every business location in the Dun & Bradstreet database that has a unique, separate, and distinct operation. D-U-N-S numbers are used by industries and organizations around the world as a global standard for business identification and tracking.

fields.name: EmployeeQuantityGrowthRate
fields.description: The yearly growth rate of the number of employees in a company expressed as a decimal percentage. The data includes the total employee growth rate for the past two years.

fields.name: EmployeesHere
fields.description: The number of employees at a specified location, such as a branch location.

fields.name: EmployeesHereReliability
fields.description: The reliability of the EmployeesHere figure. Available values are Actual number , Low , Estimated (for all records) , Modeled (for non-US records) . A blank value indicates this data is unavailable.

fields.name: EmployeesTotal
fields.description: The total number of employees in the company, including all subsidiary and branch locations. This data is available only on records that have a value of Headquarters/Parent in the LocationStatus field.

fields.name: EmployeesTotalReliability
fields.description: The reliability of the EmployeesTotal figure. Available values are Actual number , Low , Estimated (for all records) , Modeled (for non-US records) . A blank value indicates this data is unavailable.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: A system generated numeric identification.

fields.name: FamilyMembers
fields.description: The total number of family members, worldwide, within an organization, including the Global Ultimate, its subsidiaries (if any), and its branches (if any).

fields.name: Fax
fields.description: The company’s facsimile number.

fields.name: FifthNaics
fields.description: A NAICS code that’s used to further classify an organization by industry.

fields.name: FifthNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code.

fields.name: FifthSic
fields.description: A Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code that’s used to further classify an organization by industry.

fields.name: FifthSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: FifthSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: FifthSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code.

fields.name: FipsMsaCode
fields.description: The Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) and the Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) codes identify the organization’s location. The MSA codes are defined by the US Office of Management and Budget.

fields.name: FipsMsaDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s FIPS MSA code.

fields.name: FortuneRank
fields.description: The numeric value of the company’s Fortune 1000 ranking. A null or blank value means that the company isn’t ranked as a Fortune 1000 company.

fields.name: FourthNaics
fields.description: A NAICS code used to further classify an organization by industry.

fields.name: FourthNaicsDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding NAICS code.

fields.name: FourthSic
fields.description: A SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry.

fields.name: FourthSic8
fields.description: An additional SIC code used to further classify an organization by industry. Maximum size is 8 characters.

fields.name: FourthSic8Desc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code. Maximum size is 80 characters.

fields.name: FourthSicDesc
fields.description: A brief description of an organization’s line of business, based on the corresponding SIC code.

fields.name: GeoCodeAccuracy
fields.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. Available values include Rooftop level , Street level , Block level , Census tract level , Mailing address level , ZIP code level , Geocode could not be assigned , Places the address in the correct city , Not matched , State or Province Centroid , Street intersection , PO BOX location , Non-US rooftop accuracy , County Centroid , Sub Locality-Street Level , and Locality Centroid

fields.name: GlobalUltimateBusinessName
fields.description: The primary name of the Global Ultimate, which is the highest entity within an organization’s corporate structure and may oversee branches and subsidiaries.

fields.name: GlobalUltimateDunsNumber
fields.description: The D-U-N-S number of the Global Ultimate, which is the highest-ranking entity within an organization’s corporate structure and can oversee branches and subsidiaries.

fields.name: GlobalUltimateTotalEmployees
fields.description: The total number of employees at the Global Ultimate, which is the highest entity within an organization’s corporate structure and may oversee branches and subsidiaries.

fields.name: ImportExportAgent
fields.description: Identifies whether a business imports goods or services, exports goods or services, and/or is an agent for goods.

fields.name: IncludedInSnP500
fields.description: A true or false value. If true , the company is listed in the S&P 500 Index. If false , the company isn’t listed in the S&P 500 Index.

fields.name: Industry
fields.description: A description of the type of industry such as Telecommunications, Agriculture, or Electronics.

fields.name: IsOwned
fields.description: A true or false value. True, your organization owns the record. False, your organization doesn’t own the record.

fields.name: IsParent
fields.description: A true or false value. True, the company is a parent company. False, the company isn’t a parent company. A parent company owns other companies.

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: Used with longitude to specify a precise location, which is used to assess the Geocode Accuracy.

fields.name: LegalStatus
fields.description: Identifies the legal structure of an organization. Available values include Cooperative , Nonprofit organization , Local government body , Partnership of unknown type , and Foreign company .

fields.name: Single location : The business has no branches or subsidiaries.
Headquarters/Parent : A parent company that owns more than 50 percent of another company. When the company also has branches, it’s the headquarters.
Branch : A secondary location of a business.
DataDotComKey
fields.description: The Data.com contact or company record identification number used by the DatacloudPurchaseUsage object to keep track of purchased records. This is equivalent to the Data.com record ID for a contact or company.

fields.name: DatacloudEntityType
fields.description: The type of Data.com record you want to purchase. 0—contact 1—company

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An optional field used to name your record.

fields.name: PurchaseType
fields.description: A read only field set by the API to identify the purchase type. Added Export API

fields.name: PurchaseUsageId
fields.description: The unique identification number for the DatacloudPurchaseUsage object created by making a REST POST request. 0—contact 1—company

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the user making the purchase.

fields.name: DatacloudEntityType
fields.description: The type of Data.com record you want to purchase. 0—indicates contact entity type. 1—indicates company entity type.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: An optional field. You can add a description for your purchase.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: An optional field used to name your record.

fields.name: PurchaseType
fields.description: A read only field set by the API to identify the purchase type. Added Export API

fields.name: Usage
fields.description: A read only field set by the API. It is used to track the points used to purchase records.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: A read only field set by the API that identifies the user purchasing the records.

fields.name: UserType
fields.description: A read only field set by the API with 2 user types. Monthly Usage List Pool User

fields.name: CurrentObject
fields.description: Name of the scan policy object associated with the job object session.

fields.name: DataDetectJobSessionId
fields.description: ID of the job session associated with a scan policy data scan. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: SessionEndTime
fields.description: Time and date when the scan policy object scan completes.

fields.name: ScannedRecordsCount
fields.description: The number of records already scanned while the overall job is in progress.

fields.name: LastScannedRecord
fields.description: The Last scanned record identifier of the object.

fields.name: JobStatus
fields.description: Status of the scan policy object scan. Possible values are: Cancelled Cancelled and CsvNoPiiData - Scan cancelled. No sensitive data detected. Cancelled and CsvUploadFailed - Scan cancelled. Results upload failed. Cancelled and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan cancelled. Results upload in progress. Cancelled and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan cancelled. Results upload completed successfully. Completed Completed and CsvNoPiiData - Scan completed. No sensitive data detected. Completed and CsvUploadFailed - Scan completed. Results upload failed. Completed and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan completed. Results upload in progress. Completed and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan completed. Results upload completed successfully. Failed Failed and CsvNoPiiData - Scan failed. No sensitive data detected. Failed and CsvUploadFailed - Scan failed. Results upload failed. Failed and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan failed. Results upload in progress. Failed and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan failed. Results upload completed successfully. PartialSuccess PartialSuccess and CsvNoPiiData - Scan partially successful. No sensitive data detected. PartialSuccess and CsvUploadFailed - Scan partially successful. Results upload failed. PartialSuccess and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan partially successful. Results upload in progress. PartialSuccess and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan partially successful. Results upload completed successfully. Running Scheduled TimedOut The default value is Scheduled .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Auto-generated name of the job object session.

fields.name: SessionStartTime
fields.description: Time and date when the scan policy object scan begins. Scan policy object scan can start anytime within a 30-day window from the current date.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyId
fields.description: ID of the scan policy associated with this job session. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicySnapshotId
fields.description: ID of the snapshot of the scan policy associated with this job session. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: SessionEndTime
fields.description: Time and date when the data scan completes.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Auto-generated name of the job session.

fields.name: NamedEntityCount
fields.description: Aggregate count of PII found during the data scan.

fields.name: PolicyJobStatus
fields.description: Status of the data scan. Valid values are: Cancelled Cancelled and CsvNoPiiData - Scan cancelled. No sensitive data detected. Cancelled and CsvUploadFailed - Scan cancelled. Results upload failed. Cancelled and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan cancelled. Results upload in progress. Cancelled and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan cancelled. Results upload completed successfully. Completed Completed and CsvNoPiiData - Scan completed. No sensitive data detected. Completed and CsvUploadFailed - Scan completed. Results upload failed. Completed and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan completed. Results upload in progress. Completed and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan completed. Results upload completed successfully. Failed Failed and CsvNoPiiData - Scan failed. No sensitive data detected. Failed and CsvUploadFailed - Scan failed. Results upload failed. Failed and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan failed. Results upload in progress. Failed and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan failed. Results upload completed successfully. PartialSuccess PartialSuccess and CsvNoPiiData - Scan partially successful. No sensitive data detected. PartialSuccess and CsvUploadFailed - Scan partially successful. Results upload failed. PartialSuccess and CsvUploadInProgress - Scan partially successful. Results upload in progress. PartialSuccess and CsvUploadSuccess - Scan partially successful. Results upload completed successfully. Running Scheduled TimedOut The default value is Scheduled .

fields.name: RunByUser
fields.description: User who started the job session or data scan.

fields.name: SessionStartTime
fields.description: Time and date when the data scan begins.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the scan policy.

fields.name: EndTime
fields.description: Time and date when the data scan completes.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the scan policy.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The UserID of the person who owns the record. This field is a polymorphic relationship field.

fields.name: ScanType
fields.description: Designates whether the data scan type is AIInference or PatternMatching . The default value is PatternMatching .

fields.name: StartTime
fields.description: Time and date when the data scan begins. Data scans can start anytime within a 30-day window from the current date.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyId
fields.description: ID of the scan policy associated with this scan policy object. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the scan policy object.

fields.name: ObjectReference
fields.description: Name of the scan policy object to be scanned.

fields.name: CreatedDate
fields.description: Time and date when an instance of PII is added to the scan result.

fields.name: DataDetectJobSessionId
fields.description: ID of the job session associated with the scan policy. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: FieldName
fields.description: UDD name from standard fields, or custom field ID from custom fields.

fields.name: NamedEntityCount
fields.description: Number of times PII is found.

fields.name: NamedEntityType
fields.description: Type of PII found in the record of the scan policy object.

fields.name: ObjectName
fields.description: KeyPrefix of the scan policy object that contains PII.

fields.name: RecordIdentifier
fields.description: Unique identifier for the record.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyObjectId
fields.description: ID of the scan policy object associated with the scan policy object's field. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: FieldName
fields.description: Name of the scan policy object field.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyId
fields.description: ID of the scan policy associated with the scan policy snapshot. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the scan policy snapshot.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the record owner. This field is a polymorphic relationship field.

fields.name: RevisionNumber
fields.description: Revision number of the scan policy snapshot associated with the scan policy.

fields.name: SerializedPolicy
fields.description: Sensitive data category item associated with the scan policy.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyId
fields.description: ID of the scan policy associated with the data search expression. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: Expression
fields.description: Regular expression that represents sensitive data to be scanned.

fields.name: IsCaseSensitive
fields.description: Designates whether the expression is case-sensitive (true) or not (false) . The default value is false .

fields.name: IsKeywordSearch
fields.description: Designates whether the expression can be used as a search keyword (true) or not (false) . The default value is false .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the expression.

fields.name: Criteria
fields.description: Defines category of inclusion or exclusion criteria applied to fields during scan policy creation. Valid values are: ComplianceCategory —Compliance acts, definitions, or regulations related to the field's data. DataSensitivity —Level of data sensitivity related to the field's data. FieldUsage —Data planned for deprecation, or intended to be hidden, related to the active and visible field's data.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyId
fields.description: ID of the policy associated with the data search expression. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the criteria.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines what criteria, inclusion or exclusion , is applied to a field in the policy scan object.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: Value of the criteria applied to filters.

fields.name: DataCategory
fields.description: Sensitive data category associated with the scan policy.

fields.name: DataDetectPolicyId
fields.description: ID of the scan policy associated with the sensitive data category. This field is a relationship field.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the sensitive data category.

fields.name: CreatedBy
fields.description: The email address of the user who created the DEK. For example, user@example.com .

fields.name: DataEncryptionKeyCertName
fields.description: The name of the certificate whose public key is used to encrypt the DEK during a remote key callout. When you want to create a BYOK-compatible certificate, use this property in a call to create() to name the certificate. You need to know the name to retrieve the certificate later. Specify only the file name. Salesforce will add the .crt extension when it creates the file.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The user-defined description of the root key.

fields.name: DoesUseKeyDerivation
