fields.description: The order that electronic media is displayed in.

fields.name: ClickThroughRate
fields.description: The percentage of visitors who click links contained in emails delivered (sent minus bounces) to them. Multiple clicks for a same link are counted.

fields.name: ClickToOpenRatio
fields.description: The number of unique clicks divided by unique HTML opens.

fields.name: DeliveryRate
fields.description: The percentage of the emails that were delivered compared to the number that bounced (soft and hard). Note: this data includes emails that were delivered to the recipient's spam folder.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the email content, for example, Promotion Mass Mailing.

fields.name: HtmlBody
fields.description: The body of the email in HTML format. The field is read-only.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp that indicates when the current user last viewed the record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, the record could have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the email asset.

fields.name: OpenRate
fields.description: The percentage of unique HTML opens compared to the total number of emails delivered (sent minus bounces).

fields.name: OptOutRate
fields.description: The percentage of users that have opted out compared to the total number of emails sent.

fields.name: SpamComplaintRate
fields.description: The percentage of spam complaints compared to the total number emails sent.

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: Content of the subject line.

fields.name: TemplateId
fields.description: The Email Template field is mostly read-only. You can populate the Email Template field only during record create to prevent overwriting data on the email content record.

fields.name: TextBody
fields.description: The body of the email in plain text format. The character limit is 384, 000.

fields.name: TotalDelivered
fields.description: The total number of emails minus hard and soft bounces. Note: this data includes emails that were delivered to the recipient's spam folder.

fields.name: TotalHardBounced
fields.description: The total number of emails that permanently returned to the sender because the address is invalid. A hard bounce can occur because the domain name doesn't exist or because the recipient is unknown.

fields.name: TotalOpens
fields.description: The total number of times a prospect’s email client loaded the images in the HTML version of the email. We also record an open if the prospect clicks a link within the HTML or text email without downloading images. A click indicates that they viewed the message. Some email clients (Outlook, Apple Mail, Thunderbird) do not display images by default. Account Engagement counts an open each time the images load.

fields.name: TotalSent
fields.description: Read-only field. The total number of list emails sent, including bounced, opted-out, and invalid To: addresses.

fields.name: TotalSoftBounced
fields.description: Read-only field. The total number of times a recipient’s mail server acknowledged the email, but returned it to the sender. Sometimes it is because the recipient's mailbox is full or the mail server is temporarily unavailable. After 5 soft bounces, Account Engagement opts the prospect out of emails.

fields.name: TotalSpamComplaints
fields.description: Read-only field. The total number of prospects that reported the email as spam.

fields.name: TotalTrackedLinkClicks
fields.description: Read-only field. The number of times prospects clicked a link in the email.

fields.name: UniqueClickThroughRate
fields.description: Read-only field. The percentage of visitors who clicked a link contained in an email

fields.name: UniqueOpens
fields.description: Read-only field. The number of prospects who loaded the images in the HTML version of the email. The Unique Opens category counts each recipient only one time, even if the prospect loaded images more than once.

fields.name: UniqueOptOuts
fields.description: Read-only field. The total number of prospects that have clicked the link to unsubscribe or opted out of all emails in the Email Preference Center. They are removed from future email sends.

fields.name: UniqueTrackedLinkClicks
fields.description: Read-only field. The number of times a prospect clicked a link in the email. This metric doesn’t include multiple clicks of the same link.

fields.name: EmailRelayId
fields.description: The ID of the EmailRelay record.

fields.name: FromDomain
fields.description: Restricts the email relay to send emails based on the sender domains ( FromDomain ) listed in this field. This field is optional, accepts a list of comma-separated values, and supports the wildcard character.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether the email domain filter is active ( true ) or not ( false ). Use this field to enable or disable the email domain filter.

fields.name: PriorityNumber
fields.description: Indicates the order in which the email domain filter is processed. Filters are evaluated in ascending order. The priority number must be unique. If this field is left blank, it is assigned the next available number and is processed last. Processing stops after the first matching filter is applied.

fields.name: ToDomain
fields.description: Restricts the email relay to send emails based on the recipient domains ( ToDomain ) listed in this field. This field is optional, accepts a list of comma-separated values, and supports the wildcard character.

fields.name: AlternatePublicKey
fields.description: Read-only. Alternate public keys are used by Salesforce to auto-rotate domain keys. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later after activating the Critical Update.

fields.name: AlternateSelector
fields.description: The text used to distinguish the DKIM key from any other DKIM keys your organization uses for the specified domain. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later after activating the Critical Update.

fields.name: AlternateTxtRecordName
fields.description: The alternate TXT record name is used to create the CNAME record. Refer to the Usage section for more information. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later after activating the Critical Update.

fields.name: Domain
fields.description: The organization’s domain name that the DKIM key is generated for.

fields.name: DomainMatch
fields.description: The specificity of match required on the sending domain name before signing with this DKIM key. Valid values are: DomainOnly —Sign if sending domain matches at the domain level only (example.com but not mail.example.com) SubdomainsOnly —Sign if sending domain matches at the subdomain level only (mail.example.com but not example.com) DomainAndSubdomains —Sign if sending domain matches at the domain and subdomain levels (example.com and mail.example.com)

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this DKIM key is active ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: KeySize
fields.description: Indicates the RSA key size, in bits. The possible values are: 1024 2048 This field is available in API version 45.0 and later.

fields.name: PrivateKey
fields.description: Once you activate the Critical Update, this field is no longer visible. The private portion of the DKIM key pair used to encrypt mail headers from your domain. Salesforce generates an encrypted PrivateKey if you don’t specify a value when creating the DKIM key. If you do specify a value, it must be an existing valid PrivateKey from another EmailDomainKey object. This field doesn’t contain the actual private key, but a value that represents the key in our system. Therefore: The actual private key can’t be leaked. You can’t use the value to do your own email signing.

fields.name: PublicKey
fields.description: Part of the domain key pair that mail recipients retrieve to decrypt the DKIM header and verify your domain. Add the PublicKey value to your domain’s DNS records before you start signing with this domain key.

fields.name: Selector
fields.description: Text used to distinguish the DKIM key from any other DKIM keys your organization uses for the specified domain.

fields.name: TxtRecordName
fields.description: Read-only. The TXT record name is used to create the CNAME record. Refer to the Usage section for more information. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later after activating the Critical Update.

fields.name: TxtRecordsPublishState
fields.description: The possible values are: Published Publishing in progress Publishing failed This field is available in API version 44.0 and later after activating the Critical Update.

fields.name: EmailMessageId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the email message the insight is generated for.

fields.name: GeneratedDate
fields.description: Required. The date and time when the insight was generated in the legacy system.

fields.name: InsightTypeDescription
fields.description: Required. Description of the insight type.

fields.name: InsightTypeIdentifier
fields.description: Required. The ID of the insight type based on which the insight is generated.

fields.name: InsightTypeLabel
fields.description: Required. The display name of the insight type.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the email insight record is locked or not.

fields.name: LegacyInsightIdentifier
fields.description: Required. The unique ID of the insight that was generated and stored in the legacy system.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the email insight record can be edited or not.

fields.name: RowVersion
fields.description: A system-generated, read-only field that tracks the version of a record. Each time a record is created or updated, the RowVersion value increments, providing a mechanism to detect changes and manage concurrency.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Required. The status of the insight record.

fields.name: ActionMetadata
fields.description: The metadata for the action.

fields.name: EmailInsightId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the email insight where the action is applied.

fields.name: InsightAction
fields.description: Required. The action that's taken on the email insight.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the email insight action record is locked or not.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the email insight action record can be edited or not.

fields.name: RowVersion
fields.description: A system-generated, read-only field that tracks the version of a record. Each time a record is created or updated, the RowVersion value increments, providing a mechanism to detect changes and manage concurrency.

fields.name: ActivityId
fields.description: ID of the activity that is associated with the email. Usually represents an open task that is created for the case owner when a new unread email message is received. ActivityId can only be specified for emails on cases. It’s auto-created for other entities.

fields.name: AttachmentIds
fields.description: A comma-separated list of email attachments. This is used by the Send Email quick action when you use Salesforce Classic email templates. Maximum length is 32, 768 characters.

fields.name: AutomationType
fields.description: A picklist value that determines if an outgoing email was manually created or AI-generated.

fields.name: BccAddress
fields.description: A string array of email addresses for recipients who were sent a visually impaired carbon copy of the email message. Include only email addresses that aren’t associated with Contact, Lead, or User records in Salesforce. If the recipient is a contact, lead, or user, add their ID to the BccIds field instead of adding their email address to the BccAddress field. When adding their ID, the email message is automatically associated with the contact, lead, or user. For an Experience Cloud site user who isn’t the sender of the email, this field returns null.

fields.name: BccIds
fields.description: A string array of IDs for contacts, leads, and users who were sent a visually impaired carbon copy of the email message. Each ID is linked to an EmailMessageRelation record, which represents the relationship between an email message and a Contact, Lead, or User record. For an Experience Cloud site user who isn’t the sender of the email, this list is empty. Adding a JunctionIdList field name to the fieldsToNull property deletes all related junction records. This action can’t be undone.

fields.name: CcAddress
fields.description: A string array of email addresses for recipients who were sent a carbon copy of the email message. Include only email addresses that aren’t associated with Contact, Lead, or User records in Salesforce. If the recipient is a contact, lead, or user, add their ID to the CcIds field instead of adding their email address to the CcAddress field. Then the email message is automatically associated with the contact, lead, or user.

fields.name: CcIds
fields.description: A string array of IDs for contacts, leads, and users who were sent a carbon copy of the email message. Each ID is linked to an EmailMessageRelation record, which represents the relationship between an email message and a Contact, Lead, or User record. Adding a JunctionIdList field name to the fieldsToNull property deletes all related junction records. This action can’t be undone.

fields.name: ClientThreadIdentifier
fields.description: A value used by third-party email clients to identify which thread an email belongs to. See Email-to-Case Threading for more information. Available in API versions 56.0 and later.

fields.name: ContentDocumentIds
fields.description: A string array of IDs for content documents such as files and attachments that are associated with an email. Each ID is linked to a ContentDocumentLink record, which represents the relationship between an email message and a content document record. Adding a JunctionIdList field name to the fieldsToNull property deletes all related junction records. This action can’t be undone.

fields.name: Division
fields.description: A logical segment of your organization's data. For example, if your company is organized into different business units, you could create a division for each business unit, such as “North America,” “Healthcare,” or “Consulting.” Available only if the organization has the Division permission enabled.

fields.name: EmailRoutingAddressId
fields.description: Stores the ID of the email routing address used to create the email. This value is set when the email is processed by Email-to-Case service. When this field is set, EmailMessage.Incoming cannot be false .

fields.name: EmailTemplateId
fields.description: The email template, if any, that was chosen for the email. This field is populated in Lightning Experience only.

fields.name: FirstOpenedDate
fields.description: The date the email was first opened.

fields.name: FromAddress
fields.description: The address that originated the email. When using this field, specify an email address that exists in EmailMessageRelation, with a RelationType of FromAddress .

fields.name: FromId
fields.description: The contact, lead, or user who sent the email. Maximum length is 18 characters.

fields.name: FromName
fields.description: The sender’s name. When using this field, specify an email address that exists in EmailMessageRelation, with a RelationType of FromAddress .

fields.name: HasAttachment
fields.description: Indicates whether the email was sent with an attachment ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: Headers
fields.description: The Internet message headers of the incoming email. Used for debugging and tracing purposes. Doesn’t apply to outgoing emails.

fields.name: HtmlBody
fields.description: The body of the email in HTML format.

fields.name: Incoming
fields.description: Indicates whether the email was received ( true ) or sent ( false ).

fields.name: IsBounced
fields.description: Indicates whether the email bounced. This field is set to True for bounced emails in orgs using Lightning Threading. It’s not set to True for orgs using Ref ID threading.

fields.name: IsClientManaged
fields.description: If EmailMessage is created with IsClientManaged set to true , users can modify EmailMessage.ContentDocumentIds to link file attachments even when the Status of the EmailMessage isn’t set to Draft . When this field is set to true and Enhanced Email is enabled, a Task record is created for the EmailMessage regardless of Email-to-Case settings.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: IsExternallyVisible
fields.description: If the Experience Cloud site case feed is enabled, IsExternallyVisible controls the external visibility of emails in sites. When IsExternallyVisible is set to true —its default value—external users see the email message in the case feed. Emails remain visible in the Emails related list whether or not this field is set to true. For security reasons, we recommend that you remove this related list from your case page layout for external community users. Only emails with a value in the ParentId field can be made externally visible in sites. This field can’t be updated if the email’s Status is set to Draft . The Enable Case Feeds in Experience Cloud Sites organization preference in Setup makes case-related emails, comments, and updates visible to site members. When this preference is off, IsExternallyVisible is True by default for the EmailMessage. When this preference is on, IsExternallyVisible defaults to True only if the case contact email is the sender or the recipient of the EmailMessage. Otherwise, IsExternallyVisible defaults to False.

fields.name: IsOpened
fields.description: Indicates whether the email has been opened.

fields.name: IsPrivateDraft
fields.description: If IsPrivateDraft is set to true , then only the CreatedById user can view, update, and send this email draft. If IsPrivateDraft is set to false , then any user with permissions to work on the case can see these drafts. After the email is sent, then this field is updated to be false . Public drafts are loaded and visible in Salesforce Classic while Private Drafts are only used in Lightning Experience.

fields.name: IsTracked
fields.description: Indicates whether the email is being tracked.

fields.name: LastOpenedDate
fields.description: The date the email was last opened.

fields.name: MessageDate
fields.description: The date the email was created.

fields.name: MessageIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the email message.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: A name for the email message that's derived from the first 255 characters of the Subject field. If the Subject field is empty, a localized string of [No Subject] is used. This field is read-only and can’t be created or updated. Available in API versions 56.0 and later.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: ID of the case that’s associated with the email.

fields.name: RelatedToId
fields.description: The RelatedToId represents nonhuman objects such as accounts, opportunities, campaigns, cases, or custom objects. RelatedToIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a RelatedToId is equivalent to the ID of a related object. You must have access to at least one entity listed under Refers To to access RelatedToId. You can update RelatedToId when IsClientManaged is set to true . RelatedtoId and ParentId should have the same value when ParentId is set. You might see unexpected results otherwise.

fields.name: ReplyToEmailMessageId
fields.description: ID of the inbound or outbound email message the current email message is a reply to. It’s not possible to reply to a message whose Status is Draft .

fields.name: Source
fields.description: When Sync Email as Salesforce Activity is enabled, this value reflects from where the email was captured automatically. Available in API version 64.0 and later.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the email. The Status field is mostly read-only. You can change the status only from New to Read . Possible values are: 0 (New) 1 (Read) 2 (Replied) 3 (Sent) 4 (Forwarded) 5 (Draft)

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: The subject line of the email.

fields.name: TextBody
fields.description: The body of the email, in plain text format. If TextBody isn’t set, then it’s extracted from HtmlBody .

fields.name: ThreadIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the email thread the email message belongs to. This field is used by features that sync emails directly from an inbox into Salesforce. This field is not used by On-Demand Email-to-Case.

fields.name: ToAddress
fields.description: A string array of email addresses for recipients who were sent the email message. Include only email addresses that aren’t associated with Contact, Lead, or User records in Salesforce. If the recipient is a contact, lead, or user, add their ID to the ToIds field instead of adding their email address to the ToAddress field. Then the email message is automatically associated with the contact, lead, or user.

fields.name: ToIds
fields.description: A string array of IDs for contacts, leads, and users who were sent a carbon copy of the email message. Each ID is linked to an EmailMessageRelation record, which represents the relationship between an email message and a Contact, Lead, or User record. Adding a JunctionIdList field name to the fieldsToNull property deletes all related junction records. This action can’t be undone.

fields.name: ValidatedFromAddress
fields.description: A picklist value with either the sender's address, org-wide email addresses, or Email-to-Case routing address. The email address must be verified. If the sender’s email address is used, the sender must be the current user. ValidatedFromAddress isn’t suitable for use in Group By or Sort By statements. Use FromAddress instead.

fields.name: EmailMessageId
fields.description: The ID of the EmailMessage record.

fields.name: RelationAddress
fields.description: The email address of the sender or recipient. Note If a record relates an email to an existing contact, lead, or user record in Salesforce, the value of RelationAddress is the current value of the email address. If the value is not set, it is auto-populated from RelationId .

fields.name: RelationId
fields.description: The RecordId of the sender or recipient. Note If a record relates an email to an email address that’s not associated with an existing contact, lead, or user record in Salesforce, the value of RelationId is null.

fields.name: RelationObjectType
fields.description: The API name of the object type of the RecordId in the RelationId field. It can be a contact, lead, or user.

fields.name: RelationType
fields.description: The type of relationship the contact, lead, or user has with the email message. Possible values include: ToAddress CcAddress BccAddress FromAddress OtherAddress For an Experience Cloud site user who is not the sender of the email, no BccAddress relations are returned.

fields.name: AuthType
fields.description: Specifies which SASL mechanism Salesforce uses for SMTP authentication. This field is available when Enable SMTP Auth is selected. Select an option: PLAIN- Salesforce uses PLAIN SASL mechanism for SMTP authentication. Default. LOGIN- Salesforce uses LOGIN SASL mechanism for SMTP authentication This field is available in API version 52.0 and later.

fields.name: Host
fields.description: Indicates the host name or IP address of your company's SMTP server.

fields.name: IsRequireAuth
fields.description: Indicates whether (true) or not (false) authentication is required. When setting this field to true, the TlsSetting must be set to RequiredVerify . This field is available in API version 44.0 and later.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Specifies the password for relay host STMP authentication. When IsRequireAuth is set to true, this field is required. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later.

fields.name: Port
fields.description: Indicates the port number of your company's SMTP server. 25 587 10025 11025

fields.name: TlsSetting
fields.description: Specifies whether Salesforce uses TLS for SMTP sessions. Off : TLS is turned off. SMTP session continues through an insecure connection. Preferred : If the remote server supports TLS, Salesforce upgrades the current SMTP session to use TLS. If TLS is unavailable, Salesforce continues the session without TLS. Required : Salesforce continues the session only if the remote server supports TLS. If TLS is unavailable, Salesforce terminates the session without delivering the email. PreferredVerify : If the remote server supports TLS, Salesforce upgrades the current SMTP session to use TLS. Before the session begins, Salesforce verifies that the certificate is signed by a valid certificate authority, and that the common name presented in the certificate matches the domain or mail exchange of the current connection. If TLS is available but the certificate is not signed or the common name does not match, Salesforce disconnects the session and does not deliver the email. If TLS is unavailable, Salesforce continues the session without TLS. RequiredVerify : Salesforce continues the session only if the remote server supports TLS, the certificate is signed by a valid certificate authority, and the common name presented in the certificate matches the domain or mail exchange to which Salesforce is connected. If any of these criteria are not met, Salesforce terminates the session without delivering the email.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Specifies the username for relay host STMP authentication. When IsRequireAuth is set to true, this field is required. This field is available in API version 44.0 and later.

fields.name: PersonalName
fields.description: The display name of the EmailRoutingAddress. Maximum size is 300 characters.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: The email address to which your customers direct their questions. Emails are forwarded from this address.

fields.name: EmailServicesAddress
fields.description: A unique, Salesforce-generated email address. This field value is read-only and can't be modified. Emails are forwarded to this address.

fields.name: AuthorizedSenders
fields.description: Configures the email service address to only accept messages from the email addresses or domains listed in this field. If the email service address receives a message from an unlisted email address or domain, the email service performs the action specified in the AuthorizationFailureAction field of its associated email service. Leave this field blank if you want the email service address to receive email from any email address.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This 25-character field must be unique among other EmailServicesAddress records under the same EmailServiceFunction parent. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. This field is automatically generated, but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance might be slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: EmailDomainName
fields.description: A read only field you can query that contains the system-generated domain part of this email service address. The system generates a unique domain-part for each email service address to ensure that no two email service addresses are identical.

fields.name: FunctionId
fields.description: The ID of the email service for which the email service address receives messages.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this object is active (true) or not (false).

fields.name: LocalPart
fields.description: The local-part of the email service address. The local-part of the address is the string that comes before the @ symbol.

fields.name: RunAsUserId
fields.description: The username of the user whose permissions the email service assumes when processing messages sent to this address.

fields.name: AddressInactiveAction
fields.description: Indicates what the email service does with messages received at an email address that is inactive. One of the following values: UseSystemDefault —The system default is used. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 0 .) Bounce —The email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 1 .) Discard —The email service deletes the message without notifying the sender. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 2 .) Requeue —The email service queues the message for processing in the next 24 hours. If the message is not processed within 24 hours, the email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 3 .)

fields.name: ApexClassId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the Apex class that the email service uses to process inbound messages. This field is required for API version 12.0 and later.

fields.name: AttachmentOption
fields.description: Indicates the types of attachments the email service accepts. One of the following values: None —The email service accepts the message but discards any attachment. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 0 .) NoContent —The attachment metadata (filename, MIME type, and so on) is provided to the Apex class, but the body is set to null . There was no previous numeric value for this choice. TextOnly —The email service only accepts the following types of attachments: Attachments with a Multipurpose Internet Mail Extension (MIME) type of text. Attachments with a MIME type of application/octet-stream and a file name that ends with either a .vcf or .vcs extension. These are saved as text/x-vcard and text/calendar MIME types, respectively. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 1 .) BinaryOnly —The email service only accepts binary attachments, such as image, audio, application, and video files. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 2 .) All —The email service accepts any type of attachment. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 3 .)

fields.name: AuthenticationFailureAction
fields.description: Indicates what the email service does with messages that fail or do not support any of the authentication protocols if the IsAuthenticationRequired field is true. One of the following values: UseSystemDefault —The system default is used. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 0 .) Bounce —The email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 1 .) Discard —The email service deletes the message without notifying the sender. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 2 .) Requeue —The email service queues the message for processing in the next 24 hours. If the message is not processed within 24 hours, the email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 3 .)

fields.name: AuthorizationFailureAction
fields.description: Indicates what the email service does with messages received from senders who are not listed in the AuthorizedSenders field on either the email service or email service address. One of the following values: UseSystemDefault —The system default is used. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 0 .) Bounce —The email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 1 .) Discard —The email service deletes the message without notifying the sender. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 2 .) Requeue —The email service queues the message for processing in the next 24 hours. If the message is not processed within 24 hours, the email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 3 .)

fields.name: AuthorizedSenders
fields.description: Configures the email service to only accept messages from the email addresses or domains listed in this field. If the email service receives a message from an unlisted email address or domain, the email service performs the action specified in the AuthorizationFailureAction field. Leave this field blank if you want the email service to receive email from any email address.

fields.name: ErrorRoutingAddress
fields.description: The destination email address for error notification email messages when IsErrorRoutingEnabled is true .

fields.name: FunctionInactiveAction
fields.description: Indicates what the email service does with messages it receives when the email service itself is inactive. One of the following values: UseSystemDefault —The system default is used. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 0 .) Bounce —The email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 1 .) Discard —The email service deletes the message without notifying the sender. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 2 .) Requeue —The email service queues the message for processing in the next 24 hours. If the message is not processed within 24 hours, the email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 3 .)

fields.name: FunctionName
fields.description: The name of the email service.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates whether this object is active ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsAuthenticationRequired
fields.description: Configures the email service to verify the legitimacy of the sending server before processing a message. The email service uses the SPF, SenderId, and DomainKeys protocols to verify the sender's legitimacy: If the sending server passes at least one of these protocols and does not fail any, the email service accepts the email. If the server fails a protocol or does not support any of the protocols, the email service performs the action specified in the AuthenticationFailureAction field.

fields.name: IsErrorRoutingEnabled
fields.description: When incoming email messages can’t be processed, indicates whether error notification email messages are routed to a chosen address or to the senders.

fields.name: IsTextAttachmentsAsBinary
fields.description: If true , text attachments are supplied to the Apex code as a Messaging.BinaryAttachment instead of as a Messaging.TextAttachment . This means that the body is supplied as an Apex Blob instead of as an Apex String.

fields.name: IsTextTruncated
fields.description: This field is deprecated. It is not available as of API version 23.0 and is deprecated and hidden in versions 17.0 through 22.0. In all API versions, the email service now accepts inbound email messages up to the 10 MB size limit, without truncating the text. Previously, it indicated whether the email service truncated and accepted email messages with HTML body text, plain body text, and text attachments over approximately 100,000 characters ( true ) or rejected these email messages and notified the sender ( false ).

fields.name: IsTlsRequired
fields.description: Not currently in use.

fields.name: OverLimitAction
fields.description: Indicates what the email service does with messages if the total number of messages processed by all email services combined has reached the daily limit for your organization. One of the following values: UseSystemDefault —The system default is used. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 0 .) Bounce —The email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 1 .) Discard —The email service deletes the message without notifying the sender. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 2 .) Requeue —The email service queues the message for processing in the next 24 hours. If the message is not processed within 24 hours, the email service returns the message to the sender with a notification that explains why the message was rejected. (In API version 41.0 and earlier, the value specified for this choice is 3 .) The system calculates the limit by multiplying the number of user licenses by 1,000.

fields.name: EmailTemplateName
fields.description: The name of the EmailTemplate.

fields.name: FirstOpenDate
fields.description: Date when the email was first opened by recipient. Label is Date Opened .

fields.name: LastOpenDate
fields.description: Date when the email was last opened by recipient.

fields.name: TaskId
fields.description: The activity (task or event) associated with the email. Label is Activity ID .

fields.name: TimesOpened
fields.description: Number of times the recipient opened the email.

fields.name: WhoId
fields.description: The WhoId represents a human such as a lead or a contact. WhoIds are polymorphic. Polymorphic means a WhoId is equivalent to a contact’s ID or a lead’s ID. The label is Name ID .

fields.name: ApiVersion
fields.description: The API version for this class. Every class has an API version specified at creation.

fields.name: Body
fields.description: Content of the email. Limit: 384 KB.

fields.name: BrandTemplateId
fields.description: Required. ID of the BrandTemplate associated with this email template. The brand template supplies letterhead information for the email template.

fields.name: DeliveryRate
fields.description: Read-only. The percentage of the emails that were delivered compared to the number that bounced (soft and hard). Note: this data includes emails that were delivered to the recipient's spam folder. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later. To access this field, your org must use Sales Engagement and users need the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Cadence Creator permission set. This field value includes emails sent via the ListEmail object or Sales Engagement cadences.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the template, for example, Promotion Mass Mailing.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Template Unique Name . Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: Encoding
fields.description: Character set encoding for the template.

fields.name: EnhancedLetterheadId
fields.description: ID of the enhanced letterhead associated with the email template. Note To use an enhanced letterhead, associate it with a Lightning email template that uses the HML merge language.

fields.name: EntityType
fields.description: When UIType is 2 (Lightning Experience) or 3 (Lightning ExperienceSample), EntityType indicates which entities this template can be used with (for example, account or lead). Valid values are standard object ID prefixes: 001 for account, 003 for contact, 006 for opportunity, and 00Q for lead, 500 for case, and 701 for campaign.

fields.name: FolderId
fields.description: ID of the folder that contains the template.

fields.name: FolderName
fields.description: The name of the folder that contains the template.

fields.name: HasSalesforceFiles
fields.description: If the email template has attachments from Salesforce Files. The default value is false.

fields.name: HtmlValue
fields.description: This field contains the content of the email message, including HTML coding to render the email message. Limit: 384 KB.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Indicates that this template is active if true , or inactive if false .

fields.name: IsBuilderContent
fields.description: If the email template was made in Email Template Builder. The default value is false.

fields.name: LastUsedDate
fields.description: Date and time when this email template was last used.

fields.name: Markup
fields.description: The Visualforce markup, HTML, JavaScript, or any other Web-enabled code that defines the content of the template.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the template. Label is Email Template Name .

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: ID of the owner of the template.

fields.name: RelatedEntityType
fields.description: When UIType is 2 (Lightning Experience) or 3 (Lightning ExperienceSample), RelatedEntityType indicates which entities this template can be used with. Valid values are the entity API name: "Account" for account, "Contact" for contact, "Opportunity" for opportunity, "Lead" for lead, and so on. The value can be any entity the user has read access to (including custom entities) but not virtual entities, setup entities, or platform entities.

fields.name: Subject
fields.description: Content of the subject line.

fields.name: TemplateStyle
fields.description: Style of the template.

fields.name: TemplateType
fields.description: Type of template.

fields.name: TimesUsed
fields.description: Number of times this email template has been used.

fields.name: TotalDelivered
fields.description: Read-only. The total number of emails sent minus hard and soft bounces. Note: this data includes emails that were delivered to the recipient's spam folder. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later. To access this field, your org must use Sales Engagement and users need the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Cadence Creator permission set. This field value includes emails sent via the ListEmail object or Sales Engagement cadences.

fields.name: TotalHardBounced
fields.description: Read-only. The total number of emails that permanently bounced back to the sender because the address is invalid. A hard bounce can occur because the domain name doesn't exist or because the recipient is unknown. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later. To access this field, your org must use Sales Engagement and users need the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Cadence Creator permission set. This field value includes emails sent via the ListEmail object or Sales Engagement cadences.

fields.name: TotalOpens
fields.description: Read-only. The total number of times a prospect’s email client loaded the images in the HTML version of the email. We also record an open if the prospect clicks a link within the HTML or text email without downloading images. A click indicates that they viewed the message. Some email clients (Outlook, Apple Mail, Thunderbird) don’t display images by default. Pardot counts an open each time the images load. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later. To access this field, your org must use Sales Engagement and users need the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Cadence Creator permission set. This field value includes emails sent via the ListEmail object or Sales Engagement cadences.

fields.name: TotalSent
fields.description: Read-only. The total number of emails sent, including bounced, opted-out, and invalid To: addresses. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later. To access this field, your org must use Sales Engagement and users need the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Cadence Creator permission set. This field value includes emails sent via the ListEmail object or Sales Engagement cadences.

fields.name: TotalSoftBounced
fields.description: Read-only. The total number of times a recipient’s mail server acknowledged the email, but returned it to the sender. Sometimes it is because the recipient's mailbox is full or the mail server is temporarily unavailable. A soft bounce message can sometimes be delivered at another time. After 5 soft bounces, Pardot opts the prospect out of emails. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later. To access this field, your org must use Sales Engagement and users need the Sales Engagement User or Sales Engagement Cadence Creator permission set. This field value includes emails sent via the ListEmail object or Sales Engagement cadences.

fields.name: UIType
fields.description: Indicates the user interface where this template is usable.

fields.name: AllEmailsBouncedCount
fields.description: The total of hard and soft bounced emails for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of successfully delivered emails for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsHardBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of hard bounced emails for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsLinkClickedCount
fields.description: The number of emails containing a link clicked by the recipient for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsNotDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of emails not delivered for this email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: AllEmailsOpenedCount
fields.description: The number of emails opened by the recipient for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsOutOfOfficeCount
fields.description: The number of emails that triggered an out-of-office reply for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsRepliedCount
fields.description: The number of emails replied to for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsSoftBouncedCount
fields.description: The number of emails soft bounced for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsTrackedSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent with engagement tracking enabled for this email template in the month.

fields.name: AllEmailsUntrackedSentCount
fields.description: The number of emails sent without engagement tracking for this email template in the month.

fields.name: DeliveredRecipientCount
fields.description: The number of recipients who were successfully delivered an email for this email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: DeliveredRecipientRate
fields.description: The percentage of unique recipients that received an email you sent. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: EmailTemplateId
fields.description: The ID of the related email template.

fields.name: HardBounceTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with hard bounce tracking. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: HrdBncTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with hard bounce tracking. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the monthly metric record is locked or not.

fields.name: LinkClickTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with link click tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: LinkClkTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with link tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the monthly metric record can be edited or not.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: The month in which the engagement occurred.

fields.name: MonthInt
fields.description: The month in which the engagement occurred, in yyyymm format.

fields.name: OooTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with out-of-office tracking for the email template in the month. Out-of-office tracking requires Inbox. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: OpenTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with open tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: OpenTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with open tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: OutOfOfficeTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with out-of-office tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientReplies
fields.description: The number of unique recipients who replied to an email for this email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientSends
fields.description: The number of unique email recipients for this email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientsHardBounced
fields.description: The number of recipients that hard-bounced an email for this email template in the month. Hard bounces can mean that the recipient's email address doesn't exist or is misspelled. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientsOutOfOffice
fields.description: The number of recipients that responded with an out-of-office reply for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: RecipientsSoftBounced
fields.description: The number of recipients that soft-bounced an email for the email template in the month. A soft bounce often indicates a temporary issue with the recipient's email server, such as a full inbox. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: ReplyTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with reply tracking for this email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: ReplyTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with reply tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SftBncTrackableRecipientSends
fields.description: The number of recipients who received an email with soft bounce tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SoftBounceTrackableSends
fields.description: The number of emails sent with soft bounce tracking for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SomeEmailsDeliveredCount
fields.description: The number of sent emails that were successfully delivered to at least one of its recipients for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: SomeEmailsDeliveredRate
fields.description: The percentage of sent and tracked emails that were successfully delivered to at least one of their recipients for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendHrdBncRt
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent to unique recipients with hard bounce tracking that hard bounced for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendOooRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with out-of-office tracking that received out-of-office replies from unique recipients for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendReplyRt
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with reply tracking that received replies from unique recipients for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableRecipientSendSftBncRt
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent to unique recipients with soft bounce tracking that soft-bounced for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendHardBounceRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with hard bounce tracking that hard bounced for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendLinkClickRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with link tracking that had link clicks for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendOpenRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with open tracking that were opened by the recipient for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendOutOfOfficeRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with out-of-office tracking that received out-of-office replies for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendReplyRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with reply tracking that received replies for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: TrackableSendSoftBounceRate
fields.description: The percentage of emails sent with soft bounce tracking that soft bounced for the email template in the month. This field is available in API version 54.0 and later.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsLinkClickedCount
fields.description: The number of link clicks by unique recipients for the email template in the month.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsOpenedCount
fields.description: The number of times an email you sent was opened by a unique recipient for the email template in the month. When you send a list email, this field increments each time a recipient opens the received email.

fields.name: UniqueEmailsRepliedCount
fields.description: The number of replies from unique recipients for the email template in the month.

fields.name: AvatarImg
fields.description: URL of the image used as the agent avatar image.

fields.name: ContrastInvertedColor
fields.description: Accent branding color used in the embedded component, displayed as a hexadecimal value. Changes made to this field in the API aren’t reflected in the embedded component.

fields.name: ContrastPrimaryColor
fields.description: Value of the ContrastPrimaryColor field in the EmbeddedServiceBranding setup object.

fields.name: CustomMinimizedComponent
fields.description: The custom Aura component that’s used for the minimized state for this Embedded Chat deployment.

fields.name: CustomPrechatComponent
fields.description: The custom Aura component that’s used for the pre-chat page for this Embedded Chat deployment.

fields.name: DurableId
fields.description: Developer name for the EmbeddedServiceConfig.

fields.name: FieldServiceConfirmCardImg
fields.description: URL of the image used for the confirmation card in embedded Appointment Management (beta).

fields.name: FieldServiceHomeImg
fields.description: URL of the image used for the home screen in embedded Appointment Management (beta).

fields.name: FieldServiceLogoImg
fields.description: URL of the logo used for the home screen in embedded Appointment Management (beta).

fields.name: Font
fields.description: Font used in the chat text of the Embedded Chat window.

fields.name: FontSize
fields.description: Font size for the embedded component. Possible values are: Small Medium Large

fields.name: HeaderBackgroundImg
fields.description: URL of the image used for the header background in Embedded Chat. This field is removed in API version 49.0 and later. The header background image is no longer supported.

fields.name: Height
fields.description: Height of the embedded component.

fields.name: IsFieldServiceEnabled
fields.description: Specifies whether Field Service is enabled for this Embedded Service deployment ( true ) or not ( false ). Embedded Appointment Management is currently beta.

fields.name: IsLiveAgentEnabled
fields.description: Specifies whether Chat is enabled for this Embedded Service deployment ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsOfflineCaseEnabled
fields.description: Specifies whether offline support is enabled for this Embedded Chat deployment ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: IsPrechatEnabled
fields.description: Value of the PrechatEnabled field in the EmbeddedServiceLiveAgent setup object.

fields.name: IsQueuePositionEnabled
fields.description: Specifies whether queue position (displaying the customer’s place in line while they wait for an agent) is enabled for this Embedded Chat deployment ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: NavBarColor
fields.description: Value of the NavBarColor field in the EmbeddedServiceBranding setup object.

fields.name: NavBarTextColor
fields.description: This field is used to set the text color for the header.

fields.name: OfflineCaseBackgroundImg
fields.description: URL of the image used for the background for the offline support case form in Embedded Chat.

fields.name: PrechatBackgroundImg
fields.description: URL of the image used for the background for the pre-chat form in Embedded Chat.

fields.name: PrimaryColor
fields.description: Value of the PrimaryColor field in the EmbeddedServiceBranding setup object.

fields.name: SecondaryColor
fields.description: Value of the SecondaryColor field in the EmbeddedServiceBranding setup object.

fields.name: SecondaryNavBarColor
fields.description: This field is used to set the color of a secondary header.

fields.name: ShouldHideAuthDialog
fields.description: Specifies whether the prompt that the customer log in again during a flow should be hidden ( true ) or not ( false ). When it’s hidden, the customer is taken directly to your login page.

fields.name: ShouldShowExistingAppointment
fields.description: Specifies whether to display a button on the home screen for customers to access their existing appointments ( true ) or not ( false ) for embedded Appointment Management (beta).

fields.name: ShouldShowNewAppointment
fields.description: Specifies whether to display a button on the home screen for customers to create a new appointment ( true ) or not ( false ) for embedded Appointment Management (beta).

fields.name: Site
fields.description: Value of the Site field in the EmbeddedServiceConfig setup object.

fields.name: SmallCompanyLogoImg
fields.description: URL of the logo image used with Embedded Chat.

fields.name: WaitingStateBackgroundImg
fields.description: URL of the image used for the background image in Embedded Chat while the customer waits to be connected with a support agent.

fields.name: Width
fields.description: Width of the embedded component.

fields.name: CustomLabelName
fields.description: The developer name for the custom label.

fields.name: DurableId
fields.description: The unique name containing EmbeddedServiceConfig.labelKey .

fields.name: EmbeddedServiceConfigDeveloperName
fields.description: Developer name for the EmbeddedServiceConfig.

fields.name: LabelKey
fields.description: The type of label for this embedded component. The value corresponds to the label within a label group (substate of chat state or page type).

fields.name: AboutMe
fields.description: Information about the employee, such as areas of interest or skills. Values can be provided on Employee’s profile page. This field is available even if Chatter is disabled.

fields.name: AlternateEmail
fields.description: The employee’s alternate email address.

fields.name: Availability
fields.description: The employee’s availability status.

fields.name: AvailabilityEndDate
fields.description: The end date of the Employee’s availability, inclusive of the date.

fields.name: AvailabilityStartDate
fields.description: The start date of the Employee’s availability, inclusive of the date.

fields.name: BannerPhotoUrl
fields.description: Read only. The URL for the employee's banner photo. Available in API v51.0 and later.

fields.name: CurrentWellnessStatus
fields.description: The employee’s current wellness status.

fields.name: DateOfBirth
fields.description: The employee’s date of birth.

fields.name: Email
fields.description: The employee’s email address. This field is unique within your organization.

fields.name: EmployeeNumber
fields.description: Required. The employee's employment ID for the organization they were hired into. This field is unique within your organization.

fields.name: EmployeeStatus
fields.description: Required. The employee's current work status.

fields.name: EmploymentType
fields.description: The employee's full-time or part-time status.

fields.name: FirstName
fields.description: Required. The employee’s first name.

fields.name: FullPhotoUrl
fields.description: Read only. The URL for the employee's profile photo. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo isn’t guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo. Available in API v51.0 and later.

fields.name: Gender
fields.description: The employee’s gender.

fields.name: HomeAddress
fields.description: The employee’s home address.

fields.name: HomeCity
fields.description: The city for the employee’s home address.

fields.name: HomeCountry
fields.description: The county for the employee’s home address.

fields.name: HomeGeocodeAccuracy
fields.description: The level of accuracy of an employee’s home address geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. A geocoding service typically provides this value based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.

fields.name: HomeLatitude
fields.description: Used with HomeLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of the employee’s home address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: HomeLongitude
fields.description: Used with HomeLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of the employee’s home address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

fields.name: HomePhone
fields.description: The employee’s home phone number.

fields.name: HomePostalCode
fields.description: The postal code for the employee’s home address.

fields.name: HomeState
fields.description: The state for the employee’s home address.

fields.name: HomeStreet
fields.description: The street for the employee’s home address.

fields.name: IndividualId
fields.description: A reference to the Individual record that this employee is assigned to.

fields.name: InternalOrganizationUnitId
fields.description: A reference to the InternalOrganizationUnit this employee is assigned to.

fields.name: JobProfile
fields.description: The employee’s job profile at the company.

fields.name: LastName
fields.description: Required. The employee’s last name.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: LocationId
fields.description: A reference to the Location that this employee is assigned to.

fields.name: ManagerId
fields.description: A reference to the Employee record of the employee's manager.

fields.name: MediumPhotoUrl
fields.description: Read only. The URL for the medium-sized employee's profile photo. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo isn’t guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo. Available in API v51.0 and later.

fields.name: MiddleName
fields.description: The employee’s middle name.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: A compound field of Employee.FirstName , Employee.MiddleName , and Employee.LastName .

fields.name: NameSuffix
fields.description: The employee’s suffix.

fields.name: OutOfOfficeMessage
fields.description: The message portion of the employee availability. This message can provide reasons or details about the change in availability. The maximum length of this string is 40 characters.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who currently owns this record. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create operation.

fields.name: PreferredFirstName
fields.description: The name the employee prefers to be called.

fields.name: PreferredPronoun
fields.description: The employee's preferred pronoun.

fields.name: RelatedPersonId
fields.description: Links an employee to a person account with a unique value. Reserved for future use. Don’t edit it.

fields.name: SmallPhotoUrl
fields.description: Read only. The URL for the small-sized employee's profile photo. The URL is updated every time a photo is uploaded and reflects the most recent photo. If a newer photo has been uploaded, the URL returned for an older photo isn’t guaranteed to return a photo. Query this field for the URL of the most recent photo. Available in API v51.0 and later.

fields.name: StatusAsOf
fields.description: Required. Start date of the employee’s current status.

fields.name: StatusEndDate
fields.description: Planned end date for the employee’s status.

fields.name: TimeZone
fields.description: The time zone which the employee’s work hours fall within.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: Lookup field to associate an Employee record with a user in the org. The field is optional and unique.

fields.name: WorkPhone
fields.description: The employee's formatted work phone number including country code and extension.

fields.name: WorkerType

fields.name: WorkingHoursStart
fields.description: The start time of the employee’s working hours.

fields.name: AlternateEmail
