fields.description: The 18-character case-insensitive ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: APP_NAME

fields.name: BROWSER_NAME
fields.description: The name of the browser that the user accessed.

fields.name: BROWSER_VERSION
fields.description: The version of the browser that the user accessed in major.minor version format. Some browsers don’t provide a minor version.

fields.name: CLIENT_GEO
fields.description: The geolocation of the client in the form of <Country>/<State|Province> .

fields.name: CLIENT_ID

fields.name: CLIENT_IP
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as Salesforce.com IP .

fields.name: CONNECTION_TYPE
fields.description: The type of connection.

fields.name: DEVICE_ID
fields.description: The unique identifier used to identify a device when tracking events. DEVICE_ID is a generated value that’s created when the mobile app is initially run after installation.

fields.name: DEVICE_MODEL
fields.description: The name of the device model.

fields.name: DEVICE_PLATFORM
fields.description: The type of application experience in name:experience:form format.

fields.name: DEVICE_SESSION_ID
fields.description: The unique identifier of the user’s session based on page load time. When the user reloads a page, a new session is started.

fields.name: DURATION
fields.description: If the page completes loading, then DURATION indicates the duration of time in milliseconds between PAGE_START_TIME and when the loading completes. In this case, DURATION corresponds to EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME . If the page doesn't complete loading, then DURATION indicates the duration of time in milliseconds between PAGE_START_TIME and when the user navigates to another page.

fields.name: EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME
fields.description: Indicates how many milliseconds it takes for the page to load before a user can interact with the page. Multiple factors can affect effective page time (EPT), such as network speed, hardware performance, or page complexity.

fields.name: EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME_DEVIATION
fields.description: When a deviation is detected, EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME_DEVIATION records true . The default value is false .

fields.name: EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME_DEVIATION_ERROR_TYPE
fields.description: Indicates the origin of an error. This field is populated when EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME_DEVIATION_REASON contains the PAGE_HAS_ERROR value.

fields.name: EFFECTIVE_PAGE_TIME_DEVIATION_REASON
fields.description: The reason for deviation in page loading time.

fields.name: EVENT_TYPE
fields.description: The type of event. The value is always LightningPageView .

fields.name: GRANDPARENT_UI_ELEMENT
fields.description: The grandparent scope of the page element where the event occurred.

fields.name: LOGIN_KEY
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring.

fields.description: The operating system version, derived from USER_AGENT .

fields.name: PAGE_CONTEXT
fields.description: The name of the component hosting the main content of the page.

fields.name: PAGE_ENTITY_ID
fields.description: The ID of the record that the user accessed which triggered the event on the page.

fields.name: PAGE_ENTITY_TYPE
fields.description: The entity type of the event.

fields.description: The page name or identifier.

fields.name: PAGE_FLEXI_PAGE_TYPE
fields.description: The page type.

fields.name: PAGE_START_TIME
fields.description: The time when the page starts loading, measured in milliseconds.

fields.name: PAGE_URL

fields.name: AUTHENTICATION_METHOD_REFERENCE
fields.description: The authentication method used by a third-party identification provider for an OpenID Connect single sign-on protocol. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.

fields.description: The 15-character ID for the authentication service used to log in. This field stores IDs for these authentication services. SAML single sign-on providers Token exchange handlers

fields.description: The identifier string returned by the browser used at login.

fields.name: CIPHER_SUITE
fields.description: The TLS cipher suite used for the login. Values are OpenSSL-style cipher suite names, with hyphen delimiters. For more information, see OpenSSL Cryptography and SSL/TLS Toolkit .

fields.name: CLIENT_IP
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP (such as a login from AppExchange) is shown as “Salesforce.com IP”.

fields.name: COUNTRY_CODE
fields.description: The country code associated with the IP address of the user logging in.

fields.name: CPU_TIME
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: DB_TOTAL_TIME
fields.description: The time in nanoseconds for a database round trip. Includes time spent in the JDBC driver, network to the database, and DB_CPU_TIME . Compare this field to CPU_TIME to determine whether performance issues are occurring in the database layer or in your own code.

fields.name: EVENT_TYPE
fields.description: The type of event. The value is always Login .

fields.name: FORWARDED_FOR_IP
fields.description: The value in the X-Forwarded-For header of HTTP requests sent by the client. For logins that use one or more HTTP proxies, the X-Forwarded-For header is sometimes used to store the origin IP and all proxy IPs.

fields.name: HTTP_REFERER
fields.description: The referring URI of the page that’s receiving the request.

fields.name: LOGIN_KEY
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring.

fields.name: LOGIN_STATUS
fields.description: The status of the login attempt. For successful logins, the value is LOGIN_NO_ERROR. All other values indicate errors or authentication issues. For details, see Login Event Type — LOGIN_STATUS Values .

fields.name: LOGIN_SUB_TYPE
fields.description: The type of login flow used. See the LoginSubType field of LoginHistory in the Object Reference guide for the list of possible values. Label is Login Subtype .

fields.name: LOGIN_URL

fields.name: SOURCE_IP
fields.description: The IP address of the incoming client request that first reaches Salesforce during a login. For example, 126.7.4.2 . For clients that redirect through one or more HTTP proxies, this field stores the IP address of the first proxy to reach Salesforce. To better identify the origin IP for these cases, check the FORWARDED_FOR_IP field instead.

fields.description: The 18-character case-safe ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: BROWSER_DEVICE_TYPE
fields.description: A code used to identify the browser and device type. The code is in the format “BBVVVXYZ,” with the following signification: BB — Two digits that indicate the browser type. IE: “10” CHROME: "13" FIREFOX: "11" SAFARI: "14" OPERA: "15" ANDROID_WEBKIT: "16" NETSCAPE: "17" OTHER_WEBKIT: "18" OTHER_GECKO: "19" OTHER_KHTML: "20" OTHER_MOBILE: "21" SALESFORCE_DESKTOP: "22" BLACKBERRY: "23" GOOD_ACCESS: "24" EDGE: "25" SALESFORCE_MOBILE: "26" VVV—Three digits that indicate version, leading zeroes. XYZ—Browser-type specific flags or options. Each digit in XYZ represents a different flag depending on the BrowserType: X=1: If the parser recognizes a "touch" browser. Here, touch means the older touch native client, not that the device supports touch. Y=1: If the parser recognizes a browser in compatibility mode. Only for IE. Z=1: If the browser is recognized as MOBILE . Z=2: If the browser is recognized as PHONE . Z=3: If the browser is recognized as TABLET . Z=4: If the browser is a recognized as MEDIA PLAYER . Z=6: Only for Opera Mini.

fields.name: DB_TOTAL_TIME

fields.name: RUN_TIME
fields.description: The amount of time that the request took in milliseconds. Requests with a value over five seconds are considered long-running requests for the purposes of the Concurrent Long-Running Apex Limit. Note HTTP callout processing time isn't included when calculating the 5-second limit. We pause the timer for the callout and resume it when the callout completes.

fields.name: TYPE
fields.description: The type of time-based workflow event. UIDEL —An entry was deleted from the Time-Based Automations page in Setup. ERRDEL —An entry was deleted from the workflow queue, because there was an error reading the record that triggered the workflow rule. The associated time-dependent actions weren’t processed. DELETE —An entry was deleted from the workflow queue, because it’s no longer relevant. For example, the criteria are no longer met by the associated record. If the evaluation date for the entry changed, the entry is re-added with the updated evaluation date. PROC —An entry was deleted from the workflow queue after processing a time-dependent action.

objects.name: UI Telemetry Navigation Timing Event Type
objects.title: UI Telemetry Navigation Timing Event Type

fields.name: APP_NAME
fields.description: The name of the application that the user accessed.

fields.name: BROWSER_NAME
fields.description: The name of the browser that the user accessed.

fields.name: BROWSER_VERSION
fields.description: The version of the browser that the user accessed in major.minor version format. Some browsers don’t provide a minor version.

fields.name: CLIENT_GEO
fields.description: The geolocation of the client in the form of <Country>/<State|Province> .

fields.name: CLIENT_ID
fields.description: The API client ID.

fields.name: CLIENT_IP
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP, such as a login from AppExchange, is shown as Salesforce.com IP .

fields.name: CONNECT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser establishes a connection to a server so that it can retrieve a resource. To calculate the Transport Control Protocol (TCP) handshake time, subtract the CONNECT_START time from the CONNECT_END time.

fields.name: CONNECT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds after the browser completes the Domain Name System (DNS) lookup and begins connecting to a server so that it can retrieve a resource. To calculate the Transport Control Protocol (TCP) handshake time, subtract the CONNECT_START time from the CONNECT_END time.

fields.name: CONNECTION_TYPE
fields.description: The type of connection.

fields.name: DECODED_BODY_SIZE
fields.description: The size in octets of the HTTP message body after the removal of any applied content encoding.

fields.name: DEVICE_MODEL
fields.description: The name of the device model.

fields.name: DEVICE_PLATFORM
fields.description: The type of application experience in name:experience:form format.

fields.name: DEVICE_SESSION_ID
fields.description: The unique identifier of the user’s session based on page load time. When the user reloads a page, a new session is started.

fields.name: DOM_COMPLETE
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s readyState property is set to complete . Indicates that the page and its subresources have finished loading.

fields.name: DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s DOMContentLoaded event handler completes. To calculate the processing time for the DOMContentLoaded event handler, subtract the DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_START time from the DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s DOMContentLoaded event handler starts. To calculate the processing time for the DOMContentLoaded event handler, subtract the DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_START time from the DOM_CONTENT_LOADED_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: DOM_INTERACTIVE
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s readyState is set to interactive . Indicates that the page has finished loading, but subresources, such as images and scripts, are still loading.

fields.name: DOMAIN_LOOKUP_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser completes a DNS lookup for a resource. To calculate the DNS lookup time, subtract the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_START time from the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_END time.

fields.name: DOMAIN_LOOKUP_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts a DNS lookup for a resource. To calculate the DNS lookup time, subtract the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_START time from the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_END time.

fields.name: DURATION
fields.description: The total duration in milliseconds of the event from the START_TIME to the LOAD_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: ENCODED_BODY_SIZE
fields.description: The size in octets of the HTTP message body before the removal of any applied content encoding.

fields.name: EVENT_TYPE
fields.description: The type of event. The value is always UITelemetryNavigationTiming .

fields.name: FETCH_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to fetch a resource from the server, not including redirects. Occurs before the DNS lookup and the connection to the server is established. To calculate the total time used to fetch a resource without redirects, subtract the FETCH_START time from the RESPONSE_END time.

fields.name: FIRST_INTERIM_RESPONSE_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the first byte of the interim 1xx response from the server. To calculate the time from when the browser sends a request to when it starts to receive an interim response, subtract the REQUEST_START time from the FIRST_INTERIM_RESPONSE_START time.

fields.name: INITIATOR_TYPE
fields.description: The HTML element that initiates the resource load.

fields.name: LOAD_EVENT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s load event handler completes. To calculate the processing time for the load event handler, subtract the LOAD_EVENT_START time from the LOAD_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: LOAD_EVENT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s load event handler begins. To calculate the processing time for the load event handler, subtract the LOAD_EVENT_START time from the LOAD_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: LOGIN_KEY
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring.

fields.name: NAVIGATION_TYPE
fields.description: The type of navigation timing data.

fields.name: NEXT_HOP_PROTOCOL
fields.description: The Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation (ALPN) Protocol ID that fetches the resource.

fields.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the org.

fields.name: OS_NAME
fields.description: The operating system name, derived from USER_AGENT .

fields.name: OS_VERSION
fields.description: The operating system version, derived from USER_AGENT .

fields.name: PAGE_CONTEXT
fields.description: The name of the component hosting the main content of the page.

fields.name: PAGE_ENTITY_ID
fields.description: The unique entity identifier of the event.

fields.name: PAGE_ENTITY_TYPE
fields.description: The entity type of the event.

fields.name: PAGE_URL
fields.description: The relative URL of the top-level Lightning Experience page that the user opened. The page can contain one or more Lightning components. Multiple record IDs can be associated with PAGE_URL .

fields.name: REDIRECT_COUNT
fields.description: The total number of redirects since the last non-redirect navigation in the current browsing context.

fields.name: REDIRECT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the last byte of the response of the final redirect. To calculate the total redirection time, subtract the REDIRECT_START time from the REDIRECT_END time.

fields.name: REDIRECT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to fetch a resource that initiates a redirect. To calculate the total redirection time, subtract the REDIRECT_START time from the REDIRECT_END time.

fields.name: RENDER_BLOCKING_STATUS
fields.description: The status that indicates whether the resource can block or delay the browser from rendering page content.

fields.name: REQUEST_ID
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID .

fields.name: REQUEST_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to request the resource from the server. To calculate the total request time, subtract the REQUEST_START time from the RESPONSE_START time.

fields.name: RESPONSE_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the resource’s last byte or when the transport connection closes, whichever comes first. To calculate the total time used to fetch a resource without redirects, subtract the FETCH_START time from the RESPONSE_END time.

fields.name: RESPONSE_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the first byte of the response from the server. To calculate the total request time, subtract the REQUEST_START time from the RESPONSE_START time.

fields.name: RESPONSE_STATUS
fields.description: The HTTP response status code.

fields.name: SDK_APP_TYPE
fields.description: The mobile SDK application type.

fields.name: SDK_APP_VERSION
fields.description: The mobile SDK application version number.

fields.name: SDK_VERSION
fields.description: The mobile SDK version number.

fields.name: SECURE_CONNECT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser begins the handshake process that secures the connection. To calculate the Transport Layer Security (TLS) time, subtract the SECURE_CONNECT_START time from the REQUEST_START time.

fields.name: SERVER_REQUEST_ID
fields.description: The request ID for the server request that’s used to find associated server logs.

fields.name: SESSION_KEY
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all events in Lightning Experience within a session. When the user logs out and logs in again, a new session starts.

fields.name: START_TIME
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to fetch the resource, including redirects.

fields.name: TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT.

fields.name: TIMESTAMP_DERIVED
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in ISO8601-compatible format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ).

fields.name: TRANSFER_SIZE
fields.description: The size in octets of the resource, including the response header and the response payload body.

fields.name: UI_EVENT_RELATIVE_TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The difference in milliseconds between when the event is logged and when the browser tab is opened.

fields.name: UI_EVENT_TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The time at which this event occurs, measured in milliseconds.

fields.name: UI_ROOT_ACTIVITY_ID
fields.description: The ID of the root activity when the event occurs.

fields.name: UI_THREAD_RESPONSE_DELAY
fields.description: The time in milliseconds from when the browser receives the response to when it executes the callback. This delay occurs if the main Javascript thread is busy when the response is received.

fields.name: UNLOAD_EVENT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s unload event handler completes. To calculate the processing time for the unload event handler, subtract the UNLOAD_EVENT_START time from the UNLOAD_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: UNLOAD_EVENT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the page’s unload event handler starts. To calculate the processing time for the unload event handler, subtract the UNLOAD_EVENT_START time from the UNLOAD_EVENT_END time.

fields.name: URL
fields.description: The URL of the request.

fields.name: USER_ID
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user accessing Salesforce services through the UI or API.

fields.name: USER_ID_DERIVED
fields.description: The 18-character case-insensitive ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: USER_TYPE
fields.description: The category of user license of the user accessing Salesforce services through the UI or API.

fields.name: WORKER_START
fields.description: If a service worker is installed, the time in milliseconds when the active service worker receives the fetch event. To measure the service worker processing time, subtract the WORKER_START time from the FETCH_START time.

fields.name: APP_NAME
fields.description: The name of the application that the user accessed.

fields.name: BROWSER_NAME
fields.description: The name of the browser that the user accessed.

fields.name: BROWSER_VERSION
fields.description: The version of the browser that the user accessed in major.minor version format. Some browsers don’t provide a minor version.

fields.name: CLIENT_GEO
fields.description: The geolocation of the client in the form of <Country>/<State|Province> .

fields.name: CLIENT_ID
fields.description: The API client ID.

fields.name: CLIENT_IP
fields.description: The IP address of the client that’s using Salesforce services. A Salesforce internal IP, such as a login from AppExchange, is shown as “Salesforce.com IP.”

fields.name: CONNECT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser establishes a connection to a server so that it can retrieve a resource. To calculate the Transport Control Protocol (TCP) handshake time, subtract the CONNECT_START time from the CONNECT_END time.

fields.name: CONNECT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds after the browser completes the Domain Name System (DNS) lookup and begins connecting to a server so that it can retrieve a resource. To calculate the Transport Control Protocol (TCP) handshake time, subtract the CONNECT_START time from the CONNECT_END time.

fields.name: CONNECTION_TYPE
fields.description: The type of connection.

fields.name: DECODED_BODY_SIZE
fields.description: The size in octets of the HTTP message body after the removal of any applied content encoding.

fields.name: DEVICE_MODEL
fields.description: The name of the device model.

fields.name: DEVICE_PLATFORM
fields.description: The type of application experience in name:experience:form format.

fields.name: DEVICE_SESSION_ID
fields.description: The unique identifier of the user’s session based on page load time. When the user reloads a page, a new session is started.

fields.name: DOMAIN_LOOKUP_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser completes a DNS lookup for a resource. To calculate the DNS lookup time, subtract the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_START time from the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_END time.

fields.name: DOMAIN_LOOKUP_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts a DNS lookup for a resource. To calculate the DNS lookup time, subtract the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_START time from the DOMAIN_LOOKUP_END time.

fields.name: DURATION
fields.description: The total duration in milliseconds of the event from the START_TIME to the RESPONSE_END time.

fields.name: ENCODED_BODY_SIZE
fields.description: The size in octets of the HTTP message body before the removal of any applied content encoding.

fields.name: EVENT_TYPE
fields.description: The type of event. The value is always UITelemetryResourceTiming .

fields.name: FETCH_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to fetch a resource from the server, not including redirects. Occurs before the DNS lookup and the connection to the server is established. To calculate the total time used to fetch a resource without redirects, subtract the FETCH_START time from the RESPONSE_END time.

fields.name: FIRST_INTERIM_RESPONSE_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the first byte of the interim 1xx response from the server. To calculate the time from when the browser sends a request to when it starts to receive an interim response, subtract the REQUEST_START time from the FIRST_INTERIM_RESPONSE_START time.

fields.name: INITIATOR_TYPE
fields.description: The HTML element that initiates the resource load.

fields.name: LOGIN_KEY
fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring.

fields.name: NEXT_HOP_PROTOCOL
fields.description: The Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation (ALPN) Protocol ID that fetches the resource.

fields.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the org.

fields.name: OS_NAME
fields.description: The operating system name, derived from USER_AGENT .

fields.name: OS_VERSION
fields.description: The operating system version, derived from USER_AGENT .

fields.name: PAGE_CONTEXT
fields.description: The name of the component hosting the main content of the page.

fields.name: PAGE_ENTITY_ID
fields.description: The unique entity identifier of the event.

fields.name: PAGE_ENTITY_TYPE
fields.description: The entity type of the event.

fields.name: PAGE_URL
fields.description: Relative URL of the top-level Lightning Experience page that the user opened. The page can contain one or more Lightning components. Multiple record IDs can be associated with PAGE_URL .

fields.name: REDIRECT_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the last byte of the response of the final redirect. To calculate the total redirection time, subtract the REDIRECT_START time from the REDIRECT_END time.

fields.name: REDIRECT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to fetch a resource that initiates a redirect. To calculate the total redirection time, subtract the REDIRECT_START time from the REDIRECT_END time.

fields.name: RENDER_BLOCKING_STATUS
fields.description: The status that indicates whether the resource can block or delay the browser from rendering page content.

fields.name: REQUEST_ID
fields.description: The unique ID of a single transaction. A transaction can contain one or more events. Each event in a given transaction has the same REQUEST_ID .

fields.name: REQUEST_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to request the resource from the server. To calculate the total request time, subtract the REQUEST_START time from the RESPONSE_START time.

fields.name: RESPONSE_END
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the resource’s last byte or when the transport connection closes, whichever comes first. To calculate the total time used to fetch a resource without redirects, subtract the FETCH_START time from the RESPONSE_END time.

fields.name: RESPONSE_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser receives the first byte of the response from the server. To calculate the total request time, subtract the REQUEST_START time from the RESPONSE_START time.

fields.name: RESPONSE_STATUS
fields.description: The HTTP response status code.

fields.name: SDK_APP_TYPE
fields.description: The mobile SDK application type.

fields.name: SDK_APP_VERSION
fields.description: The mobile SDK application version number.

fields.name: SDK_VERSION
fields.description: The mobile SDK version number.

fields.name: SECURE_CONNECT_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser begins the handshake process that secures the connection. To calculate the Transport Layer Security (TLS) time, subtract the SECURE_CONNECT_START time from the REQUEST_START time.

fields.name: SERVER_REQUEST_ID
fields.description: The requestId for the server request that’s used to find associated server logs.

fields.name: SESSION_KEY
fields.description: The user’s unique session ID. You can use this value to identify all events in Lightning Experience within a session. When the user logs out and logs in again, a new session starts.

fields.name: START_TIME
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the browser starts to fetch the resource, including redirects.

fields.name: TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in GMT.

fields.name: TIMESTAMP_DERIVED
fields.description: The access time of Salesforce services in ISO8601-compatible format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ).

fields.name: TRANSFER_SIZE
fields.description: The size in octets of the resource, including the response header and the response payload body.

fields.name: UI_EVENT_RELATIVE_TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The difference in milliseconds between when the event is logged and when the browser tab is opened.

fields.name: UI_EVENT_TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The time at which this event occurs, measured in milliseconds.

fields.name: UI_ROOT_ACTIVITY_ID
fields.description: The ID of the root activity when the event occurs.

fields.name: UI_THREAD_RESPONSE_DELAY
fields.description: The time in milliseconds from when the browser receives the response to when it executes the callback. This delay occurs if the main Javascript thread is busy when the response is received.

fields.name: URL
fields.description: The URL of the request.

fields.name: USER_ID
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the user accessing Salesforce services through the UI or API.

fields.name: USER_ID_DERIVED
fields.description: The 18-character case-insensitive ID of the user who’s using Salesforce services through the UI or the API.

fields.name: USER_TYPE
fields.description: The category of user license of the user accessing Salesforce services through the UI or API.

fields.name: WORKER_START
fields.description: The time in milliseconds when the active service worker receives the fetch event, if a service worker is installed. To measure the service worker processing time, subtract the WORKER_START time from the FETCH_START time.

fields.name: BOT_IDENTIFIER
fields.description: The ID of the bot.

fields.name: BOT_SESSION_IDENTIFIER
fields.description: The bot session ID.

fields.description: The string that ties together all events in a given user’s login session. It starts with a login event and ends with either a logout event or the user session expiring.

fields.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
fields.description: The 15-character ID of the organization.

fields.description: The text of the SOQL query run or the Id of the report or list view run.

fields.name: QUERY_TYPE

fields.name: CPU_TIME
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds used to complete the request. This field indicates the amount of activity taking place in the app server layer.

fields.name: DB_BLOCKS
fields.description: Indicates how much activity is occurring in the database. A high value for this field suggests that adding indexes or filters on your queries would benefit performance.

fields.name: DB_CPU_TIME
fields.description: The CPU time in milliseconds to complete the request. Indicates the amount of activity taking place in the database layer during the request.

fields.name: DB_TOTAL_TIME
fields.description: The time in nanoseconds for a database round trip. Includes time spent in the JDBC driver, network to the database, and DB_CPU_TIME . Compare this field to CPU_TIME to determine whether performance issues are occurring in the database layer or in your own code.

fields.description: The view mode for the CRM Analytics asset. Possible values include view , edit , present , json , or print .

fields.name: WAVE_SESSION_ID
fields.description: The ID of a particular session of CRM Analytics. Use this field to determine which log lines originated from a particular session.

fields.name: WAVE_TIMESTAMP
fields.description: The time at which this log line was generated.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: Contains the Account ID of the relation. For information on IDs, see ID Field Type . AccountId is visible when Shared Activities is enabled.

fields.name: EventId
fields.description: Contains the ID of the event. This value can’t be changed after it’s been specified.

fields.name: IsDeleted
fields.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin ( true ) or not ( false ). Label is Deleted .

fields.name: IsInvitee
fields.description: Indicates whether the relation is an invitee. IsInvitee is visible while Shared Activities is being enabled, after it has been enabled, and while it is being disabled. IsInvitee defaults to true while Shared Activities is being enabled, after it has been enabled, and while it is being disabled if IsInvitee , IsParent , and IsWhat are not set. This configuration ensures compatibility when Shared Activities isn’t enabled and EventRelation represents event invitees only. IsInvitee defaults to false when Shared Activities is enabled if IsParent is set to true .

fields.name: IsParent
fields.description: IsParent is visible only when Shared Activities is enabled. When false , indicates that the relation is an invitee (a contact, lead, or user). When true , indicates that the relation is a Who or What, as determined by IsWhat field.

fields.name: IsWhat
fields.description: IsWhat is visible only when Shared Activities is enabled. The value is relevant only if IsParent is true . When IsWhat is true , the relation specified by RelationId is a What (an account, opportunity, custom object, etc.). When IsWhat is false , the relation specified by RelationId is a Who (a contact, lead, or user).

fields.name: RelationId
fields.description: Contains the ID of the person (User, Contact, or Lead) or the resource invited to an event. When Shared Activities is enabled, RelationId can also contain the ID of an account, opportunity, or other object related to an event.

fields.name: RespondedDate
fields.description: Indicates the most recent date and time when the invitee responded to an invitation to an event.

fields.name: Response
fields.description: Contains optional text that the invitee can enter when responding to an invitation to an event.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Indicates the invitee status with one of the following values: New : Invitee has received the invitation but hasn’t yet responded. This value is the default. Declined : Invitee has declined the invitation. Accepted : Invitee has accepted the invitation. Note Uninvited and Maybe aren’t currently supported.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: The ID of the subscriber. For example, the trigger ID.

fields.name: IsPartitioned
fields.description: Indicates whether the platform event Apex trigger is configured with parallel subscriptions ( true ) or not ( false ). The default value is false . See Platform Event Processing at Scale with Parallel Subscriptions for Apex Triggers in the Platform Events Developer Guide .

fields.name: LastError
fields.description: The error message that the last thrown EventBus.RetryableException contains. This field applies to Apex triggers only. Available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: LastProcessed
fields.description: The replay ID of the last event that the subscriber processed. This field replaces Position as of API level 66.0.

fields.name: LastPublished
fields.description: The replay ID of the last published event. This field replaces Tip as of API level 66.0. Note For high-volume platform events and change events, the value for Tip isn’t available and is always -1.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the subscribed item, such as the trigger or process name. If the subscribed item’s name is “Process”, at least one flow Pause element is subscribed to the event.

fields.name: Position
fields.description: The replay ID of the last event that the subscriber processed. This field has been deprecated as of API level 66.0 and should no longer be used. Use LastProcessed instead. This field may not be properly represented if the value exceeds the maximum integer size.

fields.name: Retries
fields.description: The number of times the trigger was retried due to throwing the EventBus.RetryableException . This field applies to Apex triggers only. Available in API version 43.0 and later.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: Indicates the status of the subscriber. Can be one of these values: Error — The subscriber was disconnected and stopped receiving published events. A trigger reaches this state when it exceeds the number of maximum retries with the EventBus.RetryableException . Trigger assertion failures and unhandled exceptions don’t cause the error state. We recommend limiting the retries to fewer than nine times to avoid reaching this state. When you fix and save the trigger, or for a managed package trigger, if you redeploy the package, the trigger resumes automatically from the tip, starting from new events. Also, you can resume a trigger subscription in the subscription detail page that you access from the platform event page. Repartitioning —The system is in the process of modifying the trigger's parallel subscription configuration. Running —The subscriber is actively listening to events. If you modify the subscriber, the subscription continues to process events. Suspended —The subscriber is disconnected and can’t receive events because a Salesforce admin suspended it or due to an internal error. You can resume a trigger subscription in the subscription detail page that you access from the platform event page. To resume a process, deactivate it and then reactivate it. If you modify the subscriber, the subscription resumes automatically from the tip, starting from new events.

fields.name: Tip
fields.description: The replay ID of the last published event. This field has been deprecated as of API level 66.0 and should no longer be used. Use LastPublished instead. This field may not be properly represented if the value exceeds the maximum integer size. Note For high-volume platform events and change events, the value for Tip isn’t available and is always -1.

fields.name: Topic
fields.description: The name of the subscription channel that corresponds to a platform event or change event. For a platform event, the topic name is the event name appended with __e , such as MyEvent__e . For a change event, the topic is the name of the change event, such as AccountChangeEvent .

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The subscriber type ( ApexTrigger ). If the subscriber is a process or flow Pause element, the type is blank.

fields.name: DestinationResourceName
fields.description: The developer name of the named credential, which stores the AWS account information. The destinationResourceName value contains the callout: prefix. For example: callout:MyRelayNamedCredential

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: Required. The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Label is Record Type Name . This field is automatically generated, but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API.

fields.name: EventChannel
fields.description: The full name of the event channel used in the event relay. For example: MyRelayChannel__chn

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the EventRelayConfig.

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Label for the EventRelayConfig. In the UI, this field is Event Relay Config.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix associated with this object. Each Developer Edition organization that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values: In Developer Edition organizations, the namespace prefix is set to the namespace prefix of the organization for all objects that support it. There is an exception if an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition organization of the package developer. In organizations that are not Developer Edition organizations, NamespacePrefix is only set for objects that are part of an installed managed package. There is no namespace prefix for all other objects.

fields.name: RelayOption
fields.description: A JSON-encoded string that contains an option for resuming an event relay after the system recovers from an error. This option is used if the event relay can't resume after the last relayed event. The options available are: "{\"ReplayRecovery\":\"LATEST\"}" —(Default) Start relaying events from new events received in the event bus. Use this option if you aren’t interested in missed events while the relay was down. "{\"ReplayRecovery\":\"EARLIEST\"}" —Resend all events stored in the event bus and relay new events thereafter. The event bus stores events for up to three days. Use this option if you want to reprocess all stored events and catch up on missed events.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The execution state of the event relay. Possible values are: RUN —The event relay is running and actively relaying event messages from Salesforce to Amazon EventBridge. PAUSE —An administrator paused the event relay. No events are relayed to Amazon EventBridge during this status. All current state information is saved. STOP —(Default) The event relay is stopped and no events are relayed to Amazon EventBridge. All current state information is deleted.

fields.name: UsageType
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: ErrorCode
fields.description: The error code of the last error that occurred during the relay of event messages. For a list of possible error codes and messages, see Error Codes .

fields.name: ErrorIdentifier
fields.description: The identifier of an unexpected system error that occurred during the relay of event messages.

fields.name: ErrorMessage
fields.description: The error message of the last error that occurred during the relay of event messages. For a list of possible error codes and messages, see Error Codes .

fields.name: ErrorTime
fields.description: The date and time in the UTC time zone when the last error occurred during the relay of event messages.

fields.name: EventRelayConfigId
fields.description: The ID of the event relay configuration that this feedback record is collecting the execution information of.

fields.name: EventRelayNumber
fields.description: The number that identifies the EventRelayFeedback record. This field is of type Auto Number.

fields.name: LastRelayedEventTime
fields.description: The date and time in the UTC time zone when the last event was relayed to Amazon EventBridge.

fields.name: RemoteResource
fields.description: The name of the partner event source associated with the event relay. It is in the format aws.partner/salesforce.com/ orgID / channelID . For example: aws.partner/salesforce.com/00DRM000000Fxts2AC/0YLRM0000004Dfg4AE .

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the event relay.

fields.name: UsageType
fields.description: Reserved for future use.

fields.name: EventId
fields.description: The unique ID of the related event record.

fields.name: IsArchived
fields.description: Indicates whether the event is archived ( true ) or not ( false ). This value helps manage high volumes of archived events, improving query performance.

fields.name: IsOrganizer
fields.description: Indicates whether the invitee is the event organizer ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The invited email address.

fields.name: StagedInviteeEmailId
fields.description: The unique ID of the related invitee email address record.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The attendance response to the event from the invitee.

fields.name: ItemId
fields.description: ID of the tagged item.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the tag. If this value does not already exist, a new TagDefinition is created and becomes the parent of this Tag object. Otherwise, a TagDefinition with the same name becomes the parent of this Tag object. Parent relationships are created automatically.

fields.name: TagDefinitionId
fields.description: ID of the parent TagDefinition object that owns the tag.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Defines the visibility of a tag.

fields.name: EventId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the event.

fields.name: RelationId
fields.description: Indicates the ID of the contacts or lead related to the event.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Indicates whether the person related to the event is a contact or lead.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: The ID of the account associated with the linked work order.

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: The amount of the expense.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description for the expense.

fields.name: Discount
fields.description: The percentage deducted from the Subtotal price. Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: ExpenseEndDate
fields.description: If the expense was incurred over multiple days, the Expense End Date is the last day that the expense covers.

fields.name: ExpenseNumber
fields.description: The number that uniquely identifies the expense.

fields.name: ExpenseStartDate
fields.description: If the expense was incurred over multiple days, the Expense Start Date is the first day that the expense covers.

fields.name: ExpenseType
fields.description: The type of expense. Possible values are: Billable Non-Billable The default value is Billable .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who owns the expense record.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.description: The number of items purchased in this record. Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: Subtotal
fields.description: The subtotal price calculated as the product of Quantity and UnitPrice . Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: A title that identifies the expense.

fields.name: TotalPrice
fields.description: The total price of the transaction which is equal to the discounted subtotal: Subtotal - ( Discount * Subtotal ). Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: TransactionDate
fields.description: The day that the expense was incurred, or the payment date for the expense.

fields.name: UnitPrice
fields.description: The price of one item on the record. Available in version 51.0 and later.

fields.name: WorkOrderId
fields.description: The ID of the work order associated with the expense.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: A description for the expense report.

fields.name: ExpenseReportNumber
fields.description: An auto-generated number identifying the expense report.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the user who owns the expense report record.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: A title that identifies the expense report.

fields.name: TotalExpenseAmount
fields.description: The sum of all expense entries in the report.

fields.name: Amount
fields.description: The amount of the expense.

fields.name: CurrencyIsoCode
fields.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

fields.name: ExpenseId
fields.description: The expense that corresponds to the expense report entry.

fields.name: ExpenseReportEntryNumber
fields.description: An auto-generated number identifying the expense report entry.

fields.name: ExpenseReportId
fields.description: The expense report that’s associated with the expense report entry.

fields.name: ExpenseType
fields.description: The type of expense. Possible values are: Billable Non-Billable The default value is Billable .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: A title that identifies the expense.

fields.name: TransactionDate
fields.description: The day that the expense was incurred, or the payment date for the expense.

fields.name: ContextId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the MacroInstruction object that contains the expression.

fields.name: FilterConditionLogic
fields.description: Optional. The filter conditions to use and the order in which to apply them. For example, ‘1 AND 2’ evaluates condition 1 and then condition 2.

fields.name: FilterDescription
fields.description: Optional. A description of the filter expression that helps to explain the logic to users. For example, ‘Applies to New cases.’

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Optional. A label for the expression.

fields.name: ExpressionFilterId
fields.description: Required. The ID of the ExpressionFilter object that references this condition.

fields.name: FilterTarget
fields.description: Required. The target object or field used in the condition. For example, to create a condition that applies to new cases, use Case.Status as the FilterTarget .

fields.name: FilterTargetValue
fields.description: Optional. The value that’s compared to the value of the FilterTarget. For example, to create a condition that applies to new cases, use New as the FilterTargetValue .

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Optional. A label for the condition.

fields.name: Operation
fields.description: Required. Specifies the operator used to compare the target field and the target value. For example, to create a condition that applies to new cases, use EQUALS for the Operation field, as in Case.Status EQUALS New . EQUALS NOTEQUALS CONTAINS NOTCONTAIN

fields.name: SortOrder
fields.description: Required. The order in which the criteria are evaluated.

fields.name: ConstraintModelTag
fields.description: The product tag that is defined in the constraint model, for example, Laptop .

fields.name: ConstraintModelTagType
fields.description: The type of the product tag that is defined in the constraint model.

fields.name: ExpressionSetId
fields.description: The expression set associated with the expression set constraint object.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but didn’t view it.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the expression set constraint.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: ReferenceObjectId
fields.description: The object associated with the expression set constraint object.

fields.name: DataShareType
fields.description: The type of data share, indicating the direction of data flow. If Outbound , the data share was created on this Data Cloud org and is shared to third-party partners or with another Data Cloud org. If Inbound , the data share comes from another Data Cloud org and is shared to this Data Cloud org.

fields.name: DataSpaceId
fields.description: The ID of the data space under which the data share was created.

fields.name: InboundDataShareName
fields.description: The name of the data share in the source Data Cloud org.

fields.name: InboundDataShareOrgIdentifier
fields.description: The ID of the source Data Cloud org that shared a data share with the target org.

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate is not null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the data share.

fields.name: ObjectCount
fields.description: The number of Data Cloud objects added to this data share.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: The ID of the account in the external account hierarchy.

fields.name: CurrencyISOCode
fields.description: Possible values are: GBP — British Pound USD — U.S. Dollar The default value is USD .

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The description of the external account hierarchy.

fields.name: HierarchyType
fields.description: Possible values are: CustomerPortal — Customer Partner The default value is Partner .

fields.name: IsAccessibleToParent
fields.description: Allows data to be shared with parent account in the account hierarchy. The default value is true .

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: When true, the hierarchy is turned on. The default value is false .

fields.name: LastReferencedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

fields.name: LastViewedDate
fields.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced ( LastReferencedDate ) and not viewed.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Name of the external account hierarchy.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The ID of the account owner.

fields.name: ParentId
fields.description: The ID of the parent account.

fields.name: DataType
fields.description: Possible values are: Address AnyType AutoNumber Base64 BitVector Boolean Content Currency DataCategoryGroupReference DateOnly DateTime Division Double DynamicEnum Email EncryptedBase64 EncryptedText EntityId EnumOrId ExternalId Fax File HtmlMultiLineText HtmlStringPlusClob InetAddress Json Location MultiEnum MultiLineText Namespace Percent PersonName Phone Raw RecordType SfdcEncryptedText SimpleNamespace StringPlusClob Switchable_PersonName Text TimeOnly Url YearQuarter

fields.name: ExternalAccountHierarchyId
fields.description: The ID of the external account hierarchy.

fields.name: Field
fields.description: Possible values are: Account HierarchyType - Hierarchy Type IsAccessibleToParent - Is Accessible to Parent IsActive - Is Hierarchy Active Name Owner Parent Created - Created. FeedEvent - Feed Event IndividualMerged - Individual Merged Locked - Record Locked OwnerAccepted - Owner (Accepted) OwnerAssignment - Owner (Assignment) Unlocked - Record unlocked

fields.name: NewValue
fields.description: The updated value of the changed field.

fields.name: OldValue
fields.description: The previous value of the changed field.

fields.name: AuthProviderId
fields.description: Salesforce ID of the authentication provider, which defines the service that provides the login process and approves access to the external system. Only users with the “Customize Application” and “Manage AuthProviders” permissions can view this field. This field is available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: CustomConfiguration
fields.description: A JSON-encoded configuration string that defines parameters specific to the type of external data source.

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record.

fields.name: Endpoint
fields.description: The URL of the external system, or if that URL is defined in a named credential, the named credential URL.

fields.name: isWritable
fields.description: Lets the Lightning Platform and users in this org create, update, and delete records for external objects associated with the external data source. The external object data is stored outside the org. By default, external objects are read only. Available only for Salesforce Connect external data sources. Available in API version 35.0 and later. However, with the cross-org adapter for Salesforce Connect, you can set this field to true only in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: Language
fields.description: The language of the MasterLabel .

fields.name: MasterLabel
fields.description: Master label for the external data source. This internal label doesn’t get translated.

fields.name: NamedCredentialId
fields.description: The Salesforce ID of the referenced named credential for an external data source. Required for Salesforce Connect adapters for Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon Athena, GraphQL, and OData 4.01. For connecting to other external data sources, the field must be null. This field is available in API version 58.0 and later.

fields.name: NamespacePrefix
fields.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix __ componentName notation.

fields.name: PrincipalType
fields.description: Specifies whether the org uses one set ( NamedUser ), multiple sets ( PerUser ), or no ( Anonymous ) credentials to access the external system. Each set of credentials corresponds to a login account on the external system. Corresponds to Identity Type in the user interface.

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: Specifies whether to use OAuth, password authentication, or no authentication to access the external system.

fields.name: Repository
fields.description: Used for SharePoint Online. An optional name of the repository in the data source. Not applicable to all data source types.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: Specifies the adapter that connects to the external system.

fields.name: AuthProviderId
fields.description: Salesforce ID of the authentication provider, which defines the service that provides the login process and approves access to the external system. Only users with the “Customize Application” and “Manage AuthProviders” permissions can view this field. This field is available in API version 39.0 and later.

fields.name: ExternalDataSourceId
fields.description: Salesforce ID of the external data source or named credential that defines the external system.

fields.name: Password
fields.description: Password portion of the credentials for the Salesforce user to access the external system.

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: Specifies whether to use OAuth, password authentication, or no authentication when the user accesses the external system.

fields.name: UserId
fields.description: ID of the Salesforce user who’s accessing the external system.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username portion of the credentials for the Salesforce user to access the external system.

fields.name: ActivatedDate
fields.description: The date the key was activated in Salesforce.

fields.name: CreatedBy
fields.description: The email address of the user who created the root key. For example, user@example.com .

fields.name: Description
fields.description: The user-defined description of the root key.

fields.name: LastModifiedBy
fields.description: The email address of the user who most recently modified the key. For example, user@example.com .

fields.name: Region
fields.description: The region for the customer managed key. For example, if the RootKeyService is AWS , the region is an Amazon Web Services (AWS) region such as us-east1 .

fields.name: RootKeyIdentifier
fields.description: The unique key identifier from the external KMS, such as an AWS Amazon Resource Name (ARN). For example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:123456789000:key/123ab456-7cd8-9012-3e4f-5gh678i901j2

fields.name: RootKeyService
fields.description: The external key management service connected to Salesforce. For example, AWS .

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The status of the key. This is the only value that can be changed using update(). You can only change the status from Active to Inactive, or from Inactive to Active.

fields.name: Location

fields.name: Name

fields.name: Notes

fields.name: Time

fields.name: Title

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The date the external event ends.

fields.name: EventId
fields.description: The ID of the Salesforce event created by the external event.

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.description: The ID of the external event.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Returns true if the external event is locked, or false if it’s not.

fields.name: IsRecurring
fields.description: Indicates whether the external event is recurring (true) or not (fales).

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The name of the external event’s organizer.

fields.name: OwnerId

fields.name: StartDate

fields.name: DefaultResponseAccountId

fields.name: DeveloperName
fields.description: The unique name of the record in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. This field is automatically generated but you can supply your own value if you create the record using the API. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance may slow while Salesforce generates one for each record. Note Only users with View DeveloperName OR View Setup and Configuration permission can view, group, sort, and filter this field.

fields.name: ExternalAccountId
fields.description: ID of the social account on the social network.

fields.name: ExternalPictureURL
fields.description: URL to the picture of the social account on the social network.

fields.name: IsActive
fields.description: Specifies whether the social account is active or not.

fields.name: IsAuthenticated

fields.name: IsCaseCreationEnabled
fields.description: Specifies whether case creation for the social account is enabled or not.

fields.name: IsDataSourceActive

fields.name: Language
fields.description: Specifies the language of the social account.

fields.name: ProfileUrl
fields.description: URL for the profile.

fields.name: Provider
fields.description: Social network, such as Facebook or Twitter, of the social account.

fields.name: ProviderUserId
fields.description: User ID for the social network of the social account.

fields.name: RuleId
fields.description: ID of the Radian6 rule for the account.

fields.name: SocialPropertyId
fields.description: ID of the Radian6 social property for the account.

fields.name: TopicId
fields.description: ID of the topic for the social account.

fields.name: UniqueName
fields.description: Unique name for the social account.

fields.name: Username
fields.description: Username for the social account.

fields.name: IsLocked
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated action condition record is locked or not.

fields.name: LastSyncDate
fields.description: Indicates when the connector last synced with the third-party knowledge source to import articles into Salesforce.

fields.name: LastSyncStatus
fields.description: Indicates the status of the connector’s last sync of articles from the third-party knowledge source into Salesforce.

fields.name: MayEdit
fields.description: Indicates whether the automated import article condition record can be edited or not.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: The connector’s label in Unified Knowledge setup.

fields.name: NamedCredentialId
fields.description: Salesforce ID of the named credential that’s used for a request. The named credential identifies the third-party system and the third-party authentication settings.

fields.name: OwnerId
fields.description: The user ID of the owner of the connector.

fields.name: ShouldOpenInSource
fields.description: Indicates whether articles imported into Salesforce open in the third-party source from links in Salesforce.

fields.name: CnctName
fields.description: Name of the connection.

fields.name: CnctRole
fields.description: System’s role in the connection.

fields.name: CnctStatus
fields.description: Status of the connection.

fields.name: ExternalClientApplicationId
fields.description: ID of external client app representing your org’s connection to the external system.

fields.name: ExtlSystem
fields.description: ID of the external system.

fields.name: NamedCredentialId
fields.description: ID of the named credential.

fields.name: AccountId
fields.description: ID of the account.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrCnctId
fields.description: ID of the ExtlRecShrCnct record.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrObjectId
fields.description: ID of the ExtlRecShrObject record.

fields.name: FieldDefaultValue
fields.description: Default value of the field.

fields.name: FieldSetType
fields.description: Set of fields associated with this record.

fields.name: IsFieldNillable
fields.description: Indicates whether this field can be set to null ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: SendFieldUpdates
fields.description: Indicates whether updates are tracked for this field, sent to the connected org, and stored in the ExtlRecShrLead or ExlRecShrOpportunity objects ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: SharedFieldDevName
fields.description: Developer name of the field.

fields.name: SharedFieldLabel
fields.description: Label of the field.

fields.name: SharedFieldLength
fields.description: Maximum length of the field.

fields.name: SharedFieldType
fields.description: Field type of the imported, exported, or updated field.

fields.name: ImportedFieldId
fields.description: ID of the ExtlRecShrField record containing the field data sent from the external system.

fields.name: InternalFieldId
fields.description: ID of the ExtlRecShrField record containing the field data received on the internal system.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrCnctId
fields.description: ID of the external record share connection.

fields.name: LeadId
fields.description: ID of the partner lead.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: DefaultRecordOwnerId
fields.description: ID of the shared record owner. The owner can be a user or a queue, represented by a Group ID.

fields.name: ExtlObjectType
fields.description: Object type in the external org or system that is part of the object field mapping.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrCnctId
fields.description: ID of the external record share connection.

fields.name: FieldMapStatus
fields.description: Exporter’s status of the field mapping.

fields.name: InternalObjectType
fields.description: Object type in your org or system used to group field selections and field mappings.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrCnctId
fields.description: ID of the external record share connection.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: OpportunityId
fields.description: ID of the associated opportunity.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrFieldId
fields.description: ID of the associated external record share field of type picklist.

fields.name: IsDefaultOption
fields.description: Indicates whether this picklist option is set as the default option ( true ) or not ( false ).

fields.name: SharedOptionLabel
fields.description: Label of the picklist option.

fields.name: SharedOptionValue
fields.description: Value of the picklist option.

fields.name: ImportedPcklstOptionId
fields.description: ID of the external record share picklist option of the external system.

fields.name: InternalPcklstOptionId
fields.description: ID of the external record share picklist option of the internal system.

fields.name: ExtlRecShrCnctId
fields.description: ID of the external record share connection.

fields.name: ExtlRecord
fields.description: ID of the lead or opportunity record on the external system.

fields.name: InboundStatus
fields.description: Status of imports and updates received.

fields.name: InternalRecordId
fields.description: ID of the lead or opportunity record on the internal system.

fields.name: IsImported
fields.description: Indicates whether the record originated on the internal system ( true ) or external system ( false ).

fields.name: LastModifiedSent
fields.description: Timestamp of the last record update between the vendor and partner. This field doesn’t capture when the result is received.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: For internal use only.

fields.name: OutboundStatus
fields.description: Status of exports, updates, and results received.

fields.name: UniqueRecordKey
fields.description: Record key used internally for indexing. If IsImported is false , then this field contains the InternalRecordId value. If IsImported is true , this field contains the ExtlRecord value.

fields.name: FeedEntityId
fields.description: The ID of the associated feed entity that contains this attachment.

fields.name: RecordId
fields.description: The ID of the record that this feed attachment contains. For inline images, RecordId is a ContentDocument ID. For content attachments, RecordId is a ContentVersion ID, For feed items, RecordId is a FeedItem ID.

fields.name: Title
fields.description: The title of this feed attachment. When Type is Link , Title value is the label for the attachment link. Otherwise, Title value isn’t used.

fields.name: Type
fields.description: The type of this feed attachment. Valid values are: 0 Content —A content attachment. 1 InlineImage —An inline image. The system creates an inline image attachment when an image is added to the body of the associated FeedItem. You can’t add an inline image directly using FeedAttachment. 2 Link —A link. 3 FeedEntity — A feed entity, for example, a post that is shared. Available in API version 39 and later in Lightning Experience. 4 ChatterExtension —a Rich Publisher App that’s integrated with the Chatter publisher. 5 Record —A record.

fields.name: Value
fields.description: The string value of this FeedAttachment. This field is optional. If the feed attachment is a Link FeedAttachment, the value is the link URL string.

fields.name: CommentBody
fields.description: The text in the comment.

fields.name: CommentType
fields.description: The type of comment: ContentComment —an uploaded file on a comment TextComment —a direct text entry on a comment Before API version 24.0, a text entry was required on a comment. As of version 24.0, a text entry is optional if the CommentType is ContentComment .

fields.name: FeedItemId
fields.description: ID of the feed item containing the comment.

fields.name: HasEntityLinks
fields.description: Indicates whether the feed CommentBody includes at least one link to a record. Note This field is available starting in API version 43.0.

fields.name: InsertedById
fields.description: ID of the user who added this item to the feed. For example, if an application migrates posts and comments from another application into a feed, the InsertedBy value is set to the ID of the context user.

fields.name: IsRichText
fields.description:
Indicates whether the feed CommentBody contains rich text. If you post a rich text feed comment using SOAP API, set IsRichText to true and escape HTML entities from the body. Otherwise, the comment is rendered as plain text. Rich text supports the following HTML tags:

Tip Though the
